human_translation: a certain man who deposited a favorable in court, and said: If I do not come within thirty days, these a favorable verdict will be void. He was impeded and did not come Rav Huna said: His a favorable verdict are void
llm_translation: The man who was caught with merits in the court, and he said: If I do not come within thirty days, let my merits be nullified. He tried and did not come. Rav Huna said: His merits are nullified.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אָנוּס הוּא, וְאָנוּס רַחֲמָנָא פַּטְרֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלַנַּעֲרָה לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה דָבָר״.
human_translation: Rava said to him: He is a victim of circumstances beyond control and the Merciful One exempted a victim of circumstances beyond control as it is written “But unto the damsel you shall do nothing;
llm_translation: He said to him Rava: He is coerced, and the Merciful One exempts the coerced, as it is written: "But to the young woman do not do anything."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא קְטָלָא שָׁאנֵי, וְהָתְנַן: נִדְרֵי אוֹנָסִין, הִדִּירוֹ חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁיֹּאכַל אֶצְלוֹ, וְחָלָה הוּא אוֹ שֶׁחָלָה בְּנוֹ אוֹ שֶׁעִיכְּבוֹ נָהָר — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ נִדְרֵי אוֹנָסִין!
human_translation: And if you would say death, different, but didn’t we learn vows circumstances beyond control? one’s friend took a vow with regard to him that he should eat with him, and he became sick, or his son became sick, or a river barred him these are vows circumstances beyond control;
llm_translation: And if you say, perhaps it is different in the case of a murderer, but we learned in a Mishnah: Vows of compulsion, if one's friend vowed that he should eat with him, and he became ill, or his son became ill, or a river overflowed — behold, these are vows of compulsion!

hebrew_text: וּלְרָבָא, מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ מֵעַכְשָׁיו אִם לֹא בָּאתִי מִכָּאן עַד שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ״, וּמֵת בְּתוֹךְ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ — הֲרֵי זֶה גֵּט. אַמַּאי? וְהָא מֵינָס אִיתְּנִיס! אָמְרִי: דִּלְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם
human_translation: And according to Rava, what is different from which we learned This is your bill of divorce from now if I do not arrive from now until twelve months, and he died within twelve months, this is bill of divorce Why? But he was a victim of circumstances beyond control, Say perhaps different there,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for Rava, what is different from what we learned: "Here is your bill of divorce from now, if I do not come from here until twelve months," and he dies within twelve months - this is a bill of divorce. Why? But he might recover! They said: Perhaps the circumstances are different there. English translation:

hebrew_text: דְּאִי הֲוָה יָדַע דְּמִית, מִן לְאַלְתַּר הֲוָה גָּמַר וְיָהֵיב גִּיטָּא.
human_translation: for had he known that he would die he would have immediately finalized and given the bill of divorce.
llm_translation: If he knew that he was similar, immediately he would have completed and given the divorce document.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מֵהָהוּא דַּאֲמַר לְהוּ: אִי לָא אָתֵינָא מִכָּאן עַד תְּלָתִין יוֹמִין לֶיהֱוֵי גִּיטָּא. אֲתָא וּפַסְקֵיהּ מַעְבָּרָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי, חֲזוֹ דַּאֲתַאי! וַאֲמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לָא שְׁמֵיהּ מֵתְיָיא. אַמַּאי? וְהָא מֵינָס אֲנִיס!
human_translation: what is different from a certain who said to If I do not return from now until thirty days let be a bill of divorce. He came but was prevented by the ferry He said to the See that I have arrived, see that I have arrived. And Shmuel said: is not considered an arrival, Why but he was impeded by circumstances beyond control?
llm_translation: What is different from the one who said to them: If I do not come from here until thirty days, let it be a divorce. He came and crossed the river. He said to them: See, he is coming, see, he is coming! And Samuel said: His name is not Metayya. Why? Because he escapes by miracle!

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא אוּנְסָא דְּמִיגַּלְּיָא שָׁאנֵי, וּמַעְבָּרָא מִיגַּלֵּי אוּנְסֵיהּ.
human_translation: Perhaps circumstances beyond control that are apparent is different, and a ferry is an apparent circumstance beyond control,
llm_translation: Perhaps the rape of Migalleya changes, and the transgression of her rapist changes.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב הוּנָא, מִכְּדִי אַסְמַכְתָּא הִיא. וְאַסְמַכְתָּא לָא קָנְיָא! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּמִיתַּפְסָן זָכְוָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: And according to Rav Huna, After all, it is a transaction with inconclusive consent [ asmakhta ], and an asmakhta does not effect acquisition. Here different because his a favorable verdict are being held
llm_translation: And for Rav Huna, since it is a support. And a support does not acquire! It is different here because his merit is established.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא דְּמִיתַּפְסִין לָאו אַסְמַכְתָּא הִיא? וְהָתְנַן: מִי שֶׁפָּרַע מִקְצָת חוֹבוֹ, וְהִשְׁלִישׁ אֶת שְׁטָרוֹ, וְאָמַר: אִם אֵין אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לוֹ מִכָּאן עַד שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם — תֵּן לוֹ שְׁטָרוֹ.
human_translation: And where are held is it not an asmakhta ? But didn’t we learn one who repaid part of his debt, and deposited his document with a third and said: If I do not give him from now until thirty days, give him his document
llm_translation: And where is it that we find that it is not a support? And it was taught: One who forgives part of his debt, and tears up his document, and says: "If I do not give it to him from now until thirty days - give him his document."

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעַ זְמַן וְלֹא נָתַן, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יִתֵּן. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִתֵּן. וְאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ אָמַר רַב: אֵין הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּאָמַר אַסְמַכְתָּא קָנְיָא!
human_translation: the time arrived and he did not give Rabbi Yosei says: should give And Rabbi Yehuda says: He should not give And Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said Rav said: The halakha is not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said that an asmakhta effects acquisition.
llm_translation: The time arrived and he did not give, Rabbi Yosei says: he should give. And Rabbi Yehuda says: he should not give. And Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh said in the name of Rav: the halakha is not like Rabbi Yosei who says: "A legal support acquires."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּאָמַר לִבַּטְלָן זָכְוָתֵיהּ.
human_translation: It is different here because said that a favorable verdict should be void,
llm_translation: The difference here is that he said to nullify their merit.

hebrew_text: וְהִלְכְתָא: אַסְמַכְתָּא קָנְיָא. וְהוּא דְּלָא אֲנִיס, וְהוּא דִּקְנוֹ מִינֵּיהּ בְּבֵית דִּין חָשׁוּב.
human_translation: And the halakha An asmakhta effects acquisition but this is if was not impeded this is if he effected an acquisition from in an eminent court,
llm_translation: The Halakha: Asmachtah Kanya. And he who did not coerce, and he who acquired from him in a court of law is considered.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ נוֹדְרִין לֶהָרָגִין וְלֶחָרָמִין וְלַמּוֹכְסִין. שֶׁהִיא תְּרוּמָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינוֹ תְּרוּמָה. שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן שֶׁל בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בַּכֹּל נוֹדְרִין,
human_translation: One may take a vow to murderers, or to robbers [ ḥaramin ]; or to tax collectors that is teruma although it is not teruma . that belongs to the house of the king, although it does not belong to the house of the king. Beit Shammai say: One may vow using every
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may make vows to kill, to dedicate to the Temple, and to give to the priests, even if it is not actually for the Temple or the priests. Likewise, one may make vows regarding items belonging to the king's house, even if they do not actually belong to the king's house. Beit Shammai says: In all cases one may make vows,

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִבִּשְׁבוּעָה. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: except for by an oath, And Beit Hillel say: even by an oath.
llm_translation: Outside of the oath. And Beit Hillel says: Even within the oath.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִפְתַּח לוֹ בְּנֶדֶר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף יִפְתַּח לוֹ. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בַּמֶּה שֶׁהוּא מַדִּירוֹ. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף בַּמֶּה שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַדִּירוֹ.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say: one should not initiate by a vow for him And Beit Hillel say: He may even initiate to him. Beit Shammai say: about that which compels him to take a vow And Beit Hillel say: even about that which he does not compel him to take a vow.
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: He shall not open for him with a vow, and House of Hillel says: Even open for him. House of Shammai says: With what he is vowing. And House of Hillel says: Even with what he is not vowing.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: אֱמוֹר ״קֻוֽנָּם אִשְׁתִּי נֶהֱנֵית לִי״, וְאָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם אִשְׁתִּי וּבָנַי נֶהֱנִין לִי״, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אִשְׁתּוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת וּבָנָיו אֲסוּרִין. וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: How said to him say: Benefiting from me is konam for my wife and he said: Benefiting from me is konam for my wife and my children, Beit Shammai say: His wife is permitted but his children, are prohibited And Beit Hillel say: Both these and those are permitted
llm_translation: "How so? He said to him: Say 'My wife is permitted to me,' and he said: 'My wife and my sons are permitted to me.' Beit Shammai say: His wife is permitted and his sons are forbidden. Beit Hillel say: Both are permitted."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דִּינָא דְמַלְכוּתָא דִּינָא?
human_translation: But didn’t Shmuel say: The law of the kingdom is the law,
llm_translation: Gemara: And Samuel said: Is the law of the kingdom the law?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִינָּנָא אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּמוֹכֵס שֶׁאֵין לוֹ קִצְבָה. דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר: בְּמוֹכֵס הָעוֹמֵד מֵאֵלָיו.
human_translation: Rav Ḥinnana said Rav Kahana said Shmuel said: to a tax collector who has no fixed amount of the school of Rabbi Yannai said: to a tax collector who establishes himself independently
llm_translation: Rav Chinana said in the name of Rav Kahana who said in the name of Shmuel: In a customhouse that does not have a fixed measure. The house of Rabbi Yannai said: In a customhouse where one stands opposite him.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהֵן שֶׁל בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן שֶׁל בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ. הֵיכִי נָדַר? אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַב: בְּאוֹמֵר ״יֵאָסְרוּ פֵּירוֹת הָעוֹלָם עָלַי אִם אֵינָן שֶׁל בֵּית הַמֶּלֶךְ״.
human_translation: that belongs to the house of the king, although it does not belong to the house of the king. How take a vow Rav Amram said Rav said: where he said: The produce of the world should be forbidden to me if does not belong to the house of the king.
llm_translation: The text reads: "That they are of the king's house, even though they are not of the king's house. How can he annul? Rav Amram said in the name of Rav: By saying, 'I will forbid myself the fruits of the world if they are not of the king's house.'"

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר ״יֵאָסְרוּ״ — אִיתְּסַרוּ עֲלֵיהּ כׇּל פֵּירֵי עָלְמָא! בְּאוֹמֵר ״הַיּוֹם״. אִי דְּאָמַר ״הַיּוֹם״ לָא מְקַבֵּל מִינֵּיהּ מוֹכֵס!
human_translation: Since he said shall be forbidden all the produce of the world be forbidden to him, where he says: today. If he says: Today, the tax collector will not accept it
llm_translation: As soon as he said "they shall be forbidden" - all the fruits of the world were forbidden upon it! When he says "today." If he said "today," he does not accept from it a tax!

hebrew_text: בְּאוֹמֵר בְּלִבּוֹ ״הַיּוֹם״, וּמוֹצִיא בִּשְׂפָתָיו סְתָם. וְאַף עַל גַּב דִּסְבִירָא לַן דְּבָרִים שֶׁבַּלֵּב אֵינָן דְּבָרִים — לְגַבֵּי אוֹנָסִין שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: where he says: Today, in his heart but verbalizes an unspecified And although we hold matters that in the heart are not matters with regard to circumstances beyond control it is different,
llm_translation: He says in his heart "today," and he utters with his lips generally. And even though it is clear to us that matters in the heart are not considered matters, with regard to cases of coercion, it is different.

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בַּכֹּל כּוּ׳. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בַּמֶּה שֶׁהוּא מַדִּירוֹ, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מַדִּירוֹ. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״קֻוֽנָּם אִשְׁתִּי נֶהֱנֵית לִי״, וְאָמַר ״קֻוֽנָּם אִשְׁתִּי וּבָנַי נֶהֱנִין לִי״. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אִשְׁתּוֹ מוּתֶּרֶת וּבָנָיו אֲסוּרִין, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Beit Shammai say using every Beit Shammai say: about that which compels him to take a vow And Beit Hillel say: even about that which he does not compel him to take a vow. How said to him say: Benefiting from me is konam for my wife and he said: Benefiting from me is konam for my wife and my children, Beit Shammai say: His wife is permitted but his children, are prohibited And Beit Hillel say: Both these and those are permitted
llm_translation: House of Shammai says: "In all cases." House of Shammai says: "In that in which he dwells." And House of Hillel says: "Even in that in which he does not dwell." How so? He said to him: "Your wife is permitted to me," and he said, "Your wife and your sons are permitted to me." House of Shammai says: "His wife is permitted and his sons are forbidden," and House of Hillel says: "Both these and those are permitted."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: תָּנָא, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִפְתַּח לוֹ בִּשְׁבוּעָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אַף יִפְתַּח לוֹ בִּשְׁבוּעָה. לְבֵית שַׁמַּאי בִּשְׁבוּעָה הוּא דְּלֹא יִפְתַּח לוֹ, הָא בְּנֶדֶר יִפְתַּח לוֹ. וְהָא תְּנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: לֹא יִפְתַּח לוֹ בַּנֶּדֶר!
human_translation: Rav Huna said taught: Beit Shammai say one may not initiate by an oath to him and Beit Hillel say: He may even initiate by an oath to him. according to Beit Shammai it is by an oath to him that one may not initiate, but one may initiate by a vow to him. But didn’t we learn Beit Shammai say: He may not initiate by a vow to him?
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: It was taught in a Baraita, Beit Shammai say: He should not open for him with an oath, and Beit Hillel say: He should even open for him with an oath. For Beit Shammai, in an oath is where he should not open for him, but in a vow he should open for him. And we learned in the Mishnah, Beit Shammai say: He should not open for him with a vow!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: מִיפְתָּח הוּא דְּלָא יִפְתַּח לוֹ בִּשְׁבוּעָה, הָא מִידָּר נָדַר בִּשְׁבוּעָה. וְהָתְנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: בַּכֹּל נוֹדְרִין חוּץ מִבִּשְׁבוּעָה!
human_translation: And furthermore, he may not initiate by an oath to him, but he may certainly vow with an oath but didn’t we learn Beit Shammai say: They may take a vow using every except for by taking an oath,
llm_translation: And come: from the beginning that he should not open to him in a week, behold immediately he vowed in a week. And we learned, Beit Shammai say: In everything one can vow except for in a week!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּא מַתְנִיתִין בְּנֶדֶר, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי. תַּנָּא בָּרַיְיתָא בִּשְׁבוּעָה, לְהוֹדִיעֲךָ כֹּחָן דְּבֵית הִלֵּל.
human_translation: The mishna taught pertains to a vow to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Beit Shammai, the baraita taught pertains to an oath to convey to you the far-reaching nature of Beit Hillel,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah regarding a vow, to inform you of the strength of the opinion of Beit Shammai. We learned in a Baraita regarding an oath, to inform you of the strength of the opinion of Beit Hillel.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, הָכִי קָתָנֵי, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: אֵין שְׁאֵלָה בִּשְׁבוּעָה, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: יֵשׁ שְׁאֵלָה בִּשְׁבוּעָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said This is what is teaching: Beit Shammai say there is no a request of an oath, And Beit Hillel say there is a request of an oath.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, thus it was taught: Beit Shammai say: there is no questioning on an oath, and Beit Hillel say: there is questioning on an oath.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵי נְטִיעוֹת הָאֵלּוּ קׇרְבָּן אִם אֵינָן נִקְצָצוֹת״, ״טַלִּית זוֹ קׇרְבָּן אִם אֵינָהּ נִשְׂרֶפֶת״ — יֵשׁ לָהֶן פִּדְיוֹן. ״הֲרֵי נְטִיעוֹת הָאֵלּוּ קׇרְבָּן עַד שֶׁיִּקָּצְצוּ״, ״טַלִּית זוֹ קׇרְבָּן עַד שֶׁתִּשָּׂרֵף״ —
human_translation: These saplings are an offering if they are not cut This garment is an offering if it is not burned, they are subject to redemption These saplings are an offering until they are cut This garment is an offering until it is burned,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "These saplings are considered sacrifices if they are not uprooted," "This garment is considered a sacrifice if it is not burned" - they are subject to redemption. "These saplings are considered sacrifices until they are uprooted," "This garment is considered a sacrifice until it is burned" -

hebrew_text: אֵין לָהֶם פִּדְיוֹן.
human_translation: they are not subject to redemption.
llm_translation: They do not have redemption.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְלִיתְנֵי ״קְדוֹשׁוֹת וְאֵין קְדוֹשׁוֹת״! אַיְּידֵי דְבָעֵי לְמִיתְנָא סֵיפָא ״אֵין לָהֶם פִּדְיוֹן״, תְּנָא נָמֵי רֵישָׁא ״יֵשׁ לָהֶם פִּדְיוֹן״.
human_translation: Let teach: They are consecrated and they are not consecrated, Since it wanted to teach the latter clause They are not subject to redemption, it taught also the first clause They are subject to redemption.
llm_translation: Gemara: And it was taught: "Holy and not holy"! Since it is necessary to teach the latter part: "They do not have redemption," a Tanna similarly taught in the first part: "They have redemption."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי נָדַר? אָמַר אַמֵּימָר: בְּאוֹמֵר ״אִם אֵינָן נִקְצָצוֹת הַיּוֹם״, וְעָבַר הַיּוֹם וְלֹא נִקְצְצוּ. אִם כֵּן לְמָה לִי לְמֵימַר? פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא כְּגוֹן דְּאִיכָּא זִיקָא נְפִישָׁא.
human_translation: How did he take a vow? Ameimar said: Where he says: if they are not cut today, and the day passed and they were not cut If so, why do I to say obvious No, it is necessary where there is a great wind
llm_translation: "How does one make a vow?" Amemar said: By saying, "If they are not cut today," and the day passed without them being cut. If so, why do I need to say it? It is obvious! It is necessary in a case where there is a weak injury.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ גַּבֵּי טַלִּית, וְטַלִּית לִשְׂרֵיפָה קָיְימָא? [אִין] כְּגוֹן דְּאִיכָּא דְּלֵיקָה. הָכָא נָמֵי, דְּאִיכָּא זִיקָא נְפִישָׁא, וְסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ דְּמַסֵּיק אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּלָא מִיתְנַצְלָן וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי קָא נָדַר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But isn’t this taught together with a garment, and a garment ready for burning, Yes, where there is a fire. Here also there is a great wind, and enters your mind that one raised in his mind that will not be saved, and due to that he took a vow. teaches us
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a contradiction: regarding a garment over a talit, and the talit is designated for burning, is it permissible like a case where there is no fire? Here too, since there is a great danger, and it is evident to you that if one does not remove them, they will not be saved, and therefore he made a vow, he is informing us of this ruling.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי נְטִיעוֹת הָאֵלּוּ קׇרְבָּן כּוּ׳. וּלְעוֹלָם? אָמַר בַּר פְּדָא: פְּדָאָן — חוֹזְרוֹת וְקוֹדְשׁוֹת, פְּדָאָן — חוֹזְרוֹת וְקוֹדְשׁוֹת, עַד שֶׁיִּקָּצְצוּ. נִקְצְצוּ — פּוֹדָן פַּעַם אַחַת וְדַיּוֹ. וְעוּלָּא אָמַר: כֵּיוָן שֶׁנִּקְצְצוּ — שׁוּב אֵין פּוֹדָן.
human_translation: These saplings are an offering And forever? Bar Padda said: redeemed them, they become consecrated again, If redeemed them they become consecrated again, until they are cut they are cut he redeems them once and it is sufficient. And Ulla said: Once they are cut not redeem them again
llm_translation: Behold, these saplings are a burnt offering. And forever? Bar Pada said: Padaan - they return and become holy, Padaan - they return and become holy, until they are pruned. Once they are pruned - they are redeemed once and for all. And Ulla said: Once they are pruned - they are no longer redeemed.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הַמְנוּנָא: קְדוּשָּׁה שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלְכָה? וּמָה אִילּוּ אָמַר לְאִשָּׁה ״הַיּוֹם אַתְּ אִשְׁתִּי וּלְמָחָר אִי אַתְּ אִשְׁתִּי״, מִי נָפְקָא בְּלָא גֵּט?!
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said Where did their sanctity go? And what if said to a woman Today you are my wife and tomorrow you are not my wife? Would she exit without a bill of divorce?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Hamnuna: The sanctity of which place is the halakha? And what if he said to a woman, "Today you are my wife, and tomorrow you are not my wife," would she leave without a divorce?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: מִי קָא מְדַמֵּית קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים לִקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף? קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים פָּקְעָה בִּכְדֵי, קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף לָא פָּקְעָה בִּכְדִי.
human_translation: Rava said to him: do you compare sanctity value inherent sanctity? Sanctity value departs with nothing inherent sanctity, does not depart with nothing
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Who is comparing the sanctity of blood to the sanctity of the body? The sanctity of blood can be nullified in a minimal amount, while the sanctity of the body cannot be nullified in a minimal amount.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף לָא פָּקְעָה בִּכְדִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״שׁוֹר זֶה עוֹלָה כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם, וּלְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם שְׁלָמִים״ — כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם עוֹלָה, לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם שְׁלָמִים. אַמַּאי? קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף נִינְהוּ, וּפָקְעָה בִּכְדִי!
human_translation: Abaye said to him: inherent sanctity not depart with nothing But isn’t it taught This ox a burnt-offering all thirty days and after thirty days a peace-offering, all thirty days a burnt-offering after thirty days a peace-offering. Why These are inherent sanctity, and it departs with nothing
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: The sanctity of the body did not pass in its entirety? And it was taught: "This ox shall be burnt within thirty days, and after thirty days it shall be peace-offerings" - within thirty days it is burnt, after thirty days it is peace-offerings. Why? Because they are considered sanctity of the body, and it did not pass in its entirety!

hebrew_text: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, דְּאָמַר לִדְמֵי.
human_translation: With what are we dealing here? where he said for monetary value,
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what are we dealing with, for he said to liken.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם עוֹלָה, וּמֵעַכְשָׁיו שְׁלָמִים״. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא חֲדָא בִּקְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף, וַחֲדָא בִּקְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים —
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause: after thirty days a burnt-offering, and from now a peace-offering, Granted, if you say one to inherent sanctity and one to sanctity value,
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: "After thirty days it ascends, and from now on it is peace offerings." If you say, it is well: one in the sanctity of the body, and one in the sanctity of blood—

hebrew_text: הַיְינוּ דְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ לֵיהּ לְתַנָּא לְמִיתְנֵא תַּרְתֵּי. דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: קְדוּשַּׁת הַגּוּף לָא פָּקְעָה בִּכְדִי, קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים פָּקְעָה בִּכְדִי, אַמְּטוּ לְהָכִי תְּנָא תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: this is that was necessary for the tanna to teach two as enter your mind to say: Inherent sanctity does not lapse on its own, sanctity value departs with nothing Because of this, the tanna taught two
llm_translation: That is, that it is necessary for the Mishna to teach two cases. For when your mind was made up, I say: The sanctity of the body was not violated in order, the sanctity of blood was violated in order. Therefore, the Mishna teaches two cases.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי קְדוּשַּׁת דָּמִים, לְמָה לִי לְמִיתְנֵא תַּרְתֵּי? הַשְׁתָּא יֵשׁ לוֹמַר: מִקְּדוּשָּׁה חֲמוּרָה לִקְדוּשָּׁה קַלָּה פָּקְעָה, מִקְּדוּשָּׁה קַלָּה לִקְדוּשָּׁה חֲמוּרָה צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר?!
human_translation: But if you say this and that sanctity value, why do I to teach two Now, it can be said from the stringent sanctity to the less stringent sanctity departs from the less stringent sanctity to the more stringent sanctity need this be said?
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that both are necessary for the sanctity of blood, why do I need to teach both? Now we can say: from a severe sanctity to a light sanctity it has been breached, from a light sanctity to a severe sanctity it is necessary to say?!

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּבַר פְּדָא, דְּאָמַר: לָא פָּקְעָה קְדוּשָּׁה בִּכְדִי?
human_translation: Let say should be a conclusive refutation of bar Padda, who said: Sanctity does not depart with nothing
llm_translation: Let it be the goodness of the matter of redemption, as it is said: "Has holiness not been breached enough?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אָמַר לָךְ בַּר פְּדָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִם לֹא אָמַר ״מֵעַכְשָׁיו שְׁלָמִים״ — לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם עוֹלָה הָוֵי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Bar Padda said to you: This is what is saying: if he does not say: From now a peace-offering, after thirty days it is a burnt-offering.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Bar Peda said to you, thus he said: If he did not say "from now complete," after thirty days it becomes a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשָּׁה: ״הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי לְאַחַר שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם״, דִּמְקוּדֶּשֶׁת וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנִּתְעַכְּלוּ הַמָּעוֹת.
human_translation: just as it is who says to a woman: Be betrothed to me after thirty days that is betrothed And although the money was squandered away
llm_translation: From the time that one says to a woman, "Be consecrated to me after thirty days," she becomes consecrated even though the coins have not yet been weighed.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא? לָא צְרִיכָא דַּהֲדַר בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: is obvious No, necessary where he retracted
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita? La'tzricha d'hadur beih."

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חוֹזֶרֶת, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר!
human_translation: This well according to the one who said may not retract But according to the one who says she may retract, what can be said?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said it does not return. But for the one who said it does return, what can be said!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָתָם חוֹזֶרֶת, הָכָא שָׁאנֵי — דַּאֲמִירָתוֹ לְגָבוֹהַּ כִּמְסִירָתוֹ לְהֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: Even according to the one who says there, may retract here, it is different because one’s declaration to God is equal to his transfer to a common person [ hedyot ],
llm_translation: Even according to the one who said there it returns, here it is different - for his statement is as effective as that of a layman.

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב רַבִּי אָבִין וְרַב יִצְחָק בְּרַבִּי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, וְקָא מְנַמְנֵם רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, יָתְבִי וְקָאָמְרִי: לְבַר פְּדָא דְּאָמַר פְּדָאָן חוֹזְרוֹת וְקוֹדְשׁוֹת,
human_translation: Rabbi Avin and Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rabbi, sat before Rabbi Yirmeya, and Rabbi Yirmeya was dozing [ menamnem ]. they sat and said: According to bar Padda, who said redeems them become consecrated again,
llm_translation: Sitting Rabbi Avin and Rav Yitzchak son of Rabbi before Rabbi Yirmeya, and Rabbi Yirmeya was dozing off. They sat and said: "Regarding the calf of redemption that Pidyon said, its ashes and its sanctities."

hebrew_text: תִּפְשׁוֹט דְּבָעֵי רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: הַנּוֹתֵן שְׁתֵּי פְרוּטוֹת לְאִשָּׁה וְאָמַר לָהּ: ״בְּאַחַת הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי הַיּוֹם, וּבְאַחַת הִתְקַדְּשִׁי לִי לְאַחַר שֶׁאֲגָרְשֵׁיךְ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּהָווּ קִידּוּשֵׁי.
human_translation: resolve as Rav Hoshaya asked: one who gives two perutot to a woman and says to her: With one be betrothed to me today and with one be betrothed to me after I divorce you, So too, it should be betrothal.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Rav Hoshaya raised a dilemma: If one gives two prutot to a woman and says to her, "Be consecrated to me with one of them today, and be consecrated to me with the other after I divorce you," is this considered a valid act of consecration?

hebrew_text: אִיתְּעַר בְּהוּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, אֲמַר לְהוּ: מַאי קָא מְדַּמֵּיתוּן פְּדָאָן הוּא לִפְדָאוּם אֲחֵרִים? הָכִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פְּדָאָן הוּא — חוֹזְרוֹת וּקְדוֹשׁוֹת, פְּדָאוּם אֲחֵרִים — אֵין חוֹזְרוֹת וּקְדוֹשׁוֹת. וְאִשָּׁה כִּפְדָאוּהָ אֲחֵרִים דָּמְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya, woke up said to them: what are you comparing he redeemed them to where others redeemed them? This is what Rabbi Yoḥanan said: he redeemed they become consecrated again, others redeemed them they do not become consecrated again, and a woman is considered as if others redeemed her.
llm_translation: There was an incident involving Rabbi Yirmeya, he said to them: What are you comparing them to? A pearl to other pearls? This is what Rabbi Yochanan said: A pearl itself - its beauty and holiness return, other pearls - their beauty and holiness do not return. And a woman, when compared to other women, is similar to a pearl.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר נָמֵי, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא שֶׁפְּדָאָן הוּא, אֲבָל פְּדָאוּם אֲחֵרִים — אֵין חוֹזְרוֹת וּקְדוֹשׁוֹת.
human_translation: It was also stated Rabbi Ami said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught only when he redeemed them but others redeemed them they do not become consecrated again
llm_translation: It was stated: Indeed, Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They only decreed regarding their redemption, but if others redeemed them - they do not revert and become holy.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִיּוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם — מוּתָּר בְּיוֹשְׁבֵי הַיַּבָּשָׁה. מִיּוֹשְׁבֵי הַיַּבָּשָׁה — אָסוּר מִיּוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם, שֶׁיּוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם בִּכְלַל יוֹשְׁבֵי הַיַּבָּשָׁה. לֹא כְּאֵלּוּ שֶׁהוֹלְכִים מֵעַכּוֹ לְיָפוֹ, אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: one who takes a vow from seafarers, permitted from those who live on dry land. from those who live on dry land, prohibited from seafarers, because seafarers are included those who live on dry land. Not like those that travel from Akko to Jaffa, but rather one who customarily departs [ lefaresh ]
llm_translation: It was taught: One who vows from those who descend to the sea — permitted for the inhabitants of the dry land. For the inhabitants of the dry land — forbidden from those who descend to the sea, because those who descend to the sea are included in the category of inhabitants of the dry land. Not like those who walk from Acco to Yaffo, but rather in one whose way is to spread out.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַב פָּפָּא וְרַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא, חַד מַתְנֵי אַרֵישָׁא וְחַד מַתְנֵי אַסֵּיפָא. מַאן דְּתָנֵי אַרֵישָׁא, מַתְנֵי הָכִי: הַנּוֹדֵר מִיּוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם — מוּתָּר בְּיוֹשְׁבֵי יַבָּשָׁה, הָא בְּיוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם — אָסוּר, וְלֹא כְּאֵלּוּ
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika. One teaches with regard to the first clause and one teaches with regard to the latter clause. The one who teaches with regard to the first clause teaches like this: One who takes a vow from seafarers permitted from those who live on dry land. But prohibited from seafarers, and not like those
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Papa and Rav Acha, son of Rav Ika, one teaches the first clause and one teaches the final clause. The one who teaches the first clause teaches as follows: One who vows from those who descend to the sea - is permitted for those who dwell on dry land, but those who descend to the sea - are forbidden, and not like these.

hebrew_text: הַהוֹלְכִים מֵעַכּוֹ לְיָפוֹ, דְּהָלֵין יוֹשְׁבֵי הַיַּבָּשָׁה נִינְהוּ, אֶלָּא מִמִּי שֶׁדַּרְכָּן לְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: who travel from Akko to Jaffa, for they are those who dwell on the land. Rather, from those who customarily depart
llm_translation: Those who walk from Akko to Jaffa, as they are considered residents of the mainland, except for the one who is accustomed to explain.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּמַתְנֵי אַסֵּיפָא, מַתְנֵי הָכִי: הַנּוֹדֵר מִיּוֹשְׁבֵי יַבָּשָׁה — אָסוּר בְּיוֹרְדֵי הַיָּם, וְלֹא בְּאֵלּוּ הַהוֹלְכִים מֵעַכּוֹ לְיָפוֹ בִּלְבַד, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ בְּמִי שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לְפָרֵשׁ, הוֹאִיל וְסוֹפוֹ לְיַבָּשָׁה סָלֵיק.
human_translation: And the one who teaches it with regard to the latter clause teaches this One who takes a vow from those who dwell on dry land is prohibited from seafarers, and not only with regard to those who travel from Akko to Jaffa, but even with regard to one who customarily departs Since eventually he will go up onto dry land.
llm_translation: And one who teaches in the latter part, teaches thus: One who vows from those who dwell on dry land - is forbidden to those who descend to the sea, but not to those who walk from Acco to Yaffo alone, rather even to one whose way is to spread out, since ultimately he will reach dry land.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מֵרוֹאֵי הַחַמָּה — אָסוּר אַף בַּסּוֹמִין, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְכַּוֵּון זֶה אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁהַחַמָּה רוֹאָה אוֹתָן.
human_translation: One who takes a vow from those who see the sun prohibited even from blind, because he meant only those that the sun sees,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from the sight of the sun - it is forbidden even with regard to the blind, for he did not intend this except for one whom the sun sees.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא? מִדְּלָא קָאָמַר ״מִן הָרוֹאִין״. לְאַפּוֹקֵי דָּגִים וְעוּבָּרִים.
human_translation: What is the reason Since he did not say: From those who see, to exclude fish and fetuses,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Because he did not say "from the seers." To go out to fish and birds.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִשְּׁחוֹרֵי הָרֹאשׁ — אָסוּר בַּקֵּרְחִין, וּבַעֲלִי שֵׂיבוֹת. וּמוּתָּר בַּנָּשִׁים וּבַקְּטַנִּים, שֶׁאֵין נִקְרָאִין ״שְׁחוֹרֵי הָרֹאשׁ״ אֶלָּא אֲנָשִׁים.
human_translation: One who takes a vow from dark heads [ sheḥorei harosh ] prohibited from those that are bald, and elderly But permitted from women and from children, because only men are called: dark heads.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows from the black hairs of the head - is prohibited with regard to the temples, and with regard to the white hairs. And is permitted with regard to women and children, as only men are called "black hairs of the head."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי טַעְמָא — מִדְּלָא קָאָמַר ״מִבַּעְלֵי שֵׂעָר״.
human_translation: What is the reason Because it does not say: From those with hair.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? - Because he did not say "from the owners of hair."

hebrew_text: וּמוּתָּר בְּנָשִׁים וּבִקְטַנִּים, שֶׁאֵין נִקְרָאִין ״שְׁחוֹרֵי הָרֹאשׁ״ אֶלָּא אֲנָשִׁים. מַאי טַעְמָא — אֲנָשִׁים זִימְנִין דְּמִיכַּסּוּ רֵישַׁיְיהוּ וְזִימְנִין דְּמִגַּלּוּ רֵישַׁיְיהוּ. אֲבָל נָשִׁים לְעוֹלָם מִיכַּסּוּ, וּקְטַנִּים לְעוֹלָם מִיגַּלּוּ.
human_translation: But permitted from women and from children, because only men are called: dark heads. What is the reason Men sometimes cover their heads and sometimes uncover their heads. But women’s are always covered, and children’s are always uncovered,
llm_translation: And permitted with women and with minors, for they are not called "those who blacken their heads" except men. What is the reason? Men sometimes cover their heads, and sometimes uncover their heads. But women always cover, and minors always uncover.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיְּלוּדִים — מוּתָּר בְּנוֹלָדִים. מִן הַנּוֹלָדִים — אָסוּר מִן הַיְּלוּדִים. רַבִּי מֵאִיר מַתִּיר אַף בַּיְּלוּדִים. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: לֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון זֶה אֶלָּא בְּמִי שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לְהִוּוֹלֵד.
human_translation: One who takes a vow from those that are born [ yeludim ] permitted those who will be born [ noladim ] from those who will be born, prohibited from those that are born Rabbi Meir permits even from those that are born And the Rabbis say: He intended only one whose nature is to be born.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from newborns — is permitted with those already born. From those already born — is prohibited from newborns. Rabbi Meir permits even with newborns. And the Sages say: This intention was only directed towards one whose nature is to be born.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא נוֹלָדִים. אֶלָּא מִמַּאן אָסוּר?
human_translation: According to Rabbi Meir, And it is not necessary will be born However, from whom is he prohibited
llm_translation: "Gemara: For Rabbi Meir it is a 'gema' and not a 'mibba'aya' regarding the issue of 'noladim.' But from whom is it prohibited?"

hebrew_text: חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיְּלוּדִים — מוּתָּר בַּנּוֹלָדִים, מִן הַנּוֹלָדִים — אָסוּר בַּיְּלוּדִים, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אַף הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַנּוֹלָדִים מוּתָּר בַּיְּלוּדִים, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנוֹדֵר מִן הַיְּלוּדִים מוּתָּר בַּנּוֹלָדִים.
human_translation: is incomplete and is teaching like this: One who takes a vow from those that are born permitted those who will be born from those who will be born, prohibited from those that are born Rabbi Meir says: Even one who takes a vow from those who will be born permitted from those who are born, just as one who takes a vow from those who are born permitted from those who will be born,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hasorei michasera ve'hachi katanei: Ha'noder min ha'yeludim - mutar ba'noladim, min ha'noladim - asur ba'yeludim, Rabbi Meir omer: Af ha'noder min ha'noladim mutar ba'yeludim, ki heichi denoder min ha'yeludim mutar ba'noladim." Translation: "Those who are lacking are considered as if they are complete, and thus it is taught: One who vows from the unborn - permitted in the born, from the born - forbidden in the unborn. Rabbi Meir says: Even one who vows from the unborn is permitted in the born, for just as one who vows from the born is permitted in the unborn."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: לְמֵימְרָא דְּ״נוֹלָדִים״ דְּמִתְיַילְּדָן מַשְׁמַע? אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה ״שְׁנֵי בָנֶיךָ הַנּוֹלָדִים לְךָ בְּאֶרֶץ מִצְרַיִם״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְאִיתְיַילְדָן הוּא?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: Is this to say that noladim means those who will be born But if that is so, “Your two sons who were born [ noladim ] to you in the land of Egypt” does it also those who will be born?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: To say that the "born" implies that they are born, is that what you mean to say? Rather, from now on, "your two sons who were born to you in the land of Egypt," is it not so that they were born?

hebrew_text: וְאֶלָּא מַאי דִּיילִידוּ מַשְׁמַע, אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה דִּכְתִיב ״הִנֵּה בֵן נוֹלָד לְבֵית דָּוִד יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ שְׁמוֹ״, הָכִי נָמֵי דַּהֲוָה? וְהָא עֲדַיִין מְנַשֶּׁה לֹא בָּא? אֶלָּא מַשְׁמַע הָכִי וּמַשְׁמַע הָכִי, וּבִנְדָרִים הַלֵּךְ אַחַר לְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: But rather, what that means those already born? However, if that is so, which is written: “Behold, a son shall be born [ nolad ] to the house of David, Josiah by name” also that he is already But Manasseh had not yet come Rather, means this, and means that, and with regard to vows, follow the colloquial language,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And rather what is inferred, but from now that it is written "Behold, a son is born to the house of David, Josiah is his name," is it so that he was already existing? But Menashe has not yet come? Rather, infer thus and infer thus, and with regards to vows, we follow the language of people.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים, לֹא נִתְכַּוֵּין זֶה אֶלָּא מִמִּי שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לְהִוּוֹלֵד. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאי — לְאַפּוֹקֵי דָּגִים וְעוֹפוֹת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: He intended only one whose nature is to be born. What does exclude? to exclude fish and birds,
llm_translation: The Sages say, "This was not intended except from one whose way is to beget." To refute this - to refute fish and birds.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִשּׁוֹבְתֵי שַׁבָּת — אָסוּר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָסוּר בַּכּוּתִים. מֵאוֹכְלֵי שׁוּם — אָסוּר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָסוּר בַּכּוּתִים. מֵעוֹלֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם — אָסוּר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וּמוּתָּר בַּכּוּתִים.
human_translation: One who takes a vow from who rest on Shabbat prohibited from a Jew, and prohibited from Samaritans [ Kutim ] from those who eat garlic prohibited from a Jew, and prohibited from Samaritans. from those who ascend Jerusalem prohibited from a Jew, but permitted from Samaritans
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows from the prohibitions of Shabbat - is forbidden among the Israelites and forbidden among the Samaritans. Those who eat garlic - are forbidden among the Israelites and forbidden among the Samaritans. Those who are residents of Jerusalem - are forbidden among the Israelites and permitted among the Samaritans.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״שׁוֹבְתֵי שַׁבָּת״? אִילֵּימָא מִמְּקַיְּימֵי שַׁבָּת, מַאי אִירְיָא בַּכּוּתִים? אֲפִילּוּ גּוֹיִם נָמֵי! אֶלָּא מִמְּצֻוִּוים עַל הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: What Those who rest on Shabbat? If we say from those who uphold Shabbat, why specifically from Samaritans; even gentiles also Rather, from who are commanded about Shabbat
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "Shovtei Shabbat"? If you say it refers to those who observe Shabbat, what is the relevance to the Kutim? Even Gentiles also! Rather, it refers to those commanded regarding Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״מֵעוֹלֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם״ — אָסוּר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וּמוּתָּר בַּכּוּתִים, אַמַּאי? וְהָא מְצֻוִּוים נִינְהוּ!
human_translation: If that is so, say the latter clause from those who ascend to Jerusalem prohibited from a Jew but permitted from Samaritans. Why? But aren’t commanded
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: "From the inhabitants of Jerusalem" — forbidden for Israelites and permitted for Samaritans, why? Because they are considered obligated!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מְצֻוֶּוה וְעוֹשֶׂה קָתָנֵי. בְּתַרְתֵּי בָּבֵי קַמָּיָיתָא: יִשְׂרָאֵל וְכוּתִים — מְצֻוִּוין וְעוֹשִׂין, גּוֹיִם הָהוּא דְּעָבְדִי — עוֹשִׂין וְאֵינָם מְצֻוִּוין. בְּעוֹלֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם: יִשְׂרָאֵל — מְצֻוִּוין וְעוֹשִׂין, כּוּתִים — מְצֻוִּוין וְאֵינָם עוֹשִׂין.
human_translation: Abaye said: is teaching commanded and perform In the first two clauses Jews and Samaritans commanded and perform gentiles, those who perform perform but are not commanded of those who ascend to Jerusalem, a Jew is commanded and performs Samaritans commanded but do not perform
llm_translation: Abaye said: "One who is commanded and does, is greater." In two houses of study it was taught: "Israelites and Samaritans - commanded and do, that nation that serves - do but are not commanded. In the residents of Jerusalem: Israelites - commanded and do, Samaritans - commanded but do not do."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה לִבְנֵי נֹחַ״ — מוּתָּר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְאָסוּר בְּאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: of descendants of Noah is konam that I will not benefit permitted from a Jew but prohibited from the nations of the world.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Their nest that I do not benefit from" - permitted for Israel and prohibited for the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְיִשְׂרָאֵל מִי נָפֵיק מִכְּלָל בְּנֵי נֹחַ? כֵּיוָן דְּאִיקַּדַּשׁ אַבְרָהָם, אִיתְקְרוֹ עַל שְׁמֵיהּ.
human_translation: And is a Jew excluded from the category descendants of Noah? Since Abraham was sanctified are called by his name
llm_translation: Gemara: And Yisrael, who emerged from the category of the sons of Noah? Since Abraham was sanctified, he was called by his name.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה לְזֶרַע אַבְרָהָם״ — אָסוּר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וּמוּתָּר בְּאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: of the offspring of Abraham that I will not benefit he is prohibited from a Jew but permitted from the nations of the world.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "One who does not derive benefit from the seed of Abraham" — it is prohibited for an Israelite and permitted for the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָאִיכָּא יִשְׁמָעֵאל! ״כִּי בְיִצְחָק יִקָּרֵא לְךָ זָרַע״ כְּתִיב. וְהָאִיכָּא עֵשָׂו! ״בְּיִצְחָק״, וְלֹא כׇּל יִצְחָק.
human_translation: But isn’t there Ishmael It is written “For in Isaac shall seed be called to you” But isn’t there Esau “in Isaac” but not all Isaac.
llm_translation: Gemara: And where is Yishmael mentioned? "For in Yitzchak shall your seed be called" is written. And where is Esav mentioned? "In Yitzchak," and not all of Yitzchak.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל״ — לוֹקֵחַ בְּיוֹתֵר וּמוֹכֵר בְּפָחוֹת. ״שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל נֶהֱנִין לִי״ — לוֹקֵחַ בְּפָחוֹת וּמוֹכֵר בְּיוֹתֵר, וְאֵין שׁוֹמְעִין לוֹ. ״שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה לָהֶן וְהֵן לִי״ — יֵהָנֶה לְאוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: a Jew is that I will not benefit he may purchase for more and may sell for less Benefit from me is to a Jew, he may purchase for less and may sell for more But they do not listen to him, that I will not benefit from them, and they from me, he may benefit from the nations of the world
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Sh'eini nehenah miYisrael" — loke'ach be'yoter u'mokher be'fachot. "SheYisrael nehenin li" — loke'ach be'fachot u'mokher be'yoter, ve'ein shome'in lo. "She'eini nehenah lahen ve'hen li" — yehaneh le'umot ha'olam. English translation: "One who does not benefit from Israel" — he buys at a higher price and sells at a lower price. "When Israel benefits me" — he buys at a lower price and sells at a higher price, and no one listens to him. "When I do not benefit them and they benefit me" — he benefits the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַלּוֹקֵחַ כְּלִי מִן הָאוּמָּן לְבַקְּרוֹ וְנֶאֱנַס בְּיָדוֹ — חַיָּיב. אַלְמָא קָסָבַר הֲנָאַת לוֹקֵחַ הִיא.
human_translation: Shmuel said: one who takes a vessel from a craftsman to examine it, and an accident occurs in his hand, liable Apparently, holds the benefit the buyer.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Shmuel: One who takes a vessel from a craftsman to inspect it and it breaks in his hand - he is liable. This implies that the benefit of the taker is considered.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: ״שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל״ — מוֹכֵר בְּפָחוֹת, אֲבָל שָׁוֶה בְּשָׁוֶה — לָא. וְאִי הֲנָאַת לוֹקֵחַ הִיא — אֲפִילּוּ שָׁוֶה בְּשָׁוֶה! מַתְנִיתִין בִּזְבִינָא דִּרְמֵי עַל אַפֵּיהּ.
human_translation: We learned a Jew is that I will not benefit he may sell for less but equal not But if the benefit buyer, even equal The mishna to a sale that lies in his face,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "One who does not benefit from Israel" - he may sell at a loss, but to exchange for an equal value - no. And if it is a benefit for the buyer - even to exchange for an equal value! Mishnah in the marketplace of the south on its own.

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן אֵימָא רֵישָׁא: לוֹקֵחַ בְּיוֹתֵר. וְעוֹד, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל נֶהֱנִין לִי״ — [לוֹקֵחַ בְּפָחוֹת] וּמוֹכֵר בְּיוֹתֵר. וְאִי בִּזְבִינָא דִּרְמֵי עַל אַפֵּיהּ — אֲפִילּוּ שָׁוֶה בְּשָׁוֶה!
human_translation: If so, say the first clause He may purchase for more Furthermore, say the latter clause Benefit from me is to a Jew, he may purchase for less and may sell for more But if to a sale that lies in his face, even at the equal
llm_translation: If so, say the beginning: One who buys excessively. And furthermore, say the end: "For Israel are My delight" - buys for less and sells for more. And if it is in the case of a merchant who sets the price at his own discretion - even if it is equal to equal!

hebrew_text: סֵיפָא בִּזְבִינָא חֲרִיפָא. אִי הָכִי לוֹקֵחַ בְּפָחוֹת? אֲפִילּוּ שָׁוֶה בְּשָׁוֶה! אֶלָּא
human_translation: The latter clause to a keen [ ḥarifa ] sale, If that is so, purchase for less Even at the equal Rather,
llm_translation: The latter part is in Aramaic. If so, does he acquire with less? Even if it is equal to equal! Rather

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין בִּזְבִינָא מִיצְעָא, וְדִשְׁמוּאֵל בִּזְבִינָא חֲרִיפָא.
human_translation: the mishna with an average sale, And of Shmuel to a keen sale,
llm_translation: Mishnah in Zvina from the middle, and Dishmuel in Zvina sharp.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּוָתֵיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל: הַלּוֹקֵחַ כֵּלִים מִן הַתַּגָּר לְשַׁגְּרָן לְבֵית חָמִיו, וְאָמַר לוֹ: אִם מְקַבְּלִין אוֹתָן מִמֶּנִּי — אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ דְּמֵיהֶם, וְאִם לָאו — אֲנִי נוֹתֵן לְךָ לְפִי טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה שֶׁבָּהֶן. נֶאֶנְסוּ בַּהֲלִיכָה — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: is taught in accordance with the opinion of Shmuel one who takes utensils from a merchant to send them to his father-in-law’s house and says to If they accept them from me I give you their value, and if not I give you according to the financial benefit that from them, an accident occurs to on the way liable
llm_translation: It was taught in the presence of Shmuel: One who takes vessels from a peddler to rent them to his fellow, and he says to him: If they are accepted from me - I will give you their value, and if not - I will give you according to the benefit they bring. If they were tested by walking - he is liable.

hebrew_text: בַּחֲזָרָה — פָּטוּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּנוֹשֵׂא שָׂכָר.
human_translation: on the return is exempt because he is like a paid bailee.
llm_translation: In review - exempt, because he is like one who carries reward.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא סַפְסִירָא דִּשְׁקַל חֲמָרָא לְזַבּוֹנֵי וְלָא אִיזַּבַּן. בַּהֲדֵי דַּהֲדַר, אִיתְּנִיס חַמְרָא, חַיְּיבֵיהּ רַב נַחְמָן לְשַׁלּוֹמֵי. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: נֶאֶנְסוּ בַּהֲלִיכָה חַיָּיב, בַּחֲזָרָה פָּטוּר.
human_translation: a certain middleman [ safseira ] who took a donkey to sell but it was not sold, While he was in the midst of returning an accident occurred donkey. Rav Naḥman obligated him to pay Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman If an accident occurred while on the way, he is liable on the return he is exempt.
llm_translation: That certain wine merchant who took wine for sale and did not sell it. While he was returning, wine entered, Rav Nachman held him liable. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: If they were forced into walking, they are liable; if they were forced into returning, they are exempt.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲזָרָה דְסַפְסִירָא — הוֹלָכָה הִיא. דְּאִילּוּ מַשְׁכַּח לְזַבּוֹנֵי — אֲפִילּוּ אַבָּבָא דְבֵיתֵיהּ מִי לָא מְזַבֵּין לֵיהּ?
human_translation: said to him: The return of a middleman is the trip because were he to find to sell even at the door of his house, would he not sell it?
llm_translation: He said to him: The courtyard of Sapsira - it is a public domain. For if he forgets the wine cellars, even the gate of his house, do they not bring wine to him?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי נֶהֱנֶה לָעֲרֵלִים״ — מוּתָּר בְּעַרְלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְאָסוּר בְּמוּלֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: Benefiting from those who are uncircumcised is konam for me, permitted from uncircumcised Jews but he is prohibited from the circumcised of the nations of the world.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Their nestlings from which I benefit are permitted in the case of uncircumcised Jews" — permissible with regard to the foreskins of Israel, and prohibited with regard to the circumcised of the nations of the world.

hebrew_text: ״שֶׁאֲנִי נֶהֱנֶה לַמּוּלִים״ — אָסוּר בְּעַרְלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וּמוּתָּר בְּמוּלֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם. שֶׁאֵין הָעׇרְלָה קְרוּיָה אֶלָּא לְשֵׁם אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי כׇל הַגּוֹיִם עֲרֵלִים וְכׇל בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל עַרְלֵי לֵב״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״וְהָיָה הַפְּלִשְׁתִּי הֶעָרֵל הַזֶּה״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״פֶּן תִּשְׂמַחְנָה בְּנוֹת פְּלִשְׁתִּים פֶּן תַּעֲלֹזְנָה בְּנוֹת הָעֲרֵלִים״.
human_translation: Benefiting from those who are circumcised for me, he is prohibited from uncircumcised Jews and permitted from the circumcised of the nations of the world, as uncircumcised is used only to name the nations of the world, as it is stated: “For all the nations are uncircumcised, but all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in the heart” and it says: “And this uncircumcised Philistine shall be” and it says: “Lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised triumph”
llm_translation: "Because I derive benefit from the circumcised" — prohibited for uncircumcised Israelites, and permitted for circumcised non-Jews. For the foreskin is only called foreskin in relation to non-Jews, as it is stated: "For all the nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel are uncircumcised in heart." And it says: "This uncircumcised Philistine." And it says: "Lest the daughters of the Philistines rejoice, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised exult."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה אוֹמֵר: מְאוּסָה הִיא הָעׇרְלָה, שֶׁנִּתְגַּנּוּ בָּהּ רְשָׁעִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי כׇל הַגּוֹיִם עֲרֵלִים״. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה, שֶׁנִּכְרְתוּ עָלֶיהָ שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה בְּרִיתוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: The foreskin is repulsive, as the wicked are disgraced through it, as it is stated: for all the nations are uncircumcised, Rabbi Yishmael says: great is circumcision that thirteen covenants were sealed with regard to it,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah says: Disgusting is the foreskin, for in it wicked people were disparaged, as it is said: "For all the nations are uncircumcised." Rabbi Ishmael says: Great is circumcision, for thirteen covenants were made upon it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה שֶׁדּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת חֲמוּרָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: great is circumcision that it overrides the strict Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Great is circumcision that overrides the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה — שֶׁלֹּא נִתְלָה לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה הַצַּדִּיק עָלֶיהָ מְלֹא שָׁעָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: Great is circumcision, that Moses the righteous for was not postponed a full hour
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Great is circumcision, for it was not hung on Moses the Righteous for even an hour.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה — שֶׁדּוֹחָה אֶת הַנְּגָעִים. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה, שֶׁכׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת שֶׁעָשָׂה אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ לֹא נִקְרָא שָׁלֵם עַד שֶׁמָּל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִתְהַלֵּךְ לְפָנַי וֶהְיֵה תָמִים״.
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: great is circumcision that it overrides leprosy. Rabbi says: great is circumcision that all the mitzvot that Abraham our Patriarch did, was not called wholehearted until he circumcised as it is stated “Walk before Me and you should be wholehearted”
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says: Great is circumcision, for it pushes away afflictions. Rabbi says: Great is circumcision, for all the commandments that our father Abraham performed, he was not called complete until he circumcised, as it is said: "Walk before Me and be perfect."

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה — שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא הִיא, לֹא בָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֶת עוֹלָמוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ אִם לֹא בְרִיתִי יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה חֻקּוֹת שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ לֹא שָׂמְתִּי״.
human_translation: Alternatively, great is circumcision that if not for it the Holy One, Blessed be He, would not have created His world, as it is stated: “Thus says the Lord: If My covenant be not with day and night, I would not have appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth”
llm_translation: Another explanation: The significance of the word is great, for if not for it, the Holy One, blessed be He, would not have created His world, as it is stated: "Thus says the Lord: If not for My covenant day and night, I would not have established the laws of heaven and earth."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה, שֶׁכׇּל זְכִיּוֹת שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לֹא עָמְדוּ לוֹ כְּשֶׁנִּתְרַשֵּׁל מִן הַמִּילָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּפְגְּשֵׁהוּ ה׳ וַיְבַקֵּשׁ הֲמִיתוֹ״.
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa says: great is circumcision that all the merits that Moses our teacher performed did not protect him when he was negligent about the circumcision, as it is stated: “And the Lord met him and sought to kill him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, Tanya, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha says: Great is circumcision, for all the merits that our teacher Moses did not stand for him when he was circumcised, as it says: 'And the Lord met him and sought to kill him.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: חַס וְשָׁלוֹם שֶׁמּשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ נִתְרַשֵּׁל מִן הַמִּילָה, אֶלָּא כָּךְ אָמַר: אָמוּל וְאֵצֵא — סַכָּנָה הִיא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְהִי בַיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי בִּהְיוֹתָם כֹּאֲבִים וְגוֹ׳״. אָמוּל וְאֶשְׁהֶא שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים, הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אָמַר לִי ״לֵךְ שֻׁב מִצְרָיִם״. אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי מָה נֶעֱנַשׁ מֹשֶׁה —
human_translation: Rabbi said: Heaven forbid that Moses our teacher was neglectful of the circumcision. Rather, this he said: I circumcise and depart is a danger as it is stated: “And it came to pass on the third day, when they were in pain” I circumcise and wait three days the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to me: “Go, return into Egypt” But for what reason was Moses punished?
llm_translation: Rabbi said: Heaven forbid that Moses our teacher was exempt from circumcision, rather thus he said: "I will circumcise and go out" - it is a danger, as it is stated: "And it was on the third day when they were in pain, etc." He said "circumcise and stay for three days," the Holy One, blessed be He, said to me "Go, return from Egypt." But why was Moses punished -

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּתְעַסֵּק בַּמָּלוֹן תְּחִלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וַיְהִי בַּדֶּרֶךְ בַּמָּלוֹן״.
human_translation: Because he was occupied with lodging first as it is stated: “And it came to pass on the way at the lodging-place”
llm_translation: Due to the fact that he first engaged in the inn, as it is stated, "And it came to pass on the way in the inn."

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: לֹא לְמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ בִּקֵּשׁ שָׂטָן לַהֲרוֹג, אֶלָּא לְאוֹתוֹ תִּינוֹק, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי חֲתַן דָּמִים אַתָּה לִי״, צֵא וּרְאֵה מִי קָרוּי חָתָן — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה הַתִּינוֹק.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: It was not Moses our teacher Satan wanted to kill, but rather, that infant as it is stated: “Surely a bridegroom of blood are you to me” Go out and see: Who is called the bridegroom You must say this is the infant,
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Not for Moses our teacher did Satan seek to kill, but for that infant, as it is stated: "For you are a bridegroom of blood to me." Go out and see who is called a bridegroom - you would say, this is the infant.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בַּר בִּיזְנָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּתְרַשֵּׁל מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ מִן הַמִּילָה, בָּאוּ ״אַף״ וְ״חֵימָה״ וּבְלָעוּהוּ, וְלֹא שִׁיְּירוּ מִמֶּנּוּ אֶלָּא רַגְלָיו. מִיָּד ״וַתִּקַּח צִפֹּרָה צֹר וַתִּכְרֹת אֶת עׇרְלַת בְּנָהּ״, מִיָּד ״וַיִּרֶף מִמֶּנּוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Bizna taught: At the time that Moses our teacher was negligent about the circumcision, Af, and Ḥeima, came and swallowed him, and only his legs were left Immediately, “Zipporah took a flint, and cut off the foreskin of her son” immediately “He let him alone”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Bizna expounded: At the moment when our teacher Moses was delayed from the circumcision, "Zipporah took a flint and cut off her son's foreskin," immediately "and she touched his feet," and immediately "he let him go."

hebrew_text: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה בִּיקֵּשׁ מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לְהוֹרְגָן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֶרֶף מֵאַף וַעֲזֹב חֵמָה״. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: לְחֵימָה הֲרָגוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חֵמָה אֵין לִי״. וְהָכְתִיב: ״כִּי יָגֹרְתִּי מִפְּנֵי הָאַף וְהַחֵמָה״! תְּרֵי חֵימָה הֲווֹ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: גּוּנְדָּא דְחֵימָה.
human_translation: At that moment, Moses our teacher wanted to kill them, as it is stated: “Cease from anger [ af ] and forsake wrath [ ḥeima ]” And there are those who say: He killed Ḥeima, as it is stated: “Wrath is not in me” Isn’t it written “For I was in dread of the anger and wrath” There are two wrath. And if you wish, say the army of Ḥeima
llm_translation: At that moment, Moses our teacher sought to kill them, as it is said: "Refrain from anger and forsake wrath." And some say: He killed them with anger, as it is said: "I have no anger." And it is written: "For I was enraged because of anger and wrath!" There were two angers. And if you wish, say: The bundle of anger.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה, שֶׁאֵין לָךְ מִי שֶׁנִּתְעַסֵּק בְּמִצְוֹת כְּאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ, וְלֹא נִקְרָא תָּמִים אֶלָּא עַל שֵׁם מִילָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִתְהַלֵּךְ לְפָנַי וֶהְיֵה תָמִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶתְּנָה בְרִיתִי בֵּינִי וּבֵינֶךָ״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi says: Great is circumcision, for there is no one who was engaged in mitzvot like Abraham our Patriarch, and he was called wholehearted only due to circumcision, as it is stated: “Walk before Me and you should be wholehearted” and it is written “And I will make My covenant between Me and you”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi says: Great is circumcision, for you have no one who engaged in mitzvot like our father Abraham, and he was not called "tamim" except on account of circumcision, as it is stated: "Walk before Me and be tamim," and it is written: "And I will establish My covenant between Me and you."

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה, שֶׁשְּׁקוּלָה כְּנֶגֶד כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי עַל פִּי הַדְּבָרִים הָאֵלֶּה וְגוֹ׳״, דָּבָר אַחֵר: גְּדוֹלָה מִילָה, שֶׁאִילְמָלֵא מִילָה לֹא נִתְקַיְּימוּ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם לֹא בְּרִיתִי יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Alternatively, great is circumcision that it is equal to all the mitzvot of the Torah, as it is stated “For according to these words Alternatively, great is circumcision that if not for circumcision heaven and earth would not have been established, as it is stated: “If My covenant be not with day and night,
llm_translation: Another explanation: Great is circumcision, for it is equivalent to all the commandments of the Torah, as it is stated: "For by these words, etc." Another explanation: Great is circumcision, for were it not for circumcision, heaven and earth would not endure, as it is stated: "If not for My covenant day and night, etc."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: גְּדוֹלָה תּוֹרָה, שֶׁאִילְמָלֵא תּוֹרָה לֹא נִתְקַיְּימוּ שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם לֹא בְרִיתִי יוֹמָם וָלָיְלָה חֻקּוֹת שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ לֹא שָׂמְתִּי וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: And disagrees of Rabbi Eliezer, for Rabbi Eliezer said: Great is the Torah, for if not for Torah, heaven and earth would not have been established, as it is stated: “If My covenant be not with day and night,
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rabbi Eliezer, for Rabbi Eliezer said: Great is the Torah, for if not for the Torah, the heavens and the earth would not have been established, as it is stated: "If not for My covenant day and night, the laws of the heavens and the earth I would not have set" (Jeremiah 33:25).

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְאַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ ״הִתְהַלֵּךְ לְפָנַי וֶהְיֵה תָמִים״ אֲחָזַתּוּ רְעָדָה. אָמַר: שֶׁמָּא יֵשׁ בִּי דָּבָר מְגוּנֶּה. כֵּיוָן שֶׁאָמַר לוֹ: ״וְאֶתְּנָה בְרִיתִי בֵּינִי וּבֵינֶךָ״, נִתְקָרְרָה דַּעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav said: At the time that the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Abraham our Patriarch: “Walk before Me and you should be wholehearted” trembling seized him he said: Perhaps there is something disgraceful about me When said to him: “And I will make My covenant between Me and you” his mind was set at ease,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: At the moment when the Holy One, blessed be He, said to our father Abraham, "Walk before Me and be perfect," trembling seized him. He said: Perhaps there is something lacking in me. But once it was said to him, "And I will establish My covenant between Me and you," his mind was put at ease.

hebrew_text: ״וַיּוֹצֵא אֹתוֹ הַחוּצָה״, אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, הִסְתַּכַּלְתִּי בַּמַּזָּל שֶׁלִּי וְאֵין לִי אֶלָּא בֵּן אֶחָד. אָמַר לוֹ: צֵא מֵאִיצְטַגְנִינוּת שֶׁלְּךָ, אֵין מַזָּל לְיִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: “and He brought him outside” said before Him: Master of the Universe, I looked at my constellation and I have only one son, He said to him: Emerge from your astrology there is no constellation for the Jewish people,
llm_translation: "And he brought him outside," he said before Him: Master of the Universe, I have looked at my constellation and I have no one but one son. He said to him: Leave your astrology, there is no constellation for Israel."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הַמְתַמֵּים עַצְמוֹ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִתַּמֵּים עִמּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עִם חָסִיד תִּתְחַסָּד עִם גִּבּוֹר תָּמִים תִּתַּמָּם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Anyone who conducts himself with wholeheartedness, the Holy One, Blessed be He, treats him with wholeheartedness, as it is stated: “With the devout You act devoutly, and with the one who is strong in his wholeheartedness You act wholeheartedly”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who purifies himself - the Holy One, blessed be He, purifies himself with him, as it is said: "With the kind You show Yourself kind, with the blameless You show Yourself blameless."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: כׇּל הַמְתַמֵּים עַצְמוֹ — שָׁעָה עוֹמֶדֶת לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הִתְהַלֵּךְ לְפָנַי וֶהְיֵה תָמִים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְהָיִיתָ לְאַב הֲמוֹן גּוֹיִם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Hoshaya said: Anyone who acts wholeheartedly, time will stand for him, as it is stated: “Walk before Me and you should be wholehearted” and it is written: “And you shall be the father of a multitude of nations”
llm_translation: Rabbi Hoshaya said: Anyone who makes himself pure - an hour stands for him, as it is stated: "Walk before Me and be perfect," and it is written: "And you shall be a father of a multitude of nations."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: כֹּל הַמְנַחֵשׁ — לוֹ נַחַשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא נַחַשׁ בְּיַעֲקֹב״. וְהָא בְּלָמֶד אָלֶף כְּתִיב! אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם מִדָּה כְּנֶגֶד מִדָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi said: Anyone who divines, the sign him, as it is stated: “For there is to him [ lo ] divination with Jacob” But it is written with lamed alef , Rather, due to measure for measure:
llm_translation: Rabbi said: Anyone who practices divination — to him a serpent, as it is stated: "For there is no enchantment against Jacob." But is it not written with an aleph? Rather, due to measure for measure.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי אַהֲבָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי זֵירָא: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְנַחֵשׁ, מַכְנִיסִין אוֹתוֹ בִּמְחִיצָה שֶׁאֲפִילּוּ מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת אֵין יְכוֹלִין לִיכָּנֵס בְּתוֹכָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא נַחַשׁ בְּיַעֲקֹב וְלֹא קֶסֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Ahava, son of Rabbi Zeira, teaches: Any person who does not divine is brought inside a partition that even the ministering angels cannot enter inside, as it is stated: “For there is no divination with Jacob, neither is there any enchantment with Israel,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Zeira: Any person who does not engage in divination, they bring him into the partition, for even ministering angels cannot enter within it, as it is stated: "For there is no enchantment in Jacob, nor divination in Israel, etc."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִפְּנֵי מָה נֶעֱנַשׁ אַבְרָהָם אָבִינוּ וְנִשְׁתַּעְבְּדוּ בָּנָיו לְמִצְרַיִם מָאתַיִם וְעֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁעָשָׂה אַנְגַּרְיָיא בְּתַלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּרֶק אֶת חֲנִיכָיו יְלִידֵי בֵיתוֹ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Elazar said: For what reason was Abraham our Patriarch punished and his children enslaved to Egypt 210 years? Because he made a draft [ angarya ] of Torah scholars, as it is stated: “He led forth his trained men, born in his house”
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: Why was our father Abraham punished, and his descendants enslaved in Egypt for two hundred and ten years? Because he made an "angaria" (forced labor) with the disciples of the sages, as it is said: "And he armed his trained servants, born in his house" (Genesis 14:14).

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִפְרִיז עַל מִדּוֹתָיו שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּמָּה אֵדַע כִּי אִירָשֶׁנָּה״. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: שֶׁהִפְרִישׁ בְּנֵי אָדָם מִלְּהִכָּנֵס תַּחַת כַּנְפֵי הַשְּׁכִינָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תֶּן לִי הַנֶּפֶשׁ וְהָרְכֻשׁ קַח לָךְ״.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: Because he greatly examined [ hifriz ] the characteristics of the Holy One, Blessed be He, as it is stated: “Whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?” And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: because he distanced people from entering under the wings of the Divine Presence, as it is stated “Give me the people and take the goods to yourself”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel said: Because he King Saul acted presumptuously against the measures of the Holy One, blessed be He, as it is stated: "How shall I know that I will inherit it?" And Rabbi Yochanan said: Because he King Saul separated people from coming under the wings of the Divine Presence, as it is stated: "Give me the people and the possessions take for yourself." English translation:

hebrew_text: ״וַיָּרֶק אֶת חֲנִיכָיו יְלִידֵי בֵיתוֹ״, רַב אָמַר: שֶׁהוֹרִיקָן בַּתּוֹרָה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: שֶׁהוֹרִיקָן בְּזָהָב.
human_translation: “He led forth [ vayyarek ] his trained men, born in his house” Rav said: He showered them [ horikan ] with Torah and Shmuel said: He showered them [ horikan ] with gold
llm_translation: "And he poured out his drink offering, the sons of his house," Rav said: that he poured them out in Torah. And Shmuel said: that he poured them out in gold.

hebrew_text: ״שְׁמֹנָה עָשָׂר וּשְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי בַּר אַבָּא: אֱלִיעֶזֶר כְּנֶגֶד כּוּלָּם. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֱלִיעֶזֶר הוּא, דְּחוּשְׁבָּנֵיהּ הָכִי הָוֵי.
human_translation: “eighteen and three hundred” Rabbi Ami bar Abba said: Eliezer equivalent all of them. There are who say: Eliezer is as the numerical value is this
llm_translation: "Eighteen and three hundred," said Rabbi Ammi bar Abba: Eliezer corresponds to all of them. Some say: Eliezer himself, for his calculations were thus."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי בַּר אַבָּא: בֵּן שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁנִים הִכִּיר אַבְרָהָם אֶת בּוֹרְאוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עֵקֶב אֲשֶׁר שָׁמַע אַבְרָהָם בְּקֹלִי״ — חוּשְׁבָּנֵיהּ מְאָה וְשִׁבְעִין וּתְרֵין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Ami bar Abba said: Abraham recognized his Creator at the age of three years, as it is stated: “Because [ ekev ] Abraham hearkened to My voice” The numerical value 172,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Ammi bar Abba said: A child of three years recognized his Creator, as it is stated: "Because Abraham listened to My voice" - his calculations were one hundred and seventy-two.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא:
human_translation: And Rami bar Abba said
llm_translation: And Ramei bar Abba said:

hebrew_text: ״הַשָּׂטָן״ בְּחוּשְׁבָּנֵיהּ תְּלָת מְאָה וְשִׁיתִּין וְאַרְבְּעָה. וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא: כְּתִיב ״אַבְרָם״, וּכְתִיב ״אַבְרָהָם״. בַּתְּחִלָּה הִמְלִיכוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא עַל מָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה אֵבָרִים, וּלְבַסּוֹף הִמְלִיכוֹ עַל מָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנֶה אֵבָרִים,
human_translation: the Satan [ haSatan ] in numerical value 364, And Rami bar Abba said: It is written “Abram,” and it is written “Abraham” Initially the Holy One, Blessed be He, enthroned him over 243 limbs, And in the end, He enthroned him over 248 limbs,
llm_translation: "The Satan" in his calculations three hundred and sixty-four. And Ramei bar Abba said: It is written "Avram," and it is written "Avraham." Initially, the Holy One, blessed be He, crowned him with one hundred and forty-three limbs, and ultimately crowned him with one hundred and forty-eight limbs.

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ הֵן: שְׁתֵּי עֵינַיִם, וּשְׁתֵּי אׇזְנַיִם, וְרֹאשׁ הַגְּוִיָּיה.
human_translation: These are Two eyes, and two ears, and the tip of the sex organ.
llm_translation: These are they: two eyes, and two ears, and the head of the spinal cord.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר אַבָּא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״עִיר קְטַנָּה וַאֲנָשִׁים וְגוֹ׳״. ״עִיר קְטַנָּה״ — זֶה הַגּוּף, ״וַאֲנָשִׁים בָּהּ מְעַט״ — אֵלּוּ אֵבָרִים, ״וּבָא אֵלֶיהָ מֶלֶךְ גָּדוֹל וְסָבַב אֹתָהּ״ — זֶה יֵצֶר הָרָע, ״וּבָנָה עָלֶיהָ מְצוֹדִים וַחֲרָמִים״ — אֵלּוּ עֲוֹנוֹת,
human_translation: And Rami bar Abba said: What is which is written: “There was a little city and men “A little city,” this the body; “and few men in it,” this the limbs; “and there came a great king against it and besieged it,” this the evil inclination; “and built great bulwarks against it,” these sins.
llm_translation: And Ramei, son of Abba, said, What is the meaning of what is written: "A small city with few men, etc." "A small city" - this refers to the body, "and few men in it" - these are the limbs, "and a great king comes against it and besieges it" - this is the evil inclination, "and builds against it siege-works and ramps" - these are sins.

hebrew_text: ״וּמָצָא בָהּ אִישׁ מִסְכֵּן וְחָכָם״ — זֶה יֵצֶר טוֹב, ״וּמִלַּט הוּא אֶת הָעִיר בְּחׇכְמָתוֹ״ — זוֹ תְּשׁוּבָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים. ״וְאָדָם לֹא זָכַר אֶת הָאִישׁ הַמִּסְכֵּן הַהוּא״ — דְּבִשְׁעַת יֵצֶר הָרָע לֵית דְּמִדְּכַר לֵיהּ לְיֵצֶר טוֹב.
human_translation: “Now there was found in it a man poor and wise,” this the good inclination; “and he by his wisdom delivered the city,” this repentance and good deeds “Yet no man remembered that same poor man” that when the evil inclination no one remembers the good inclination.
llm_translation: "And he found in her a poor man and wise" — this is the good inclination, "and he saved the city with his wisdom" — this is repentance and good deeds. "And no one remembered that poor man" — at the time of the evil inclination, there is no remembrance of the good inclination.

hebrew_text: ״הַחׇכְמָה תָּעֹז לֶחָכָם מֵעֲשָׂרָה שַׁלִּיטִים״. ״הַחׇכְמָה תָּעֹז לֶחָכָם״ — זוֹ תְּשׁוּבָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים, ״מֵעֲשָׂרָה שַׁלִּיטִים״ — שְׁתֵּי עֵינַיִם, וּשְׁתֵּי אׇזְנַיִם, וּשְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם, וּשְׁתֵּי רַגְלַיִם, וְרֹאשׁ הַגְּוִיָּיה, וּפֶה.
human_translation: “Wisdom is a stronghold to the wise man more than ten rulers “Wisdom is a stronghold to the wise man,” this repentance and good deeds. “More than ten rulers,” the two eyes, and two ears, and two hands, and two legs, and the tip of the sex organ, and the mouth,
llm_translation: "The wisdom will give strength to the wise more than ten rulers." "The wisdom will give strength to the wise" - this is repentance and good deeds, "more than ten rulers" - two eyes, and two ears, and two hands, and two feet, and the head of the body, and the mouth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זְכַרְיָה מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: בִּיקֵּשׁ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהוֹצִיא כְּהוּנָּה מִשֵּׁם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהוּא כֹהֵן לְאֵל עֶלְיוֹן״. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִקְדִּים בִּרְכַּת אַבְרָהָם לְבִרְכַּת הַמָּקוֹם — הוֹצִיאָהּ מֵאַבְרָהָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Zekharya said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: The Holy One, Blessed be He, wanted the priesthood to emerge from Shem, as it is stated: and he was priest of God the Most High” Once placed the blessing of Abraham before the blessing of the Omnipresent, emerge from Abraham
llm_translation: Rabbi Zechariah said in the name of Rabbi Ishmael: The Holy One, blessed be He, sought to bring out the priesthood from Shem, as it is stated: "And he was a priest to God Most High." Once the blessing of Abraham preceded the blessing of the Omnipresent, it was brought out from Abraham.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְבָרְכֵהוּ וַיֹּאמַר בָּרוּךְ אַבְרָם לְאֵל עֶלְיוֹן קֹנֵה שָׁמַיִם וָאָרֶץ וּבָרוּךְ אֵל עֶלְיוֹן״. אָמַר לוֹ אַבְרָהָם: וְכִי מַקְדִּימִין בִּרְכַּת עֶבֶד לְבִרְכַּת קוֹנוֹ? מִיָּד נְתָנָהּ לְאַבְרָהָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״נְאֻם ה׳ לַאדֹנִי שֵׁב לִימִינִי עַד אָשִׁית אֹיְבֶיךָ הֲדֹם לְרַגְלֶיךָ״, וּבָתְרֵיהּ כְּתִיב: ״נִשְׁבַּע ה׳ וְלֹא יִנָּחֵם אַתָּה כֹהֵן לְעוֹלָם עַל דִּבְרָתִי מַלְכִּי צֶדֶק״. עַל דִּיבּוּרוֹ שֶׁל מַלְכִּי צֶדֶק.
human_translation: As it is stated: “And he blessed him and said: Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth, and blessed be God the Most High” Abraham said to him: And does one place the blessing of the servant before the blessing of his master? Immediately gave to Abraham, as it is stated: “The Lord says to my lord: Sit at My right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool” and afterward it is written: “The Lord has sworn, and will not repent: you shall be a priest forever, because you are a king of righteousness [ al divrati malki tzedek ]” Due to the words [ divrati ] of Melchizedek,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "And he blessed him and said: 'Blessed be Abram of God Most High, Maker of heaven and earth; and blessed be God Most High.'" Abraham said to him: "Do slaves precede their master in offering a blessing? Immediately, He gave it to Abraham, as it is stated: "The Lord says to my lord: 'Sit at My right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool,'" and following it is written: "The Lord has sworn and will not relent: 'You are a priest forever, according to the manner of Melchizedek.'" Concerning the utterance of Melchizedek.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב ״וְהוּא כֹהֵן לְאֵל עֶלְיוֹן״: הוּא כֹּהֵן, וְאֵין זַרְעוֹ כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: And this is as it is written: “And he was priest of God the Most High” he, is a priest, but his children not priests.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And this is what is written, 'And he was a priest to God Most High': he is a priest, but his offspring is not a priest." English translation: "And this is what is written, 'And he was a priest to God Most High': he is a priest, and his seed is not a priest."

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ אַרְבָּעָה נְדָרִים
llm_translation: We will return to you, four vows.

hebrew_text: אֵין בֵּין הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לַמּוּדָּר הֵימֶנּוּ מַאֲכָל אֶלָּא דְּרִיסַת הָרֶגֶל וְכֵלִים שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין בָּהֶם אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ.
human_translation: The difference between one for whom benefit from another is forbidden by vow [ hamuddar hana’a meḥaveiro ] and one for whom from his food is forbidden by vow only setting foot and utensils that one does not use preparation of food
llm_translation: There is no pleasure between one dwelling and another dwelling except for trampling with the foot and vessels that are not used for food.

hebrew_text: הַמּוּדָּר מַאֲכָל מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לֹא יַשְׁאִילֶנּוּ נָפָה וּכְבָרָה וְרֵיחַיִם וְתַנּוּר, אֲבָל מַשְׁאִיל לוֹ חָלוּק וְטַבַּעַת וְטַלִּית וּנְזָמִים.
human_translation: one for whom from another’s food is forbidden by vow, may not lend him a sieve, or a strainer, or a millstone, or an oven. However, he may lend him a garment, or a finger ring, or a cloak, or nose rings,
llm_translation: The one who is pledged to return food from his fellow, he shall not lend to him a sieve, a winnowing fork, a sifter, or an oven. But he may lend to him a sickle, a ring, a cloak, or bells.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תְּנָא? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ וִיתּוּר אָסוּר בְּמוּדַּר הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: Who is the tanna Rav Adda bar Ahava said: It is Rabbi Eliezer, as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer said: Even overlooking [ vittur ] is prohibited in one prohibited by vow from deriving benefit
