llm_translation: Gemara: Who is the Tanna? Rav Adda bar Ahava said: It is Rabbi Eliezer, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says: Even if it is extra, it is prohibited in a vow of benefit.

hebrew_text: הַמּוּדָּר מַאֲכָל מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לֹא יַשְׁאִילֶנּוּ וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: one for whom from another’s food is forbidden by vow, may not lend him
llm_translation: The one who is pledged food from his fellow, he shall not lend it to him, etc.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מִן מַאֲכָל נָדַר! אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ: בְּאוֹמֵר ״הֲנָאַת מַאֲכָלְךָ עָלַי״.
human_translation: But didn’t he vow from food, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: where he says: Benefit from your food is forbidden to me,
llm_translation: "And this, from food he vowed! Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: By saying 'the pleasure of your food upon me.'"

hebrew_text: אֵימָא שֶׁלֹּא יִלְעוֹס חִיטִּין וְיִתֵּן עַל מַכָּתוֹ! אָמַר רָבָא: בְּאוֹמֵר ״הֲנָאָה הַמְּבִיאָה לִידֵי מַאֲכָלְךָ עָלַי״.
human_translation: Say that he may not chew wheat and place on his wound, Rava said where he says: Benefit that leads to your food is forbidden to me.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima shelo yil'os chitim v'yiten al makhato!" Amar Rava: B'omer 'hana'ah ham'vi'ah li'dei ma'achal'kha alai. English translation: "Say that he should not grind wheat and place it on his wound!" Rava said: By saying, "The pleasure that leads to your food is upon me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שַׂק לְהָבִיא פֵּירוֹת, וַחֲמוֹר לְהָבִיא עָלָיו פֵּירוֹת, וַאֲפִילּוּ צַנָּא בְּעָלְמָא, הֲנָאָה הַמְּבִיאָה לִידֵי מַאֲכָל הוּא. בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: סוּס לִרְכּוֹב עָלָיו וְטַבַּעַת לֵירָאוֹת בָּהּ, מַהוּ? מִיפְסַק וּמֵיזַל בְּאַרְעֵיהּ, מַאי?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: a sack to bring produce, or a donkey upon which to bring produce, or even merely a basket, benefit that leads to food, Rav Pappa raised a dilemma: a horse upon which to or a ring with which to be seen what is traversing and walking on his land what
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: A sack to bring fruits, and a donkey to bring fruits on it, and even if it is a basket in general, the pleasure of bringing it leads to food. Rav Papa asked: A horse to ride on it and a ring to adorn with it, what is the law? If it breaks and falls in his land, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אֲבָל מַשְׁאִיל לוֹ חָלוּק וְטַלִּית נְזָמִים וְטַבָּעוֹת. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא שֶׁלֹּא לֵירָאוֹת בָּהֶן, צְרִיכָא לְמֵימַר? אֶלָּא לָאו, אֲפִילּוּ לֵירָאוֹת בָּהֶן, וְקָתָנֵי ״מַשְׁאִילוֹ״!
human_translation: Come hear However, he may lend him a garment, and a cloak, and nose rings, and finger rings. What are the circumstances If we say where not to be seen with them, need to be said? Rather, isn’t even to be seen with them, and it is taught he may lend him?
llm_translation: Come and hear: But if he lent him a cloak and a scarf with gems and rings. How much are they worth? If you say it is not for him to wear them, is it necessary to say? Rather, no, even if it is for him to wear them, and it teaches "he lent him"!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם שֶׁלֹּא לֵירָאוֹת, וְאַיְּידֵי דְּקָתָנֵי רֵישָׁא ״לֹא יַשְׁאִילֶנּוּ״, תְּנָא סֵיפָא ״מַשְׁאִילוֹ״.
human_translation: No, actually not to be seen since it is taught the first clause: He may not lend him, taught the latter clause He may lend him.
llm_translation: Not, forever not to fear, and since it teaches in the beginning "he shall not lend him," a Tanna teaches in the end "he shall lend him."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין בּוֹ אוֹכֶל נֶפֶשׁ, מָקוֹם שֶׁמַּשְׂכִּירִין כְּיוֹצֵא בָּהֶן — אָסוּר.
human_translation: And any item that one does not use in the preparation of food, a place where one rents of that kind, forbidden.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "And any matter that does not involve a tangible benefit, in a place where they would hire workers like them - it is prohibited."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין מַשְׂכִּירִין. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא.
human_translation: By inference, that the first clause even if where one does not rent Who taught Rav Adda bar Ahava said: It is Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar miklal d'reisha, af al pi she'ein maskirin. Man tana? Amar Rav Adda bar Ahava: Rabbi Eliezer hi." English translation: "It is derived from the general principle of the first clause, even though they do not rent. Who is the Tanna? Rav Adda bar Ahava said: It is Rabbi Eliezer."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, שׁוֹקֵל לוֹ אֶת שִׁקְלוֹ וּפוֹרֵעַ אֶת חוֹבוֹ, וּמַחֲזִיר לוֹ אֶת אֲבֵידָתוֹ. מָקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין עָלֶיהָ שָׂכָר — תִּפּוֹל הֲנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: one prohibited by vow from deriving benefit from another, he may contribute the half-shekel on his and repay his debt, and return his lost item to him, a place where one takes payment benefit should fall into consecrated
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is entrusted with an object for benefit from his fellow, he weighs out his shekel for him and pays his debt, and returns his lost item to him. In a place where they receive payment for it, the benefit falls to the Temple treasury.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַלְמָא אַבְרוֹחֵי אֲרִי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא, וּשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Apparently, merely driving away a lion and permitted.
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma Al'ma Avrochei Ari B'alma Hu, U'shrei."

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: זוֹ
human_translation: Who taught Rav Hoshaya said: This
llm_translation: Who taught it? Rav Hoshaya said: This is...

hebrew_text: דִּבְרֵי חָנָן הִיא.
human_translation: is the statement of Ḥanan
llm_translation: The words of Hanan it is.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל, גַּבֵּי מוּדָּר הֲנָאָה דְּיָהֵיב עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא לִפְרוֹעַ.
human_translation: Rava said: Even if you say everyone agrees with regard to one prohibited by vow from deriving benefit from another that on the condition that he not to repay
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you say "the words of everyone," regarding a vow of benefit that one gives on the condition that it not be annulled.

hebrew_text: מַאי חָנָן? דִּתְנַן: מִי שֶׁהָלַךְ לִמְדִינַת הַיָּם, וְעָמַד אֶחָד וּפִירְנֵס אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ. חָנָן אָמַר: אִיבֵּד אֶת מְעוֹתָיו.
human_translation: What Ḥanan as we learned who went to a country overseas, and one arose and supported his wife Ḥanan said: lost his money,
llm_translation: What is the case of Hanan? As we learned: One who went to the province of the sea, and one stood and supported his wife. Hanan said: "I will lose my money."

hebrew_text: נֶחְלְקוּ עָלָיו בְּנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים, וְאָמְרוּ: יִשָּׁבַע כַּמָּה הוֹצִיא, וְיִטּוֹל. אָמַר רַבִּי דּוֹסָא בֶּן הַרְכִּינָס כְּדִבְרֵיהֶם. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי: יָפֶה אָמַר חָנָן, הִנִּיחַ מְעוֹתָיו עַל קֶרֶן הַצְּבִי.
human_translation: The sons of High Priests disagreed with him and said: will take an oath how much he spent and take Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas said in accordance with statement Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said: Ḥanan spoke well, he placed his money on the antler of a deer,
llm_translation: The sons of the great priests disputed about it, and they said: He should swear how much he took out, and then he should take. Rabbi Dosa ben Harkinas said in accordance with their words. Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai said: Hanan said well, he placed his coins on the horn of the deer.

hebrew_text: רָבָא לָא אָמַר כְּרַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא, דְּקָא מוֹקֵים לָהּ לְמַתְנִיתִין כְּדִבְרֵי הַכֹּל. רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא לָא אָמַר כְּרָבָא, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁלֹּא לִיפָּרַע מִשּׁוּם לִיפָּרַע.
human_translation: Rava did not say as did Rav Hoshaya, as he establishes the mishna in accordance with the statements everyone Rav Hoshaya did not say as did Rava, decree on the condition that he not to repay due to to repay.
llm_translation: Rava did not say like Rav Hoshaya, who establishes for it (the Mishnah) according to the words of everyone. Rav Hoshaya did not say like Rava, a decree that should not be violated in order to avoid violation.

hebrew_text: מַחֲזִיר לוֹ אֶת אֲבֵידָתוֹ. פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, חַד אָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי מַחְזִיר אֲסוּרִין עַל בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה, דְּכִי מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ — מִידַּעַם דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ. אֲבָל נִכְסֵי בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה אֲסוּרִין עַל מַחְזִיר — לָא קָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ, דְּקָא מְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ פְּרוּטָה דְּרַב יוֹסֵף.
human_translation: He returns his lost item to him. Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi disagree about this. One said: They taught only where the property of the one returning is forbidden to the owner of the lost item, as when he returns to him he is returning something of his own However, where the property of the owner of the lost item is forbidden to the one returning he may not return to him, benefits him peruta of Rav Yosef.
llm_translation: He returns his lost item. Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi disagree about it. One says: They only taught this regarding returning prohibited items to the owner of the lost item, for when he returns it, he is returning it to himself. But regarding the property of the owner of the lost item, it is prohibited for the one returning it, for he is benefiting from the profit of Rabbi Yosef.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ נִכְסֵי בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה אֲסוּרִין עַל מַחְזִיר מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ, וּמִשּׁוּם פְּרוּטָה דְּרַב יוֹסֵף לָא שְׁכִיחַ.
human_translation: And one said: Even where the property of the owner of the lost item is forbidden to the one returning he returns And due to peruta of Rav Yosef, uncommon
llm_translation: And one said: Even the properties of a lost object owner are forbidden upon the one who returns it to him, and because of the small coin of Rav Yosef, it is not common.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מָקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין עָלֶיהָ שָׂכָר — תִּפּוֹל הֲנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲפִילּוּ בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה אֲסוּרִים עַל מַחְזִיר נָמֵי מַהְדַּר — הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי מָקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין עָלֶיהָ שָׂכָר תִּפּוֹל הֲנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ.
human_translation: We learned a place where one takes payment benefit should fall into consecrated Granted, according to the one who says that even where the property of the owner of the lost item is forbidden to the one returning he returns This is that which teaches: a place where one takes payment benefit should fall into consecrated
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: "In a place where they receive payment for it, benefit shall fall to the Temple treasury." It is well according to the one who says that even with regard to items that are forbidden to benefit from, one is obligated to return them, as it is taught: "In a place where they receive payment for it, benefit shall fall to the Temple treasury."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה אֲסוּרִים עַל מַחְזִיר לָא מַהְדַּר, אַמַּאי תִּפּוֹל הֲנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ?
human_translation: However, according to the one who says where the property of the owner of the lost item is forbidden to the one returning he may not return why should the benefit fall into consecrated
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says when the owner of a lost object is hidden, it is forbidden for the finder to return it, why should the benefit fall to the Temple treasury?

hebrew_text: אַחֲדָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: teaches about one
llm_translation: One Mishnah teaches:

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּמַתְנֵי לַהּ בְּהַאי לִישָּׁנָא: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי. חַד אָמַר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה אֲסוּרִין עַל מַחְזִיר, וּמִשּׁוּם פְּרוּטָה דְּרַב יוֹסֵף לָא שְׁכִיחַ. אֲבָל נִכְסֵי מַחְזִיר אֲסוּרִים עַל בַּעַל אֲבֵדָה — לָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ, מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: There are who teach in this formulation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi disagree about this. One said: They taught only where the property of the owner of lost item is forbidden to one returning and due to peruta of Rav Yosef not common. However, where the property of one returning is forbidden to owner of lost item, he may not return to him, due to that he benefits him.
llm_translation: There is one who teaches it in this manner: Rabbi Amei and Rabbi Asi disagree about it. One says: They only taught that when the lost item belongs to the one who is returning it, it is forbidden to return it, and because of the small coin of Rav Yosef, it is not common. But when the lost item belongs to the one who lost it, it is forbidden to return it - he does not return it, because he benefits from it.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ נִכְסֵי מַחְזִיר אֲסוּרִים עַל בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה — מוּתָּר. דְּכִי מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ — מִידֵּי דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ קָמַהְדַּר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And one said: Even if the property of one returning is forbidden to owner of the lost item, permitted as when he returns it, he is returning something of his own
llm_translation: And one said: Even if the lost property of a lost object is found in the possession of a suspect, it is permitted. For when he returns it to him, he returns it of his own accord, he returns it to him willingly.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: מָקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין עָלֶיהָ שָׂכָר — תִּפּוֹל הֲנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲפִילּוּ בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי מַחְזִיר אֲסוּרִים עַל בַּעַל אֲבֵידָה מַהְדַּר — הַיְינוּ דִּמְתָרֵץ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: We learned a place where one takes payment benefit should fall into consecrated Granted, according to the one who says that even if the property of one returning is forbidden to owner of the lost item he returns this is that resolve a place
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah: a place where one receives payment - benefit shall fall to the Temple. It is well according to the one who says even with stolen goods, one returns forbidden items to the owner of a lost object, he beautifies - that is how he resolves the place.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי מַחְזִיר אֲסוּרִין, וְלָא מַהְדַּר, הֵיכִי מְתָרֵץ מָקוֹם? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: However, according to the one who said in where the property of one returning is forbidden he may not return how does he explain a place difficult.
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says that when it comes to returning forbidden items, one should not return them, how does he resolve the issue of the place? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָיְתָה לְפָנָיו כִּכָּר שֶׁל הֶפְקֵר, וְאָמַר: ״כִּכָּר זוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁ״, נְטָלָהּ לְאוֹכְלָהּ — מָעַל לְפִי כּוּלָּהּ. לְהוֹרִישָׁה לְבָנָיו — מָעַל לְפִי טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה שֶׁבָּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: there was a loaf of ownerless before and he said: This loaf is consecrated, he took to eat it, he misused consecrated based on entire value. to bequeath it to his sons, he misused the consecrated based on the discretionary benefit that
llm_translation: Rava said: If there was before him a loaf that is ownerless, and he said: "This loaf is holy," and he took it to eat it - he has acted beyond the requirements of the law. If he designated it for his sons to inherit - he has acted beyond the requirements of the law based on the benefit it contains.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין מֵרָבָא: ״כִּכָּרִי עָלֶיךָ״ וּנְתָנָהּ לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה, מַהוּ? ״כִּכָּרִי״ אָמַר לוֹ, כִּי אִיתֵיהּ בִּרְשׁוּתֵיהּ הוּא דְּאָסוּר. אוֹ דִּלְמָא ״עָלֶיךָ״ אֲמַר לֵיהּ, עִילָּוֵיהּ שַׁוִּיתֵיהּ הֶקְדֵּשׁ?
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya bar Avin raised a dilemma before Rava. My loaf for you, and gave it to him as a gift, what is My loaf he said to him when is in his possession, that is when it is forbidden, Or, perhaps to you, he said to him he rendered for him like a consecrated item
llm_translation: Rav Chiya bar Avin from Rava asked him: "My 'kikari' is upon you," and he gave it to him as a gift, what is the law? "My 'kikari'," he said to him, for it is in his domain that it is prohibited. Or perhaps "upon you" he said to him, is it considered as if he dedicated it to him?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פְּשִׁיטָא דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּיַהֲבַהּ לֵיהּ בְּמַתָּנָה — אָסוּר. אֶלָּא ״כִּכָּרִי עָלֶיךָ״ לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאַפּוֹקֵי דְּאִי גַּנְבַהּ מִינֵּיהּ מִיגְנָב? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא, לְאַפּוֹקֵי דְּאִי אַזְמְנֵיהּ עֲלַהּ.
human_translation: said to him: is obvious that although he gave it to as a gift, forbidden. But My loaf to you, what does it to exclude? Does it not to exclude where he stole it from him, said to him: No, it to exclude he invited him
llm_translation: He said to him: It is obvious that even though he gave it to him as a gift - it is forbidden. Rather, "like my wages upon you" - to exclude what? Not to exclude that if he stole from him, he should steal from him? He said to him: No, to exclude that if he appointed him, he should go up.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ, אָמַר לוֹ: ״הַשְׁאִילֵנִי פָּרָתְךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״קֻוֽנָּם פָּרָה שֶׁאֲנִי קָנוּי לָךְ״, ״נְכָסַי עָלֶיךָ אִם יֵשׁ לִי פָּרָה אֶלָּא זוֹ״. ״הַשְׁאִילֵנִי קַרְדּוּמְּךָ״, אָמַר לוֹ: ״קֻוֽנָּם קַרְדּוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לִי שֶׁאֲנִי קָנוּי״, ״נְכָסַי עָלַי אִם יֵשׁ לִי קַרְדּוֹם אֶלָּא זֶה״, וְנִמְצָא שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ — בְּחַיָּיו אָסוּר, מֵת אוֹ שֶׁנִּתְּנָה לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר.
human_translation: raised an objection to said to him: Lend me your cow, said to him: cow that I purchased is konam for you; My property to you if I have a cow other than this one, Lend me your spade, said to him: spade that I have that I purchased is konam for you; My property to me if I have a spade other than this one, and it is discovered that he has during the life forbidden died or was given to as a gift, it is permitted.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: "Lend me your cow." He said to him: "The cow that I have is designated for you." "My possessions are upon you if I have any cow other than this one." "Lend me your donkey." He said to him: "The donkey that I have is designated for you." "My possessions are upon me if I have any donkey other than this one." And if it turns out that he does have one — during his lifetime it is forbidden, if he dies or if it was given to him as a gift — then it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִיקָא: שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה לוֹ עַל יְדֵי אַחֵר.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Ika, said: was given to by another
llm_translation: Rav Ahah son of Rav Ika said: "It was given to him by another."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: דַּיְקָא נָמֵי דְּקָתָנֵי ״שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה לוֹ״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״שֶׁנְּתָנָהּ לוֹ״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: is also precise, as it teaches: That was given to him, and it is not taught: That he gave it to him.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: It is precisely stated as it is taught, "that was given to him," and not stated as "that he was given."

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: יֵשׁ מְעִילָה בְּקוּנָּמוֹת, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma before Rav Naḥman: Is there misuse of consecrated property in konamot or not?
llm_translation: Requested by Rava from Rav Nachman: Is there a concept of "me'ilah" in regards to consecrated items or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: מְקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין עָלֶיהָ שָׂכָר — תִּיפּוֹל הֲנָאָה לַהֶקְדֵּשׁ. לְמֵימְרָא כִּי הֶקְדֵּשׁ, מָה הֶקְדֵּשׁ יֵשׁ בּוֹ מְעִילָה — אַף קוּנָּמוֹת יֵשׁ בָּהֶן מְעִילָה.
human_translation: said to You learned a place where one takes payment benefit should fall into consecrated to say, consecrated property. Just as consecrated property there is misuse, so too konamot there is misuse.
llm_translation: He said to him, "You have taught it: in a place where they receive reward for it - benefit shall fall to the Sanctuary." By way of inference, when it comes to the Sanctuary, just as the Sanctuary has a covering - so too, the corners have a covering.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״קֻוֽנָּם כִּכָּר זוֹ הֶקְדֵּשׁ״ וַאֲכָלָהּ, בֵּין הוּא וּבֵין חֲבֵירוֹ — מָעַל, לְפִיכָךְ יֵשׁ לָהּ פִּדְיוֹן. ״כִּכָּר זוֹ עָלַי לְהֶקְדֵּשׁ״ וַאֲכָלָהּ, הוּא — מָעַל, חֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא מָעַל. לְפִיכָךְ אֵין לָהּ פִּדְיוֹן. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: like tanna’im . This loaf is konam consecrated property, and he ate it, whether he or whether another misused consecrated property. Therefore, it has redemption. This loaf is konam for me consecrated property and he eats it, he misused consecrated property. another he did not misuse consecrated property, Therefore, it does not have redemption, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Tannaim: "Their measure like a kor, this is consecrated," and he ate it, whether he or his fellow — he transgressed, therefore it requires redemption. "This kor is upon me for consecration," and he ate it, he — transgressed, his fellow — did not transgress. Therefore, it does not require redemption. The words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין כָּךְ וּבֵין כָּךְ לֹא מָעַל, לְפִי שֶׁאֵין מְעִילָה בְּקוּנָּמוֹת.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: both this manner and in that manner, no misused consecrated property because there is no misuse in konamot .
llm_translation: The sages say: "In this way and in that way he did not transgress, because there is no cloak in the corners."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: ״כִּכָּרִי עָלֶיךָ״ וּנְתָנָהּ לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה, מִי מָעַל? לִמְעוֹל נוֹתֵן — הָא לָא אֲסִירָא עֲלֵיהּ! לִמְעוֹל מְקַבֵּל — יָכוֹל דְּאָמַר: הֶיתֵּירָא בְּעֵיתִי, אִיסּוּרָא לָא בְּעֵיתִי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מְקַבֵּל מָעַל לִכְשֶׁיּוֹצִיא, שֶׁכׇּל הַמּוֹצִיא מְעוֹת הֶקְדֵּשׁ לְחוּלִּין, כְּסָבוּר שֶׁל חוּלִּין הוּא — מוֹעֵל. אַף זֶה — מוֹעֵל.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: My loaf is for you, and he gave it to him as a gift, which misused consecrated property? Let the one who gives misuse, is not forbidden to him? Let the one who receives misuse, he can say: I wanted a permitted I did not want a forbidden said to him: The one who receives misuse when he utilizes that anyone who utilizes consecrated money for non-sacred when he is under the impression that it is non-sacred, misuses consecrated property. This also misuses consecrated property.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ahah son of Rav Avya said to Rav Ashi: "My loaf is upon you," and he gave it to him as a gift, who has transgressed? If he gives it as a gift, he has not transgressed! If he receives it as a gift, he might say: "I desired permission, I did not desire prohibition." He said to him: He transgresses when he takes it out, for anyone who takes out consecrated items into mundane items, thinking they are mundane, is considered a transgressor. So too here, he is considered a transgressor.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְתוֹרֵם אֶת תְּרוּמָתוֹ וּמַעְשְׂרוֹתָיו לְדַעְתּוֹ, וּמַקְרִיב עָלָיו קִינֵּי זָבִין, קִינֵּי זָבוֹת, קִינֵּי יוֹלְדוֹת, חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת. וּמְלַמְּדוֹ מִדְרָשׁ הֲלָכוֹת וְאַגָּדוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא יְלַמְּדֶנּוּ מִקְרָא. אֲבָל מְלַמֵּד הוּא אֶת בָּנָיו וְאֶת בְּנוֹתָיו מִקְרָא.
human_translation: And he separates his teruma and his tithes, with the knowledge And he sacrifices for him the bird nests, of zavin the bird nests of zavot the bird nests of women after childbirth sin-offerings; and guilt-offerings. And he teaches him midrash, halakhot , and aggadot , but he may not teach him Bible. However, he may teach his sons and daughters Bible.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "And he separates his contribution and his tithes according to his own knowledge, and he brings upon himself the offerings of those with discharges, the offerings of those with menstrual impurity, the offerings of those who have given birth, sin offerings, and guilt offerings. And he teaches him the laws and the aggadot, but he should not teach him Scripture. However, he should teach his sons and his daughters Scripture."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הָנֵי כָּהֲנֵי, שְׁלוּחֵי דִידַן הָווּ, אוֹ שְׁלוּחֵי דִשְׁמַיָּא? לְמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ — לְמוּדָּר הֲנָאָה. אִי אָמְרַתְּ דִּשְׁלוּחֵי דִידַן הָווּ, הָא מְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ וְאָסוּר. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ שְׁלוּחֵי דִשְׁמַיָּא — שְׁרֵי. מַאי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Are these priests our agents or agents of Heaven What is the practical difference one prohibited by vow from deriving benefit If you say that are our agents, don’t benefit and prohibited? And if you say that they are agents of Heaven, permitted. What
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question: Are those priests, our emissaries, or emissaries of Heaven? What practical difference does it make? — It emerges for a matter of benefit. If you say they are our emissaries, then they benefit him and it is prohibited. And if you say they are emissaries of Heaven — it is permitted. What is the ruling?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דִּתְנַן: מַקְרִיב עָלָיו קִינֵּי זָבִין כּוּ׳. אִי אָמְרַתְּ שְׁלוּחֵי דִידַן, קָא מְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Come hear as we learned And he sacrifices for him the bird nests of zavin , etc. If you say our agents, benefit
llm_translation: Come and hear, for it was taught: One brings upon him the lamentations of those afflicted with gonorrhea. If you say they are our emissaries, are they benefiting him?

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, לִיתְנֵי: מַקְרִיב עָלָיו קׇרְבָּנוֹת! אֶלָּא, מְחוּסְּרֵי כַפָּרָה שָׁאנֵי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל צְרִיכִין דַּעַת, חוּץ מִמְּחוּסְּרֵי כַפָּרָה. שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל בָּנָיו וְעַל בְּנוֹתָיו הַקְּטַנִּים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַזָּב״, בֵּין גָּדוֹל בֵּין קָטָן.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, let teach He sacrifices for him offerings. Rather, those lacking atonement are different as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Everyone requires knowledge except for those lacking atonement, that a person brings offering for his minor sons and daughters, as it is stated: “This is the law of the zav ” both an adult and a minor.
llm_translation: And to taste, let him give: he brings sacrifices upon him! Rather, those lacking atonement are different. As Rabbi Yochanan said: Everything requires knowledge, except for those lacking atonement. For a person brings a sacrifice for his young sons and daughters, as it is said: "This is the law of the one with a discharge," whether an adult or a minor.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַיֹּלֶדֶת וְגוֹ׳״, בֵּין קְטַנָּה וּבֵין גְּדוֹלָה? קְטַנָּה בַּת לֵידָה הִיא?! וְהָא תָּנֵי רַב בִּיבִי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים מְשַׁמְּשׁוֹת בְּמוֹךְ: קְטַנָּה וּמְעוּבֶּרֶת וּמְנִיקָה. קְטַנָּה — שֶׁמָּא תִּתְעַבֵּר וְתָמוּת.
human_translation: However, if that is so to Rabbi Yoḥanan, “This is the law of a woman after childbirth” both an adult and a minor? Is a minor capable of birth? But didn’t Rav Beivai teach before Rav Naḥman: three women engage in intercourse with resorbent: A minor, and a pregnant and a nursing a minor lest she conceive and die.
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, according to Rabbi Yochanan, "This is the Torah of the woman who gives birth, etc.," whether she is young or old? Is a young woman considered a birthing mother?! But didn't Rav Bibi teach before Rav Nachman: Three women are in danger during childbirth: a young woman, a pregnant woman, and a nursing woman. A young woman - lest she become pregnant and die.

hebrew_text: הַהִיא ״זֹאת תּוֹרַת הַיֹּלֶדֶת״, בֵּין פִּקַּחַת בֵּין שׁוֹטָה, שֶׁכֵּן אָדָם מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ שׁוֹטָה,
human_translation: That “This is the law of a woman after childbirth,” both a halakhically competent woman and a woman an imbecile, as a man brings an offering for his wife who is an imbecile.
llm_translation: That, "This is the Torah of the woman who gives birth," whether she is intelligent or foolish, for so a man brings a sacrifice for his foolish wife.

hebrew_text: כְּדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אָדָם מֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָשִׁיר עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ, וְכׇל קׇרְבָּנוֹת שֶׁחַיֶּיבֶת,
human_translation: in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: A man brings the offering of a wealthy person for his wife, as well as all offerings that she is obligated for which she is obligated.
llm_translation: In the words of Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: A man brings a sacrifice for his wealthy wife, and all the sacrifices that she is obligated to bring,

hebrew_text: שֶׁכָּךְ כּוֹתֵב לָהּ: וְאַחְרָיוּת דְּאִית לִיךְ עֲלַי מִן קַדְמַת דְּנָא.
human_translation: that this he writes her And responsibility that you have before this is upon me.
llm_translation: So it is written to her: "And afterward, I will give you from the former things."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אַבָּא: אִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן, יִזְרוֹק עָלָיו דַּם חַטָּאתוֹ וְדַם אֲשָׁמוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Abba raised an objection If was a priest, he may sprinkle the blood of his sin-offering and the blood of his guilt-offering on
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Abba raises an objection: If he was a Kohen, they should sprinkle upon him the blood of his sin-offering and the blood of his guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: דַּם חַטָּאתוֹ שֶׁל מְצוֹרָע וְדַם אֲשָׁמוֹ שֶׁל מְצוֹרָע. דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹאת תִּהְיֶה תּוֹרַת הַמְּצֹרָע״, בֵּין גָּדוֹל וּבֵין קָטָן.
human_translation: blood of the sin-offering of a leper and blood of the guilt-offering of a leper. as it is written: “This is the law of the leper” both an adult and a minor.
llm_translation: The blood of his sin offering and the blood of his guilt offering. As it is written: "This shall be the law of the leper," whether an adult or a minor.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: הַכֹּהֲנִים שֶׁפִּיגְּלוּ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ, מְזִידִין — חַיָּיבִין. הָא שׁוֹגְגִין — פְּטוּרִין, אֶלָּא שֶׁפִּיגּוּלָן פִּיגּוּל.
human_translation: We learned priests who rendered piggul in the Temple, they did intentionally, they are obligated they did unwittingly, they are exempt However, they piggul , piggul
llm_translation: We learned: Kohanim who intentionally defile themselves in the Temple - are liable. But if it was unintentional - they are exempt, except for their defilement, which is defiled.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא שְׁלוּחֵי דִשְׁמַיָּא הָווּ, הַיְינוּ שֶׁפִּיגּוּלָן פִּיגּוּל. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ שְׁלוּחֵי דִידַן הָווּ, אַמַּאי פִּיגּוּלָן פִּיגּוּל? לֵימָא לֵיהּ: שְׁלִיחָא שַׁוֵּיתָיךְ לְתַקּוֹנֵי וְלָא לְעַוּוֹתֵי!
human_translation: Granted, if you say are agents of Heaven, this is their piggul piggul ; However, if you say are our agents, why their piggul piggul ? Let say to I designated you an agent to perform properly but not to perform improperly.
llm_translation: If you say that they were emissaries of Heaven, that means they were revealed. Rather, if you say they were our emissaries, why were they revealed? Say to him: "I have appointed you as a messenger for mending, not for corrupting!"

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: שָׁאנֵי גַּבֵּי פִּיגּוּל, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״לֹא יֵחָשֵׁב לוֹ״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: say is different with regard to piggul , as the verse states it will not be imputed to him” in any case,
llm_translation: They said: It is different regarding Pigul, as the verse says "it shall not be accepted for him," in any case.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל צְרִיכִין דַּעַת חוּץ מִמְּחוּסַּר כַּפָּרָה, שֶׁהֲרֵי אָדָם מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל בָּנָיו וְעַל בְּנוֹתָיו הַקְּטַנִּים. אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה יָבִיא אָדָם חַטַּאת חֵלֶב עַל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁכֵּן אָדָם מֵבִיא עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ שׁוֹטָה, כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הִפְרִישׁ חַטַּאת חֵלֶב עַל חֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם!
human_translation: the itself, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Everyone requires knowledge, except for those lacking atonement; that a person brings offering for his minor sons and daughters. However, if that is so, let a person bring a sin-offering on another who unwittingly ate fat just as a man brings for his wife who is an imbecile, in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Why did Rabbi Elazar say: separated a sin-offering on another fat has done nothing?
llm_translation: Body, Rabbi Yochanan said: Everything requires knowledge except for a lack of intention, for a person brings a sacrifice for his young sons and daughters. Rather, from now on, a person should bring a sin offering of fat for his fellow, for a person brings for his foolish wife, like Rabbi Yehuda. Why did Rabbi Elazar say: If one designates a sin offering of fat for his fellow - he has done nothing!

hebrew_text: אִשְׁתּוֹ שׁוֹטָה הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאָכְלָה כְּשֶׁהִיא שׁוֹטָה — לָאו בַּת קׇרְבָּן הִיא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances of his wife who is an imbecile? If she ate fat when she was an imbecile, she is not subject an offering,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "His wife is a fool, what is the law? If she ate while she was a fool - she is not considered a daughter of the offering."

hebrew_text: וְאִי דְּאָכְלָה כְּשֶׁהִיא פִּקַּחַת, וְנִשְׁתַּטֵּית — הָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אָכַל חֵלֶב וְהִפְרִישׁ קׇרְבָּן, וְנִשְׁתַּטָּה וְחָזַר וְנִשְׁתַּפָּה — פָּסוּל, הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחָה — יִדָּחֶה.
human_translation: And if she ate when she was competent and became an imbecile, didn’t Rabbi Yirmeya say Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one ate fat and separated an offering, and became an imbecile, and became competent again, the offering is disqualified. Since it was disqualified it will be disqualified
llm_translation: And if she ate while she was conscious, and then became unconscious - this is what Rabbi Yirmiyah said in the name of Rabbi Avahu in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one ate forbidden fat and separated an offering, and then became unconscious and recovered - it is disqualified, since it was disqualified when it was separated.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה יָבִיא אָדָם פֶּסַח עַל חֲבֵירוֹ, שֶׁכֵּן אָדָם מֵבִיא עַל בָּנָיו וְעַל בְּנוֹתָיו הַקְּטַנִּים. אַלְּמָה אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הִפְרִישׁ פֶּסַח עַל חֲבֵירוֹ לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם!
human_translation: However, if that is so, let a person bring a Paschal lamb on another just as a person brings for his minor sons and daughters. Why did Rabbi Elazar say: separated a Paschal lamb on another has done nothing?
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, a person should bring the Paschal offering for his fellow, for so does a person bring for his young sons and daughters. Why did Rabbi Elazar say, "He who separates the Paschal offering for his fellow has done nothing"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: ״שֶׂה לְבֵית אָבֹת״ לָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: “A lamb for each father’s house, is not by Torah law.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: "A sheep for ancestral house" is not of the Torah.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי — מִדִּתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לְבָנָיו: הֲרֵינִי שׁוֹחֵט אֶת הַפֶּסַח עַל מִי שֶׁיַּעֲלֶה מִכֶּם רִאשׁוֹן לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִכְנִיס רִאשׁוֹן רֹאשׁוֹ וְרוּבּוֹ — זָכָה בְּחֶלְקוֹ, וּמְזַכֶּה אֶת אֶחָיו עִמּוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ ״שֶׂה לְבֵית״ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, עַל בִּישְׂרָא קָאֵי וּמְזַכֵּי לְהוּ?!
human_translation: And from where from that which we learned one who says to his sons: I am hereby slaughtering the Paschal lamb on the one of you who will ascend to Jerusalem first, once the first introduces his head and most he acquires his portion and acquires on behalf of his brothers with him. And if you say “a lamb for the household” is by Torah law, he stand over the meat and acquire it on behalf of
llm_translation: And from where? - From what we learned: One who says to his sons, "I am slaughtering the Passover sacrifice for the one among you who will be the first to ascend to Jerusalem," once the first one has brought in his head and the majority of his body - he has acquired his portion, and he acquires for his brothers with him. And if you say, "A sheep for a house" is from the Torah, it stands for the entire Israel and acquires for them?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמָה לְהוּ דְּאָמַר לְהוֹן אֲבוּהוֹן? כְּדֵי לְזָרְזָן בְּמִצְוֹת. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה וְקָדְמוּ בָּנוֹת לַבָּנִים, וְנִמְצְאוּ בָּנוֹת זְרִיזוֹת וּבָנִים שְׁפָלִים.
human_translation: However, why do they that their father say to them: in order to motivate them in mitzvot. This is also taught There was an incident and the daughters preceded the sons, and the daughters were found motivated and the sons lazy [ shefalim ].
llm_translation: Rather, why did their fathers say to them? In order to hasten them in the commandments. It was also taught likewise: There was an incident where daughters preceded sons, and it was found that the daughters were diligent and the sons were negligent.

hebrew_text: וְתוֹרֵם אֶת תְּרוּמָתוֹ כּוּ׳.
human_translation: And he separates his teruma .
llm_translation: And he shall lift up his offering, as it is written: "וְתוֹרֵם אֶת תְּרוּמָתוֹ"

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הַתּוֹרֵם מִשֶּׁלּוֹ עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, צָרִיךְ דַּעְתּוֹ אוֹ לָא? מִי אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דִּזְכוּת הוּא לוֹ, לֹא צָרִיךְ דַּעַת. אוֹ דִּלְמָא מִצְוָה דִּילֵיהּ הִיא, וְנִיחָא לֵיהּ לְמִיעְבְּדֵיהּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before one who separates teruma from his own on of another, require the knowledge or not? Do we say: Since it is a benefit for it does not require his knowledge, Or, perhaps it is his mitzva, and preferable for him to perform
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Does a person who separates his own offering on behalf of his fellow require his consent or not? Do we say: Since it is a merit for him, he does not require consent? Or perhaps it is a mitzvah that is upon him, and it is preferable for him to perform it himself.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: תּוֹרֵם אֶת תְּרוּמוֹתָיו וְאֶת מַעְשְׂרוֹתָיו לְדַעְתּוֹ. בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא מִן בַּעַל הַכְּרִי עַל שֶׁל בַּעַל הַכְּרִי, וּלְדַעְתּוֹ דְּמַאן? אִילֵּימָא לְדַעְתּוֹ דִּילֵיהּ — מַאן שַׁוְּויֵהּ שָׁלִיחַ?
human_translation: Come hear he separates his teruma and his tithes, with his knowledge With what are we dealing? If we say owner of the pile for of the owner of the pile, And with the knowledge of whom If we say with the knowledge who designated him an agent
llm_translation: Come and hear: "He shall lift up his offerings and his tithes to his knowledge." With what are we dealing? If you say it is from the owner of the field to the owner of the field, and to his knowledge, whose knowledge? If you say it is to his own knowledge - who is fit to be his agent?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְדַעְתּוֹ דְּבַעַל הַכְּרִי. הָא קָמְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ דְּקָעָבֵיד שְׁלִיחוּתֵיהּ! אֶלָּא מִשֶּׁלּוֹ עַל שֶׁל הַכְּרִי. וּלְדַעְתּוֹ דְּמַאן? אִילֵימָא לְדַעְתּוֹ דְּבַעַל הַכְּרִי — הָא קָמְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו, לְדַעְתֵּיהּ דְּנַפְשֵׁיהּ, וּמִשֶּׁלּוֹ תּוֹרֵם עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ צָרִיךְ דַּעַת — הָא קָמְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא לָאו, אֵין צָרִיךְ דַּעַת.
human_translation: Rather, with the knowledge of the owner of the pile. isn’t he benefiting he is performing agency Rather, from his own on the pile. And with the knowledge of whom If we say with the knowledge of the owner of the pile, isn’t he benefiting Rather, is it not on his own knowledge, and he is separating from his own on the produce of another? And if you say that requires knowledge isn’t he benefiting Rather, is it not does not require knowledge
llm_translation: Rather, to know that of Baal HaKeri. This one stands before him, honoring his emissary! Rather, from his own property to that of the Keri. And to know whose opinion? If you say to know that of Baal HaKeri — this one stands before him! Rather, no, to know his own opinion, and from his own property he contributes to that of his fellow. And if you say it requires knowledge — this one stands before him! Rather, no, it does not require knowledge.

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם מִשֶּׁל בַּעַל הַכְּרִי עַל בַּעַל הַכְּרִי, כִּדְאָמַר רָבָא: בְּאוֹמֵר ״כׇּל הָרוֹצֶה לִתְרוֹם יָבֹא וְיִתְרוֹם״, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּאוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: Actually, from owner of the pile for of the owner of the pile. as Rava said where one says: Anyone who wishes to come and separate teruma may come and separate teruma . Here too, where one says:
llm_translation: Always the owner of the vineyard over the owner of the vineyard, as Rava said: With regard to one who says, "Whoever wishes to contribute should come and contribute," here too with regard to one who says, and so on.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מֵרַבִּי זֵירָא: הַתּוֹרֵם מִשֶּׁלּוֹ עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ, טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה שֶׁל מִי? מִי אָמְרִינַן: אִי לָאו פֵּירֵי דְּהַאיְךְ, מִי מִתַּקְּנָא כַּרְיָא דְּהָהוּא, אוֹ דִּלְמָא: אִי לָאו כַּרְיָא דְּהָהוּא, לָא הָוְיָין פֵּירֵי דְּהָדֵין תְּרוּמָה?
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma before Rabbi Zeira: one separates teruma from his own for of another, who the discretionary benefit, Do we say: If not for the produce of this would the pile of that be properly tithed, Or, perhaps If not for the pile of that the produce of this would not be teruma ,
llm_translation: Requested of him Rabbi Yirmeya from Rabbi Zeira: The one who lifts his own produce onto that of his fellow, whose benefit is it? Who do we say: If not the fruits of this one, who is envious like the raven, or perhaps: If not the raven, the fruits of that one will not be tithed?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״אֵת כׇּל תְּבוּאַת זַרְעֶךָ ... וְנָתַתָּ״.
human_translation: said to him the verse states: all the produce of your seed…and you shall give”
llm_translation: He said to him, the verse says: "All the produce of your seed... and you shall give."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ: תּוֹרֵם אֶת תְּרוּמוֹתָיו וְאֶת מַעְשְׂרוֹתָיו לְדַעְתּוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה דְּבַעַל הַכְּרִי, הָא קָא מְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה דִּילֵיהּ. אָמְרִי: לֹא, מִשֶּׁל בַּעַל הַכְּרִי עַל שֶׁל בַּעַל הַכְּרִי, וּלְדַעְתּוֹ דְּבַעַל הַכְּרִי, בְּאוֹמֵר ״כֹּל הָרוֹצֶה לִתְרוֹם יָבֹא וְיִתְרוֹם״.
human_translation: raised an objection to he separates his teruma and his tithes, with the knowledge And if you say the discretionary benefit to the owner of the pile, isn’t he benefiting Rather, conclude from the discretionary benefit to say: No, from of the owner of the pile for of the owner of the pile, and knowledge of the owner of the pile, where he says: Anyone who wishes to come and separate teruma may come and separate teruma .
llm_translation: He raised an objection to it: "He shall lift up his offerings to Hashem, his tithes according to his vow, and according to his freewill offering, for the sake of Hashem. And if you say, 'The benefit of the owner of the field,' then he is benefiting from it! Rather, understand from it the benefit of his own benefit. They said: No, the contribution of the owner of the field is for the owner of the field, and according to his intention, the owner of the field, as it says, 'Whoever is willing to contribute, let him come and contribute.'"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ, וּמִתְכַּפֵּר — עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה. וְהַתּוֹרֵם מִשֶּׁלּוֹ עַל שֶׁאֵינוֹ שֶׁלּוֹ — טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Come hear as Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: the one who consecrates adds one-fifth And the one seeking atonement renders a substitute. And one who separates teruma from his own for that is not his, the discretionary benefit is his.
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: One who consecrates and adds a fifth, and achieves atonement - he makes an exchange. And one who donates from what is his for what is not his - his benefit is a good deed.

hebrew_text: מְלַמְּדוֹ מִדְרָשׁ הֲלָכוֹת וְאַגָּדוֹת, אֲבָל לֹא יְלַמְּדֶנּוּ מִקְרָא. מִקְרָא מַאי טַעְמָא לֹא יְלַמְּדֶנּוּ — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָמְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ, מִדְרָשׁ נָמֵי קָמְהַנֵּי לֵיהּ! אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין שָׂכָר עַל הַמִּקְרָא וְאֵין נוֹטְלִין שָׂכָר עַל הַמִּדְרָשׁ. מַאי פַּסְקָא?
human_translation: teaches midrash, halakhot , and aggadot , but he may not teach him Bible. What is the reason he may not teach him Bible? due to that benefits midrash he also benefits him. Shmuel said: to a place where one takes payment for Bible and one does not take payment for midrash. Why without qualification?
llm_translation: He teaches him Midrash Halakhot and Aggadot, but he does not teach him Mikra. What is the reason he does not teach him Mikra? Because they are engaged in it, Midrash is also engaged in it! Shmuel said: In a place where they receive reward for Mikra and do not receive reward for Midrash. What is the conclusion?

hebrew_text: הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דַּאֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין שָׂכָר, עַל הַמִּקְרָא שְׁרֵי לְמִשְׁקַל, עַל הַמִּדְרָשׁ לָא שְׁרֵי לְמִשְׁקַל.
human_translation: This teaches us that even in a place where one takes payment for Bible permitted to take for midrash not permitted to take
llm_translation: This is what we can infer, that even in a place where they receive payment, regarding Scripture it is permitted to weigh the words, but regarding Midrash it is not permitted to weigh the words.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא מִדְרָשׁ דְּלָא — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֹתִי צִוָּה ה׳ בָּעֵת הַהִיא לְלַמֵּד אֶתְכֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״רְאֵה לִמַּדְתִּי אֶתְכֶם חֻקִּים וּמִשְׁפָּטִים כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוַּנִי ה׳״, מָה אֲנִי בְּחִנָּם — אַף אַתֶּם נָמֵי בְּחִנָּם. מִקְרָא נָמֵי בְּחִנָּם!
human_translation: what is midrash different that not which is written, “And the Lord commanded me at that time to teach you and is written: “Behold, I have taught you statutes and laws, as the Lord commanded me, Just as I for free, so too you also for free. Bible too, for free.
llm_translation: What is different about a teaching that is not? As it is written: "And I commanded you at that time all the things you should do," and it is also written: "See, I have taught you statutes and judgments, as the Lord my God commanded me." Just as I am gratuitous, so too you are gratuitous. The Scripture is also gratuitous!

hebrew_text: רַב אָמַר: שְׂכַר שִׁימּוּר. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: שְׂכַר פִּיסּוּק טְעָמִים.
human_translation: Rav said: payment watching And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: payment punctuation cantillation notes.
llm_translation: Rav said: "The reward is for guarding." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "The reward is for the interpretation of reasons."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: לֹא יְלַמְּדֶנּוּ מִקְרָא. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׂכַר פִּיסּוּק טְעָמִים — הַיְינוּ דְּלָא יְלַמְּדֶנּוּ, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׂכַר שִׁימּוּר — גָּדוֹל בַּר שִׁימּוּר הוּא? בְּקָטָן קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: We learned may not teach him Bible. Granted, according to the one who says payment punctuation cantillation notes, this is that he shall not teach him Bible, However, according to the one who says payment watching is an adult one who requires watching, is teaching of a minor
llm_translation: We learned: He shall not teach him Scripture. Granted according to the one who says the reward for teaching verses is the interpretation of the verses — that is why he shall not teach him. But according to the one who says the reward is for teaching the guarding of the verses — is Bar Shimur great? It is taught in the case of a minor.

hebrew_text: אִי בְּקָטָן, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אֲבָל מְלַמֵּד אֶת בָּנָיו מִקְרָא, קָטָן בַּר בָּנִים הוּא?! חַסּוֹרֵי מְחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: לֹא יְלַמְּדֶנּוּ מִקְרָא — בְּקָטָן, אִם הָיָה גָּדוֹל — מְלַמְּדוֹ לוֹ וּלְבָנָיו מִקְרָא.
human_translation: If of a minor, say the latter clause However, he may teach his sons Bible. Is a minor one capable of sons? The mishna is incomplete, and this it is teaching: He may not teach him Bible, in a minor. If is an adult, he may teach him and his sons Bible.
llm_translation: If with a minor, say the latter: But if he teaches his sons Scripture, is he a minor son of sons?! Lacking, and thus it teaches: He should not teach him Scripture — if he is a minor, if he was an adult — he should teach him and his sons Scripture.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: תִּינוֹקוֹת לֹא קוֹרִין בַּתְּחִילָּה בַּשַּׁבָּת, אֶלָּא שׁוֹנִין בָּרִאשׁוֹן. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׂכַר פִּיסּוּק טְעָמִים — הַיְינוּ דְּאֵין קוֹרִין בַּתְּחִילָּה בַּשַּׁבָּת. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׂכַר שִׁימּוּר, אַמַּאי אֵין קוֹרִין בַּתְּחִילָּה בַּשַּׁבָּת, וְאַמַּאי שׁוֹנִין בָּרִאשׁוֹן? הָא אִיכָּא שְׂכַר שִׁימּוּר דְּשַׁבָּת!
human_translation: raises an objection Children may not read for the first on Shabbat; however, they may review once. Granted, according to the one who says payment punctuation cantillation notes, this is children may not read for the first on Shabbat, However, according to the one who says payment watching why may not read for the first on Shabbat? And why may review once? Isn’t there payment watching on Shabbat
llm_translation: The Tannaite scholar challenges: Infants do not recite at the outset on Shabbat, rather they recite in the first meal. Granted according to the one who says the reward for reciting the blessings is due to the taste — that is why they do not recite at the outset on Shabbat. But according to the one who says the reward is for safeguarding, why do they not recite at the outset on Shabbat, and why do they recite in the first meal? Because there is reward for safeguarding on Shabbat!

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ שְׂכַר פִּיסּוּק בְּשַׁבָּת מִי אָסוּר? הַבְלָעָה הִיא, וְהַבְלָעָה מִישְׁרֵא שְׁרֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: הַשּׂוֹכֵר אֶת הַפּוֹעֵל לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת הַתִּינוֹק, לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת הַפָּרָה, לִשְׁמוֹר אֶת הַזְּרָעִים — אֵין נוֹתְנִין לוֹ שְׂכַר שַׁבָּת. לְפִיכָךְ
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, is payment punctuation prohibited on Shabbat? It is incorporation and incorporation is permitted, as it is taught One who hires laborer to watch a child, to watch a cow, to guard seeds does not give him payment for Shabbat. Therefore,
llm_translation: And to hire labor on Shabbat, is it prohibited? It is considered swallowing, and swallowing directly is permitted. As it was taught: One who hires a worker to tend to his infant, to tend to his cow, to tend to his seeds - we do not pay him for Shabbat. Therefore,

hebrew_text: אִם אָבְדוּ — אֵינוֹ חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן. וְאִם הָיָה שְׂכִיר שַׁבָּת, שְׂכִיר חֹדֶשׁ, שְׂכִיר שָׁנָה, שְׂכִיר שָׁבוּעַ — נוֹתֵן לוֹ שְׂכַר שַׁבָּת. לְפִיכָךְ אִם אָבְדוּ — חַיָּיב בְּאַחְרָיוּתָן.
human_translation: if were lost he does not bear responsibility for them, And if hired for a week, hired for a month, hired for a year, hired for seven years, gives him payment Shabbat if were lost he bears responsibility for them.
llm_translation: If they were lost - he is not liable for their replacement. And if he was hired for the Sabbath, hired for a month, hired for a year, hired for a week - he gives him the wage for the Sabbath. Therefore, if they were lost - he is liable for their replacement.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: גַּבֵּי שַׁבָּת הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּאֵין קוֹרְאִין בַּתְּחִילָּה — מִשּׁוּם דְּיִפְנוּ אֲבָהָתְהוֹן דְּיָנוֹקֵי לְמִצְוְתָא דְשַׁבְּתָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: מִשּׁוּם דִּבְשַׁבְּתָא אָכְלִין וְשָׁתִין וְיַקִּיר עֲלֵיהוֹן עָלְמָא. כִּדְאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שִׁינּוּי וֶסֶת תְּחִילַּת חוֹלִי מֵעַיִים.
human_translation: Rather, with regard to Shabbat, this is the reason that may not read for the first so that the fathers of the children will be at leisure to the mitzva of Shabbat. And if you wish, say Due to that on Shabbat eat and drink their world is heavy upon them, as Shmuel said: A change in routine [ veset ] the onset of an intestinal ailment.
llm_translation: Rather: Regarding Shabbat, that is the reason why we do not recite the blessing at the outset — because their fathers directed them to engage in the mitzvah of Shabbat. And if you wish, I can say: because on Shabbat they eat and drink and honor themselves. As Shmuel said: changing and setting the beginning of an illness from the intestines.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׂכַר פִּיסּוּק טְעָמִים, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר שְׂכַר שִׁימּוּר? קָסָבַר בָּנוֹת מִי קָא בָּעֲיָין שִׁימּוּר?
human_translation: And according to the one who says payment punctuation cantillation notes, what is the reason did not say payment watching He holds: Do girls need watching?
llm_translation: And for the one who says that the reward for the fulfillment of commandments is based on reasons, what is the reason he did not say the reward for guarding? He holds that daughters require guarding?

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׂכַר שִׁימּוּר, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר שְׂכַר פִּיסּוּק טְעָמִים? קָסָבַר (שְׂכַר) פִּיסּוּק טְעָמִים דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הוּא.
human_translation: And according to the one who says payment watching what is the reason did not say payment punctuation cantillation notes? He holds the punctuation cantillation notes is by Torah law;
llm_translation: And for the one who says "payment for guarding," what is the reason he did not say "payment for the cessation of reasons"? He holds that "payment for the cessation of reasons" is of biblical origin.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַב אִיקָא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַב חֲנַנְאֵל אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וַיִּקְרְאוּ בַסֵּפֶר בְּתוֹרַת הָאֱלֹהִים מְפֹרָשׁ וְשׂוֹם שֶׂכֶל וַיָּבִינוּ בַּמִּקְרָא״. ״וַיִּקְרְאוּ בַסֵּפֶר בְּתוֹרַת הָאֱלֹהִים״ — זֶה מִקְרָא, ״מְפֹרָשׁ״ — זֶה תַּרְגּוּם, ״וְשׂוֹם שֶׂכֶל״ — אֵלּוּ הַפְּסוּקִים, ״וַיָּבִינוּ בַּמִּקְרָא״ — זֶה פִּיסּוּק טְעָמִים. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: אֵלּוּ הַמְּסוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: as Rav Ika bar Avin said Rav Ḥananel said Rav said: What is which is written: “And they read in the book, in the Torah of God, distinctly; and they gave the sense, and caused them to understand the reading” “They read in the book, in the Torah of God”; that is the Bible. “Distinctly”; that is translation. “And they gave the sense”; these are the verses. “And caused them to understand the reading”; this is punctuation cantillation notes, And some say: These are the traditions
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "D'amar Rav Ika bar Avin amar Rav Chananel amar Rav: Ma'ai dikhtiv 'vayikreu bassefer betorat haElohim m'forash v'som sechel vayavinu bamikra'. 'Vayikreu bassefer betorat haElohim' — zeh mikra, 'm'forash' — zeh targum, 'v'som sechel' — elu hap'sukim, 'vayavinu bamikra' — zeh p'sukei te'amim. V'amar lei: elu ham'sorot." English translation: "As Rav Ika bar Avin said in the name of Rav Chananel who said in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of the verse, 'And they read in the book, in the law of God, distinctly; and they gave the sense, and caused them to understand the reading'? 'And they read in the book, in the law of God' — this refers to the written text, 'distinctly' — this is the translation, 'and they gave the sense' — these are the verses, 'and caused them to understand the reading' — this is the division of the verses. And some say: these are the traditions."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מִקְרָא סוֹפְרִים, וְעִיטּוּר סוֹפְרִים, וְקַרְיָין וְלָא כְּתִיבָן, וּכְתִיבָן וְלָא קַרְיָין — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: The vocalization of the scribes, and the ornamentation of the scribes, and read but not written, and written but not read halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Scripture of scribes, and the writing of scribes, and they read but it is not written, and it is written but they do not read — this is a halakha from Moses at Sinai.

hebrew_text: מִקְרָא סוֹפְרִים: אָרֶץ, שָׁמָיִם, מִצְרָיִם.
human_translation: The vocalization of the scribes aretz shamayim mitzrayim
llm_translation: Scripture of the Scribes: Eretz, Shamayim, Mitzrayim.

hebrew_text: עִיטּוּר סוֹפְרִים: ״אַחַר תַּעֲבֹרוּ״, ״אַחַר תֵּלֵךְ״, ״אַחַר תֵּאָסֵף״, ״קִדְּמוּ שָׁרִים אַחַר נֹגְנִים״, ״צִדְקָתְךָ כְּהַרְרֵי אֵל״.
human_translation: The ornamentation of the scribes “Then [ aḥar ] go on” “then [ aḥar ] she will go” “afterward [ aḥar ] you will be gathered” “the singers go before, the minstrels follow after [ aḥar ]” “Your righteousness is like the mighty mountains”
llm_translation: Interpretation of Scribes: "After you pass," "After you go," "After you gather," "Princes should precede musicians," "Your righteousness is like the mountains of God."

hebrew_text: קַרְיָין וְלָא כְּתִיבָן: ״פְּרָת״ דִּ״בְלֶכְתּוֹ״, ״אִישׁ״ דְּ״כַאֲשֶׁר יִשְׁאַל אִישׁ בִּדְבַר הָאֱלֹהִים״, ״בָּאִים״ דְּ״נִבְנְתָה״, ״לָהּ״ דִּ״פְלֵיטָה״, ״אֵת״ ״דְּהֻגֵּד הֻגַּד״, ״אֵלַי״ דְּ״הַגֹּרֶן״, ״אֵלַי״ דְּ״הַשְּׂעֹרִים״, הָלֵין קַרְיָין וְלָא כְּתִבָן.
human_translation: read but not written “Euphrates” that “as he went “man” that was as if a man inquired of the word of God” “come” that shall be built “her” that escape” unto that been told me, “to me” that the threshing floor” “to me” that barley; These are read but not written.
llm_translation: They read but it is not written: "Parat" of "Diblakto," "Ish" of "as a man asks his fellow concerning the word of God," "Ba'im" of "it was built," "La" of "she escaped," "Et" "that which has been told has been told," "Eilai" of "the threshing floor," "Eilai" of "the barley." They read but it is not written.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִבָן וְלָא קַרְיָין: ״נָא דְּ״יִסְלַח״,
human_translation: And written but not read. “may” that forgive
llm_translation: And like their writing, but not read: "na de'yislah."

hebrew_text: ״זֹאת״ ״דְּ״הַמִּצְוָה״, ״יִדְרֹךְ״ דְּ״הַדֹּרֵךְ״, ״חֲמֵשׁ״ דִּ״פְאַת נֶגֶב״, ״אִם״ דְּ״כִי גֹאֵל״ — הָלֵין כְּתִבָן וְלָא קַרְיָין.
human_translation: “this” that the mitzva” “bend” that the archer “five” that the south side “if” that “that a near kinsman” these are written but not read.
llm_translation: "This" "of" "the commandment," "will tread" of "the one who treads," "five" of "the corner of the south," "if" of "when he redeems" — they stay their writing but do not read.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַדָּא: בְּמַעְרְבָא פָּסְקִין לְהָדֵין פְּסוּקָא לִתְלָתָא פְּסוּקִין: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה הִנֵּה אָנֹכִי בָּא אֵלֶיךָ בְּעַב הֶעָנָן״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Adda said: In the West, divide this verse into three verses: “And the Lord said to Moses, behold I come to you in a thick cloud,
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Adda said: In the West, they would conclude a ruling with three conclusions: "And Hashem said to Moshe, 'Behold, I am coming to you in the thickness of the cloud.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא הֶעֱשִׁיר מֹשֶׁה אֶלָּא מִפְּסוֹלְתָּן שֶׁל לוּחוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פְּסׇל לְךָ שְׁנֵי לֻחֹת אֲבָנִים כָּרִאשֹׁנִים״ — פְּסוֹלְתָּן שֶׁלְּךָ יְהֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: Moses became wealthy only from the waste from the Tablets as it is stated: “Hew for you two tablets of stone like the first” their waste shall be yours.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said: Moses only became rich from the broken pieces of the Tablets, as it is stated: "Hew for yourself two stone tablets like the first ones" - let your broken pieces be yours.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא נִיתְּנָה תּוֹרָה אֶלָּא לְמֹשֶׁה וּלְזַרְעוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כְּתׇב לְךָ״, ״פְּסׇל לְךָ״: מָה פְּסוֹלְתָּן שֶׁלְּךָ — אַף כְּתָבָן שֶׁלְּךָ. מֹשֶׁה נָהַג בָּהּ טוֹבַת עַיִן וּנְתָנָהּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, וְעָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״טוֹב עַיִן הוּא יְבֹרָךְ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: The Torah was given only to Moses and his descendants, as it is stated: “Write for you” “Hew for you” Just as their waste is yours, so too their writing is yours. Moses treated with generosity and gave it to the Jewish people. And about him, the verse says: “He that has a bountiful eye shall be blessed,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: The Torah was given only to Moses and his descendants, as it is stated: "Write for yourself," "Invalidate for yourself." Just as their disqualification is yours, so too their writing is yours. Moses conducted himself with generosity and gave it to the Israelites, and concerning him the verse states: "He who is generous will be blessed."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חִסְדָּא: ״וְאֹתִי צִוָּה ה׳ בָּעֵת הַהִיא לְלַמֵּד אֶתְכֶם״ — וְאוֹתִי צִוָּה, וַאֲנִי לָכֶם. ״רְאֵה לִמַּדְתִּי אֶתְכֶם חֻקִּים וּמִשְׁפָּטִים כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוַּנִי ה׳ אֱלֹהָי״ — אוֹתִי צִוָּה, וַאֲנִי לָכֶם.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection “And the Lord commanded me at that time to teach you And the Lord commanded me, and I, to you “Behold, I have taught you statutes and laws, as the Lord my God commanded me” The Lord commanded me, and I to you
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And I commanded you at that time" - 'And I commanded you,' and I am for you. "See, I have taught you statutes and ordinances as the Lord my God commanded me" - 'I commanded you,' and I am for you.

hebrew_text: ״וְעַתָּה כִּתְבוּ לָכֶם אֶת הַשִּׁירָה הַזֹּאת״, הַשִּׁירָה לְחוּדַּהּ. ״לְמַעַן תִּהְיֶה לִּי הַשִּׁירָה הַזֹּאת לְעֵד בִּבְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״! אֶלָּא, פִּילְפּוּלָא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: “Now therefore write this song for you, the song alone “That this song may be a witness for Me among the children of Israel” merely profound analysis
llm_translation: "And now write for yourselves this song," the song for testimony. "So that this song may be a witness for Me among the children of Israel"! Rather, a wonder in the world.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁרֶה שְׁכִינָתוֹ אֶלָּא עַל גִּבּוֹר וְעָשִׁיר וְחָכָם וְעָנָיו, וְכוּלָּן מִמֹּשֶׁה. גִּבּוֹר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּפְרֹשׂ אֶת הָאֹהֶל עַל הַמִּשְׁכָּן״, וְאָמַר מָר: מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ פְּרָסוֹ, וּכְתִיב: ״עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת אֹרֶךְ הַקָּרֶשׁ וְגוֹ׳״. אֵימָא דַּאֲרִיךְ וְקַטִּין!
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, rests His Divine Presence only upon mighty, and wealthy, and wise, and humble. And all of these from Moses. mighty, as it is written: “And he spread the tent over the Tabernacle” and the Master said: Moses, our teacher, spread it And it is written: “Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, Say that he was tall and thin,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: The Holy One, blessed be He, only bestows His Divine Presence upon a strong, wealthy, wise, and humble person, and all of these qualities were found in Moses. Strong, as it is written: "And he spread the tent over the Tabernacle," and the Master said: "Our teacher Moses spread it out," and it is written: "Ten cubits was the length of a board." Let us say that he was both tall and short!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִן הָדֵין קְרָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וָאֶתְפֹּשׂ בִּשְׁנֵי הַלֻּחֹת וָאַשְׁלִכֵם מֵעַל שְׁתֵּי יָדָי וָאֲשַׁבְּרֵם״, וְתַנְיָא: הַלּוּחוֹת אׇרְכָּן שִׁשָּׁה וְרׇחְבָּן שִׁשָּׁה וְעׇבְיָין שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: Rather, from this verse, as it is written: “And I took hold of the two tablets, and cast them out of my two hands, and broke them and it is taught The tablets, their length was six and their width was six and their thickness was three
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather from this, a verse, as it is written: "And I took hold of the two tablets and threw them from upon my two hands and broke them." And it was taught: The tablets were six handbreadths in length, six handbreadths in width, and three handbreadths in thickness.

hebrew_text: עָשִׁיר — ״פְּסׇל לָךְ״, פְּסוֹלְתָּן שֶׁלְּךָ יְהֵא. חָכָם — רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: חֲמִשִּׁים שַׁעֲרֵי בִינָה נִבְרְאוּ בָּעוֹלָם, וְכוּלָּם נִתְּנוּ לְמֹשֶׁה חָסֵר אַחַת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתְּחַסְּרֵהוּ מְעַט מֵאֱלֹהִים״. עָנָיו — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָאִישׁ מֹשֶׁה עָנָו מְאֹד״.
human_translation: wealthy, “Hew for you” waste shall be yours, was wise Rav and Shmuel, who both say: Fifty measures of understanding were created in the world, and all were given to Moses except one, as it is stated: “Yet you have deprived him of little, of God” humble, as it is written: “Now the man Moses was very humble”
llm_translation: Rich - "It is disqualified for you," their disqualification should be yours. Wise - Rav and Shmuel both said: Fifty gates of understanding were created in the world, and all of them were given to Moses except for one, as it is stated: "And you lacked a little from God." Humble - As it is written: "Now the man Moses was very humble."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַנְּבִיאִים עֲשִׁירִים הָיוּ, מְנָלַן — מִמֹּשֶׁה וּמִשְּׁמוּאֵל מֵעָמוֹס וּמִיּוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: All the prophets were wealthy. From where do we from Moses, and from Samuel, from Amos, and from Jonah,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: All the prophets were wealthy, from Moses and from Samuel to Amos and to Jonah.

hebrew_text: מֹשֶׁה — דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא חֲמוֹר אֶחָד מֵהֶם נָשָׂאתִי״. אִי בְּלָא אַגְרָא, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאן דְּשָׁקֵל בְּלָא אַגְרָא? אֶלָּא דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּאַגְרָא. דִּילְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּעָנִי הֲוָה. אֶלָּא מִן ״פְּסׇל לָךְ״ — פְּסוֹלְתָּן יְהֵא שֶׁלְּךָ.
human_translation: Moses as it is written: “I have not taken one donkey from them” If without payment, to exclude one who takes without paying? Rather, that even with payment Perhaps, because he was poor Rather, “Hew for you” their waste shall be yours.
llm_translation: Moses — as it is written: "I have not taken one donkey from them." If without pay, to go out and find who took without pay? Rather, even with pay. Perhaps because he was poor. Rather, from "disqualify for you" — their disqualification shall be yours.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל, דִּכְתִיב: ״הִנְנִי עֲנוּ בִי נֶגֶד ה׳ וְנֶגֶד מְשִׁיחוֹ אֶת שׁוֹר מִי לָקַחְתִּי וַחֲמוֹר מִי לָקַחְתִּי״. אִי בְּחִנָּם, לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאן דְּשָׁקֵל בְּחִנָּם?! אֶלָּא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׂכָר. דִּלְמָא דְּעָנִי הֲוָה, אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וּתְשֻׁבָתוֹ הָרָמָתָה כִּי שָׁם בֵּיתוֹ״, וְאָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁהָלַךְ — בֵּיתוֹ עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Samuel as it is written: “Here I am; witness against me before the Lord, and before His anointed: Whose ox have I taken, or whose donkey have I taken?” If for free, to exclude one who takes for free? Rather, that even with payment Perhaps, that he was poor. Rather, from here, “And his return was to Ramah, for there was his house” And Rava said: Everywhere he went, his home was with him.
llm_translation: Samuel, as it is written: "Here I am; testify against me before the Lord and before His anointed: Whose ox have I taken, or whose donkey have I taken?" If it was for free, to establish who took it for free?! Rather, even for payment. Perhaps he was poor, but from here: "And his return shall be to Ramah, for there is his house," and Rava said: Wherever he went — his house is with him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: גָּדוֹל מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר בִּשְׁמוּאֵל יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּמֹשֶׁה, דְּאִילּוּ בְּמֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ כְּתִיב ״לֹא חֲמוֹר אֶחָד מֵהֶם נָשָׂאתִי״, דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּשָׂכָר, וְאִילּוּ גַּבֵּי שְׁמוּאֵל אֲפִילּוּ בְּרָצוֹן לֹא שְׂכָרוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמְרוּ לֹא עֲשַׁקְתָּנוּ וְלֹא רַצּוֹתָנוּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rava said: That which is stated with regard to Samuel is greater than that which is stated with regard to Moses, as with regard to Moses our teacher it is written: “I have not taken one donkey from them” even with payment. Whereas with regard to Samuel, even with consent he would not rent as it is written: “And they said: You have not defrauded us, nor oppressed us [ ratzotanu ],
llm_translation: Rava said: Great is what is said in the name of Shmuel more than what is said in the name of Moshe, for if in the case of Moshe our teacher it is written, "I have not taken a single donkey of theirs," even for payment, whereas in the case of Shmuel, even willingly, his reward was not taken, as it is written: "They said, 'You have not oppressed us, nor have you taken anything from us.'"

hebrew_text: עָמוֹס, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַן עָמוֹס וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל אֲמַצְיָה לֹא נָבִיא אָנֹכִי וְלֹא בֶן נָבִיא אָנֹכִי כִּי בוֹקֵר אָנֹכִי וּבוֹלֵס שִׁקְמִים״, כְּדִמְתַרְגֵּם רַב יוֹסֵף: אֲרִי מָרֵי גִיתֵּי אֲנָא וְשִׁקְמִין לִי בְּשָׁפֵלְתָּא וְגוֹ׳.
human_translation: Amos as it is written: “Then answered Amos, and said to Amaziah: I am neither a prophet, nor son of a prophet, but I am a herdsman, and a dresser of sycamore-trees” as Rav Yosef translates: Because I am the owner of flocks and I have sycamores in the lowland,
llm_translation: Amos, as it is written: "And Amos answered and said to Amaziah, 'I am not a prophet, nor am I a prophet's son, but I am a herdsman and a tender of sycamore trees.'" As Rav Yosef interpreted: "I am a master of the bow, and sycamores are mine in the lowlands, etc."

hebrew_text: יוֹנָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתֵּן שְׂכָרָהּ וַיֵּרֶד בָּהּ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שֶׁנָּתַן שְׂכָרָהּ שֶׁל סְפִינָה כּוּלָּהּ. אָמַר רַבִּי רוֹמָנוּס: שְׂכָרָהּ שֶׁל סְפִינָה הָוְיָא אַרְבַּעַת אֲלָפִים דִּינָרֵי דַהֲבָא.
human_translation: Jonah as it is written: so he paid its cost and went down into it” and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: He paid the cost of the entire ship. Rabbi Romanus said: The cost for the ship was four thousand gold dinars.
llm_translation: Jonah, as it is written: "And he paid its fare and went down into it." And Rabbi Yochanan said: Its fare was the entire cost of the ship. Rabbi Romanus said: The fare of the ship was four thousand gold dinars.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בַּתְּחִלָּה הָיָה מֹשֶׁה לָמֵד תּוֹרָה וּמְשַׁכְּחָה, עַד שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּתֵּן אֶל מֹשֶׁה כְּכַלֹּתוֹ לְדַבֵּר אִתּוֹ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Initially, Moses would study Torah and forget it, until it was given to him as a gift, as it is stated: “And He gave it to Moses when he concluded speaking with him”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: In the beginning, Moses would learn Torah and forget it, until it was given to him as a gift, as it is said: "And He gave to Moses, when He had finished speaking with him."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְזָן אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְאֶת בָּנָיו, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתָן. וְלֹא יָזוּן אֶת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ, בֵּין טְמֵאָה בֵּין טְהוֹרָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: זָן אֶת הַטְּמֵאָה, וְאֵינוֹ זָן אֶת הַטְּהוֹרָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה בֵּין טְמֵאָה לִטְהוֹרָה? אָמַר לְהוּ: שֶׁהַטְּהוֹרָה נַפְשָׁהּ לַשָּׁמַיִם וְגוּפָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ, וּטְמֵאָה
human_translation: And may feed wife and children, although is obligated in their support And he may not feed his animal, whether a kosher whether a non-kosher Rabbi Eliezer says: He may feed the non-kosher and he may not feed the kosher said to him: What is between kosher and non-kosher said to them: The kosher being to Heaven, and body is And a non-kosher
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "And he shall provide for his wife and his children, even though he is obligated to support them. And he shall not provide for his animals, whether they are ritually impure or ritually pure." Rabbi Eliezer says: "He shall provide for the ritually impure animal, but he shall not provide for the ritually pure animal." They said to him: "What is the difference between the ritually impure and the ritually pure?" He said to them: "That the ritually pure one's soul belongs to Heaven, but its body is his, while the ritually impure..."

hebrew_text: נַפְשָׁהּ וְגוּפָהּ לַשָּׁמַיִם. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַף הַטְּמֵאָה נַפְשָׁהּ לַשָּׁמַיִם וְגוּפָהּ שֶׁלּוֹ, שֶׁאִם יִרְצֶה הֲרֵי הוּא מוֹכְרָהּ לַגּוֹיִם אוֹ מַאֲכִילָהּ לַכְּלָבִים.
human_translation: its being and its body to Heaven, said to him: The non-kosher too, its being to Heaven, and its body is he sells it to gentiles or feeds it to dogs.
llm_translation: Her soul and her body to heaven. They said to him: Even the impure one, her soul to heaven and her body is his, for if he wishes, behold, he may sell her to the gentiles or feed her to the dogs.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר חֲנַנְיָה אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — מוּתָּר לְהַשִּׂיא לוֹ בִּתּוֹ. הָוֵי בַּהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי אֲבִי כַלָּה אֲסוּרִין עַל הֶחָתָן, הֲרֵי מוֹסֵר לוֹ שִׁפְחָה לְשַׁמְּשׁוֹ!
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Ḥananya said Rav Huna said: one for whom benefit from another is forbidden by vow, he is permitted to marry his daughter to him. Rabbi Zeira discussed it: With what are we dealing? If we say the property of the father of the bride is forbidden to the groom, he provides him a maidservant to serve him
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yitzchak bar Chananya said in the name of Rav Huna: One who is pledged to benefit from his fellow - he is permitted to marry off his daughter to him. Rabbi Zeira objected to this: With what are we dealing? If you say we are dealing with the property of the father-in-law, it is forbidden for the groom, as he is giving him a maidservant to serve him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בְּנִכְסֵי חָתָן אֲסוּרִין עַל אֲבִי כַלָּה. גְּדוֹלָה מִזּוֹ אָמְרוּ: זָן אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְאֶת בָּנָיו, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוּא חַיָּיב בִּמְזוֹנוֹתָן, וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ מוּתָּר לְהַשִּׂיא לוֹ בִּתּוֹ?!
human_translation: Rather, the property of the groom is forbidden to the father of the bride, stated greater than that may feed wife and children, although is obligated in their support. And you say that it is permitted to marry his daughter to him?
llm_translation: Rather, with the property of the son-in-law, they are forbidden upon the father of the bride. Greater than this they said: He should provide for his wife and his sons, even though he is obligated for their sustenance, and you say it is permitted to marry off his daughter to him?!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי אֲבִי כַלָּה אֲסוּרִין עַל הֶחָתָן, וּבְבִתּוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת, וּמִדַּעְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Actually, where the property of the father of the bride is forbidden to the groom, and where his daughter is a grown woman, and with her consent.
llm_translation: Always when the property of the father of the bride is in the possession of the groom, and his daughter is a convert, it is with her consent.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — אָסוּר לְהַשִּׂיא לוֹ בִּתּוֹ, אֲבָל מַשִּׂיאוֹ בִּתּוֹ בּוֹגֶרֶת וּמִדַּעְתָּהּ.
human_translation: That is also taught prohibited to marry his daughter to him. However, he may marry his daughter, a grown woman, to with her consent.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: If one is pledged to derive benefit from his fellow, it is forbidden to marry off his daughter to him. However, if he marries off his daughter to him with her consent and knowledge.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: הַמַּדִּיר בְּנוֹ לְתַלְמוּד תּוֹרָה — מוּתָּר לְמַלּאוֹת לוֹ חָבִית שֶׁל מַיִם, וּלְהַדְלִיק לוֹ אֶת הַנֵּר. רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: לִצְלוֹת לוֹ דָּג קָטָן. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — מוּתָּר לְהַשְׁקוֹתוֹ כּוֹס שֶׁל שָׁלוֹם. מַאי נִיהוּ? הָכָא תַּרְגִּימוּ: כּוֹס שֶׁל בֵּית הָאֵבֶל. בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי: כּוֹס שֶׁל בֵּית הַמֶּרְחָץ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov said: one vows from his son, Torah study, permitted to fill a barrel of water for and to kindle a lamp for him. Rabbi Yitzḥak said: permitted to roast a small fish for him. Rabbi Yirmeya said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one for whom benefit from another is forbidden by vow it is permitted to give him a cup of peace to drink. What is this Here, interpreted a cup of the house of mourning. In the West, said cup of the bathhouse.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov said: One who vows his son to Torah study - he is permitted to fill for him a jug of water, and to light for him the lamp. Rabbi Yitzchak said: To roast for him a small fish. Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who is vowed to benefit from his fellow - he is permitted to give him a cup of peace. What is the case? Here they explained: A cup of mourning house. In the West they say: A cup of bathhouse.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא יָזוּן אֶת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ בֵּין כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אִישׁ עוּזָּא אוֹמֵר: זָן עֲבָדָיו וְשִׁפְחוֹתָיו הַכְּנַעֲנִים, וְלֹא יָזוּן אֶת בְּהֶמְתּוֹ, בֵּין טְמֵאָה בֵּין טְהוֹרָה. מַאי טַעְמָא? עֲבָדָיו וְשִׁפְחוֹתָיו הַכְּנַעֲנִים — לְמַנְחֲרוּתָא עֲבִידָן, בְּהֵמָה — לְפִטּוּמָא עֲבִידָא.
human_translation: And he may not feed animal whether It is taught Yehoshua of Uzza says: may feed Canaanite slaves and maidservants; however, he may not feed his animal, whether a non-kosher whether a kosher What is the reason His Canaanite slaves and maidservants are designated for labor, an animal is designated for fattening.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And he shall not feed his animal between the teeth. It was taught: Yehoshua the man of Uzza says: One may feed his Canaanite slaves and maidservants, but he shall not feed his animal, whether it is ritually impure or ritually pure. What is the reason? His Canaanite slaves and maidservants — he feeds them for the sake of profit, but an animal — he feeds it for the sake of loss.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְנִכְנַס לְבַקְּרוֹ — עוֹמֵד אֲבָל לֹא יוֹשֵׁב. וּמְרַפְּאוֹ רְפוּאַת נֶפֶשׁ, אֲבָל לֹא רְפוּאַת מָמוֹן.
human_translation: one for whom benefit from another is forbidden by vow and he enters to visit him, he stands but does not sit. And heals him a cure nefesh but not a cure of mamon .
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who is pledged to benefit from his fellow and enters his cattle pen - he may stand but not sit. And he may heal him for a life-threatening illness, but not for a monetary loss.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִי בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי מְבַקֵּר אֲסוּרִין עַל חוֹלֶה — אֲפִילּוּ יוֹשֵׁב נָמֵי? אִי בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי חוֹלֶה אֲסוּרִין עַל הַמְבַקֵּר — אֲפִילּוּ עוֹמֵד נָמֵי לָא! אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לְעוֹלָם בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי מְבַקֵּר אֲסוּרִין עַל הַחוֹלֶה, וּבִמְקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין שָׂכָר עַל הַיְּשִׁיבָה, וְאֵין נוֹטְלִין שָׂכָר עַל הָעֲמִידָה.
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If where the property of the visitor is forbidden to the ill person, even sitting, also If where the property of the ill person is forbidden to the visitor, even standing, also not Shmuel said: Actually, where the property of the visitor is forbidden to the ill person, and in a place where one takes payment for sitting and one does not take payment for standing
llm_translation: We are dealing with what? If with those who visit the sick, are they forbidden to sit even if they are silent? If with the sick, are they forbidden to visit even if they are standing? Shmuel said: Always with those who visit the sick are forbidden to sit in front of the sick person, and in a place where they receive payment for sitting, they may receive payment for sitting but not for standing.

hebrew_text: מַאי פַּסְקָא? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּאַף בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁנּוֹטְלִין שָׂכָר, עַל הַיְּשִׁיבָה — בָּעֵי לְמִשְׁקַל, עַל הָעֲמִידָה — לָא בָּעֵי לְמִשְׁקַל. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּדְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְיָקִים, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁהֶא בַּעֲמִידָה. הָכָא נָמֵי גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁהֶא בִּישִׁיבָה.
human_translation: Why without qualification? teaches us this: Even in a place where one takes payment for sitting, one ought to take for standing, one ought not to take And if you wish, say in accordance with Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim decree lest he remain standing Here too, decree, lest he remain sitting
llm_translation: What is the ruling? This teaches us that even in a place where they receive payment, for sitting — it requires weighing, for standing — it does not require weighing. And if you wish, say: Like Rabbi Shimon ben Eliezer, a decree lest one lean on the standing. Here too, a decree lest one lean on the sitting.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי חוֹלֶה אֲסוּרִין עַל הַמְבַקֵּר, וּכְגוֹן דְּלָא אַדְּרֵיהּ מִן חַיּוּתֵיהּ. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ יוֹשֵׁב נָמֵי! הָא אֶפְשָׁר בַּעֲמִידָה.
human_translation: Ulla said: Actually, where the property of the ill person is forbidden to the visitor, and where did not vow his existence. If so, even sitting as well, Isn’t it possible while standing?
