llm_translation: Ulla said: Always when the sick person's belongings are forbidden to the visitor, such as when he did not remove them from his animals. If so, even if he is sitting silently! This is possible only when standing.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: חָלָה הוּא — נִכְנָס לְבַקְּרוֹ, חָלָה בְּנוֹ — שׁוֹאֲלוֹ בַּשּׁוּק. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְעוּלָּא דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי חוֹלֶה אֲסוּרִין עַל הַמְבַקֵּר, וּכְגוֹן דְּלָא אַדְּרֵיהּ מִן חַיּוּתֵיהּ — שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: raises an objection If he became ill, he enters to visit him; if his son became ill, he inquires his in the marketplace Granted, according to Ulla, who said: where the property of the ill person is forbidden to the visitor and where did not vow existence, well,
llm_translation: Challot he is — entered to check, challah in his son — ask in the market. Granted, according to the opinion that sick animals are forbidden to be checked, and for example if he did not tend to his animals properly — it is fine.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמַר בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי מְבַקֵּר אֲסוּרִין עַל הַחוֹלֶה, מַאי שְׁנָא הוּא וּמַאי שְׁנָא בְּנוֹ? אָמַר לָךְ: מַתְנִיתִין בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי מְבַקֵּר אֲסוּרִין עַל הַחוֹלֶה, בָּרַיְיתָא בְּשֶׁנִּכְסֵי חוֹלֶה אֲסוּרִין עַל הַמְבַקֵּר.
human_translation: However, according to Shmuel, who said: where the property of the visitor is forbidden to the ill person, what is different him and what is different his son? said to you: The mishna where the property of the visitor is forbidden to the ill person; the baraita where the property of the ill person is forbidden to the visitor.
llm_translation: Rather, to Shmuel who said that when it comes to those who inspect the sick, they are forbidden, what is the difference between him and his son? I will tell you: Mishnah - when it comes to those who inspect the sick, they are forbidden; Baraita - when it comes to those who are sick, they are forbidden to inspect.

hebrew_text: מַאי פַּסְקָא? אָמַר רָבָא: (אָמַר) שְׁמוּאֵל
human_translation: Why without qualification? Rava said: Shmuel,
llm_translation: What is the ruling? Rava said: (He said) Shmuel.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין קְשִׁיתֵיהּ; מַאי אִירְיָא דְּתָנֵי עוֹמֵד אֲבָל לֹא יוֹשֵׁב? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּנִכְסֵי מְבַקֵּר אֲסוּרִין עַל הַחוֹלֶה.
human_translation: the mishna was difficult for him: Why does specifically teach: stands may not sit? Conclude from it that the property of the visitor is forbidden to the ill person.
llm_translation: Mishnaic teaching: Its stalks are hard; what is the meaning of teaching "standing but not sitting"? Learn from it that visitors are forbidden to visit the sick.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: רֶמֶז לְבִיקּוּר חוֹלִין מִן הַתּוֹרָה מִנַּיִן? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם כְּמוֹת כׇּל הָאָדָם יְמֻתוּן אֵלֶּה וּפְקֻדַּת כׇּל הָאָדָם וְגוֹ׳״. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רָבָא: אִם כְּמוֹת כׇּל הָאָדָם יְמוּתוּן אֵלֶּה, שֶׁהֵן חוֹלִים וּמוּטָלִים בַּעֲרִיסָתָן, וּבְנֵי אָדָם מְבַקְּרִים אוֹתָן, מָה הַבְּרִיּוֹת אוֹמְרִים — ״לֹא ה׳ שְׁלָחַנִי לָזֶה״.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: From where an allusion from the Torah to visiting the ill? as it is stated: “If these men die the common death of all men, and the visitation of all men, From where may be inferred? Rava said If these men, die the common death of all men, who become ill, and are confined to their beds, and people come to visit them; what do the people say? The Lord has not sent me for this
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: A hint for visiting the sick from the Torah, from where? As it is stated: "If like the death of all men these will die, and the fate of all men, etc." What is implied? Rava said: "If like the death of all men these will die," that they are sick and lying in their beds, and people visit them. What do the creatures say? "It is not Hashem who sent me to this."

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא: ״אִם בְּרִיאָה יִבְרָא ה׳״, ״אִם בְּרִיאָה״ גֵּיהִנָּם — מוּטָב תִּהְיֶה, אִם לָאו — ״יִבְרָא ה׳״.
human_translation: Rava interpreted homiletically: “But if the Lord will create a creation [ beria yivra ], If Gehenna a creation [ beria ] that is optimal; if not, God should create [ yivra ]
llm_translation: Rava expounded: "If with creation, Hashem will create," "If with creation" Gehinnom - it is preferable it should be, if not - "Hashem will create."

hebrew_text: אִינִי? וְהָא תַּנְיָא: שִׁבְעָה דְּבָרִים נִבְרְאוּ קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, אֵלּוּ הֵן: תּוֹרָה, וּתְשׁוּבָה, גַּן עֵדֶן, וְגֵיהִנָּם, כִּסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד, וּבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּשְׁמוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ.
human_translation: Is that so? But isn’t it taught Seven phenomena were created before the world was created, and they are: Torah, and repentance, the Garden of Eden, and Gehenna, the Throne of Glory, and the Temple, and the name of the Messiah.
llm_translation: I? But isn't it taught: Seven things were created before the world was created, and these are they: Torah, repentance, the Garden of Eden, Gehenna, the Throne of Glory, the Temple, and the name of the Messiah.

hebrew_text: תּוֹרָה, דִּכְתִיב ה׳: ״קָנָנִי רֵאשִׁית דַּרְכּוֹ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Torah as it is written: “The Lord made me as the beginning of His way,
llm_translation: Torah, as it is written (Proverbs 8:22): "The Lord acquired me as the beginning of His way, etc."

hebrew_text: תְּשׁוּבָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּטֶרֶם הָרִים יֻלָּדוּ וַתְּחוֹלֵל וְגוֹ׳ תָּשֵׁב אֱנוֹשׁ עַד דַּכָּא וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Repentance as it is written: “Before the mountains were brought forth, and it is written “You return man to contrition;
llm_translation: Repentance, as it is written: "Before the mountains were born, and You gave birth to the earth and the world, from eternity to eternity, You are God."

hebrew_text: גַּן עֵדֶן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּטַּע ה׳ אֱלֹהִים גַּן בְּעֵדֶן מִקֶּדֶם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The Garden of Eden as it is written: “And the Lord God planted a garden in Eden eastward [ mikedem ]”
llm_translation: Garden of Eden, as it is written: "And the Lord God planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and so forth."

hebrew_text: גֵּיהִנָּם, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי עָרוּךְ מֵאֶתְמוּל תׇּפְתֶּה״.
human_translation: Gehenna as it is written: “For its hearth is ordained of old”
llm_translation: Gehinnam, as it is written: "For it is prepared from yesterday, deep and wide."

hebrew_text: כִּסֵּא כָּבוֹד, דִּכְתִיב: ״נָכוֹן כִּסְאֲךָ מֵאָז״.
human_translation: The Throne of Glory as it is written: “Your throne is established of old,
llm_translation: The seat of honor, as it is written: "Your throne is established from of old."

hebrew_text: בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּסֵּא כָבוֹד מָרוֹם מֵרִאשׁוֹן״.
human_translation: The Temple as it is written: “Your Throne of Glory on high from the beginning,
llm_translation: The Temple, as it is written: "A throne of glory, exalted from the beginning."

hebrew_text: שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל מָשִׁיחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהִי שְׁמוֹ לְעוֹלָם וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: The name of the Messiah as it is written “May his name endure forever;
llm_translation: The name of the Messiah, as it is written: "His name shall endure forever, etc."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי אִיבְּרִי לֵיהּ פּוּמָּא — מוּטָב, וְאִם לָא — ״יִבְרָא ה׳״. וְהָכְתִיב: ״אֵין כׇּל חָדָשׁ תַּחַת הַשָּׁמֶשׁ״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִי הָכָא לָא מְקָרַב פּוּמָּא — לְהָכָא לִיקְרַב.
human_translation: Rather, this is what is saying: If the opening was created for optimal, and if not, the Lord should create But isn’t it written: there is nothing new under the sun” This is what said: If the mouth is not close to here, let bring it closer.
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: If he explained it with the mouth - it is better, and if not - "Let God create." And it is written: "There is nothing new under the sun!" Thus he said: If here it does not come close with the mouth - let it come close here.

hebrew_text: דָּרֵשׁ רָבָא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״שֶׁמֶשׁ יָרֵחַ עָמַד זְבֻלָה״. שֶׁמֶשׁ וְיָרֵחַ בִּזְבוּל מַאי בָּעֲיָין? וְהָא בְּרָקִיעַ קְבִיעִי! מְלַמֵּד שֶׁעָלוּ שֶׁמֶשׁ וְיָרֵחַ מֵרָקִיעַ לִזְבוּל, וְאָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, אִם אַתָּה עוֹשֶׂה דִּין לְבֶן עַמְרָם — אָנוּ מְאִירִים, וְאִם לָאו — אֵין אָנוּ מְאִירִין.
human_translation: Rava interpreted homiletically, and some say that Rabbi Yitzḥak said: What is which is written: “The sun and moon stood still in their habitation [ zevula ], What do the sun and moon seek in zevul , aren’t they fixed in rakia , teaches that the sun and moon ascended from rakia to zevul and said before Him: Master of the Universe! If You do justice for the son of Amram, we illuminate and if not, we not illuminate
llm_translation: Rava expounded, and some say it was said by Rabbi Yitzchak: What is the meaning of the verse, "The sun and the moon stood still in their habitation"? What do the sun and the moon need in the habitation of Zvul? But are they not fixed in the firmament? This teaches that the sun and the moon ascended from the firmament to Zvul, and they said before Him: Master of the Universe, if You do justice for the son of Amram, we will shine; but if not, we will not shine.

hebrew_text: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה יָרָה בָּהֶן חִיצִּים וַחֲנִיתוֹת, אָמַר לָהֶם: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם מִשְׁתַּחֲוִים לָכֶם וְאַתֶּם מְאִירִים. בִּכְבוֹדִי לֹא מְחִיתֶם, בִּכְבוֹד בָּשָׂר וָדָם מְחִיתֶם! וּבְכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם יוֹרִין בָּהֶן חִיצִּין וַחֲנִיתוֹת וּמְאִירִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לְאוֹר חִצֶּיךָ יְהַלֵּכוּ וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: At that moment, shot arrows, and spears at them, said to them: Each and every day bow to you and you illuminate In My honor, you did not protest, but in honor of flesh and blood, you protested? And each and every day shoot arrows and spears at illuminate as it is stated: “At the light of Your arrows as they go, at the shining of Your glittering spear”
llm_translation: At that moment he shot arrows and spears at them, saying to them: "Every day you prostrate yourselves to them, and you enlighten them. You have not extinguished my honor, but you have extinguished the honor of flesh and blood! And every day they shoot arrows and spears at them and enlighten them, as it is said: 'For the light of Your arrows, they go.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: בִּיקּוּר חוֹלִים אֵין לָהּ שִׁיעוּר. מַאי ״אֵין לָהּ שִׁיעוּר״? סָבַר רַב יוֹסֵף לְמֵימַר אֵין שִׁיעוּר לְמַתַּן שְׂכָרָהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְכׇל מִצְוֹת מִי יֵשׁ שִׁיעוּר לְמַתַּן שְׂכָרָן? וְהָא תְּנַן: הֱוֵי זָהִיר בְּמִצְוָה קַלָּה כְּבַחֲמוּרָה, שֶׁאֵין אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ מַתַּן שְׂכָרָן שֶׁל מִצְוֹת! אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲפִילּוּ גָּדוֹל אֵצֶל קָטָן. רָבָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ מֵאָה פְּעָמִים בְּיוֹם.
human_translation: is taught visiting the ill has no measure. What is Has no measure? Rav Yosef thought to say: There is no measure for the granting of its reward. Abaye said to him: And do all mitzvot have measure for the granting of their reward? But didn’t we learn Be meticulous in a minor mitzva as a major one, as you do not know the granting of reward for mitzvot. Rather, Abaye said: even a prominent to a lowly Rava said: even one hundred times a day
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: In visiting the sick, there is no specific measure. What is meant by "there is no specific measure"? Rav Yosef thought to say that there is no measure for giving her reward. Abaye said to him: And for all mitzvot, is there a measure for giving their reward? But didn't we learn: Be diligent in performing a light mitzvah as you would a weighty one, for you do not know the reward of mitzvot! Rather, Abaye said: Even a great person with a small one. Rava said: Even a hundred times a day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַחָא בַּר חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הַמְבַקֵּר חוֹלֶה, נוֹטֵל אֶחָד מִשִּׁשִּׁים בְּצַעֲרוֹ. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן לִיעַלּוּן שִׁיתִּין וְלוֹקְמוּהּ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּעִישּׂוּרְיָיתָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי, וּבְבֶן גִּילוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ḥanina said: Anyone who visits an ill person takes one-sixtieth of his suffering. said to him: If so, let sixty enter and stand him up, said to them: like the tenths of the school of Rabbi Furthermore, one same constellation
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah bar Hanina said: Anyone who visits a sick person takes away one sixtieth of his suffering. They said to him: If so, let sixty come and take it away! He said to them: Like the healing practices of the house of Rabbi, and in Ben Gilo.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: בַּת הַנִּיזוֹנֶית מִנִּכְסֵי אַחִין — נוֹטֶלֶת עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי: לִדְבָרֶיךָ מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ עֶשֶׂר בָּנוֹת וּבֵן, אֵין לוֹ לַבֵּן בִּמְקוֹם בָּנוֹת כְּלוּם! אָמַר לָהֶן: רִאשׁוֹנָה נוֹטֶלֶת עִישּׂוּר נְכָסִים, שְׁנִיָּה בַּמֶּה שֶׁשִּׁיְּירָה, שְׁלִישִׁית בַּמֶּה שֶׁשִּׁיְּירָה, וְחוֹזְרוֹת וְחוֹלְקוֹת בְּשָׁוֶה.
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi says: A daughter who is supported from the property of brothers receives one-tenth estate said to Rabbi According to your statement, one who has ten daughters and a son, no at all for the son in a place daughters, said to them: The first takes one-tenth of the estate, the second of which left the third of which left then divide equally.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi says: A daughter of a Nizonit inherits from the property of her brothers - she takes a share of the estate. They said to him: According to your words, if a man has ten daughters and a son, the son will have no share in the inheritance at all! He said to them: The first daughter takes a share of the estate, the second in what is left over, the third in what is left over, and they go back and divide equally.

hebrew_text: רַב חֶלְבּוֹ חֲלַשׁ, נְפַק אַכְרֵיז רַב כָּהֲנָא:
human_translation: Rav Ḥelbo fell ill. Rav Kahana went out and announced:
llm_translation: Rav Chelbo chalash, nafka achreiz Rav Kahana.

hebrew_text: רַב חֶלְבּוֹ בְּאֵישׁ. לָא אִיכָּא דְּקָא אָתֵי. אָמַר לְהוּ: לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה בְּתַלְמִיד אֶחָד מִתַּלְמִידֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא שֶׁחָלָה. לֹא נִכְנְסוּ חֲכָמִים לְבַקְּרוֹ, וְנִכְנָס רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְבַקְּרוֹ, וּבִשְׁבִיל שֶׁכִּיבְּדוּ וְרִיבְּצוּ לְפָנָיו, חָיָה. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, הֶחֱיִיתַנִי. יָצָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְדָרַשׁ: כׇּל מִי שֶׁאֵין מְבַקֵּר חוֹלִים כְּאִילּוּ שׁוֹפֵךְ דָּמִים.
human_translation: Rav Ḥelbo fell ill. There was no one who came said Didn’t the incident involving one of the students of Rabbi Akiva who became sick in that manner? the Sages did not enter to visit him, and Rabbi Akiva entered to visit him And since they swept and sprinkled water on the floor before he recovered. said to My teacher, you revived me. Rabbi Akiva went out and taught: anyone who does not visit the ill, it is as though he is spilling blood,
llm_translation: Rav Helbo in a man. There is no one who comes. He said to them: This was not the case with one student of Rabbi Akiva's students who fell ill. The sages did not enter to visit him, but Rabbi Akiva entered to visit him, and because they honored him and sat before him, he lived. He said to him: Rabbi, you have revived me. Rabbi Akiva went out and expounded: Anyone who does not visit the sick is as if he sheds blood.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: כׇּל הַמְבַקֵּר אֶת הַחוֹלֶה גּוֹרֵם לוֹ שֶׁיִּחְיֶה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְבַקֵּר אֶת הַחוֹלֶה גּוֹרֵם לוֹ שֶׁיָּמוּת. מַאי גְּרָמָא? אִילֵּימָא כׇּל הַמְבַקֵּר אֶת הַחוֹלֶה מְבַקֵּשׁ עָלָיו רַחֲמִים שֶׁיִּחְיֶה, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין מְבַקֵּר אֶת הַחוֹלֶה מְבַקֵּשׁ עָלָיו רַחֲמִים שֶׁיָּמוּת. שֶׁיָּמוּת סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין מְבַקֵּר חוֹלֶה, אֵין מְבַקֵּשׁ עָלָיו רַחֲמִים, לֹא שֶׁיִּחְיֶה וְלֹא שֶׁיָּמוּת.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came from Eretz Yisrael he said: Anyone who visits the ill causes that he will live, and anyone who does not visit the ill causes that he will die. what the cause If we say anyone who visits the ill pleads for mercy that he will live, and anyone who does not visit the ill pleads for mercy that he will die, does it enter your mind that will die? Rather, anyone who does not visit the ill does not plead for mercy for him, neither that he will live nor that he will die.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Anyone who visits the sick causes him to live, and anyone who does not visit the sick causes him to die. What is the reason? If you say, anyone who visits the sick seeks mercy for him to live, and anyone who does not visit the sick seeks mercy for him to die. Is it your opinion that he should die?! Rather, anyone who does not visit a sick person does not seek mercy for him, neither for him to live nor for him to die.

hebrew_text: רָבָא, יוֹמָא קַדְמָאָה דְּחָלֵישׁ אָמַר לְהוֹן: לָא תִּיגַלּוֹ לְאִינִישׁ, דְּלָא לִתְּרַע מַזָּלֵיהּ. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ אָמַר לְהוֹן: פּוּקוּ וְאַכְרִיזוּ בְּשׁוּקָא, דְּכׇל דְּסָנֵי לִי לִיחְדֵּי לִי, וּכְתִיב: ״בִּנְפֹל אוֹיִבְךָ אַל תִּשְׂמָח וְגוֹ׳״, וּדְרָחֵים לִי לִיבְעֵי עֲלַי רַחֲמֵי.
human_translation: Rava: the first day that he was ill, he say to Do not reveal to any person that his luck not suffer. From this forward, he say to them: Go and proclaim in the marketplace as let all who hate me rejoice over my and it is written: “Rejoice not when your enemy falls, And let who love me pray mercy upon me.
llm_translation: Rava, on the first day of the week, when he felt weak, said to them: "Do not reveal to a person, so that his luck does not turn bad." From then on, he said to them: "Go out and proclaim in the market, for anyone who hates me, let him come and join me." And it is written: "Do not rejoice when your enemy falls, and let not your heart be glad." And they sought to have mercy on me.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: כׇּל הַמְבַקֵּר אֶת הַחוֹלֶה נִיצּוֹל מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַשְׁרֵי מַשְׂכִּיל אֶל דָּל בְּיוֹם רָעָה יְמַלְּטֵהוּ ה׳״, אֵין דַּל אֶלָּא חוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִדַּלָּה יְבַצְּעֵנִי״, אִי נָמֵי מִן הָדֵין קְרָא: ״מַדּוּעַ אַתָּה כָּכָה דַּל בֶּן הַמֶּלֶךְ בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר וְגוֹ׳״. אֵין רָעָה אֶלָּא גֵּיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּל פָּעַל ה׳ לַמַּעֲנֵהוּ וְגַם רָשָׁע לְיוֹם רָעָה״.
human_translation: Rav said: Anyone who visits the ill is spared from the judgment of Gehenna, as it is stated: “Happy is he that considers the poor; the Lord will deliver him in the day of evil” poor [ dal ] nothing other ill, as it is stated “He will cut me off from the illness [ middalla ]” Alternatively, from this verse Why, son of the king, are you so sick [ dal ] from morning to morning?” And evil means nothing other Gehenna, as it is stated: “The Lord made everything for His own purpose, and even the wicked for the day of evil”
llm_translation: Rav said: Anyone who visits the sick is saved from the judgment of Gehinnom, as it is stated: "Happy is he who is considerate to the poor; the Lord will save him in the day of evil." The poor mentioned in this verse refers to the sick, as it is stated: "From the depths He will deliver me." Alternatively, from the same reasoning, the verse states: "Why are you so weak every morning, O daughter of the king?" The evil mentioned here refers to Gehinnom, as it is stated: "The Lord will repay him according to his deeds, and bring his wickedness upon him on the day of evil."

hebrew_text: וְאִם בִּיקֵּר מָה שְׂכָרוֹ? מָה שְׂכָרוֹ?! כִּדְאָמַר: נִיצּוֹל מִדִּינָהּ שֶׁל גֵּיהִנָּם! אֶלָּא: מָה שְׂכָרוֹ בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה —
human_translation: And if one visited what is his reward? What is his reward? as said: is spared from the judgment of Gehenna. Rather, What is his reward in this world?
llm_translation: "And if he visited, what is his reward? What is his reward?! As it says: 'He shall be snatched away from the judgment of Gehinnom!' Rather: What is his reward in this world—"

hebrew_text: ״ה׳ יִשְׁמְרֵהוּ וִיחַיֵּהוּ וְאֻשַּׁר בָּאָרֶץ וְאַל תִּתְּנֵהוּ בְּנֶפֶשׁ אֹיְבָיו״. ״ה׳ יִשְׁמְרֵהוּ״ — מִיֵּצֶר הָרָע, ״וִיחַיֵּהוּ״ — מִן הַיִּסּוּרִין, ״וְאֻשַּׁר בָּאָרֶץ״ — שֶׁיְּהוּ הַכֹּל מִתְכַּבְּדִין בּוֹ, ״וְאַל תִּתְּנֵהוּ בְּנֶפֶשׁ אֹיְבָיו״ — שֶׁיִּזְדַּמְּנוּ לוֹ רֵיעִים כְּנַעֲמָן שֶׁרִיפּוּ אֶת צָרַעְתּוֹ, וְאַל יִזְדַּמְּנוּ לוֹ רֵיעִים כִּרְחַבְעָם שֶׁחִילְּקוּ אֶת מַלְכוּתוֹ.
human_translation: “The Lord will preserve him, and keep him alive, let him be called happy in the land; and deliver not You him unto the greed of his enemies” “The Lord will preserve him” from the evil inclination; “and keep him alive” from suffering; “let him be called happy in the land” everyone will be honored with him; “and deliver not You him unto the greed of his enemies,” that companions like Naaman a cure for his leprosy will happen to him, companions like Rehoboam the schism in his kingdom will not happen to him.
llm_translation: "The Lord shall preserve him and keep him alive, and he shall be blessed upon the earth, and You will not deliver him to the will of his enemies." "The Lord shall preserve him" - from the evil inclination, "and keep him alive" - from afflictions, "and he shall be blessed upon the earth" - that all will honor him, "and You will not deliver him to the will of his enemies" - that friends will be similar to him, like Naaman who burned his leprosy, and not like Rehoboam who divided his kingdom.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם יֹאמְרוּ לָךְ יְלָדִים ״בְּנֵה״ וּזְקֵנִים ״סְתוֹר״ — שְׁמַע לַזְּקֵנִים וְאַל תִּשְׁמַע לַיְּלָדִים. שֶׁבִּנְיַן יְלָדִים סְתִירָה, וּסְתִירַת זְקֵנִים בִּנְיָן. וְסִימָן לַדָּבָר: רְחַבְעָם בֶּן שְׁלֹמֹה.
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If youths would say to you: Construct, and Elders would say to you: Demolish, heed the Elders and do not heed the youths, as the construction of youths is demolition, and the demolition of Elders is construction. And a mnemonic for this matter “Rehoboam, son of Solomon”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If children say to you, "Build," and elders say, "Destroy," listen to the elders and do not listen to the children. For the building of children is destruction, and the destruction of elders is building. And a sign for this matter is Rehoboam son of Solomon.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: לָא לִיסְעוֹד אִינִישׁ קְצִירָא לָא בִּתְלָת שָׁעֵי קַדְמָיָיתָא, וְלָא בִּתְלָת שָׁעֵי בָּתְרָיָיתָא דְּיוֹמָא, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לַיסַּח דַּעְתֵּיהּ מִן רַחֲמֵי. תְּלָת שָׁעֵי קַדְמָיָיתָא — רָוְוחָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ. בָּתְרָיָיתָא — תָּקֵיף חוּלְשֵׁיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: Let one not visit a sick person, neither during the first three hours nor in the last three hours of the day, so that he will not be diverted from mercy. the first three hours is relieved, the last his weakness is exacerbated,
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: A person should not engage in harvesting neither during the first three hours of the day nor during the last three hours of the day, so that his mind will not be distracted from prayer. The first three hours of the day are when his mind is clear. The last three hours are when his physical strength is weak.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִין אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִין שֶׁהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא זָן אֶת הַחוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ יִסְעָדֶנּוּ עַל עֶרֶשׂ דְּוָי וְגוֹ׳״. וְאָמַר רָבִין אָמַר רַב: מִנַּיִין שֶׁהַשְּׁכִינָה שְׁרוּיָה לְמַעְלָה מִמִּטָּתוֹ שֶׁל הַחוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ יִסְעָדֶנּוּ עַל עֶרֶשׂ דְּוָי״.
human_translation: Ravin said Rav said: From where that the Holy One, Blessed be He sustains the sick person? as it is stated: “The Lord will support him upon the bed of suffering” And Ravin said Rav said: From where that the Divine Presence is resting above the bed of the sick person? as it is stated: “The Lord will support him upon the bed of suffering,”
llm_translation: Ravīn said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that the Holy One, blessed be He, sustains the sick, as it is stated: "The Lord will sustain him upon the bed of illness, etc." And Ravīn said in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that the Divine Presence hovers above the bed of the sick, as it is stated: "The Lord will sustain him upon the bed of illness."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַנִּכְנָס לְבַקֵּר אֶת הַחוֹלֶה, לֹא יֵשֵׁב לֹא עַל גַּבֵּי מִטָּה וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי סַפְסָל וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי כִּסֵּא, אֶלָּא מִתְעַטֵּף וְיוֹשֵׁב עַל גַּבֵּי קַרְקַע, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַשְּׁכִינָה שְׁרוּיָה לְמַעְלָה מִמִּטָּתוֹ שֶׁל חוֹלֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״ה׳ יִסְעָדֶנּוּ עַל עֶרֶשׂ דְּוָי״.
human_translation: this is also taught One who enters to visit a sick person may neither sit on the bed nor on a bench or on a chair Rather, he wraps himself and sits on the ground, because the Divine Presence is resting above the bed of the sick person, as it is stated: “The Lord will support him upon the bed of suffering,”
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita in the name of the school of Hillel: One who enters to visit the sick person should not sit neither on the bed nor on a stool nor on a chair, but should wrap himself and sit on the ground, because the Divine Presence is hovering above the bed of the sick person, as it is stated: "The Lord will sustain him on the couch of illness" (Psalms 41:4).

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבִין אָמַר רַב: מִטְרָא בְּמַעְרְבָא — סָהֲדָא רַבָּה פְּרָת. וּפְלִיגָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נַהְרָא מִכֵּיפֵיהּ מִתְבָּרֵיךְ. וּפְלִיגָא דִּשְׁמוּאֵל אַדִּשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין הַמַּיִם מְטַהֲרִין בְּזוֹחֲלִין
human_translation: And Ravin said Rav said: When rain in the West, a great witness to is the Euphrates River, And disagrees of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: A river is blessed from its banks, And of Shmuel disagrees with of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: The water purifies when flowing
llm_translation: And Rabin said in the name of Rav: Rain in Ma'arava - a large testimony. And it is in dispute with Shmuel, for Shmuel said: A river from its source is blessed. And it is in dispute with AdShmuel, for Shmuel said: Water does not purify with creeping creatures.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא פְּרָת בְּיוֹמֵי תִשְׁרֵי בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: in the Euphrates only during the days of Tishrei alone,
llm_translation: Rather, Parat only in the days of Tishrei.

hebrew_text: אֲבוּהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל עֲבַד לְהוֹן מִקְווֹאוֹת לִבְנָתֵיהּ בְּיוֹמֵי נִיסָן, וּמַפָּצֵי בְּיוֹמֵי תִשְׁרֵי.
human_translation: Shmuel’s father fashioned ritual baths for his daughters during the days of Nisan and mats during the days of Tishrei.
llm_translation: The father of Shmuel would make mikvehs for his daughters in the days of Nisan, and he would dismantle them in the days of Tishrei.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַב: מַאי דִּכְתִיב ״וְאַתָּה בֶן אָדָם עֲשֵׂה לְךָ כְּלֵי גוֹלָה״ — זוֹ נֵר וּקְעָרָה
human_translation: Rabbi Ami said Rav said: What is which is written: “And you, son of man, make for yourself implements of exile” That is a lamp, and a bowl,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rav: What is the meaning of the verse, "And you, son of man, make for yourself vessels of exile"? — This refers to a lamp and a bowl.

hebrew_text: וְשָׁטִיחַ. ״בְּחֹסֶר כֹּל״, אָמַר רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר רַב: בְּלֹא נֵר וּבְלֹא שֻׁלְחָן. רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: בְּלֹא אִשָּׁה. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: בְּלֹא שַׁמָּשׁ. רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בְּלֹא דֵּעָה. תָּנָא: בְּלֹא מֶלַח וּבְלֹא רְבָב.
human_translation: and a rug, in want of all things; Rabbi Ami said Rav said: without a lamp and without a table Rav Ḥisda said: Without a wife. Rav Sheshet said: Without an attendant Rav Naḥman said: Without intelligence. teaches Without salt and without fat [ revav ]
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And he smeared." "In complete lack," Rabbi Ammi said in the name of Rav: without a lamp and without a table. Rav Ḥisdah said: without a woman. Rav Sheshet said: without a servant. Rav Naḥman said: without knowledge. It was taught in a baraita: without salt and without a quarter-log.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: נָקְטִינַן — אֵין עָנִי אֶלָּא בְּדֵעָה. בְּמַעְרְבָא אָמְרִי: דְּדָא בֵּיהּ — כּוּלָּא בֵּיהּ, דְּלָא דָּא בֵּיהּ — מָה בֵּיהּ. דָּא קָנֵי — מָה חָסַר, דָּא לָא קָנֵי — מָה קָנֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said we have a tradition: A poor person is only in intelligence, In the West, they say: who this in him everything in him. who does not this in him, what is in him? he acquired this, what is lacking? he has not acquired this, what has he acquired?
llm_translation: Abbaye said: We have learned - poverty is only in knowledge. In the West, they say: If there is something in it - everything is in it, if there is nothing in it - what is in it. If this one acquires - what is lacking, if this one does not acquire - what does he acquire.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: אֵין הַחוֹלֶה עוֹמֵד מֵחׇלְיוֹ עַד שֶׁמּוֹחֲלִין לוֹ עַל כֹּל עֲוֹנוֹתָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַסֹּלֵחַ לְכׇל עֲוֹנֵכִי הָרֹפֵא לְכׇל תַּחֲלוּאָיְכִי״. רַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר: חוֹזֵר לִימֵי עֲלוּמָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רֻטְפַשׁ בְּשָׂרוֹ מִנֹּעַר יָשׁוּב לִימֵי עֲלוּמָיו״. ״כׇּל מִשְׁכָּבוֹ הָפַכְתָּ בְחׇלְיוֹ״, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לוֹמַר דִּמְשַׁכֵּחַ תַּלְמוּדוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: The sick person recovers from his illness only when forgives him for all his sins, as it is stated: “Who forgives all your iniquity; Who heals all your diseases” Rav Hamnuna said: he returns to the days of his youth, as it is stated “His flesh is tenderer than a child’s; he returns to the days of his youth” You overturned all his lying down in his illness” Rav Yosef said: to say that forgets his studies,
llm_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said, Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said: The sick person does not rise from his sickness until they forgive him for all his sins, as it is said: "Who forgives all your iniquities, who heals all your diseases." Rav Hamnuna said: He returns to his youthful days, as it is said: "His flesh shall be fresher than a child's; he returns to the days of his youth." "You have turned all his bed in his sickness," Rabbi Yosef said: to say that he forgets his learning.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף חֲלַשׁ, אִיעַקַּר לֵיהּ תַּלְמוּדֵיהּ, אַהְדְּרֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי קַמֵּיהּ. הַיְינוּ דִּבְכָל דּוּכְתָּא אָמְרִינַן, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא שְׁמִיעַ לִי הָדָא שְׁמַעְתָּא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אַתְּ אַמְרִיתַהּ נִיהֲלַן, וּמַהָא מַתְנִיתָא אַמְרִיתַהּ נִיהֲלַן.
human_translation: Rav Yosef fell ill his studies were forgotten. Abaye restored before him. This is which we say everywhere Rav Yosef said: I did not learn this halakha , Abaye said to him You said this to us and from this baraita you said it to us.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef weakened, his learning departed from him, Abaye reviewed it before him. That is what we say in every place, Rav Yosef said: "This teaching did not seem clear to me." Abaye said to him: "You said it clearly, and what you said in the Mishnah you said clearly."

hebrew_text: כִּי הֲוָה גְּמִיר רַבִּי תְּלָת עֶשְׂרֵי אַפֵּי הִילְכָתָא, אַגְמְרֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא שִׁבְעָה מִנְּהוֹן. לְסוֹף חֲלַשׁ רַבִּי, אַהְדַּר רַבִּי חִיָּיא קַמֵּיהּ הָנְהוּ שִׁבְעָה אַפֵּי דְּאַגְמְרֵיהּ, שִׁיתָּא אַזְּדּוּ. הֲוָה הָהוּא קַצָּרָא, הֲוָה שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי כְּדַהֲוָה גָּרֵיס לְהוּ. אֲזַל רַבִּי חִיָּיא וּגְמַר יָתְהוֹן קַמֵּי קַצָּרָא וַאֲתָא וְאַהְדַּר יָתְהוֹן קַמֵּי רַבִּי. כַּד הֲוָה חָזֵי לֵיהּ רַבִּי לְהָהוּא קַצָּרָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי: אַתָּה עָשִׂיתָ אוֹתִי וְאֶת חִיָּיא. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, הָכִי קָאָמַר לֵיהּ: אַתָּה עָשִׂיתָ אֶת חִיָּיא, וְחִיָּיא עָשָׂה אוֹתִי.
human_translation: When Rabbi would learn thirteen aspects of a halakha he taught Rabbi Ḥiyya seven of them. Ultimately, Rabbi fell ill Rabbi Ḥiyya restored those seven aspects that taught him six were gone was a certain launderer would hear Rabbi when he was studying Rabbi Ḥiyya went and learned from the launderer and he came and restored them before Rabbi When Rabbi saw that launderer, Rabbi said to him: You made me and Ḥiyya, Some say this is what he said to You made Ḥiyya, and Ḥiyya made me.
llm_translation: When Rabbi completed thirteen sections of the Halakha, he taught them to Rabbi Hiyya, who in turn taught seven of them. Eventually, Rabbi became weak, and Rabbi Hiyya reviewed those seven sections before him, and they became six. At that time, there was a shortage, and Rabbi heard that Rabbi was living there. Rabbi Hiyya went and completed them before the shortage, and then returned and reviewed them before Rabbi. When Rabbi saw that there was a shortage, he said to him, "You have made me and Hiyya." Some say that he said to him in this way: "You have made Hiyya, and Hiyya has made me."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: גָּדוֹל נֵס שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה לַחוֹלֶה יוֹתֵר מִן הַנֵּס שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂה לַחֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה. שֶׁל חֲנַנְיָה מִישָׁאֵל וַעֲזַרְיָה אֵשׁ שֶׁל הֶדְיוֹט, וְהַכֹּל יְכוֹלִים לְכַבּוֹתָהּ. וְזוֹ שֶׁל חוֹלֶה — שֶׁל שָׁמַיִם הִיא, וּמִי יָכוֹל לְכַבּוֹתָהּ?
human_translation: And Rabbi Alexandri said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: Greater is the miracle performed for the sick person than the miracle that was performed for Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah, the fire of a layman, and anyone is capable of extinguishing it. And that a sick person of Heaven, and who can extinguish it?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Alexandri said in the name of Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba: Great is the miracle that was performed for the sick person, more than the miracle that was performed for Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah. For the miracle of Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah was a fire of human origin, and everyone can extinguish it. But the miracle of the sick person - it is a fire from heaven, and who can extinguish it?

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ קִיצּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם הַכֹּל מוֹשְׁלִים בּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיָה כׇל מֹצְאִי יַהַרְגֵנִי״. רַב אָמַר מִן הָדֵין קְרָא: ״לְמִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ עָמְדוּ הַיּוֹם כִּי הַכֹּל עֲבָדֶיךָ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Alexandri said Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Once the end a person arrived, everything has dominion over him, as it is stated “Whosoever finds me will slay me” Rav said from this verse: “They stand this day according to Your judgments; for all are Your servants”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Alexandri said, Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said, and some say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Once a person's summer has arrived, everything rules over him, as it is stated: "And all who find me will kill me." Rav said: From here the verse states: "Your judgments stand today, for all are Your servants."

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: שְׁכֵיב גַּבְרָא. גָּבוֹהַּ הֲוָה, רְכִיב גִּירְדּוֹנָא זוּטְרָא, מְטָא תִּיתּוּרָא אִיסְתְּוִיט, שַׁדְיֵיהּ וְקָא שָׁכֵיב. קָרֵי עַל נַפְשֵׁיהּ: ״לְמִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ עָמְדוּ הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: said to Rabba bar Sheila: A man died. was tall riding on a small mule [ giredona ]. When he reached a bridge [ tittora ], was frightened [ istavveit ] cast off and he died. read to “They stand this day according to Your judgments.”
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Sheilah said to him: "Lie down, sir." He was tall, he rode a small donkey, he reached a bridge, he threw himself and lay down. He read upon himself: "They have stood today for Your judgments."

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל חַזְיַיהּ לְהָהוּא קְרוּקִיתָא דְעַקְרַבָּא יְתִיבָא עַל אַקְרוּקְתָּא וְעָבְרָה נַהֲרָא טָרְקָא גַּבְרָא וּמָיֵית. קָרֵי עֲלֵיהּ ״לְמִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ עָמְדוּ הַיּוֹם״.
human_translation: Shmuel saw a certain frog [ kerokita ], that a scorpion was sitting upon the frog and crossed the river. stung a man and died. read to “They stand this day according to Your judgments.”
llm_translation: Samuel saw a certain scorpion in the village of Akra'ba, sitting on a beam. A river of turbid water passed by, and it died. He recited over it, "Your judgments have stood today."

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אֵין מְבַקְּרִין אֶת הַחוֹלֶה אֶלָּא לְמִי שֶׁחֲלָצַתּוּ חַמָּה. לְאַפּוֹקֵי מַאי? לְאַפּוֹקֵי הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן פְּרָטָא אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: אֵין מְבַקְּרִין לֹא חוֹלֵי מֵעַיִים וְלֹא חוֹלֵי הָעַיִן וְלֹא מְחוּשֵׁי הָרֹאשׁ. בִּשְׁלָמָא חוֹלֵי מֵעַיִים — מִשּׁוּם כִּיסּוּפָא. אֶלָּא חוֹלֵי הָעַיִן וּמְחוּשֵׁי הָרֹאשׁ מַאי טַעְמָא?
human_translation: Shmuel said: One visits a sick person only if is one whom fever overcame. What does exclude? to exclude that which is taught Rabbi Yosei ben Perata says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: One visits neither those with intestinal illness, nor those with eye illness, nor headaches. Granted, those with intestinal sickness, due to embarrassment, However, what is the reason those with eye illnesses and headaches?
llm_translation: Samuel said: We only visit the sick for one whose sun has set. To what can this be compared? To what is taught: Rabbi Yosei ben Prata says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: We do not visit those with stomach ailments, nor those with eye ailments, nor those with head ailments. It is understandable regarding stomach ailments - due to the risk. But why not those with eye ailments and head ailments?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּרַב יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: דִּיבּוּרָא קַשְׁיָא לְעֵינָא וּמְעַלֵּי לְאִישָּׁתָא. אָמַר רָבָא: הַאי אִישָּׁתָא, אִי לָאו דְּפַרְווֹנְקָא דְּמַלְאֲכָא דְמוֹתָא, מְעַלֵּי
human_translation: It is due to which Rav Yehuda said, as Rav Yehuda said: Speech is injurious for the eye and beneficial for a fever. Rava said: this fever [ ishta ], were it not the agent [ parvanka ] of the Angel of Death, beneficial,
llm_translation: From the statement of Rav Yehudah, as Rav Yehudah said: The speech is difficult in my eyes and I ascend to the woman. Rava said: This woman, whether she is the wife of the angel of death, ascends.

hebrew_text: כְּחִיזְרָא לְדִיקְלֵי, חַד לִתְלָתִין יוֹמִין, וְכִי תִּירְיָיקִי לְגוּפָא. רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: לָא הִיא וְלָא תִּירְיָיקָה.
human_translation: like for palm trees, once in thirty days, and it is like an antidote [ tiraiki ] for the body. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: neither nor its antidote.
llm_translation: Like a cucumber to palm trees, one for thirty days, and when it withers away. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is not so, and it will not wither.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר יוֹנָתָן אָמַר רַב יְחִיאֵל: עַרְסָן יָפֶה לַחוֹלֶה לִרְפוּאָתוֹ. מַאי עַרְסָן? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: חוּשְׁלָא דִּשְׂעָרֵי עַתִּיקָתָא דְּרֵישׁ נָפְיָא, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בָּעֲיָין בִּישּׁוּלָא כְּעֵין בִּישְׂרָא דְתוֹרָא. רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר: סְמִידֵי דִּשְׂעָרֵי עַתִּיקָתָא דְּרֵישׁ נָפְיָא, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בָּעֲיָין בִּישּׁוּלָא כְּבִשְׂרָא דְתוֹרָא.
human_translation: Rabba bar Yonatan said Rav Yeḥiel said: Arsan is beneficial for the sick person for his cure. What is arsan ? Rabbi Yonatan said: old hulled barley from the beginning of sifting Abaye said: And requires cooking like the meat of a bull. Rav Yosef said: is fine flour [ semida ] from old barley from the beginning of sifting Abaye said: And requires cooking like the meat of a bull.
llm_translation: Rabba bar Yonatan said in the name of Rav Yechiel: A plaster is good for a sick person's healing. What is this plaster? Rabbi Yonatan said: A mixture of old hair, the length of a barleycorn. Abbaye said: It requires kneading like the kneading of Torah. Rav Yosef said: Wool of old hair, the length of a barleycorn. Abbaye said: It requires kneading like the kneading of Torah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בּוֹרְדָם, אֵין מְבַקְּרִים וְאֵין מַזְכִּירִין שְׁמוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא כְּמַעְיָין הַנּוֹבֵעַ. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ ״בּוֹרְדָם״ — שֶׁהוּא כְּמַעְיָין הַנּוֹבֵעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: One does not visit buredam , nor is the name mentioned, What is the reason Rabbi Elazar said: that he is like a flowing spring, And Rabbi Elazar said: Why is called buredam ? that is like a flowing spring,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In regard to Bordeaux, one does not inspect it nor mention its name. What is the reason? Rabbi Elazar said: Because it is like a spring that gushes forth. And Rabbi Elazar said: Why is it called "Bordeaux"? Because it is like a spring that gushes forth.

hebrew_text: וּמְרַפְּאֵהוּ רְפוּאַת הַנֶּפֶשׁ כּוּ׳. הֵיכִי קָתָנֵי? אִילֵּימָא דִּרְפוּאַת נֶפֶשׁ בְּחִנָּם, רְפוּאַת מָמוֹן בְּשָׂכָר, לִיתְנֵי הָכִי: מְרַפְּאֵהוּ בְּחִנָּם, אֲבָל לֹא בְּשָׂכָר! אֶלָּא: רְפוּאַת נֶפֶשׁ — גּוּפוֹ, רְפוּאַת מָמוֹן — בְּהֶמְתּוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב: אֲבָל אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״סַם פְּלוֹנִי יָפֶה לָהּ, סַם פְּלוֹנִי רַע לָהּ״.
human_translation: heals him a cure of the nefesh How is taught? If we say that cure of the nefesh for free and cure of mamon for a fee, let teach this: He cures him for free but not for a fee. Rather, cure of the nefesh his body, and cure of mamon his animal. Rabbi Zutra bar Toviya said Rav said: However, he says to him: Such and such medicine is beneficial and such and such medicine is harmful
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And he heals him with a healing of the soul, etc. How should this be taught? If you say that the healing of the soul is done for free, and the healing of wealth is done for payment, let it be taught thus: He heals him for free, but not for payment! Rather, the healing of the soul refers to his body, and the healing of wealth refers to his animal. Rabbi Zutra bar Tobiah said in the name of Rav: But if one tells him, "This medicine is good for her, this medicine is bad for her." English translation:

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְרוֹחֵץ עִמּוֹ בְּאַמְבָּטִי גְּדוֹלָה, אֲבָל לֹא בִּקְטַנָּה. וְיָשֵׁן עִמּוֹ בַּמִּטָּה.
human_translation: And one may bathe with him in a large bath [ ambati ], However, not in a small And he may sleep with him in bed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "And he may bathe with him in a large bathhouse, but not in a small one. And he may sleep with him in the same bed."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה, אֲבָל לֹא בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהוּא מַהֲנֵהוּ. וּמֵיסֵב עִמּוֹ עַל הַמִּטָּה. וְאוֹכֵל עִמּוֹ עַל הַשּׁוּלְחָן, אֲבָל לֹא מִן הַתַּמְחוּי. אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא עִמּוֹ מִן הַתַּמְחוּי הַחוֹזֵר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: during the days of summer, but not during the rainy season, because he benefits him And he may recline with him on a divan And he may eat with him at table, but not from platter However, he may eat with him from a platter that returns
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: In the days of the sun, but not in the days of rain, because it benefits him. And he reclines with him on the bed. And he eats with him at the table, but not from the trough. But he himself eats from the returning trough.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: לֹא יִרְחַץ עִמּוֹ בְּאַמְבָּטִי, וְלֹא יִשַׁן עִמּוֹ בַּמִּטָּה, בֵּין גְּדוֹלָה בֵּין קְטַנָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה בִּימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים, וּקְטַנָּה בִּימוֹת הַחַמָּה — מוּתָּר. רוֹחֵץ עִמּוֹ בְּאַמְבָּטִי גְּדוֹלָה, וּמַזִּיעַ עִמּוֹ בִּקְטַנָּה. אֲבָל מֵיסֵב עִמּוֹ עַל הַמִּטָּה וְאוֹכֵל עִמּוֹ עַל הַשּׁוּלְחָן, אֲבָל לֹא מִן הַתַּמְחוּי. אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא מִן הַתַּמְחוּי הַחוֹזֵר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: מִן הַתַּמְחוּי הַחוֹזֵר לְבַעַל הַבַּיִת.
human_translation: It is taught One may neither bathe with him in a bath nor sleep with him in a bed, whether large whether small the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: permitted large during the rainy season and a small during the days of summer, He may bathe with him in a large bath and sweat with him in a small one, he may recline with him on a divan, and he may eat with him at table but not from a platter. However, he may eat with him from a platter that returns. Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: a platter that returns to the host.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: It was taught in a baraita: One may not wash with him in a bathhouse, and one may not sleep with him in the same bed, whether it is a large bed or a small bed. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: With a large bed during the rainy season, and with a small bed during the sunny season — it is permitted. One may wash with him in a large bathhouse, and one may sweat with him in a small one. But one may recline with him on the bed and eat with him at the table, but not from the same dish. However, he may eat from the same dish if he returns. Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: He may eat from the same dish if he returns it to the owner of the house."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ לֹא יֹאכַל עִמּוֹ מִן הָאֵבוּס שֶׁלִּפְנֵי הַפּוֹעֲלִים, וְלֹא יַעֲשֶׂה עִמּוֹ בָּאוּמָן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עוֹשֶׂה וְהוּא בָּרָחוֹק מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: One may neither eat with him from the large vessel before the laborers, nor may he work with him in row in a vineyard; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: He may work he is at a distance from him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One may not eat with him from the bread of the workers, and one may not engage in business with him, these are the words of Rabbi Meir. But the Sages say: He may engage in business while he is distant from him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּקָרוֹב לָא פְּלִיגִי דַּאֲסִיר. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּרִחוּק, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: גָּזְרִינַן רָחוֹק מִשּׁוּם קָרוֹב, דְּקָא מְרַפֵּי לֵהּ לְאַרְעָא קַמֵּיהּ. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: where proximate do not disagree that it is prohibited When they disagree, where distant Rabbi Meir holds: We issue a decree distant due to proximate as he loosens for him the earth before him. And the Rabbis hold: We do not issue a decree.
llm_translation: Gemara: When they argue about something close, they do not disagree that it is prohibited. When they argue about something far, Rabbi Meir holds: We decree a prohibition for something far because of something close, as it weakens the prohibition for it to stand on the ground. And the Rabbis hold: We do not decree a prohibition.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ לִפְנֵי שְׁבִיעִית — אֵינוֹ יוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל מִן הַנּוֹטוֹת. וּבַשְּׁבִיעִית — אֵינוֹ יוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא מִן הַנְּטִיעוֹת הַנּוֹטוֹת. נָדַר הֵימֶנּוּ מַאֲכָל, לִפְנֵי שְׁבִיעִית — יוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל מִן הַפֵּירוֹת, וּבַשְּׁבִיעִית — יוֹרֵד וְאוֹכֵל.
human_translation: one for whom benefit from another is forbidden, before, the Sabbatical Year, he may neither enter the field nor eat from produce that leans out of the field And during the Sabbatical Year, he may not enter his field; however, he may eat from the growths that lean one vowed before the Sabbatical Year from food he may enter his field; however, he may not eat of the produce. And during the Sabbatical Year, he may enter and may eat
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who takes a vow prohibiting benefit from his fellow before the seventh year may not enter his field, and may not eat from its fallen produce. But during the seventh year, he may not enter his field, yet he may eat from its growing produce. If one vows to abstain from eating produce, before the seventh year, he may enter his field but may not eat from the fruits. But during the seventh year, he may enter and eat.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: ״נְכָסִים אֵלּוּ עָלֶיךָ״ — לִפְנֵי שְׁבִיעִית אֵין יוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל מִן הַנּוֹטוֹת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִגִּיעַ שְׁבִיעִית. וְאִם בַּשְּׁבִיעִית נָדַר — אֵין יוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל מִן הַנּוֹטוֹת.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel who both say before the Sabbatical Year: this property to you, may neither enter his field, nor eat from that leans even though the Sabbatical Year arrived And if he vowed during the Sabbatical Year, he may not enter a field however, he may eat from leans
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav and Shmuel both said: " 'Assets' - these are upon you" - Before the seventh year, one does not descend into his field, and he does not eat from the produce, even though the seventh year has arrived. And if one makes a vow in the seventh year - he does not descend into his field, but he may eat from the produce.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ: ״נְכָסַי עָלֶיךָ״ — לִפְנֵי שְׁבִיעִית אֵין יוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ וְאֵין אוֹכֵל מִן הַנּוֹטוֹת, הִגִּיעַ שְׁבִיעִית — אֵינוֹ יוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ, אֲבָל אוֹכֵל הוּא אֶת הַנּוֹטוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish who both say before the Sabbatical Year: my property to you, may neither enter his field nor eat from leans the Sabbatical Year arrives, he may not enter his field; however, he may eat from leans
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish both said: "Your produce is upon you" - Before the seventh year, one does not descend into his field and does not eat from the fallen produce. When the seventh year arrives, he does not descend into his field, but he may eat the fallen produce.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבְרִי: אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁבִּרְשׁוּתוֹ אֲפִילּוּ לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא מֵרְשׁוּתוֹ. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סָבְרִי: אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁבִּרְשׁוּתוֹ לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא מֵרְשׁוּתוֹ.
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree about this, that Rav and Shmuel hold: A person render an item in his possession forbidden, even when it leaves his possession. And Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish hold: A person cannot render an item in his possession forbidden when it leaves his possession.
llm_translation: Let us say in this case where they disagree, for Rav and Shmuel hold: a person may prohibit an object within his domain even when it leaves his domain. And Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish hold: a person may not prohibit an object within his domain when it leaves his domain.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? מִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁבִּרְשׁוּתוֹ לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא מֵרָשׁוּתוֹ? אִם כֵּן, נִיפְלְגֵי בִּ״נְכָסִים אֵלּוּ״, וְכׇל שֶׁכֵּן בִּ״נְכָסַי״!
human_translation: And you understand Is there anyone who says a person cannot render an item in his possession forbidden when it leaves his possession? If so, let them disagree in this property and all the more so my property
llm_translation: And was it created? Is there anyone who holds that a person does not prohibit an object within his domain when it exits his domain? If so, they should argue regarding these "assets," all the more so regarding "my assets"!

hebrew_text: וְתוּ, הָא תְּנַן דְּאָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁבִּרְשׁוּתוֹ לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא מֵרְשׁוּתוֹ, דִּתְנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לִבְנוֹ ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאַתָּה נֶהֱנֶה לִי״, מֵת — יִירָשֶׁנּוּ. ״בְּחַיָּיו וּבְמוֹתוֹ״,
human_translation: And furthermore, didn’t we learn that a person render an item in his possession forbidden when it leaves his possession? as we learned one who says to his son: Benefit from my konam for you, dies, will inherit him. during his lifetime and upon his death,
llm_translation: And come, this is what we learned in a Mishnah: If a person prohibits something that is within his domain, when he exits his domain, as we learned: One who says to his son, "Your earnings are mine," and he dies - he shall inherit him. "In his life and in his death,"

hebrew_text: אִם מֵת — לֹא יִירָשֶׁנּוּ! שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דְּקָא אָמַר לֵיהּ ״בְּחַיָּיו וּבְמוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: if dies, does not inherit him. is different here, as he said to him During his lifetime and upon his death.
llm_translation: If he dies - he shall not inherit! This is different from here where it says to him, "In his life and in his death."

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם קַשְׁיָא? אֶלָּא: בִּ״נְכָסִים אֵלּוּ״ — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּ״נְכָסַי״.
human_translation: in any case difficult: Rather, In this property everyone agrees When they disagree, in my property
llm_translation: From all places is the question difficult? Rather, in regard to "these assets" - everyone agrees. For they disagree regarding "assets."

hebrew_text: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל סָבְרִי: לָא שְׁנָא ״נְכָסִים אֵלּוּ״, לָא שְׁנָא ״נְכָסַי״, אָדָם אוֹסֵר. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ סָבְרִי: ״נְכָסִים״ — אָדָם אוֹסֵר, ״נְכָסַי״ — אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel hold: is no different This property, is no different My property; a person renders forbidden And Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish hold: Property, a person renders forbidden My property, a person does not render forbidden
llm_translation: Rav and Shmuel hold: "Nechasim" - a person prohibits, "Nechasay" - a person does not prohibit. And Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish hold: "Nechasim" - a person prohibits, "Nechasay" - a person does not prohibit.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָא שְׁנָא ״נְכָסִים אֵלּוּ״ וְלָא שְׁנָא ״נְכָסַי״? וְהָא תְּנַן: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״קֻוֽנָּם לְתוֹךְ בֵּיתְךָ שֶׁאֲנִי נִכְנָס״, ״שָׂדְךָ שֶׁאֲנִי לוֹקֵחַ״, מֵת אוֹ שֶׁמְּכָרוֹ לְאַחֵר — מוּתָּר. ״לְבַיִת זֶה שֶׁאֲנִי נִכְנָס״, ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁאֲנִי לוֹקֵחַ״, מֵת אוֹ שֶׁמְּכָרוֹ לְאַחֵר — אָסוּר.
human_translation: And is there anyone who says is no different This property, and is no different My property, But didn’t we learn If one says to another: Entering into your house is konam for me, Buying your field is konam for me, died or sold to another, permitted Entering this house for me, Buying this field for me, died or sold to another, forbidden.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And is there a difference for the one who said "nechasim elu" and not "nechasay"? But we learned: If one says to his friend, "I am entering your vessels into your house," "I am taking your field," and he dies or sells it to another - it is permitted. "I am entering this house," "I am taking this field," and he dies or sells it to another - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כִּי אָמְרִי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, בִּ״נְכָסַי״. וְרַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, בִּ״נְכָסִים אֵלּוּ״, וְלָא פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: Rather, When Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish said in My property. And Rav and Shmuel in This property. And they do not disagree,
llm_translation: Rather: when Rabbi Yohanan and Reish Lakish said, "with 'n'kasai'." And Rav and Shmuel, with "n'kasim these," and they do not disagree.

hebrew_text: וּבַשְּׁבִיעִית אֵין יוֹרֵד לְתוֹךְ שָׂדֵהוּ כּוּ׳. מַאי שְׁנָא דְּאוֹכֵל מִן הַנּוֹטוֹת — דְּפֵירֵי דְהֶפְקֵירָא אִינּוּן, אַרְעָא נָמֵי אַפְקְרַהּ?!
human_translation: And during the Sabbatical Year he may not enter his field; What is different that he eat of due to that the produce is ownerless. land as well, rendered it ownerless,
llm_translation: In the seventh year, one does not descend into his field, etc. What is the difference with regards to eating from the fallen produce? For the fruits of hefker are they not considered ownerless, so why is there a prohibition?

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: בְּעוֹמְדִין אִילָנוֹת עַל הַגְּבוּלִים. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְיָקִים אָמַר: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יִשְׁהֶא בַּעֲמִידָה.
human_translation: Ulla said: where trees are standing on the borders Rabbi Shimon ben Elyakim said: decree lest he remain standing
llm_translation: Ulla said: "When trees are standing on the borders." Rabbi Shimon ben Eliezer said: "A decree lest one come to carry out standing."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא יַשְׁאִילֶנּוּ וְלֹא יִשְׁאַל מִמֶּנּוּ, לֹא יַלְוֶנּוּ וְלֹא יִלְוֶה מִמֶּנּוּ, וְלֹא יִמְכּוֹר לוֹ וְלֹא יִקַּח מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: one for whom benefit from another is forbidden by vow, may neither lend to him nor borrow from him. he may neither lend to him nor borrow from him. And he may neither sell to him nor purchase from him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who has taken a vow to derive no benefit from his fellow - he may not lend to him, nor borrow from him; he may not give to him as a gift, nor receive from him as a gift; he may not sell to him, nor buy from him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא לֹא יַלְוֶנּוּ — דְּקָא מַהֲנֵי לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא לָא יִלְוֶה הֵימֶנּוּ, מַאי קָא מַהֲנֵי לֵיהּ? וּבִשְׁלָמָא לֹא יִלְוֶה הֵימֶנּוּ וְלֹא יִקַּח הֵימֶנּוּ — דְּקָמִיתְהֲנֵי מִינֵּיהּ, אֶלָּא לֹא יִשְׁאַל הֵימֶנּוּ, מַאי קָא מִיתְהֲנֵי מִינֵּיהּ!
human_translation: Granted may not lend to as he benefits him. However, may not borrow from what does he benefit him And granted he may neither borrow from him nor purchase from him, as one benefits However, may not borrow from what does benefit from him?
llm_translation: Gemara: "If one does not lend to Shlama, it benefits him. Rather, he should not lend to him. What benefit does he get? And if one does not lend to Shlama and does not take from him, it benefits him, for he distances himself from him. Rather, he should not ask from him. What benefit does he get?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁנָּדְרוּ הֲנָאָה זֶה מִזֶּה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: גְּזֵירָה לִשְׁאוֹל מִשּׁוּם לְהַשְׁאִיל, וְכֵן בְּכוּלְּהוּ גְּזֵירָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: where they vowed benefit from each other Abaye said: a decree to borrow due to to lend And likewise, in all decree,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: For example, when they vowed benefit from one another. Abbaye said: It is a decree to lend because of borrowing, and so too in all cases it is a decree.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמַר לוֹ: ״הַשְׁאִילֵנִי פָּרָתְךָ״. אָמַר לוֹ: אֵינָהּ פְּנוּיָה. אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם שָׂדִי שֶׁאֲנִי חוֹרֵשׁ בָּהּ לְעוֹלָם״. אִם הָיָה דַּרְכּוֹ לַחְרוֹשׁ — הוּא אָסוּר, וְכׇל אָדָם מוּתָּרִים. וְאִם אֵין דַּרְכּוֹ לַחְרוֹשׁ — הוּא וְכׇל אָדָם אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: One said to Lend me your cow. said to him: is not available. Plowing my field with is konam forever. If it was his manner to plow prohibited him but permitted every person. If it is not his manner to plow prohibited him and every person
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He said to him, "Lend me your cow." He said to him, "It is not available." He said, "I will establish a fence around my field that I plow in it forever." If his way is to plow, he is forbidden, but all other people are permitted. And if his way is not to plow, he and all other people are forbidden.

hebrew_text: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל, הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל הַחֶנְוָנִי וְאוֹמֵר: אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי נוֹדֵר מִמֶּנִּי הֲנָאָה וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מַה אֶעֱשֶׂה. וְהוּא נוֹתֵן לוֹ, וּבָא וְנוֹטֵל מִזֶּה.
human_translation: one for whom benefit from another is forbidden by vow and does not have anything to eat, goes to the shopkeeper and says So-and-so vowed that benefit from me is forbidden and I do not know what I will do. gives to and comes and takes from that
llm_translation: The one who is vowed to abstain from benefit from his fellow, and he has nothing to eat, he goes to the Chanvani and says: "So-and-so has vowed benefit from me, and I do not know what I shall do." And he gives him, and he comes and takes from this.

hebrew_text: הָיָה בֵּיתוֹ לִבְנוֹת, גְּדֵרוֹ לִגְדּוֹר, שָׂדֵהוּ לִקְצוֹר, הוֹלֵךְ אֵצֶל הַפּוֹעֲלִים וְאוֹמֵר: אִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי מוּדָּר מִמֶּנִּי הֲנָאָה וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ מַה אֶעֱשֶׂה. וְהֵן עוֹשִׂין עִמּוֹ, וּבָאִין וְנוֹטְלִין שָׂכָר מִזֶּה.
human_translation: house was to be built, his fence to be erected, his field to be harvested, goes to the laborers and says Benefit from me is forbidden by vow to so-and-so and I do not know what I will do. And perform with him, and come and take payment from that
llm_translation: His house to build, his fence to fence, his field to harvest, he goes to the workers and says: "So-and-so is pledged from me benefit and I do not know what I shall do." And they work with him, and they come and take payment from this.

hebrew_text: הָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ וְאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל, נוֹתֵן לְאֶחָד לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה, וְהַלָּה מוּתָּר בָּהּ. אִם אֵין עִמָּהֶם אַחֵר — מַנִּיחַ עַל הַסֶּלַע אוֹ עַל הַגָּדֵר וְאוֹמֵר: הֲרֵי הֵן מוּפְקָרִים לְכׇל מִי שֶׁיַּחְפּוֹץ, וְהַלָּה נוֹטֵל וְאוֹכֵל. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: If were traveling along the road and does not have anything to eat, gives to one as a gift, and permitted that If there is no other with them, places on the rock or on the fence and says: These are hereby rendered ownerless to anyone who wants that takes and eats Rabbi Yosei prohibits
llm_translation: They were walking on the road and he has nothing to eat, he gives to one as a gift, and the other is permitted to it. If there is no other with them, he leaves it on the rock or on the fence and says: Behold, they are ownerless to anyone who desires, and the other takes and eats. And Rabbi Yosei prohibits.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי? קָסָבַר: הֶפְקֵר כְּמַתָּנָה. מָה מַתָּנָה — עַד דְּאָתְיָא מֵרְשׁוּת נוֹתֵן לִרְשׁוּת מְקַבֵּל, אַף הֶפְקֵר — עַד דְּאָתְיָא לִרְשׁוּת זוֹכֶה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yosei? He holds ownerless like a gift. Just as a gift until comes from the possession of one gives into the possession of one receives so too, ownerless until comes into the possession of one acquires
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara, Rabbi Yochanan said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei? He holds: Hefker is like a gift. Just as a gift — until it comes from the possession of the giver to the possession of the recipient, so too hefker — until it comes to the possession, one acquires."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי אַבָּא: וְהַלָּה נוֹטֵל וְאוֹכֵל, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁנִּדְרוֹ קוֹדֵם לְהֶפְקֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raises an objection And that takes and eats and Rabbi Yosei prohibits Rabbi Yosei said: When When his vow predates his ownerless.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rabbi Abba asked a question: And the Halah takes and eats, and Rabbi Yosei prohibits. Rabbi Yosei said: When? — When his vow preceded his renunciation.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל אִם הָיָה הֶפְקֵירוֹ קוֹדֵם לְנִדְרוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ עַד דְּאָתֵי לִרְשׁוּת זוֹכֶה, מָה לִי נִדְרוֹ קוֹדֵם לְהֶפְקֵירוֹ, מָה לִי הֶפְקֵירוֹ קוֹדֵם לְנִדְרוֹ?
human_translation: However, if his declaration ownerless predates his vow, permitted And if you say until it comes into the possession of the one acquires what is for me his vow predates his declaration ownerless, what is for me his declaration ownerless predates his vow?
llm_translation: But if he declared it hefker before his vow - behold, this is permitted. And if you say until he acquires it, what do I need his vow before hefker, what do I need hefker before his vow?

hebrew_text: הוּא מוֹתֵיב לַהּ וְהוּא מְשַׁנֵּי לַהּ: כׇּל הַנּוֹדֵר אֵין דַּעְתּוֹ עַל מַה שֶּׁהִפְקִיר.
human_translation: raised the objection and he answered The intent of anyone who vows is not to that he rendered ownerless.
llm_translation: He sets before her and he repeats to her: Anyone who vows, his mind is not on what he has renounced.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָבָא: מִקְצָתָן לָרִאשׁוֹן וְכוּלָּן לַשֵּׁנִי — רִאשׁוֹן קָנָה,
human_translation: Rava raised an objection: A portion of to the first and all of to the second first acquired
llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: Some of them to the first and all of them to the second - the first acquires.

hebrew_text: שֵׁנִי לֹא קָנָה!
human_translation: second did not acquire
llm_translation: Second one did not acquire!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם מַתְּנַת בֵּית חוֹרוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this is the reason of Rabbi Yosei: decree due to the gift of Beit Ḥoron.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said, this is the reason of Rabbi Yosei: a decree due to the gift of the House of Horon.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: הַמַּפְקִיר אֶת שָׂדֵהוּ, כׇּל שְׁלֹשָׁה יָמִים — יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — אֵין יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught one who declares his field ownerless, entire three days he is able to retract From this forward, he is unable to retract
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who abandons his field, for three days — he may retract, from here on — he may not retract.

hebrew_text: אָמַר ״תְּהֵא שָׂדֶה זוֹ מוּפְקֶרֶת לְיוֹם אֶחָד״, ״לְשַׁבָּת אַחַת״, ״לְחֹדֶשׁ אֶחָד״, ״לְשָׁנָה אַחַת״, ״לְשָׁבוּעַ אֶחָת״ — עַד שֶׁלֹּא זָכָה בָּהּ, בֵּין הוּא בֵּין אַחֵר יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ. מִשֶּׁזָּכָה בָּהּ — בֵּין הוּא בֵּין אַחֵר, אֵין יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ. רֵישָׁא רַבָּנַן, סֵיפָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: one said: This field will be ownerless for one day, for one week, for one month, for one year, for one as long as no one took possession of neither nor another he is able to retract Once one took possession whether he whether another he is unable to retract the first clause the Rabbis, the latter clause Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: He said, "Let this field be ownerless for one day," "for one Sabbath," "for one month," "for one year," "for one week" - until he did not acquire it, he and another can retract. Once he acquires it - he and another cannot retract. The first part is the view of the Rabbis, the latter part is the view of Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: סֵיפָא נָמֵי רַבָּנַן הִיא. אִי הָכִי, אַמַּאי עַד שֶׁלֹּא זָכָה בָּהּ בֵּין הוּא בֵּין אַחֵר, יָכוֹל לַחֲזוֹר בּוֹ? שָׁאנֵי שָׁנָה וְשָׁבוּעַ דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי.
human_translation: Ulla said: The latter clause is also the Rabbis. If so, why As long as one did not take possession of neither nor another he is able to retract is different a year or a seven-year as uncommon.
llm_translation: Ula said: The latter part is also the statement of the Rabbis. If so, why can one retract until he has not acquired it, whether he or another? It is different because it is a rare occurrence of a year and a week.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִדְּסֵיפָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. וְרֵישָׁא, הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא — דְּלָא לִישְׁתַּכַּח תּוֹרַת הֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: From that the latter clause Rabbi Yosei, the first clause is also Rabbi Yosei. And the first clause, this is the reason that the status of ownerlessness not be forgotten.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: From the conclusion, Rabbi Yosei; the beginning, Rabbi Yosei. And the beginning, that is the reason — that the Torah of hefker should not be found.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ מִיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן נָמֵי לֶיהֱוֵי הֶפְקֵר! אָמַר רַבָּה: מִפְּנֵי הָרַמָּאִין, דְּמַפְקִירִין וְהָדְרִין בְּהוֹן.
human_translation: If so, let is ownerless even from the first day as well Rabba said: is due to the swindlers, who declare ownerless and retract
llm_translation: So it is, even from the first day it should be considered ownerless! Rabah said: Because of the deceitful people, who abandon and then return to claim ownership.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא לָא הָוֵי הֶפְקֵר?
human_translation: However, by Torah law, isn’t ownerless
llm_translation: But from the Torah, it is not considered ownerless?

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא אָתֵי לְעַשּׂוֹרֵי מִן הַחִיּוּב עַל הַפְּטוּר וּמִן הַפְּטוּר עַל הַחִיּוּב.
human_translation: And perhaps he come to tithe from requires for exempt and from exempt for requires
llm_translation: Perhaps one comes to exempt from the obligation upon the obligated and from the exemption upon the obligated.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ: כִּי מְעַשְּׂרַתְּ — עַשַּׂר מִינֵּיהּ וּבֵיהּ.
human_translation: because we say to When you tithe, tithe from itself.
llm_translation: We say to him: "When you tithe - tithe from it and with it."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַמַּפְקִיר אֶת כַּרְמוֹ, וְלַשַּׁחַר עָמַד וּבְצָרוֹ — חַיָּיב בְּפֶרֶט וּבְעוֹלֵלוֹת וּבְשִׁכְחָה וּבְפֵיאָה. וּפָטוּר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: raises an objection One who declares his vineyard ownerless, and at dawn he arose and picked grapes is obligated in individual fallen [ peret ], and in incompletely formed clusters [ olelot ], and in forgotten and in pe’a , And he is exempt from the tithe
llm_translation: Challenger: One who abandons his vineyard, and at dawn stands and prunes it - is liable for Pe'ah, Leket, Shikhechah, and Olelot. And he is exempt from Ma'aser.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְעוּלָּא, דְּרַבָּנַן קָתָנֵי לַהּ וּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא קָתָנֵי לַהּ. אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, אַמַּאי פָּטוּר מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר?
human_translation: Granted, according to Ulla, that the Rabbis taught and that taught in accordance with Torah law. However, according to Reish Lakish, why is he exempt from the tithe?
llm_translation: In truth, regarding Ulla, the Rabbis teach it and regarding the Torah they teach it. Rather, regarding Reish Lakish, why is he exempt from tithing?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ: כִּי אֲמַרִי אֲנָא — לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הָא — רַבָּנַן הִיא.
human_translation: said to you: when I said in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, this the Rabbis,
llm_translation: He said to you: "When I said 'I am' - it is to Rabbi Yosei, this is the teaching of the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא דְּאַפְקְרֵיהּ בְּאַנְפֵּי תְרֵין, וְהָא דְּאַפְקְרֵיהּ בְּאַפֵּי תְלָתָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: כׇּל הַמַּפְקִיר בִּפְנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה — הָוֵי הֶפְקֵר, בִּפְנֵי שְׁנַיִם — לָא הָוֵי הֶפְקֵר.
human_translation: If you wish, say That where before two and this where before three As Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: anyone who declares ownerless before three is ownerless; before two it is not ownerless.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: This one who entrusted it in the presence of two, and this one who entrusted it in the presence of three. For Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: Anyone who makes something ownerless before three - it is considered ownerless, but before two - it is not considered ownerless.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר: דְּבַר תּוֹרָה אֲפִילּוּ בְּאֶחָד — הָוֵי הֶפְקֵר, וּמַה טַּעַם אָמְרוּ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא אֶחָד זוֹכֶה וּשְׁנַיִם מְעִידִין.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: By Torah law, even with one is ownerless, and what reason said with three so that one will take possession and two testify
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: A matter of Torah, even with one - be declared ownerless. And why did they say it with three? In order that one should merit and two should testify.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ אֵין בֵּין הַמּוּדָּר
llm_translation: We will return to you, there is no difference between the one who was designated.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוּתָּפִין שֶׁנָּדְרוּ הֲנָאָה זֶה מִזֶּה — אֲסוּרִין לִיכָּנֵס לֶחָצֵר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: זֶה נִכְנָס לְתוֹךְ שֶׁלּוֹ, וְזֶה נִכְנָס לְתוֹךְ שֶׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: Partners who vowed benefit from one another are prohibited from entering into a courtyard Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: this one enters into his own and that one enters into his own
llm_translation: The partners who took an oath, one from the other — forbidden to enter the courtyard. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: This one enters into his, and this one enters into his.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִים לְהַעֲמִיד רֵיחַיִם וְתַנּוּר וּלְגַדֵּל תַּרְנְגוֹלִים.
human_translation: And they are both prohibited from setting up a mill or an oven or to raise chickens
llm_translation: And both of them are forbidden to set up spices and an oven and to raise chickens.

hebrew_text: הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶם מוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא יִכָּנֵס לֶחָצֵר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר, יָכוֹל הוּא לוֹמַר לוֹ: לְתוֹךְ שֶׁלִּי אֲנִי נִכְנָס, וְאֵינִי נִכְנָס לְתוֹךְ שֶׁלְּךָ. וְכוֹפִין אֶת הַנּוֹדֵר לִמְכּוֹר אֶת חֶלְקוֹ.
human_translation: one of the was prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from the other, he may not enter the courtyard. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: He can say to I am entering into my own and I am not entering into your And forces the one who took a vow to sell his portion
llm_translation: One of them was vowed benefit from his fellow - he may not enter the courtyard. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, he can say to him: "I enter into what is mine, and I do not enter into what is yours." And they force the one who made the vow to sell his share.

hebrew_text: הָיָה אֶחָד מִן הַשּׁוּק מוּדָּר בְּאֶחָד מֵהֶם הֲנָאָה — לֹא יִכָּנֵס לֶחָצֵר. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר, יָכוֹל לוֹמַר לוֹ: לְתוֹךְ שֶׁל חֲבֵירְךָ אֲנִי נִכְנָס, וְאֵינִי נִכְנָס לְתוֹךְ שֶׁלְּךָ.
human_translation: someone from the marketplace is prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from one of the he may not enter a courtyard Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: He can say to him: I am entering into the of another and I am not entering your
llm_translation: One who was prohibited from entering one of themarketplaces due to deriving benefit from one of them - he may not enter the courtyard. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, he can say to him: "I am entering into your friend's domain, but I am not entering into yours."

hebrew_text: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְיֵשׁ לוֹ מֶרְחָץ וּבֵית הַבַּד מוּשְׂכָּרִין בָּעִיר, אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ בָּהֶן תְּפִיסַת יָד — אָסוּר, אֵין לוֹ בָּהֶן תְּפִיסַת יָד — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: one prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from another and he has a bathhouse or an olive press in the city that is leased out if has a right usage in forbidden he has no right of usage in the permitted.
llm_translation: The pledged item of pleasure from his fellow, and he has a bathhouse and a public bathhouse rented in the city, if he has a handhold in them - forbidden, if he does not have a handhold in them - permitted.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ: ״קֻוֽנָּם לְבֵיתְךָ שֶׁאֲנִי נִכְנָס, וְשָׂדְךָ שֶׁאֲנִי לוֹקֵחַ״, מֵת אוֹ שֶׁמְּכָרוֹ לְאַחֵר — מוּתָּר. ״קֻוֽנָּם בַּיִת זֶה שֶׁאֲנִי נִכְנָס״, ״שָׂדֶה זוֹ שֶׁאֲנִי לוֹקֵחַ״, מֵת אוֹ שֶׁמְּכָרוֹ לְאַחֵר — אָסוּר.
human_translation: who says to another: Entering your house is konam for me, or: Purchasing your field for me, he, dies or sells to another, permitted Entering this house is konam for me, Purchasing this field for me, dies or sells it to another, forbidden.
llm_translation: One who says to his fellow: "I am entering your house's corner, and I am taking your field," if he dies or if he sells it to another - it is permitted. "I am entering this house," "I am taking this field," if he dies or if he sells it to another - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: בְּנָדְרוּ פְּלִיגִי, הִדִּירוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן: בְּנָדְרוּ הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי, אֲבָל בְּהִדִּירוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה — מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב דְּכִי אֲנוּסִין דָּמוּ. אוֹ דִילְמָא: אֲפִילּוּ בְּהִדִּירוּ זֶה אֶת זֶה פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before disagree where vowed vowed to prohibit one another what Do we say that they disagree where each vowed but where they vowed to prohibit one another the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as they are considered to be due to circumstances beyond their control? Or perhaps the Rabbis disagree even in each vowed to prohibit one another
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question: In the case of a vow they argue, what is the difference between when they vowed and consecrated each other? Do we say: It is in the case of a vow that they argue, but in the case of consecrating each other — the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov because they were coerced. Or perhaps, even in the case of consecrating each other, do the Rabbis argue?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיָה אֶחָד מֵהֶן מוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, וּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן! תָּנֵי: נָדוּר מֵחֲבֵירוֹ הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: Come hear one of the was prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from the other, and the Rabbis disagree Teach had vowed to prohibit himself benefit from another.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One of them was vowed to derive benefit from his fellow, and the sages disputed! It was taught: Vowed to derive benefit from his fellow.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: וְכוֹפִין אֶת הַנּוֹדֵר לִמְכּוֹר אֶת חֶלְקוֹ. אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא דִּנְדַר הוּא, הַיְינוּ דְּקָתָנֵי כּוֹפִין. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ דְּאַדְּרֵיהּ, אַמַּאי כּוֹפִין אוֹתוֹ? הָא מֵינָס אֲנִיס?
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as it was taught in the latter clause And forces the one who took a vow to sell his portion. Granted, if you say he vowed this is that which teaches forces But if you say that where the other prohibited him with a vow, why does force him He is put in a situation beyond his control.
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: for it is taught in the latter clause: "And they compel the one who made a vow to sell his portion." If you say it is referring to a vow, that is why it is taught "they compel." But if you say he is annulling it, why do they compel him? Perhaps he is being coerced?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה אָמַר זְעֵירִי:
human_translation: Rabba said Ze’eiri said:
llm_translation: Rabba said, Zeiri said:

hebrew_text: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ כְּדֵי חֲלוּקָּה. אֲבָל אֵין בָּהּ כְּדֵי חֲלוּקָּה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מוּתָּר.
human_translation: dispute where there is sufficient in divided But there is not sufficient in it divided, everyone agrees permitted
llm_translation: Disagreement that has in it the amount for disagreement. But it does not have in it the amount for disagreement - the words of everyone are permitted.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: הֲרֵי בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת, דִּכְמִי שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ כְּדֵי חֲלוּקָּה דָּמֵי, וּתְנַן: שְׁנֵיהֶן אֲסוּרִין בְּדָבָר שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר!
human_translation: Rav Yosef said to A synagogue considered like there is not sufficient in it divided, and we learned in both are prohibited from an entity belonging to that city
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yosef: "Behold, a synagogue, which is like it does not have the value of a division of blood, and we learned: both of them are prohibited in the matter of that city!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, אָמַר זְעֵירִי: מַחְלוֹקֶת שֶׁאֵין בָּהּ כְּדֵי חֲלוּקָּה, אֲבָל יֵשׁ בָּהּ כְּדֵי חֲלוּקָּה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: Ze’eiri said: dispute where there is not sufficient in divided, but there is sufficient in it divided, everyone agrees that forbidden,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said, Zeiri said: A dispute that does not have the potential for resolution, but if it does have the potential for resolution - everyone agrees it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. And so too, Rabbi Elazar said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. And so said Rabbi Elazar: The halakha is according to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְיֵשׁ לוֹ שָׁם מֶרְחָץ וְכוּ׳. וְכַמָּה תְּפִיסַת יָד? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: לְמֶחֱצָה לִשְׁלִישׁ וְלִרְבִיעַ. אֲבָל בִּבְצִיר — לָא. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּבְצִיר — אָסוּר. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי דִּשְׁרֵי — דִּמְקַבֵּל בְּטַסְקָא.
human_translation: one prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from another and he has a bathhouse And how much right usage Rav Naḥman said: one half, one-third, or one-quarter But in less, not Abaye said: Even in less, forbidden. what are the circumstances in which permitted Where he receives an annual rental fee [ taska ]
llm_translation: The pledged object of pleasure from his fellow, and he has there a bathhouse, etc. And how much is a handbreadth? Rav Nachman said: Half, a third, and a quarter.
