But in a vineyard - no. Abbaye said: Even in a vineyard - prohibited. How is it different when it is permitted? Because he receives it with a coin purse.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ וְכוּ׳. בָּעֵי אֲבִימִי: ״קֻוֽנָּם לְבַיִת זֶה שֶׁאַתָּה נִכְנָס״, מֵת אוֹ שֶׁמְּכָרוֹ לְאַחֵר, מַהוּ? אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁבִּרְשׁוּתוֹ לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא מֵרְשׁוּתוֹ, אוֹ לָא?
human_translation: who says to another: Avimi raises a dilemma: Entering this house is konam for you, he died or sold it to another, what is a person render an item in his possession forbidden for after it will leave his possession, or not?
llm_translation: The one who says to his fellow, etc. The Gemara asks: "If he said to him, 'Establish for me a claim to this house that you are entering,' and then he dies or sells it to another, what is the law? Does a person establish a claim to something that is in his possession when he leaves his possession, or not?"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: הָאוֹמֵר לִבְנוֹ ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאִי אַתָּה נֶהֱנֶה לִי״, וּמֵת — יִירָשֶׁנּוּ. ״בְּחַיָּיו וּבְמוֹתוֹ״, וּמֵת — לֹא יִירָשֶׁנּוּ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁבִּרְשׁוּתוֹ לִכְשֶׁיֵּצֵא מֵרְשׁוּתוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear one says to his son: Benefiting from me is konam for you, and dies, inherits him. in his lifetime and after his death, and dies, does not inherit him. Conclude from a person render an item in his possession forbidden for after it will leave his possession. Conclude from
llm_translation: Rava said, come and hear: One who says to his son, "Your inheritance that you will not benefit from me," and then dies - he shall inherit him. "In his lifetime and in his death," and then dies - he shall not inherit him. Learn from this, a person can prohibit something that is in his possession when he exits his possession. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: ״קֻוֽנָּם פֵּירוֹת הָאֵלּוּ עָלַי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן עַל פִּי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן לְפִי״ — אָסוּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן.
human_translation: We learned there This produce is konam upon me, It is konam upon my mouth, It is konam for my mouth, prohibited its replacements, and grows from it
llm_translation: We learned there: "Their fruits are upon me," "They are according to the mouth," "They are according to the mouth" - it is prohibited in their twisting and in their enlarging.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: אָמַר ״קֻוֽנָּם פֵּירוֹת הָאֵלּוּ עַל פְּלוֹנִי״, מַהוּ בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן? מִי אָמְרִינַן גַּבֵּי דִילֵיהּ, הוֹאִיל וְאָדָם אוֹסֵר פֵּירוֹת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל עַצְמוֹ, אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָא לְעוֹלָם עַל עַצְמוֹ. גַּבֵּי חֲבֵירוֹ, הוֹאִיל וְאֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר פֵּירוֹת חֲבֵירוֹ עַל חֲבֵירוֹ, אֵין אָדָם אוֹסֵר דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא בָא לְעוֹלָם עַל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: said: This produce is konam for so-and-so, what is with regard to their replacements? Do we say: With regard to himself, since a person can render another’s produce forbidden for himself, a person can render an entity that has not come into the world forbidden to himself? with regard to another, since a person cannot render another’s produce forbidden to another, one cannot render an entity that has not come into the world forbidden to another.
llm_translation: Ba'ei Ramei bar Ḥama asked: He said, "These fruits belong to so-and-so," what is the law regarding their exchange? Who said we can discuss his own? Since a person may forbid his friend's fruits upon himself, a person may forbid something that does not come into the world upon himself. Regarding his friend, since a person does not forbid his friend's fruits upon his friend, a person does not forbid something that does not come into the world upon his friend.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּחִילּוּפִין כְּגִידּוּלִין דָּמֵי, לָא שְׁנָא הוּא וְלָא שְׁנָא חֲבֵרוֹ.
human_translation: Or perhaps due to that replacements like that which grows is no different him and is no different another.
llm_translation: Perhaps because of the concern that they are similar to the sinews, it does not matter whether it is this one or that one.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי, תָּא שְׁמַע: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי נֶהֱנֶה לִיךְ״, לוֹוָה וּבַעְלֵי חוֹבִין בָּאִין וְנִפְרָעִין. מַאי טַעְמָא בַּעְלֵי חוֹבִין נִפְרָעִין — לָאו מִשּׁוּם דְּחִילּוּפִין לָאו כְּגִידּוּלִין דָּמֵי?
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Minyumi said: Come hear one who says to his wife: Benefiting from me is konam for you, she may borrow and the creditors can come and collect What is the reason the creditors can collect Is it not because that replacements, are not like that which grows
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Minyomei said, come and hear: One who says to his wife, "I am benefiting you with this item," lenders and creditors come and collect. What is the reason that creditors collect - is it not because they are considered like large debts?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דִּילְמָא לְכַתְּחִילָּה הוּא דְּלָא, וְאִי עֲבַד — עֲבַד.
human_translation: Rava said: Perhaps it is that one should not ab initio , but if one did done
llm_translation: Rava said: Perhaps initially it is not so, but if he did it, he did it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, תָּא שְׁמַע: הַמְקַדֵּשׁ בְּעׇרְלָה — אֵינָהּ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. מְכָרָן וְקִידֵּשׁ בִּדְמֵיהֶן — הֲרֵי זוֹ מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת. הָכָא נָמֵי: לְכַתְּחִילָּה הוּא דְּלָא, וְאִי עֲבַד — עֲבַד.
human_translation: Rather, come hear one who betroths with orla , she is not betrothed he sold them and betrothed her with the money she is betrothed. Here also, one should not ab initio , but if one did done
llm_translation: Rather, come and hear: One who sanctifies with uncircumcision - it is not sanctified. If one sells them and sanctifies with their value - this is sanctified. Here too: Ideally, he should not, but if he did - he did.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״הֲרֵינִי עָלֶיךָ חֵרֶם״ — הַמּוּדָּר אָסוּר. ״הֲרֵי אַתְּ עָלַי חֵרֶם״ — הַנּוֹדֵר אָסוּר. ״הֲרֵינִי עָלֶיךָ וְאַתְּ עָלַי״ — שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲסוּרִין, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מוּתָּרִין בְּדָבָר שֶׁל עוֹלֵי בָּבֶל,
human_translation: I am hereby to you dedicated the one prohibited by vow is prohibited You are hereby to me dedicated the one who took the vow is prohibited I am hereby to you and you are to me both are prohibited But permitted for both of them from objects belonging to those who ascended from Babylonia,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Behold, I am upon you a ban" - one who is designated is prohibited. "Behold, you are upon me a ban" - one who vows is prohibited. "Behold, I am upon you and you are upon me" - both are prohibited, and both are permitted in matters of Babylonian oaths.

hebrew_text: וַאֲסוּרִים בְּדָבָר שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר. וְאֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁל עוֹלֵי בָּבֶל — כְּגוֹן הַר הַבַּיִת, וְהָעֲזָרוֹת, וְהַבּוֹר שֶׁבְּאֶמְצַע הַדֶּרֶךְ. וְאֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁל אוֹתָהּ הָעִיר — כְּגוֹן הָרְחָבָה, וְהַמֶּרְחָץ, וּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְהַתֵּיבָה, וְהַסְּפָרִים. וְהַכּוֹתֵב חֶלְקוֹ לַנָּשִׂיא.
human_translation: But it is prohibited from objects of that city, And what are objects belonging to those who ascended from Babylonia? For example, the Temple Mount, and the Courtyards, and the cistern in the middle of the road. And what are objects of that city? For example, the square, and the bathhouse, and the synagogue, and the ark and the scrolls. And one who writes, his portion to the Nasi .
llm_translation: And forbidden in a matter of that city. And what is a matter of the Babylonians - such as the Temple Mount, the Temple courtyards, and the well in the middle of the road. And what is a matter of that city - such as the public square, the bathhouse, the synagogue, the ark, and the books. And one who writes his portion to the prince.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד כּוֹתֵב לַנָּשִׂיא, וְאֶחָד כּוֹתֵב לַהֶדְיוֹט. מָה בֵּין כּוֹתֵב לַנָּשִׂיא לַכּוֹתֵב לַהֶדְיוֹט? שֶׁהַכּוֹתֵב לַנָּשִׂיא אֵין צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת, לַהֶדְיוֹט צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה צְרִיכִין לְזַכּוֹת, לֹא דִּבְּרוּ בְּנָשִׂיא אֶלָּא בַּהֹוֶה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין אַנְשֵׁי גָלִיל צְרִיכִין לִכְתּוֹב, שֶׁכְּבָר כָּתְבוּ אֲבוֹתֵיהֶן עַל יְדֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: both writes to the Nasi and one writes to a common person. What between writes to the Nasi and writes to a common person? That one who writes to the Nasi need not confer possession to a common person must confer possession And the Rabbis say: Both this and that must confer possession, they mentioned the Nasi only in the present, Rabbi Yehuda says: The people of Galilee do not have to write because their fathers already wrote for them,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One writes to the prince, and one writes to the commoner. What is the difference between one who writes to the prince and one who writes to the commoner? The one who writes to the prince does not need to be precise, but the one who writes to the commoner needs to be precise. And the sages say: Both this one and that one need to be precise, they only spoke about the prince in a hypothetical case. Rabbi Yehuda says: The people of the Galilee do not need to write, for their forefathers already wrote on their behalf.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַמַּאי מִיתְּסַר? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: וּמָה תַּקָּנָתָן — יִכְתְּבוּ חֶלְקָן לַנָּשִׂיא.
human_translation: Why is it forbidden? Rav Sheshet said: This is what is teaching: And what is their remedy, They should write their portion to the Nasi ,
llm_translation: Gemara: Why is it forbidden? Rav Sheshet said, thus it was taught: "And what is their remedy? Their portion shall be written for the prince."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֶחָד כּוֹתֵב לַנָּשִׂיא וְאֶחָד כּוֹתֵב לַהֶדְיוֹט, וּמָה בֵּין כּוֹתֵב לַנָּשִׂיא לְכוֹתֵב לַהֶדְיוֹט? הַכּוֹתֵב לַנָּשִׂיא אֵין צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת, וְהַכּוֹתֵב לַהֶדְיוֹט צָרִיךְ לְזַכּוֹת. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה — צְרִיכִים לְזַכּוֹת, לֹא דִּבְּרוּ בְּנָשִׂיא אֶלָּא בַּהֹוֶה.
human_translation: both writes to the Nasi and one writes to a common person. What between writes to the Nasi and writes to a common person? That one who writes to the Nasi need not confer possession to a common person must confer possession And the Rabbis say: Both this and that must confer possession, they mentioned the Nasi only in the present.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One writes to the prince and one writes to the commoner. And what is the difference between writing to the prince and writing to the commoner? The one who writes to the prince does not need to be precise, and the one who writes to the commoner needs to be precise. And the sages say: Both this one and that one need to be precise, they only spoke about the prince in a hypothetical case.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין אַנְשֵׁי גָלִיל צְרִיכִין לְזַכּוֹת, שֶׁכְּבָר כָּתְבוּ אֲבוֹתֵיהֶן עַל יְדֵיהֶן. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַנְשֵׁי גָלִיל קַנְטְרָנִין הָיוּ, וְהָיוּ נוֹדְרִין הֲנָאָה זֶה מִזֶּה, עָמְדוּ אֲבוֹתֵיהֶם וְכָתְבוּ חֶלְקֵיהֶן לַנָּשִׂיא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The people of Galilee do not have to confer possession because their forefathers already wrote for them. It is taught Rabbi Yehuda says: The people of Galilee were quarrelsome [ kanteranin ] and would take vows prohibiting benefit from one another. their forefathers arose and wrote their portions to the Nasi
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: The men of Galilee do not need merit, for their ancestors have already written it for them. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: The men of Galilee were peddlers, and they would vow enjoyment from one another. Their ancestors stood up and wrote their portions for the prince.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ וְאֵין לוֹ מַה יֹּאכַל — נוֹתְנוֹ לְאַחֵר לְשׁוּם מַתָּנָה, וְהַלָּה מוּתָּר בָּהּ. מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד בְּבֵית חוֹרוֹן שֶׁהָיָה אָבִיו נוֹדֵר הֵימֶנּוּ הֲנָאָה, וְהָיָה מַשִּׂיא אֶת בְּנוֹ. וְאָמַר לַחֲבֵרוֹ: חָצֵר וּסְעוּדָה נְתוּנִים הִינָּן לְפָנֶיךָ, אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּבֹא אַבָּא וְיֹאכַל עִמָּנוּ בִּסְעוּדָה.
human_translation: one who is prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from another and he does not have anything to eat, may give to someone else as a gift and he is permitted it. An incident involving someone in Beit Ḥoron whose father had vowed not to derive benefit from him, and was marrying off his son And said to another: The courtyard and meal are given before you only so that my father will come and eat with us at the meal.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who has vowed to abstain from deriving benefit from his fellow, and has nothing to eat - he may give it to another as a gift, and he is permitted to benefit from it. There was an incident in Beit Horon involving a man whose father had vowed to abstain from deriving benefit from him, and he was supporting his son. He said to his friend: "A courtyard and a meal are prepared before you, but only so that my father may come and eat with us at the meal."

hebrew_text: אָמַר: אִם שֶׁלִּי הֵם — הֲרֵי הֵם מוּקְדָּשִׁין לַשָּׁמַיִם. אָמַר לוֹ: נָתַתִּי לְךָ אֶת שֶׁלִּי שֶׁתַּקְדִּישֵׁם לַשָּׁמַיִם?! אָמַר לוֹ: נָתַתָּ לִי אֶת שֶׁלְּךָ אֶלָּא שֶׁתְּהֵא אַתָּה וְאָבִיךְ אוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין וּמִתְרַצִּין זֶה לָזֶה, וִיהֵא עָוֹן תָּלוּי בְּרֹאשׁוֹ. אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: כׇּל מַתָּנָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁאִם הִקְדִּישָׁהּ תְּהֵא מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת — אֵינָהּ מַתָּנָה.
human_translation: said: If they are mine, they are hereby consecrated to Heaven, said to him did I give you my so that you should consecrate it to Heaven? He, said to him: You gave me your only you and your father would eat and drink and appease each other, and the sin be hung on his, head, The Sages said: Any gift that is not that if were to consecrate it would be consecrated, is not a gift.
llm_translation: He said: "If they are mine - behold, they are sanctified for Heaven." He said to him: "Did I give you mine to sanctify them for Heaven?!" He said to him: "You gave me yours only so that you and your father can eat, drink, and be satisfied with each other, and the sin will be upon his head." The sages said: "Any gift that, if one were to sanctify it, would not become sanctified - is not a gift."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַעֲשֶׂה לִסְתּוֹר! חַסּוֹרֵי מִיחַסְּרָא וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: וְאִם הוֹכִיחַ סוֹפוֹ עַל תְּחִילָּתוֹ — אָסוּר. וּמַעֲשֶׂה נָמֵי בְּבֵית חוֹרוֹן בְּאֶחָד, דַּהֲוָה סוֹפוֹ מוֹכִיחַ עַל תְּחִילָּתוֹ.
human_translation: an incident to contradict is incomplete and is teaching like this: And if his ultimate prove his initial forbidden. And there was also an incident in Beit Ḥoron concerning someone whose ultimate proved his initial
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar ma'aseh listor! Chasorei mikhassera ve'hakhi katanai: ve'im hokhiach sofo al techilato — asur. U'ma'aseh namei beit Choron be'echad, dahava sofo mokhiach al techilato." English translation: "Finish the deed to conceal! Those who are lacking are lacking, and thus it is taught: If one proves its end from its beginning — it is forbidden. And there was a similar incident in Beit Choron with one, where its end proved its beginning."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ ״וְהִינָּן לְפָנֶיךָ אֶלָּא כְּדֵי שֶׁיָּבֹא אַבָּא״. אֲבָל אָמַר לֵיהּ: ״שֶׁיְּהוּ לְפָנֶיךָ, שֶׁיָּבֹא אַבָּא״ — ״מִדַּעְתְּךָ״ הוּא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava said: They taught only where he said to him: And are before you only so that father should come, But he said to him That they should be before you that father should come, since he is saying to him: up to your judgment
llm_translation: Rava said: They only taught this because he said to him, "And they shall be before you, so that Abba may come." But if he said to him, "Let them be before you, so that Abba may come" — "From your own understanding" is what he said to him.

hebrew_text: לִישָּׁנָא אַחֲרִינָא: אָמְרִין לַהּ, אָמַר רָבָא: לָא תֵּימָא טַעְמָא דְּאָמַר לֵיהּ ״וְהִינָּן לְפָנֶיךָ״ הוּא דְּאָסוּר, אֲבָל אֲמַר לֵיהּ ״הֵן לְפָנֶיךָ שֶׁיָּבֹא אַבָּא וְיֹאכַל״ — מוּתָּר. אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ אָמַר לֵיהּ ״הֵן לְפָנֶיךָ יָבֹא אַבָּא וְיֹאכַל״ — אָסוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא — סְעוּדָתוֹ מוֹכַחַת עָלָיו.
human_translation: Some say another version Rava said: Do not say the reason is because he said to him: And are before you that it forbidden; but he said to him: They are before you so father should come and eat, permitted. Rather, even if he said to him: They are before you, father should come and eat, forbidden. What is the reason His meal proves about him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Another version: They say to her, Rava said: Do not say the reason he said to her "and they are before you" is that it is forbidden, but if he said to her "they are before you, that Abba may come and eat" — it is permitted. Rather, even if he said to her "they are before you, that Abba may come and eat" — it is forbidden. What is the reason? His meal is established upon it.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה לֵיהּ בְּרָא דַּהֲוָה שָׁמֵיט כִּיפֵּי דְכִיתָּנָא. אַסְרִינְהוּ לְנִכְסֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ. אָמְרוּ לֵיהּ: וְאִי הֲוַאי בַּר בְּרָךְ צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, מַאי? אֲמַר לְהוֹן: לִיקְנֵי הָדֵין, וְאִי הֲוַאי בַּר בְּרִי צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, לִקְנְיֵיהּ. מַאי?
human_translation: a certain man who had a son who seized sheaves [ keifei ] of flax, prohibiting from from his possessions. They said And if the son of your son would become a Torah scholar, what He said to them: Let this acquire and if the son of my son becomes a Torah scholar let him, acquire them What
llm_translation: That man who had a son who was a shepherd of sheep. They prohibited him from his property upon him. They said to him: And if this son of a son blesses the Master of the Rabbis, what? He said to them: Let him acquire the same, and if this son of a son of a son blesses the Master of the Rabbis, let him acquire it. What?

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי פּוּמְבְּדִיתָאֵי: ״קְנִי עַל מְנָת לְהַקְנוֹת״ הוּא, וְכׇל ״קְנִי עַל מְנָת לְהַקְנוֹת״ — לָא קָנֵי.
human_translation: of Pumbedita say: Acquire on the condition that you transfer And any Acquire on the condition that you transfer does not acquire
llm_translation: The scholars of Pumbedita said: "Acquire on condition to acquire" is effective, but any "acquire on condition to acquire" that is not effective.

hebrew_text: וְרַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: קָנֵי, דְּהָא סוּדָרָא ״קָנֵי עַל מְנָת לְהַקְנוֹת״ הוּא.
human_translation: But Rav Naḥman said: He does acquire, as an a cloth is acquisition in order to transfer
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman said: "Kanei," for the Sudara is "Kanei al menat lehaknot" it is.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: וּמַאן לֵימָא לַן דְּסוּדָרָא אִי תָּפֵיס לֵיהּ לָא מִיתְּפִיס? וְעוֹד: ״סוּדָרָא קָנֵי עַל מְנָת לְהַקְנוֹת וְקָנֵי מִן הַשְׁתָּא״. הָלֵין נִיכְסִין דְּהָדֵין לְאִימַתִּי קָנֵי — לְכִי הָוֵי בַּר בְּרֵיהּ צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן, לְכִי הֲוָה — הָדַר סוּדָרָא לְמָרֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: And who will say to us concerning the cloth that if seize it not seizure? And furthermore, a cloth Acquire in order to transfer but acquire from now. these possessions of this when does acquire? when his son’s son becomes a Torah scholar. And when he becomes the cloth has returned to its owner,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: And who will say to us that if one grasps it, it does not grasp? And furthermore: "A sudara acquires in order to acquire, and acquires from the moment." These coins, when are they acquired? — When he is a son of a Torah scholar, then he will acquire a sudara for his master!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא לְרַב נַחְמָן: וְהָא מַתְּנַת בֵּית חוֹרוֹן ״דִּקְנִי עַל מְנָת לְהַקְנוֹת״ הוּא, וְלָא קָא קָנֵי!
human_translation: Rava said to Rav Naḥman: But the gift of Beit Ḥoron is acquisition in order to transfer and he did not acquire
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Nachman: But the gift of the house of Horon, "to acquire upon the condition of acquiring," it is, and he did not acquire!

hebrew_text: זִימְנִין אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִשּׁוּם דִּסְעוּדָתוֹ מוֹכַחַת עָלָיו, וְזִימְנִין אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הִיא, דְּאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ וִיתּוּר אָסוּר בְּמוּדָּר הֲנָאָה.
human_translation: Sometimes he said to him: because his meal proves about him And sometimes he said to him that Rabbi Eliezer, who said: Even waived forbidden to one prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit
llm_translation: Times he said to him: because his meal established upon him, and times he said to him Rabbi Eliezer it is, for he said: even if and permitted forbidden in a vow benefit.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: כׇּל מַתָּנָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁאִם הִקְדִּישָׁהּ תְּהֵא מְקוּדֶּשֶׁת — אֵינָהּ מַתָּנָה. ״כׇּל״ לְאֵיתוֹיֵי מַאי? לָאו לְאֵתוֹיֵי הָא מִילְּתָא דְּשַׁדְיָא בְּכִיפֵּי? לָא, לְאֵתוֹיֵי לִישָּׁנָא בָּתְרָאָה דִּשְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא.
human_translation: We learned The Sages said: Any gift that is not that, if were to consecrate it would be consecrated, is not a gift. What is added Any? Is it not adding this matter of seized sheaves No, to add the latter version of the statement of Rava,
llm_translation: We learned: The sages said: Any gift that, if one were to consecrate it, it would become sanctified - it is not a gift. "Any" - for what is this term used? Is it not to include a case where the matter is in his hands? No, it is to include a case where he heard it from Rava afterwards.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ הַשּׁוּתָּפִין
llm_translation: We will return to you, O partners.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַמְבוּשָּׁל — מוּתָּר בְּצָלִי וּבְשָׁלוּק. אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם תַּבְשִׁיל שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בְּמַעֲשֵׂה קְדֵרָה רַךְ, וּמוּתָּר בְּעָבֶה, וּמוּתָּר בְּבֵיצָה טוֹרְמוֹטָא וּבַדַּלַּעַת הָרְמוּצָה. הַנּוֹדֵר מִמַּעֲשֵׂה קְדֵרָה — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מִמַּעֲשֵׂה רְתַחְתָּה, אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם הַיּוֹרֵד לִקְדֵרָה שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַמִּתְבַּשְּׁלִין בִּקְדֵרָה.
human_translation: one who vows cooked foods permitted roasted and boiled said: Cooked is konam that I will not taste prohibited from a loose cooked but permitted to a thick And permitted to a turemuta egg and the remutza gourd, one who vows cooked in a dish prohibited only from cooked by boiling one said: That which enters into a dish is konam that I will not taste prohibited anything cooked in a dish.
llm_translation: One who vows from a cooked dish - permitted in roasting and boiling. He said: "Their cooking is not to my taste" - prohibited in a soft pot, and permitted in a thick pot, and permitted in a whole egg and in a peeled gourd. One who vows from a soft pot - is only prohibited from its boiling, he said: "Their cooking that descends into a pot that is not to my taste - prohibited in all that are cooked in a pot."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה אוֹסֵר, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לְדָבָר — זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְבַשְּׁלוּ אֶת הַפֶּסַח בָּאֵשׁ כַּמִּשְׁפָּט״.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yoshiya prohibited And although there is no proof of the matter, there is an allusion to the matter, as it is stated: “And they cooked the Paschal offering with fire according to the ordinance”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rabbi Yoshiyah prohibits, even though there is no direct proof for the matter - a remembrance of the matter, as it is stated: 'And they boiled the Passover offering with fire according to the ordinance.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: לֵימָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, דְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה סָבַר: הַלֵּךְ אַחַר לְשׁוֹן תּוֹרָה, וְתַנָּא דִילַן סָבַר: בִּנְדָרִים הַלֵּךְ אַחַר לְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם?
human_translation: Let us say that they disagree with regard to this that Rabbi Yoshiya holds follow the language of Torah, and our tanna holds with regard to vows follow the language of people.
llm_translation: Let us say in this case, where Rabbi Yoshiyah disagrees: Rabbi Yoshiyah holds: one should follow the language of the Torah, and our Tanna holds: in vows, should one follow the language of people?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בִּנְדָרִים הַלֵּךְ אַחַר לְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם, מָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ וּמָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ. בְּאַתְרָא דְּתַנָּא דִילַן — לְצָלִי קָרוּ לֵיהּ צָלִי, וְלִמְבוּשָּׁל קָרוּ לֵיהּ מְבוּשָּׁל. בְּאַתְרָא דְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה — אֲפִילּוּ צָלִי קָרוּ מְבוּשָּׁל.
human_translation: No, that everyone with regard to vows follow the language of people. Sage in accordance with his locale, and Sage in accordance with his locale. In the locale of our tanna , roasted food is called roasted and cooked food is called cooked, in the locale of Rabbi Yoshiya even roasted food is called cooked.
llm_translation: Not, all, of the world, in vows, goes after the language of human beings, Master, when it is found, and Master, when it is found. In our place, as our Mishnah teaches - for roasting they called it roasted, and for boiling they called it boiled. In the place of Rabbi Yoshiyah - even if it is roasted, they called it boiled.

hebrew_text: וְהָא קְרָא נָסֵיב לַהּ! אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: But doesn’t cite a verse a mere support
llm_translation: And this, the verse is married to it! A mere support in general.

hebrew_text: קֻוֽנָּם תַּבְשִׁיל כּוּ׳. וְהָא מִתַּבְשִׁיל נְדַר!
human_translation: A cooked is konam But didn’t he vow a cooked to
llm_translation: Their cooking is like a cooked dish. But this is a vow!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי תַּנָּא כֹּל מִידֵּי דְּמִתְאֲכֵל בֵּיהּ רִיפְתָּא — תַּבְשִׁיל קָרוּ לֵיהּ. וְהָתַנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַתַּבְשִׁיל — אָסוּר בְּכׇל מִינֵי תַּבְשִׁיל, וְאָסוּר בְּצָלִי וּבְשָׁלוּק וּבִמְבוּשָּׁל, וְאָסוּר בְּהִיטְרִיּוֹת רַכּוֹת שֶׁהַחוֹלִין אוֹכְלִין בָּהֶן פִּיתָּן.
human_translation: Abaye said: This tanna anything with which bread is eaten is called a cooked And it is taught One who vows a cooked to prohibited from all types of cooked and prohibited from roasted, boiled, and cooked And he is prohibited from soft gourds [ hiteriyyot ], with which the sick eat their bread.
llm_translation: Abaye said: This Mishnah, whenever a cooked dish is absorbed in it - it imparts flavor to it. And it was taught in a Baraita: One who vows to abstain from cooked dishes - is forbidden in all types of cooked dishes, and is forbidden in roasted, boiled, and stewed dishes, and is forbidden in soft pickles that the sick eat bread with.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה חֲלַשׁ, עַל לְגַבֵּיהּ הָהוּא אָסְיָא לְאַסּוֹיֵהּ, חֲזָא קַרָא דְּמַחֵת בְּבֵיתֵיהּ, שַׁבְקֵיהּ וּנְפַק. אֲמַר: מַלְאַךְ מוֹתָא אִית לֵיהּ לְדֵין בְּבֵיתֵיהּ, וַאֲנָא אֵיעוּל לְאַסָּאָה יָתֵיהּ?!
human_translation: Is that so, But Rabbi Yirmeya fell ill, a certain doctor came to him to heal him. He saw a gourd that was placed in his house, he left and exited said: This has an angel of death, in his house, and I will enter to heal him?
llm_translation: I?! But didn't Rabbi Yirmeya fall ill, so that Asya came to heal him, saw a verse written on his wall, erased it, and left. He said: An angel of death is appointed over his household, and I will go and heal him?!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּרַכִּיכֵי, הָא — בְּאַשּׁוּנֵי. רָבָא בַּר עוּלָּא אָמַר: הָא — בְּקַרָא גּוּפֵיהּ, וְהָא — בְּגַוֵּויהּ דִּקְרָא. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: לוּלִיבָּא דְקַרָא בְּסִילְקָא, לוּלִיבָּא דְכִיתָּנָא בְּכוּתָּחָא. וְדָבָר זֶה אָסוּר לְאוֹמְרוֹ בִּפְנֵי עַם הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: not difficult. This to soft this to hard Rava bar Ulla said This to the gourd itself, and this to the innards [ luliva ] of the gourd, as Rav Yehuda said: The innards of the gourd with chard; the innards of flax with kuteḥa , And one may not say this matter in the presence of an ignoramus,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this — in blessings, this — in responses. Rava bar Ulla said: this — in the verse itself, and this — in the interpretation of the verse. For Rav Yehudah said: If the heart of the verse were in a basket, if the heart of the Mishnah were in the street. And this matter is forbidden to say in the presence of an ignoramus.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: מַאן חוֹלִין — רַבָּנַן. רָבָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר רָבָא:
human_translation: Rava said Who are sick the Sages, Rava to his reasoning, as Rava said:
llm_translation: Rava said: Who are the sick? — The Rabbis. Rava according to his reasoning, for Rava said:

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן מְצַלִּינַן עַל קְצִירֵי וְעַל מְרִיעֵי [כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי]. מִדְּאָמַר קְצִירֵי וּמְרִיעֵי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: קְצִירֵי — קְצִירֵי מַמָּשׁ, מְרִיעֵי — רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: In accordance with whose do we pray for the sick and for the suffering? In accordance with whose In accordance with Rabbi Yosei, From that he said: The sick and the suffering, learn from The sick, actual sick The suffering, the Sages,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As we establish regarding reapers and shepherds as we establish — like Rabbi Yosei. From the statement "reapers and shepherds," learn from it: reapers — actual reapers, shepherds — Sages.

hebrew_text: וּמוּתָּר בְּעָבָה. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּבַבְלָאֵי, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: בַּבְלָאֵי טַפְשָׁאֵי, דְּאָכְלִי לַחְמָא בְּלַחְמָא.
human_translation: permitted to a thick The mishna is not in accordance with the Babylonians, as Rabbi Zeira said: Babylonians are foolish, as they eat bread with bread.
llm_translation: And permitted in a thick dough. Mishnah: not like the Babylonians, for Rabbi Zeira said: Babylonians are foolish, for they eat bread with bread.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דִּמְשַׁאֵיל לְהוֹן לְהָלֵין נַקְדָּנֵי דְּהוּצַל: הָדֵין דַּיְיסָא, הֵיכֵין מְעַלֵּי לְמֵיכְלַהּ? דְּחִיטֵּי — בְּלַחְמָא דְחִיטֵּי, וְדִשְׂעָרֵי — בְּלַחְמָא דִשְׂעָרֵי, אוֹ דִּלְמָא: דְּחִיטֵּי — בְּדִשְׂעָרֵי, וְדִשְׂעָרֵי — בִּדְחִיטֵּי?
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said that those fastidious of Huzal, were asked: How is it best to eat this porridge? wheat with wheat bread and barley with barley bread, or perhaps wheat with barley and barley with wheat
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: When one asks the people who were saved from a fire: "How did you manage to escape?" Similarly, how should one bring up food for a meal? Should the wheat be with wheat bread, and the barley with barley bread, or perhaps the wheat should be with barley bread, and the barley with wheat bread?

hebrew_text: רָבָא אַכְלֵיהּ בַּחֲסִיסֵי. רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַב הוּנָא דְּקָאָכֵיל דַּיְיסָא בְּאֶצְבְּעָתֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַמַּאי קָאָכֵיל מָר בִּידֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי אָמַר רַב: דַּיְיסָא בְּאֶצְבְּעָתָא בְּסִים, וְכֹל דְּכֵן בְּתַרְתֵּין, וְכֹל דְּכֵן בִּתְלָת.
human_translation: Rava would eat with ḥasisei , Rabba, son of Rav Huna, found Rav Huna eating porridge with his fingers. He said to him: Why is the Master eating with his hands? said to him: This Rav said: Porridge with a finger is tasty, and all the more so with two and all the more so with three.
llm_translation: Rava ate with lettuce. Rabbah bar Rav Huna found Rav Huna eating a lentil with his fingers. He said to him: Why does the Master eat with his hands? He said to him: So said Rav: A lentil with the finger is two, and all that is two is three, and all that is three is four.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ, וְכֵן אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ: מְזַמְּנִים לָךְ לְמֵיכַל דַּיְיסָא עַד פַּרְסָה. לְמֵיכַל בִּישְׂרָא דְתוֹרָא עַד תְּלָתָא פַּרְסִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְחִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ, וְכֵן אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא לְרַבָּה בְּרֵיהּ: כֹּל מִידַּעַם לָא תִּפְלוֹט קַמֵּיהּ רַבָּךְ, לְבַר מִן קַרָא וְדַיְיסָא, שֶׁהֵן דּוֹמִין לִפְתִילְתָּא שֶׁל אֲבָר, וַאֲפִילּוּ קַמֵּי שַׁבּוּר מַלְכָּא פְּלוֹט.
human_translation: Rav said to his son Ḥiyya, and Rav Huna similarly said to his son Rabba: you are invited to eat porridge, up to a parasang [ parsa ]. to eat ox meat, up to three parasangs. Rav said to his son Ḥiyya, and Rav Huna similarly said to his son Rabba: You should not spit out anything before your teacher, apart from gourd and porridge, as they are like lead wick and spit out even before King Shapur,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav to Chiya his son, and so said to him, Rav Huna to Rabbah his son: They are inviting you to the banquet hall until the stomach. To the banquet hall in Yisra of the Torah until three stomachs. Rav said to Chiya his son, and so said to him, Rav Huna to Rabbah his son: All their knowledge will not be lost before your Master, to the son of a thread and a stomach, which are similar to the umbilical cord of an embryo, and even before the broken king's son will not be lost.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, חַד אָכֵיל דַּיְיסָא בְּאֶצְבְּעָתֵיהּ וְחַד אָכֵיל בְּהוּצָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ דְּאָכֵיל בְּהוּצָא לִדְאָכֵיל בְּאֶצְבְּעָתֵיהּ: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מַאֲכִילֵנִי צוֹאָתְךָ! אֲמַר לֵיהּ דְּאָכֵיל בְּאֶצְבְּעָתֵיהּ לִדְאָכֵיל בְּהוּצָא: עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מַאֲכִילֵנִי רוּקְּךָ!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yehuda One ate porridge with his fingers, and one ate with a fork [ hutza ]. who was eating with a fork said to who was eating with his fingers: For how long will you feeding me your filth? who was eating with his fingers said to who was eating with a fork: For how long will you feeding me your spittle,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Yehuda, one eats a date with his finger and one eats with a peel. He said to him, since you eat with a peel, eat with your finger: Until when will you feed me your filth! He said to him, since you eat with your finger, eat with a peel: Until when will you feed me your spittle!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אַיְיתוֹ לְקַמַּיְיהוּ בְּלוּסְפִיין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֲכַל, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא אֲכַל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָכֵיל מָר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: אֵלּוּ אֵין יוֹצְאִין מִבְּנֵי מֵעַיִם כׇּל עִיקָּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁנִּסְמוֹךְ עֲלֵיהֶן לְמָחָר.
human_translation: Belospayin , were brought before Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda ate Rabbi Shimon did not eat Rabbi Yehuda said to him: What is the reason Master is not eating? Rabbi Shimon said to him: These do not leave the intestines at all. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: all the more that one can rely on them tomorrow.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah and Rabbi Shimon brought before them lupines. Rabbi Yehudah ate, Rabbi Shimon did not eat. Rabbi Yehudah said to him: What is the reason that the Master does not eat? Rabbi Shimon said to him: These do not come out of the intestines at all. Rabbi Yehudah said to him: All the more so that they should be relied upon for tomorrow.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הֲוָה יָתֵיב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: הַיּוֹם פָּנֶיךָ צְהוּבִּין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶמֶשׁ יָצְאוּ עֲבָדֶיךָ לַשָּׂדֶה, וְהֵבִיאוּ לָנוּ תְּרָדִין, וַאֲכַלְנוּם בְּלֹא מֶלַח. וְאִם אֲכַלְנוּם בְּמֶלַח — כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁהָיוּ פָּנֵינוּ צְהוּבִּין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda was sitting before Rabbi Tarfon. Rabbi Tarfon said to him: Your face today is ruddy, said to him: Last night your servants, went out to the field, and beets were brought to us, and we ate them without salt. And had we eaten them with salt, all the more so would our faces have been ruddy.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah was sitting before Rabbi Tarfon. He said to him, "Today your face is yellow." He said to him, "Yesterday, your servants went out to the field, brought us radishes, and we ate them without salt. And if we had eaten them with salt, surely our faces would have been even more yellow."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה הָהִיא מַטְרוֹנִיתָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מוֹרֶה וְרָוֵי? אֲמַר לַהּ: הֵימָנוּתָא בִּידָא דְּהָהִיא אִיתְּתָא, אִי טָעֵימְנָא אֶלָּא קִידּוּשָׁא וְאַבְדָּלְתָּא וְאַרְבְּעָה כָּסֵי דְפִסְחָא, וְחוֹגְרַנִי צִידְעַי מִן הַפֶּסַח עַד הָעֲצֶרֶת, אֶלָּא: ״חׇכְמַת אָדָם תָּאִיר פָּנָיו״.
human_translation: A certain lady [ matronita ] said to Rabbi Yehuda, teach and a drunk He said to her: integrity in the hands of this woman if I taste except kiddush , havdala , and the four cups of Passover. And I tie my temples from Passover to Shavuot , Rather, “A man’s wisdom makes his face to shine”
llm_translation: The text: "That matron said to Rabbi Yehuda: 'Morah and Ravei?' He said to her: 'We have the tradition from the wife of that man, if we taste only the Kiddush and Havdalah and the four cups of Passover, and we gird our loins with the festival belt from Passover until Shavuot, rather: 'The wisdom of a man illuminates his face.'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא מִינָא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: פָּנֶיךָ דּוֹמִין אִי כְּמַלְוֵי רִבִּית אִי כִּמְגַדְּלֵי חֲזִירִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּיהוּדָאֵי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ אֲסִירָן. אֶלָּא — עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא אִית לִי מִן בֵּיתָא עַד בֵּי מִדְרְשָׁא, וְכׇל שָׁעָה וְשָׁעָה אֲנִי נִכְנָס לְכׇל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: A certain heretic said to Rabbi Yehuda: Your face is similar either to usurers or to pig breeders. said to him: Both are prohibited to Jews. Rather, I have twenty-four bathrooms from my home to the study hall, and all the time I enter each and every one
llm_translation: He said to him that heretic to Rabbi Yehuda: Your face is like either one who lends with interest or like one who raises pigs. He said to him: In Judea, they are both prohibited. Rather - I have twenty-four lavatories from the house to the study hall, and every hour I enter each and every one.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה כַּד אָזֵיל לְבֵי מִדְרְשָׁא שָׁקֵיל גּוּלְפָּא עַל כַּתְפֵּיהּ, אָמַר: גְּדוֹלָה מְלָאכָה שֶׁמְּכַבֶּדֶת אֶת בְּעָלֶיהָ. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שָׁקֵיל צַנָּא עַל כַּתְפֵּיהּ, אָמַר: גְּדוֹלָה מְלָאכָה שֶׁמְּכַבֶּדֶת אֶת בְּעָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: When Rabbi Yehuda would go to the study hall he would carry a pitcher [ gulefa ] on his shoulder saying: Labor is great, as it brings honor to the laborer it. Rabbi Shimon would carry a basket on his shoulder, saying: Labor is great, as it brings honor to the laborer it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda as he went to the study hall took a skull on his shoulders, he said: "Great is the work that honors its maker." Rabbi Shimon took a basket on his shoulders, he said: "Great is the work that honors its maker."

hebrew_text: דְּבֵיתְהוּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נְפַקַת, נְקַטַת עַמְרָא, עֲבַדָה גְּלִימָא דְּהוּטְבֵי. כַּד נְפַקַת לְשׁוּקָא מִיכַּסְּיָא בֵּיהּ, וְכַד נָפֵיק רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְצַלּוֹיֵי הֲוָה מִכַּסֵּי וּמְצַלֵּי. וְכַד מִיכַּסֵּי בֵּיהּ הֲוָה מְבָרַךְ ״בָּרוּךְ שֶׁעָטַנִי מְעִיל״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda’s wife went out collected wool, made a thick [ hutevei ] cloak. When she would go out to the market she would cover herself with it, and when Rabbi Yehuda would go out to pray he would cover himself and pray. And when he cover himself with it he would recite the blessing: Blessed is He who wrapped me in a coat,
llm_translation: The household of Rabbi Yehuda went out, took a lamb, and prepared a dish of liver. When they went out to the market in Kaspaya with it, and when Rabbi Yehuda went out to the bathhouse, it was stolen and lost. And when it was stolen from him, he would recite, "Blessed is He who has clothed me in a cloak."

hebrew_text: זִימְנָא חֲדָא גְּזַר רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל תַּעֲנִיתָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא אֲתָא לְבֵי תַעֲנִיתָא. אָמְרִין לֵיהּ: לָא אִית לֵיהּ כִּסּוּיָא. שַׁדַּר לֵיהּ גְּלִימָא וְלָא קַבֵּיל.
human_translation: one occasion Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, decreed a fast. Rabbi Yehuda did not come to the house of the fast, said to does not have cover sent him a cloak but did not accept
llm_translation: At one time, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel decreed a fast, but Rabbi Yehuda did not come to the fast. They said to him: "He does not have a covering." They sent him a cloak, but he did not accept it.

hebrew_text: דַּלִּי צִיפְּתָא וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ לִשְׁלוּחָא: חֲזִי מַאי אִיכָּא. מִיהוּ, לָא נִיחָא לִי דְּאִיתְהֲנֵי בְּהָדֵין עָלְמָא.
human_translation: He lifted the mat [ tzifeta ] and said to the messenger: See what there is However, it is not amenable to me to derive benefit in this world.
llm_translation: A bucket of pitch and he said to him for sending: See what there is. Nevertheless, it is not pleasing to me that they are benefiting from it in this world.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אִיתְקַדַּשַׁת לֵיהּ בְּרַתֵּיה (דְּבַר) דְּכַלְבָּא שָׂבוּעַ. שְׁמַע (בַּר) כַּלְבָּא שָׂבוּעַ, אַדְּרַהּ הֲנָאָה מִכׇּל נִכְסֵיהּ. אֲזַלָא וְאִיתְנְסִיבָה לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva became betrothed to the daughter of bar Kalba Savua. bar Kalba Savua heard prohibiting her from all of his property. she went and married
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva's daughter was betrothed to a man who was completely destitute. When he heard that she was betrothed to a destitute man, he went and became wealthy and married her.

hebrew_text: בְּסִיתְוָא הֲוָה גָּנוּ בֵּי תִיבְנָא, הֲוָה קָא מְנַקֵּיט לַיהּ תִּיבְנָא מִן מַזְּיַיהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: אִי הֲוַאי לִי, רָמֵינָא לִיךְ יְרוּשָׁלַיִם דְּדַהֲבָא. אֲתָא אֵלִיָּהוּ אִידְּמִי לְהוֹן כֶּאֱנָשָׁא וְקָא קָרֵי אַבָּבָא. אֲמַר לְהוּ: הַבוּ לִי פּוּרְתָּא דְתִיבְנָא דִּילֵדַת אִתְּתִי, וְלֵית לִי מִידַּעַם לְאַגְנוֹיַהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְאִנְתְּתֵיהּ: חֲזִי גַּבְרָא דַּאֲפִילּוּ תִּיבְנָא לָא אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: In the winter they would sleep in a storehouse of straw, would gather straw from her hair. He said to her: If I had I would place on your a Jerusalem of Gold, Elijah came appeared to them as person and calling on the door. He said to them: Give me a bit of straw, as my wife gave birth and I do not have anything on which to lay her. Rabbi Akiva said to his wife: See man, who does not even have straw.
llm_translation: In Sityava there was a garden belonging to the household of Tivna, he was removing the figs from it. He said to her: "If this were mine, I would give you Jerusalem of gold." Elijah came and appeared to them like people, and he called out "Father, Father." He said to them: "Give me the purse of the figs that you picked, for I have no knowledge to distinguish them." Rabbi Akiva said to his wife: "See the man, that even if the figs are not his, he does not take them."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: זִיל הֱוֵי בֵּי רַב. אֲזַל תַּרְתֵּי סְרֵי שְׁנִין קַמֵּי דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. לְמִישְׁלַם תַּרְתֵּי סְרֵי שְׁנִין קָא אֲתָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ, שְׁמַע מִן אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּיתֵיהּ דְּקָאָמַר לַהּ חַד רָשָׁע לִדְבֵיתְהוּ: שַׁפִּיר עָבֵיד לִיךְ אֲבוּךְ חֲדָא דְּלָא דָּמֵי לִיךְ. וְעוֹד: [שַׁבְקִךְ] אַרְמְלוּת חַיּוּת כּוּלְּהוֹן שְׁנִין. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִי צָאֵית לְדִילִי — לֶיהֱוֵי תַּרְתֵּי סְרֵי שְׁנִין אַחְרָנְיָיתָא. אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וִיהַבַת לִי רְשׁוּתָא, אֶיהְדַּר לַאֲחוֹרַי. הֲדַר אֲזַל הֲוָה תַּרְתֵּי סְרֵי שְׁנֵי אַחְרָנְיָיתָא.
human_translation: She said to him: Go be a student He went twelve years before Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua. At the completion of twelve years, he was coming home he heard from behind his house that one wicked person was saying to his wife: Your father behaved well toward you. One that is not similar to you, And furthermore, he has left you in widowhood in his lifetime all these years. She said to him: If he listens to me, he should be another twelve years. said: Since she has given me permission I will go back He turned back went was another twelve years.
llm_translation: She said to him: Go, be a student of Rav. He went for two or three years before Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Joshua. When he completed two or three years, he came back to his house. He heard from behind his house that someone was saying to his wife: Your father-in-law has done well for you, a son-in-law who is not worthy of you. And furthermore, he abandoned all the livestock. She said to him: If you go back to my opinion, it will be two or three more years. He said: Since you have given me permission, I will return. He returned, and it was two or three more years.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא בְּעֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבְּעָה אַלְפִין זוּגֵי תַלְמִידֵי. נְפוּק כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְאַפֵּיהּ, וְאַף הִיא קָמַת לְמִיפַּק לְאַפֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ הַהוּא רַשִּׁיעָא: וְאַתְּ לְהֵיכָא? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: ״יוֹדֵעַ צַדִּיק נֶפֶשׁ בְּהֶמְתּוֹ״. אֲתָת לְאִיתְחֲזוֹיֵי לֵיהּ, קָא מְדַחִן לַהּ רַבָּנַן. אֲמַר לְהוֹן: הַנִּיחוּ לָהּ, שֶׁלִּי וְשֶׁלָּכֶם שֶׁלָּהּ הוּא. שְׁמַע (בַּר) כַּלְבָּא שָׂבוּעַ, אֲתָא וְאִיתְּשִׁיל עַל נִידְרֵיהּ וְאִשְׁתְּרַיי, וְאִשְׁתְּרִי.
human_translation: he came by 24,000 pairs of students. Everyone went out to him, and she too arose to go out to him. That wicked person said to her: And to where are you She said to him: “A righteous man regards the life of his beast” She came to present herself before the Sages fend her off, He said to them: Leave her. my and yours are hers. bar Kalba Savua heard he came and requested the dissolution of his vow, and it was dissolved.
llm_translation: He came with twenty-four thousand pairs of disciples. The whole world went out to meet him, and she herself stood up to meet him. That wicked person said to her: "Where are you going?" She said to him: "I know that the soul of a righteous person is in his animal." They wanted to push her away, but the Rabbis said to them: "Leave her alone, for her and for you belongs to her." The dog barked, came and licked her feet, and her vows were annulled.

hebrew_text: מִן שֵׁית מִילֵּי אִיעַתַּר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִן כַּלְבָּא שָׂבוּעַ, מִן אַיָּלָא דִסְפִינְתָּא. דְּכֹל סְפִינָתָא עָבְדִין לֵיהּ מִין עָינָא. זִימְנָא חֲדָא אַנְשְׁיוּהּ עַל כֵּיף יַמָּא אֲתָא הוּא, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva became wealthy from six things. from Kalba Savua from the ram of a ship [ eila disfineta ], as fashion a type of sheep for every ship, one occasion, forgot on the seashore, came found it
llm_translation: From six words one extra Rabbi Akiva: from a dog satiated, from a deer of a ship. For all ships they did to him from the eye. One time his people on the edge of the sea came, they found him.

hebrew_text: וּמִן גְּווֹזָא, דְּזִימְנָא חֲדָא יְהֵיב אַרְבָּעָה זוּזֵי לְסָפוֹנָאֵי, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַיְיתֵי לִי מִדַּעַם, וְלָא אַשְׁכַּחוּ אֶלָּא גְּווֹזָא עַל כֵּיף יַמָּא. אַתְיוּהּ לֵיהּ. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: עֲבֵיד מָרַנָא עֲלֵיהּ, אִישְׁתְּכַח דַּהֲוָה מְלֵי דִּינָרֵי. דְּזִימְנָא חֲדָא טְבַעַת סְפִינְתָּא, וְכוּלֵּי עִיסְקָא הֲוָה מַחֵית בְּהָהוּא גְּווֹזָא, וְאִישְׁתְּכַח בְּהָהוּא זִימְנָא.
human_translation: And from a log [ gavza ] as one occasion he gave four dinars to sailors said to them: Bring me something And they found only a log on the seashore. They brought it to him said to him: May our master wait with this He found that was full of dinars, as one occasion a ship sunk and all the merchandise, was placed in that log, and it was found on that occasion
llm_translation: From the treasury, once a certain time he gave four zuzim to the collectors, he said to them: "Bring me from their knowledge, and they only found a treasury on the edge of the sea." They brought it to him. They said to him: "Our master, do business with it, for it was full of dinars." Once a certain time a ring of a ship sank, and all the business dealings were destroyed in that treasury, and they found it at that time.

hebrew_text: דְּמִן דִּסְרוּקִיתָא, וּמִן מַטְרוֹנִיתָא,
human_translation: from Ishmaelites [ Serukita ]. And from lady.
llm_translation: From Disrukita, and from Matronita,

hebrew_text: וּמִן אִשְׁתּוֹ שֶׁל טוֹרָנוּסְרוּפוּס, וּמִן קְטִיעָא בַּר שָׁלוֹם.
human_translation: And from the wife of Turnus Rufus, and from Ketia bar Shalom,
llm_translation: And from the wife of Tornus Rufus, and from Ketia bar Shalom.

hebrew_text: רַב גַּמָּדָא יְהֵיב אַרְבָּעָה זוּזִי לְסָפוֹנָאֵי לְאֵתוֹיֵי בְּהוֹן מִידַּעַם. לָא אַשְׁכַּחוּ, אַתְיוּהּ לֵיהּ בְּהוֹן קוֹפָא. אִישְׁתְּמִיט עַל לְחָרְתָא, חֲפַרוּ בָּתְרֵיהּ, אַשְׁכְּחוּהּ דִּרְבִיעַ עַל מַרְגָּלְיָיתָא, אַיְּיתִינּוּן לֵיהּ כּוּלְּהוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Gamda gave four dinars to sailors to bring something for them. did not find they a monkey with brought it to him. escaped entered a hole. they dug after it they found it crouching over pearls, they brought all of to
llm_translation: Rav Gammada gave four zuzim to the collectors to bring him from their region. They did not find the item, they came to him with a monkey. He threw it on a pot, they dug underneath it, they found a quarter of a zuz on its collar, they brought it all to him.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ בַּת קֵיסָר לְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן חֲנַנְיָה: תּוֹרָה מְפוֹאָרָה, בִּכְלִי מְכוֹעָר. אֲמַר לַהּ: לִמְדִי מִבֵּית אֲבוּךְ, בַּמֶּה מַנִּיחִין יַיִן? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: בְּמָאנֵי דְפַחְרָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בְּפַחְרָא, וְאַתּוּן בְּמָאנֵי דְפַחְרָא?! אַתּוּן אַחִיתוּן בְּמָאנֵי דְּכַסְפָּא וְדַהֲבָא!
human_translation: The daughter of the emperor said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: magnificent Torah, in an ugly vessel, He said to her: You may learn from your father’s house. In what do place wine? She said to him: In earthenware vessels. He said to her: everyone in earthenware and you in earthenware vessels? You place in vessels of silver and gold.
llm_translation: The daughter of Caesar said to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananiah: Torah is beautiful, in an ugly vessel. He said to her: Learn from the manners of your father's house, in what do they place wine? She said to him: In glass vessels. He said to her: All the people of the world use glass vessels, and you use glass vessels?! You use glass vessels for wine and oil!

hebrew_text: אֲזַלַת וּרְמָת חַמְרָא בְּמָאנֵי דְּכַסְפָּא וְדַהֲבָא, וּסְרִי. אֲמַר לַהּ: אַף אוֹרָיְיתָא כֵּן. וְהָאִיכָּא שַׁפִּירִין וּגְמִירִין! אֲמַר לַהּ: אִי הֲווֹ סְנוּ, הֲווֹ גְּמִירִין טְפֵי.
human_translation: She went and placed the wine in vessels of silver and gold, and it spoiled. said to her: The same is the Torah. But are there not good and learned He said to her: If they were ugly they would be more learned.
llm_translation: The text goes to Ramat Ḥamra with measures of silver, gold, and silk. He said to her: "Even the Torah is like this." But there are beautiful and complete ones! He said to her: If they were not beautiful, they would not be complete.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דְּאָתְיָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא לְדִינָא וְאִיתְחַיַּיבַת מִן דִּינָא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: שְׁמוּאֵל רַבָּךְ הָכִי דָּנַן?! אֲמַר לַהּ: יָדְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִין, גּוּצָּא וְרַבָּה כְּרֵיסֵיהּ אוּכָּם וְרַבָּה שִׁינֵּיהּ. אֲמַר לַהּ: לְבַזּוֹיֵיהּ קָאָתֵית? תֶּיהְוֵי הַהִיא אִתְּתָא בְּשַׁמְתָּא. פְּקַעָה וּמִתָה.
human_translation: A certain woman came before Rav Yehuda of Neharde’a for judgment, and she was found guilty in the judgment She said to him: Would Shmuel your teacher have judged in this He said to her: Did you know him? She said to him: Yes. short and potbellied. dark and his teeth were large. He said to her: Did you come to disparage him Let that woman be in excommunication. split open and she died,
llm_translation: That one who came before Rav Yehudah from Nehardea for judgment and was found liable in the judgment. She said to him: "Does Shmuel your teacher judge this way?!" He said to her: "Did you know him?" She said to him: "No, his belly is large and his teeth are sharp." He said to her: "You came to disgrace him? Let that woman be in the name of shame." She burst and died.

hebrew_text: וּמוּתָּר בְּבֵיצָה טוֹרְמִיטָא. מַאי בֵּיצָה טוֹרְמִיטָא? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: עַבְדָּא דְּעָבֵיד לַהּ שָׁוֵי אַלְפָּא דִּינָרֵי, וּמְעַיֵּיל לַהּ אַלְפָּא זִימְנֵי בְּמַיָּא חַמִּימֵי וְאַלְפָּא זִימְנֵי בְּמַיָּא קָרִירֵי עַד דְּמִתְזוּטְרָא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּבָלַע יָתַהּ, וְאִם אִית כֵּיבָא — סָרֵיךְ עֲלַהּ, וְכַד נָפְקָא וְאָתְיָא, יָדַע אָסְיָא מַאי סַמָּא מִתְבְּעֵי לֵיהּ וּבְמַאי מִתַּסִּי.
human_translation: and permitted to a turemita egg. What turemita egg? Shmuel said: A slave who prepare it is worth a thousand dinars. And He inserts it into hot water a thousand times and in cold water a thousand times, until it shrinks so that it can be swallowed And if there is a lesion adheres to and when emerges the doctor knows what medicine requires and with what can be healed.
llm_translation: And permitted in a "Tormita" egg. What is a "Tormita" egg? Shmuel said: A slave who does work for her worth a thousand dinars, and he feeds her a thousand times with hot water and a thousand times with cold water until she swells up so that she can swallow it, and if there is a liver - it is needed for her, and when she goes out and comes in, Asya knows what medicine she needs and with what she should be treated.

hebrew_text: שְׁמוּאֵל הֲוָה בָּדֵיק נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּקוּלְחָא, עַד דִּמְסַתְּרִין אִינָשֵׁי בֵּיתֵיהּ עֲלֵיהּ שַׂעְרֵיהוֹן.
human_translation: Shmuel would examine himself with a stalk to such an extent that the members of his household would tear their hairs out for him
llm_translation: Samuel would examine himself in a dark room, until people in his household would hide their hair.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה בִּכְלוּפְסִין — לֹא יֹאכַל בִּבְנוֹת שֶׁבַע. בִּבְנוֹת שֶׁבַע — לֹא יֹאכַל בִּכְלוּפְסִין. מַאי כְּלוּפְסִין? מִינָא דִתְאֵינֵי דְּעָבְדִין מִנְּהוֹן לַפְדֵי.
human_translation: We learned there was working with keloppasin , may not partake of benot sheva , with benot sheva he may not partake of keloppasin . What are keloppasin ? A type of fig from which compote [ lifdei ] is made.
llm_translation: We learned there: One who would make his food into peels - he may not eat it in seven daughters. In seven daughters - he may not eat it in peels. What are "peels"? A kind that they make from them wafers.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דִּיהַב עַבְדָּא לְחַבְרֵיהּ לְאַגְמוֹרֵיהּ אַלְפָּא מִינֵי לַפְדֵי, אַגְמְרֵיהּ תַּמְנֵי מְאָה. אַזְמְנֵיהּ לְדִינָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי. אָמַר רַבִּי: אֲבוֹתֵינוּ אָמְרוּ ״נָשִׁינוּ טוֹבָה״, אָנוּ אֲפִילּוּ בְּעֵינֵינוּ לֹא רָאִינוּ.
human_translation: a certain man who gave a slave to his friend so that teach him a thousand varieties of compote he taught him eight hundred. He brought for judgment before Rabbi Rabbi said: Our forefathers said: We have forgotten prosperity we have not even seen with our eyes.
llm_translation: That man who gave a slave to his friends to redeem his vineyard, his friends redeemed it for eight hundred dinars. They brought him to the court of Rabbi. Rabbi said: Our fathers said, "Our wives are good," but we have not seen it even in our own eyes.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲבַד לֵיהּ הִלּוּלָא לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי, כְּתַב עַל בֵּית גְּנָנָא: עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבְּעָה אַלְפִין רִיבּוֹאִין דִּינָרִין נְפַקוּ עַל בֵּית גְּנָנָא דֵּין, וְלָא אַזְמְנֵיהּ לְבַר קַפָּרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם לְעוֹבְרֵי רְצוֹנוֹ כָּךְ — לְעוֹשֵׂי רְצוֹנוֹ עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה. אַזְמְנֵיהּ, אֲמַר: לְעוֹשֵׂי רְצוֹנוֹ בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה כָּךְ — לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi made a wedding for Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi wrote on the canopy: 24,000 myriad dinars were expended on this canopy, and did not invite bar Kappara said to If to those who transgress will, such, all the more so those who perform His will invited him. said: to those who perform His will such in this world, all the more so in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avad said to Hillel, the son of Rabbi Shimon: He wrote on the treasury house: Twenty-four thousand myriads of dinars came out of the treasury house of judgment, and they did not appoint him to be the head tax collector. He said to him: If for those who transgress His will it is so — for those who fulfill His will, how much more so. They appointed him, he said: For those who fulfill His will in this world it is so — in the World to Come, how much more so.

hebrew_text: יוֹמָא דִּמְחַיֵּיךְ בֵּיהּ רַבִּי, אָתְיָא פּוּרְעָנוּתָא לְעָלְמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְבַר קַפָּרָא: לָא תְּבַדְּיחַן וְיָהֵיבְנָא לָךְ אַרְבְּעִין גְּרִיוֵי חִיטֵּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לִיחְזֵי מָר
human_translation: On a day when Rabbi would laugh, calamity would befall the world, He said to bar Kappara: Do not cause me to laugh, and I will give you forty se’a of wheat said to him: Master will see
llm_translation: Day that sustain in it Rabbi, came punishment to the world. Said to him to Bar Kappara: not worry and will give to you forty measures of wheat. Said to him: see, master.

hebrew_text: דְּכֹל גְּרִיוָא דְּבָעֵינָא שָׁקֵילְנָא. שְׁקַל דִּיקּוּלָא רַבָּה, חַפְיֵיהּ כּוּפְרָא וְסַחְפֵיהּ עַל רֵישֵׁיהּ, וַאֲזַל וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: לֵיכִיל לִי מָר אַרְבְּעִין גְּרִיוֵי חִיטֵּי דְּרָשֵׁינָא בָּךְ. אַחוּךְ רַבִּי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו אַזְהַרְתָּךָ דְּלָא תְּבַדְּחַן? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חִיטֵּי דְּרָשֵׁינָא קָא נָסֵיבְנָא.
human_translation: that any se’a I wish I will take. He took a large palm basket, smeared it with tar, and overturned it upon his head, and went, and said to Let the Master measure for me forty se’a of wheat that I am owed by you. Rabbi laughed said to him: Did I not warn you not to make me laugh? He said to him: I am taking from you the wheat that I am owed by you.
llm_translation: Every convert that I desire, I accept. I took a large basket, covered it with pitch, and placed it on his head, and went and said to him: "Go and bring me forty se'ahs of wheat that we need." Rabbi Akiva said to him: "Did I not warn you not to provoke him?" He replied to him: "We are marrying wheat."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לַהּ בַּר קַפָּרָא לְבַרְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי: לִמְחַר שָׁתֵינָא חַמְרָא בְּרִיקּוּדָא דַּאֲבוּךְ וּבְקִירְקָנֵי דְאִמִּךְ. בֶּן אֶלְעָשָׂה חַתְנֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי הֲוָה, וְעָשִׁיר גָּדוֹל הֲוָה. אַזְמְנֵיהּ לְבֵי הִילּוּלָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי.
human_translation: Bar Kappara said to the daughter of Rabbi Tomorrow I will drink wine at your father’s dancing and your mother’s singing [ kirekanei ]. Ben Elasa was the son-in-law of Rabbi and was a very wealthy man. invited him to the wedding of Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi
llm_translation: He said to her, Bar Kapara to his son-in-law, the son of Rabbi: Tomorrow we will drink wine in the courtyard of your father and in the vineyards of your mother. The son of Elasa was the son-in-law of Rabbi, and he was a great wealthy man. He invited him to the celebration at the house of Rabbi Shimon, the son of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ בַּר קַפָּרָא לְרַבִּי: מַאי ״תּוֹעֵבָה״? כֹּל דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי דְּהָכֵין הוּא ״תּוֹעֵבָה״, פַּרְכַהּ בַּר קַפָּרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פָּרְשֵׁיהּ אַתְּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: תֵּיתֵי דְּבֵיתְכִי תִּירְמֵי לִי נַטְלָא. אֲתָת רָמְיָא לֵיהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי: קוּם רְקוֹד לִי, דְּאֵימַר לָךְ: הָכִי אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: ״תּוֹעֵבָה״ — תּוֹעֶה אַתָּה בָּהּ.
human_translation: Bar Kappara said to Rabbi What to’eva , Whatever that Rabbi said to that this is to’eva , bar Kappara refuted it said to him: You explain it. said to him: Let your wife come and pour me a goblet She came poured him said to Rabbi Arise dance for me, so that I will tell you This is what the Merciful One is saying to’eva : You are straying after it [ to’e ata bah ],
llm_translation: He said to him, Bar Kappara to Rabbi: What is "abomination"? Anyone who Rabbi says is "abomination," Bar Kappara interprets. He said to him: Explain it. He said to him: Give me a handkerchief from your house. You are mocking him. He said to Rabbi: Get up and dance for me, for it says to you: Thus says the Merciful One: "Abomination" - you are wandering in it.

hebrew_text: לְכָסָא אַחֲרִינָא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי ״תֶּבֶל״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ כִּי עִנְיָינָא קַדְמָאָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עִיבֵיד לִי דְּאוֹמַר לָךְ. עֲבַד. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״תֶּבֶל הוּא״ — תַּבְלִין יֵשׁ בָּהּ. מִי שָׁנְיָא הָדָא בִּיאָה מִן כּוּלְּהוֹן בִּיאוֹת?
human_translation: to another cup, said to him: What tevel , said to him, as the previous said to him: Perform for me that I will tell you. did said to him “It is tevel ” it have spice [ tevalin yesh bah ]? Is this act of sexual intercourse different than all other acts of sexual intercourse,
llm_translation: To the other end of the bench he said: What is "tevel"? He said to him: Because it is a primary matter. He said to him: Do for me as I tell you. He said to him: "It is tevel" - it contains spices. Who differs in this matter from all the other matters?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּמַאי ״זִימָּה״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עִיבֵיד כִּי עִנְיָינָא קַדְמָאָה. עֲבַד וַאֲמַר לֵיהּ: זוֹ מָה הִיא. לָא יְכֵיל בֶּן אֶלְעָשָׂה לְמִיסְבַּל, קָם וּנְפַק הוּא וְאִינְתְּתֵיהּ מִתַּמָּן.
human_translation: said to And what zimma , He said to him: Perform for me as the previous did and said to him What is she [ zo ma hi ]? Ben Elasa could not tolerate he and his wife arose and left
llm_translation: He said to him: And what is "zimma"? He said to him: It is something that happened previously. He did it and said to him: What is this? The son of Elasah could not bear to be insulted, so he got up and left, and his wife followed him from there.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֶּן אֶלְעָשָׂה? דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא לְחִנָּם פִּיזֵּר בֶּן אֶלְעָשָׂה אֶת מְעוֹתָיו, אֶלָּא לְהַרְאוֹת בָּהֶן תִּסְפּוֹרֶת שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: what ben Elasa as it is taught: Ben Elasa did not dispense his money for naught. Rather, to show the haircut of a High Priest
llm_translation: What is the case of Ben Elasah? For it was taught: Ben Elasah did not distribute his coins for free, but rather to demonstrate with them the counting of the High Priest's portion.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״כָּסוֹם יִכְסְמוּ אֶת רָאשֵׁיהֶם״. תָּנָא: כְּעֵין לוּלְיָנִית. מַאי ״לוּלְיָנִית״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: תִּסְפֻּרְתָּא יְחִידְתָּא. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אָמַר רָבָא: רֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל זֶה בְּצַד עִיקָּרוֹ שֶׁל זֶה. וְהַיְינוּ תִּסְפּוֹרֶת שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: As it is written “They shall poll their heads” taught like a luleyanit . What is a luleyanit ? Rav Yehuda said: a unique haircut. What is like? Rava said: The edge of this is by the roots of that And this is the haircut of a High Priest,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "They shall cover their heads." A Tanna taught: Like a Lu'liyanit. What is a "Lu'liyanit"? Rav Yehudah said: A unique turban. How so? Rava said: The top of this one alongside the main part of that one. And this is the turban of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: וּבַדַּלַּעַת הָרְמוּצָה. מַאי ״דַּלַּעַת הָרְמוּצָה״? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קַרָּא קַרְקוּזַאי. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: דַּלַּעַת הַטְּמוּנָה בְּרֶמֶץ.
human_translation: permitted to and the remutza gourd. What the remutza gourd? Shmuel said: gourd Karkuza [ kara karkuzai ], Rav Ashi said: A gourd that is insulated in embers [ remetz ].
llm_translation: "And in the creeping gourd. What is 'creeping gourd'? Shmuel said: a striped gourd. Rav Ashi said: a gourd hidden in a pile of manure."

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: דַּלַּעַת אֲרַמִּית הִיא דַּלַּעַת הַמִּצְרִית, כִּלְאַיִם עִם הַיְּוָנִית, כִּלְאַיִם עִם הָרְמוּצָה. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Ravina raised an objection to Rav Ashi Rabbi Neḥemya says an Aramean gourd is the Egyptian gourd, diverse kinds with the Greek diverse kinds with the remutza a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rav Ashi: Rabbi Nechemiah says: "Dalata is Aramaic for the Egyptian ladder, Kilayim with the Greek, Kilayim with the worm." This is a refutation.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִמַּעֲשֵׂה קְדֵרָה — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מִמַּעֲשֵׂה רְתַחְתָּא. אָמַר ״קֻוֽנָּם הַיּוֹרֵד לִקְדֵרָה שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּקְדֵרָה.
human_translation: one who vows cooked in a dish prohibited from only cooked by boiling one said: That which enters into a dish is konam that I taste prohibited anything cooked in a dish,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows from the matter of a pot - it is prohibited only from the matter of boiling. It was said: "Their quail descends to the pot that I taste" - it is prohibited in everything done in the pot.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיּוֹרֵד לִקְדֵרָה — אָסוּר בַּיּוֹרֵד לְאִלְפָּס, שֶׁכְּבָר יָרַד לִקְדֵרָה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיּוֹרַד לְאִלְפָּס. מִן הַיּוֹרֵד לְאִלְפָּס — מוּתָּר בְּיוֹרֵד לִקְדֵרָה. מִן הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּקְדֵרָה — מוּתָּר בְּנַעֲשֶׂה בְּאִלְפָּס. מִן הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בְּאִלְפָּס — מוּתָּר בְּנַעֲשֶׂה בִּקְדֵרָה.
human_translation: It is taught One who vows that which enters into a dish to prohibited from that which enters a stewpot, as it has already entered into a dish before it enters into the stewpot. vowed that that which enters into the stewpot permitted to that which enters into a dish, vows that which is cooked in a dish permitted to that which is cooked in a stewpot, vows that which is cooked in a stewpot permitted to that which is cooked in a dish.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: The one who vows from the one who descends to the cauldron - forbidden in the one who descends to the kiln, because he already descended to the cauldron before descending to the kiln. From the one who descends to the kiln - permitted in the one who descends to the cauldron. From the one who is made in the cauldron - permitted in the one who is made in the kiln. From the one who is made in the kiln - permitted in the one who is made in the cauldron."

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיּוֹרֵד לְתַנּוּר — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא בְּפַת. וְאִם אָמַר: ״כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה תַנּוּר עָלַי״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַנַּעֲשִׂים בְּתַנּוּר.
human_translation: One who vows that which enters into an oven to prohibited only from bread, But if said: Anything made in an oven is to me, prohibited from anything made in an oven.
llm_translation: The one who vows from descending into the oven - not forbidden except with bread. And if he said: "All the work of the oven upon me" - forbidden in all that is done in the oven.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מִן הַכָּבוּשׁ״ — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מִן הַכָּבוּשׁ שֶׁל יָרָק. ״כָּבוּשׁ שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַכְּבוּשִׁים. ״מִן הַשָּׁלוּק״ — אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא מִן הַשָּׁלוּק שֶׁל בָּשָׂר. ״שָׁלוּק שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַשְּׁלוּקִים.
human_translation: pickled food to prohibited from only pickled vegetables, Pickled food that I taste he is prohibited all pickled boiled food to is prohibited from only boiled meat, Boiled food that I taste he is prohibited from all boiled foods.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "From the 'kabush' - only that which is forbidden is from the 'kabush' of vegetables. 'Kabush' that I taste - it is forbidden in all 'kabushim.' 'From the 'shaluk' - it is only forbidden from the 'shaluk' of meat. 'Shaluk' that I taste - it is forbidden in all 'shalukim.'"

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אַוְיָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: אָמַר ״דִּכְבִישׁ״, מַאי? ״דִּשְׁלִיק״, מַאי? ״דִּצְלִי״, מַאי? ״דִּמְלִיחַ״, מַאי? הֵיכֵין מַשְׁמַע? תִּיבְּעֵי.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashi: said: which is pickled what which is boiled what which is roasted what which is salted what What indicate? The dilemma remains
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, Amar lei Rav Acha baray d'Rav Avya l'Rav Ashe. Amar "dichvish," mai? "dishlik," mai? "ditzli," mai? "dimliach," mai? Heichin mashma? Tibei. English translation: Gemara, Rav Acha, the son of Rav Avya, said to Rav Ashe: He said, "dichvish," what? "dishlik," what? "ditzli," what? "dimliach," what? How is it inferred? It should be asked.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״מִן הַצָּלִי״ — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מִן הַצָּלִי שֶׁל בָּשָׂר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. ״צָלִי שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַצְּלוּיִים. ״מִן הַמָּלִיחַ״ — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מִן הַמָּלִיחַ שֶׁל דָּג. ״מָלִיחַ שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַמְּלוּחִים.
human_translation: roasted food to is prohibited from only roasted meat; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Roasted food that I taste he is prohibited from all roasted foods. salted food to is prohibited from only salted fish, Salted food that I taste he is prohibited from all salted foods.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "From roasted" - only prohibited from roasted meat, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. "Roasted that I taste" - prohibited in all roasted foods. "From salted" - only prohibited from salted fish. "Salted that I taste" - prohibited in all salted foods.

hebrew_text: ״דָּג דָּגִים שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בָּהֶן, בֵּין גְּדוֹלִים בֵּין קְטַנִּים, בֵּין מְלוּחִים בֵּין תְּפֵלִים, בֵּין חַיִּים בֵּין מְבוּשָּׁלִים, וּמוּתָּר בְּטָרִית טְרוּפָה, וּבְצִיר. הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַצַּחֲנָה — אָסוּר בְּטָרִית טְרוּפָה, וּמוּתָּר בְּצִיר וּבְמוּרְיָיס. הַנּוֹדֵר מִטָּרִית טְרוּפָה — אָסוּר בְּצִיר וּבְמוּרְיָיס.
human_translation: Fish fishes that I taste he is prohibited from them, whether large or small, whether salted or unsalted, whether raw or cooked. But he is permitted minced sardines and fish brine, One who vows tzaḥana , to is prohibited from minced sardines but he is permitted fish brine and fish gravy [ morays ]. One who vows minced sardines to is prohibited from fish brine and from fish gravy.
llm_translation: "The fish that tastes like fish" - forbidden in them, whether large or small, whether salted or unsalted, whether alive or cooked, but permitted in pickled fish, and in vinegar. One who vows from eating pickled fish - forbidden in vinegar, but permitted in pickled fish and in brine. One who vows from eating vinegar - forbidden in pickled fish and in brine.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: ״דָּג שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בִּגְדוֹלִים, וּמוּתָּר בִּקְטַנִּים. ״דָּגָה שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בִּקְטַנִּים וּמוּתָּר בִּגְדוֹלִים. ״דָּג דָּגָה שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בֵּין בִּגְדוֹלִים בֵּין בִּקְטַנִּים.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: Fish [ dag that I taste is prohibited from large and permitted to small Fish [ daga ] that I taste from small and permitted to eat large ones, Fish [ dag ] fish [ daga that I taste he is prohibited from both large and small
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: 'A fish that I taste' — prohibited with adults, and permitted with minors. 'A fish that I taste' — prohibited with minors, and permitted with adults. 'A fish, a fish that I taste' — prohibited both with adults and with minors."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: מִמַּאי דְּ״דָג שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — גָּדוֹל הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיְמַן ה׳ דָּג גָּדוֹל לִבְלוֹעַ אֶת יוֹנָה״. וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיִּתְפַּלֵּל יוֹנָה אֶל ה׳ אֱלֹהָיו מִמְּעֵי הַדָּגָה״!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: From where that Fish [ dag that I taste a large As it is written: “And the Lord prepared a great fish [ dag ] to swallow up Jonah” But isn’t it written “Then Jonah prayed to the Lord his God out of the belly of the fish [ daga ]”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: From where do you derive that "a large fish that I am tasting" - it is great, as it is written: "And the Lord appointed a great fish to swallow Jonah." And it is written: "And Jonah prayed to the Lord his God from the belly of the fish!"

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא: דִּלְמָא פַּלְטֵיהּ דָּג גָּדוֹל, וּבַלְעֵיהּ דָּג קָטָן. אֶלָּא: ״וְהַדָּגָה אֲשֶׁר בַּיְאוֹר מֵתָה״, קְטַנִּים מֵתוּ, גְּדוֹלִים לֹא מֵתוּ?! אֶלָּא: ״דָּגָה״ — מַשְׁמַע גְּדוֹלִים וּמַשְׁמַע קְטַנִּים, וּבִנְדָרִים הַלֵּךְ אַחַר לְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: This not difficult, perhaps a large fish spat him out and a small fish swallowed him. Rather, “And the fish [ daga ] that were in the river died” small died large ones did not die? Rather, daga indicates large and indicates small However, with regard to vows follow the language of people,
llm_translation: The matter is not difficult: perhaps the large fish swallowed the small fish. Rather, "and the fish that were in the river died," - the small ones died, but the large ones did not die?! Rather, "fish" - it implies both large and small fish, and in vows we follow the language of people.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַצַּחֲנָה כּוּ׳. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, אָמַר: ״הֲרֵי עָלַי צִיחִין״, מַאי? תִּיבְּעֵי.
human_translation: one who vows tzaḥana to Ravina said to Rav Ashi: said: Tziḥin are hereby to me, what The dilemma remains
llm_translation: The one who vows from the white fig tree, etc. Rabinah said to Rav Ashi, he said: "I have tzitzit upon me," what? He should ask.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הֶחָלָב — מוּתָּר בַּקּוֹם, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר. מִן הַקּוֹם — מוּתָּר בֶּחָלָב. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַגְּבִינָה — אָסוּר בָּהּ, בֵּין מְלוּחָה וּטְפֵלָה. הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַבָּשָׂר —
human_translation: One who vows milk to is permitted to whey [ kum ], But Rabbi Yosei prohibits whey to he is permitted to milk. Abba Shaul says: One who vows cheese to is prohibited it whether salted or unsalted. One who vows meat to
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from milk - is permitted to consume cheese, and Rabbi Yosei prohibits it. One who vows to abstain from cheese - is permitted to consume milk. Abba Shaul says: One who vows to abstain from cheese - is prohibited from it, whether salted or unsalted. One who vows to abstain from meat -

hebrew_text: מוּתָּר בָּרוֹטֶב וּבַקֵּיפֶה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹסֵר.
human_translation: is permitted gravy and sediments of boiled meat [ kifa ]. But Rabbi Yehuda prohibited
llm_translation: Permitted in the pit and in the basket, and Rabbi Yehuda prohibits.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה וְאָסַר עָלֵינוּ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן בְּבֵיצִים שֶׁנִּתְבַּשְּׁלוּ עִמּוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כֵּן הַדָּבָר, אֵימָתַי — בִּזְמַן שֶׁיֹּאמַר: ״בָּשָׂר זֶה עָלַי״, שֶׁהַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַדָּבָר וְנִתְעָרֵב בְּאַחֵר, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ בְּנוֹתֵן טַעַם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident and Rabbi Tarfon prohibited us from eggs that were cooked with said to him: Indeed so, when When he says: This meat is to me, because one who vows an item to and it becomes mixed into another if contains that gives flavor, is forbidden.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: An incident occurred, and Rabbi Tarfon prohibited us regarding eggs that were cooked with it. They said to him: This is the matter, when — at the time when one says, "This meat is upon me," that he vowed from the matter and it became mixed with another, if it has a taste — it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיַּיִן — מוּתָּר בְּתַבְשִׁיל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ טַעַם יַיִן. אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן זֶה שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ וְנָפַל לְתַבְשִׁיל, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ בְּנוֹתֵן טַעַם — הֲרֵי זֶה אָסוּר.
human_translation: one who vows wine to is permitted to a cooked dish that has the flavor of wine. he said: This wine is konam that I taste and fell into a cooked dish, if contains that gives flavor, it is forbidden.
llm_translation: The one who vows from wine - permitted in a dish that has the taste of wine. He said: "Prepare this wine that I taste" and it fell into the dish, if it imparts its taste - this is prohibited.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וּרְמִינְהוּ: ״מִן״ הָעֲדָשִׁים״ — אָסוּר בַּאֲשִׁישִׁים, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction lentils are to is prohibited from ashishim , But Rabbi Yosei permits
llm_translation: Gemara: And they raised a dilemma: "From the lentils" - prohibited with the peas, and Rabbi Yosei permits.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: מָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ וּמָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ. בְּאַתְרָא דְרַבָּנַן קָרוּ לַחֲלָבָא חֲלָבָא וּלְקוֹמָא קוֹמָא, בְּאַתְרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְקוֹמָא נָמֵי קָרוּ לֵיהּ ״קוֹמָא דַחֲלָבָא״.
human_translation: not difficult. Sage in accordance with his locale, and Sage in accordance with his locale. In the Rabbis’ locale they call milk, milk and whey, whey, in Rabbi Yosei’s locale they also call whey, milk whey.
llm_translation: The difficulty is not difficult: Master when he was present and Master when he was present. In the place of the Sages they called it "chalava chalava" and "koma koma," in the place of Rabbi Yosei they called it "koma dachalava."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הֶחָלָב — מוּתָּר בַּקּוֹם, מִן הַקּוֹם — מוּתָּר בְּחָלָב. מִן הֶחָלָב — מוּתָּר בִּגְבִינָה, מִן הַגְּבִינָה — מוּתָּר בְּחָלָב. מִן הָרוֹטֶב — מוּתָּר בְּקֵיפֶה, מִן הַקֵּיפֶה — מוּתָּר בְּרוֹטֶב. אִם אָמַר ״בָּשָׂר זֶה עָלַי״ — אָסוּר בּוֹ וּבְרוֹטְבּוֹ וּבְקֵיפוֹ.
human_translation: It is taught One who vows milk to is permitted to whey. whey to is permitted to milk. milk to is permitted to cheese. cheese to is permitted to milk. gravy to is permitted to sediments of boiled meat. sediments of boiled meat is permitted to gravy. If said: This meat is to me, prohibited it, and from its gravy, and from its sediments.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who vows to abstain from milk - is permitted with cheese; from cheese - is permitted with milk. From milk - is permitted with curds; from curds - is permitted with milk. From moist - is permitted with dry; from dry - is permitted with moist. If one says, "This meat is upon me" - it is forbidden to him, and to its moisture, and to its dryness.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיַּיִן — מוּתָּר בְּתַבְשִׁיל שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ טַעַם יַיִן. אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן זֶה שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״ וְנָפַל לְתוֹךְ הַתַּבְשִׁיל, אִם יֵשׁ בּוֹ טַעַם יַיִן — הֲרֵי זֶה אָסוּר.
human_translation: One who vows: Wine to is permitted to a cooked dish that has the flavor of wine. said: This wine is konam that I will not taste and fell into a cooked dish, if contains that gives flavor, it is forbidden.
llm_translation: The one who vows from wine - permitted in a dish that has the taste of wine. He said: "Their vine is from the vine that I do not taste" and it fell into the dish, if it has the taste of wine - this is prohibited.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הָעֲנָבִים — מוּתָּר בְּיַיִן. מִן הַזֵּיתִים — מוּתָּר בְּשֶׁמֶן. אָמַר ״קֻוֽנָּם זֵיתִים וַעֲנָבִים אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בָּהֶן וּבְיוֹצֵא מֵהֶן.
human_translation: One who vows grapes to permitted to wine. olives to is permitted to oil. said: Olives and grapes are konam that I will not taste these prohibited them and that emerge from them.
llm_translation: It was taught: One who vows from grapes - permitted in wine. From olives - permitted in oil. He said, "Kunam, olives, and grapes, these are ones that I do not taste" - it is forbidden in them and in what comes from them.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בָּעֵי רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: ״אֵלּוּ״ דַּוְקָא, אוֹ ״שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״ דַּוְקָא?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: specifically these, or specifically that I will not taste,
llm_translation: Gemara: Gemara asks: "These" specifically, or "that I do not taste" specifically?

hebrew_text: אִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״אֵלּוּ״ דַּוְקָא, ״שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״ לְמָה לִי? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר ״שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״, אִי דְּאָמַר ״אֵלּוּ״ — מִיתְּסַר, וְאִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: If it enters your mind specifically these, why do I That I will not taste? This teaches us that even he said: That I will not taste, if he said these is he prohibited but if not not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If according to your opinion "these" specifically, "that I do not taste" why do I need it? This teaches us that even though he said "that I do not taste," whether he said "these" - he is disciplined, and if not - not.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״קֻוֽנָּם פֵּירוֹת הָאֵלּוּ עָלַי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן לְפִי״ — אָסוּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן, הָא בַּיּוֹצֵא מֵהֶן מוּתָּר!
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear This produce is konam upon me, It is konam to my mouth, he is prohibited from their replacements and grows from them. that emerge from them are permitted.
llm_translation: Rava said, come and hear: "These fruits are forbidden upon me," "they are forbidden according to" — prohibited in their original form and in their growth, but what comes out of them is permitted!

hebrew_text: הוּא הַדִּין דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּיוֹצֵא מֵהֶן אָסוּר. וְהָא עֲדִיפָא לֵיהּ לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן דְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן כְּגִידּוּלֵיהֶן דָּמֵי.
human_translation: The same is true that emerge from too are forbidden. And it is preferable for to teach us that their replacements are like what grows from them
