llm_translation: The same law applies even to one who is derived from them, it is prohibited. And this is preferable for us to hear that their twisting is like their greatness, the value.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״שֶׁאֵינִי אוֹכֵל״, וְ״שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״ — מוּתָּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן. הָא הַיּוֹצֵא מֵהֶן — אָסוּר! אַיְּידֵי דְּלָא נָסֵיב בְּרֵישָׁא ״יוֹצֵא מֵהֶן״, לָא נָסֵיב נָמֵי בְּסֵיפָא ״יוֹצֵא מֵהֶן״.
human_translation: Come hear that I will not eat that I will not taste is permitted to their replacements and grows from them. that emerge from them are forbidden. Since did not cite that emerge from them in the first clause, it did not cite that emerge from them in the latter clause either.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'That I do not eat,' and 'That I do not taste' — permitted in their exchange and in their growth. But that which comes out of them — forbidden! For if it was not stated at the beginning 'that which comes out of them,' it would also not be stated at the end 'that which comes out of them."

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה וְאָסַר רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן עָלַי בֵּיצִים שֶׁנִּתְבַּשְּׁלוּ עִמּוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אֵימָתַי, בִּזְמַן שֶׁאָמַר ״בָּשָׂר זֶה עָלַי״, שֶׁהַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַדָּבָר וְנִתְעָרֵב בְּאַחֵר, וְיֵשׁ בּוֹ בְּנוֹתֵן טַעַם — הֲרֵי זֶה אָסוּר.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident where Rabbi Tarfon prohibited me from eggs that were cooked with said to him: Indeed so, when When said: This meat is to me, because one who vows something to and it gets mixed into another and contains that gives flavor, is forbidden.
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Yehuda said: A case occurred, and Rabbi Tarfon prohibited me regarding eggs that were cooked with him. They said to him: When? At the time when he said, "This meat is upon me," meaning one who vows from a matter and it becomes mixed with another, and there is a taste in it — this is prohibited.

hebrew_text: בְּ״אֵלּוּ״ — לָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לַן דְּדַוְקָא הוּא. כִּי מִיבַּעְיָא לַן בְּ״שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״ — דַּוְקָא, אוֹ לָאו דַּוְקָא?
human_translation: We do not raise the dilemma with regard to these, as specifically this When we raise a dilemma, it is with regard to That I will not taste specifically or not specifically
llm_translation: In these — not is asking to us that specifically it is. When is asking to us in "that he is not tasting" — specifically, or not specifically?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״דָּג דָּגִים שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בָּהֶן, בֵּין גְּדוֹלִים בֵּין קְטַנִּים, בֵּין חַיִּים בֵּין מְבוּשָּׁלִים, וּמוּתָּר בְּטָרִית טְרוּפָה וּבְצִיר.
human_translation: Come hear Fish fishes that I will not taste he is prohibited with regard to them, whether large or small, whether raw or cooked. But he is permitted minced sardines and fish brine.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'A fish of fish that I do not taste' — forbidden in them, whether large or small, whether alive or cooked, and permitted in a mixture of terefah and clean."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּכְבָר יָצָא מֵהֶן.
human_translation: Rava said: But already emerged from them
llm_translation: Rava said: And already he has departed from them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַתְּמָרִים — מוּתָּר בִּדְבַשׁ תְּמָרִים. מִסִּתְוָנִיּוֹת — מוּתָּר בְּחוֹמֶץ סִתְוָנִיּוֹת. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁשֵּׁם תּוֹלַדְתּוֹ קְרוּיָה עָלָיו, וְנוֹדֵר הֵימֶנּוּ — אָסוּר בַּיּוֹצֵא הֵימֶנּוּ, וַחֲכָמִים מַתִּירִים.
human_translation: One who vows dates to is permitted to date honey. late grapes to is permitted to vinegar of late grapes. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: any that the name of its derivative is called after its and one vows prohibited from that emerges from it. But the Rabbis permit
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from dates - is permitted to eat date honey. One who vows to abstain from fig cakes - is permitted to eat vinegar made from fig cakes. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: Any item whose derivative name is called by its name, and one vows to abstain from it - is prohibited from its derivative, and the Sages permit it.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ [חֲכָמִים] הַיְינוּ תַּנָּא קַמָּא?
human_translation: the Rabbis is the first tanna
llm_translation: "Gema' Chachamim hainu tana kama?"

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ הָדָא דְּתַנְיָא: כְּלָל זֶה אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר: כֹּל שֶׁדַּרְכּוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל, וְדֶרֶךְ הַיּוֹצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ לֶאֱכוֹל. כְּגוֹן תְּמָרִים וּדְבַשׁ תְּמָרִים, נָדַר בּוֹ — אָסוּר בַּיּוֹצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ, נוֹדֵר מִיּוֹצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ — אָסוּר בּוֹ.
human_translation: There is between them that which is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said this principle: anything that is commonly eaten and it is common to eat that emerges from it, for example, dates and date honey, vowed it is forbidden to him, prohibited that emerges from it. one vows that emerges from it prohibited from it.
llm_translation: There is a difference between them, as it was taught: This principle Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Anyone whose normal practice is to eat, and the way that comes out from him is to eat. For example, dates and date honey. If he made a vow regarding it — it is prohibited in what comes out from him. If he vowed concerning what comes out from him — it is prohibited in it.

hebrew_text: כֹּל שֶׁאֵין דַּרְכּוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל, וְדֶרֶךְ הַיּוֹצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ לֶאֱכוֹל, נוֹדֵר בּוֹ — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְכַּוֵּון זֶה אֶלָּא לַיּוֹצֵא מִמֶּנּוּ.
human_translation: anything that is not commonly eaten and it is common to eat that emerges from it, vowed from it, prohibited from only that emerges from it, as this intended to only that emerges from it.
llm_translation: All that his way is not to eat, and the way that comes out from him to eat, he vows upon it - it is forbidden only in the way that comes out from him, for he did not intend this except for the way that comes out from him.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיַּיִן — מוּתָּר בְּיֵין תַּפּוּחִים. מִן הַשֶּׁמֶן — מוּתָּר בְּשֶׁמֶן שׁוּמְשְׁמִין. מִן הַדְּבַשׁ — מוּתָּר בִּדְבַשׁ תְּמָרִים.
human_translation: One who vows wine to is permitted apple wine, oil is to permitted sesame oil, honey permitted date honey,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who vows to abstain from wine - is permitted to drink apple wine. One who vows to abstain from oil - is permitted to use sesame oil. One who vows to abstain from honey - is permitted to eat date honey.

hebrew_text: מִן הַחוֹמֶץ — מוּתָּר בְּחוֹמֶץ סִתְוָנִיּוֹת. מִן הַכְּרֵישִׁין — מוּתָּר בְּקַפְלוֹטוֹת. מִן הַיָּרָק — מוּתָּר בְּיַרְקוֹת הַשָּׂדֶה, שֶׁהוּא שֵׁם לָווּיי.
human_translation: vinegar permitted vinegar of late grapes, leeks permitted kaflutot , vegetables permitted field vegetables, as this a modifier
llm_translation: From vinegar - permissible with pickled vegetables. From leeks - permissible with beet leaves. From vegetables - permissible with field greens, which is the name of Levite.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַשֶּׁמֶן, בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל — מוּתָּר בְּשֶׁמֶן שׁוּמְשְׁמִין, וְאָסוּר בְּשֶׁמֶן זַיִת. וּבְבָבֶל — אָסוּר בְּשֶׁמֶן שׁוּמְשְׁמִין, וּמוּתָּר בְּשֶׁמֶן זַיִת. מָקוֹם שֶׁמִּסְתַּפְּקִין מִזֶּה וּמִזֶּה — אָסוּר בָּזֶה וּבָזֶה.
human_translation: It is taught one who vows oil to in Eretz Yisrael permitted to sesame oil and prohibited from olive oil, And in Babylonia, sesame oil forbidden and permitted to olive oil, a locale where use this and that he is prohibited from this and that.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: It was taught: One who vows to abstain from oil, in the land of Israel — is permitted with sesame oil, and forbidden with olive oil. But in Babylonia — forbidden with sesame oil, and permitted with olive oil. In a place where they are in doubt from this and from that — it is forbidden with this and with that."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּרוּבָּא מִן חַד מִסְתַּפְּקִין. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אֵיזִיל בָּתַר רוּבָּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן סָפֵק אִיסּוּרָא לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: Isn’t obvious No, necessary where most use one Lest you say: I should follow the majority teaches us an uncertain prohibition stringently.
llm_translation: It is obvious! It is not necessary, for most cases are doubtful. What might you say: I will go after the majority, it implies to us a doubt of prohibition for stringency.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיָּרָק, בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ — אָסוּר בְּיַרְקוֹת הַגִּינָּה, וּמוּתָּר בְּיַרְקוֹת הַשָּׂדֶה. וּבַשְּׁבִיעִית — אָסוּר בְּיַרְקוֹת הַשָּׂדֶה, וּמוּתָּר בְּיַרְקוֹת הַגִּינָּה. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל:
human_translation: one who vows vegetables to during the years of the seven-year cycle, prohibited from garden vegetables and permitted to field vegetables. But during the Sabbatical Year, prohibited from field vegetables, and permitted to garden vegetables, Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel:
llm_translation: The one who vows from the vegetables, during the rest of the two weeks - forbidden in the vegetables of the garden, and permitted in the vegetables of the field. And in the seventh year - forbidden in the vegetables of the field, and permitted in the vegetables of the garden. Rabbi Avahu said in the name of Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel:

hebrew_text: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁאֵין מְבִיאִין יָרָק מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ. אֲבָל בְּמָקוֹם שֶׁמְּבִיאִין יָרָק מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ — אָסוּר.
human_translation: They taught only in a place where do not bring vegetables from outside Eretz to Eretz However, in a place where bring vegetables from outside Eretz to Eretz prohibited
llm_translation: They only taught this in a place where they do not bring vegetables from outside the land to the land. But in a place where they bring vegetables from outside the land to the land - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: כְּתַנָּאֵי: אֵין מְבִיאִין יָרָק מִן חוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ, רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מְבִיאִין יָרָק מֵחוּצָה לָאָרֶץ לָאָרֶץ. מַאי טַעְמֵיהּ דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מְבִיאִין? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מִשּׁוּם גּוּשׁ.
human_translation: like tanna’im One may not bring vegetables from outside Eretz to Eretz Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel says: One may bring vegetables from outside Eretz to Eretz What is the reason of the one who said one may not bring Rabbi Yirmeya said: because a clod
llm_translation: Tannaim: One does not bring vegetables from outside to inside, Rabbi Hananiah ben Gamliel says: One brings vegetables from outside to inside. What is the reason of the one who says one does not bring? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: Because of guf.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִן הַכְּרוּב — אָסוּר בְּאִיסְפַּרְגוֹס, מִן הָאִיסְפַּרְגוֹס — מוּתָּר בִּכְרוּב.
human_translation: cabbage to is prohibited from ispargus , ispargus to permitted to cabbage.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: From the cherub - forbidden in isparagos, from the isparagos - permitted in cherub.

hebrew_text: מִן הַגְּרִיסִין — אָסוּר בְּמִקְפָּה, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר. מִן הַמִּקְפָּה — מוּתָּר בִּגְרִיסִין. מִן הַמִּקְפָּה — אָסוּר בִּשּׁוּם, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר. מִן הַשּׁוּם — מוּתָּר בְּמִקְפָּה.
human_translation: pounded beans to is prohibited from stew [ mikpa ]. However, Rabbi Yosei permitted stew to permitted to pounded beans stew to is prohibited from garlic However, Rabbi Yosei permitted garlic to is permitted to stew.
llm_translation: From the kernels - prohibited in the husk, and Rabbi Yosei permits. From the husk - permitted in the kernels. From the husk - prohibited in the sesame, and Rabbi Yosei permits. From the sesame - permitted in the husk.

hebrew_text: מִן הָעֲדָשִׁים — אָסוּר בַּאֲשִׁישִׁים, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מַתִּיר. מִן הָאֲשִׁישִׁים — מוּתָּר בַּעֲדָשִׁים.
human_translation: lentils to is prohibited from ashishim , Rabbi Yosei permits ashishim to is permitted to lentils.
llm_translation: From lentils - forbidden in lentil soup, Rabbi Yosei permits. From lentil soup - permitted in lentils.

hebrew_text: ״חִטָּה חִטִּין שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בָּהֶן בֵּין קֶמַח בֵּין הַפַּת. ״גְּרִיס גְּרִיסִין שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בָּהֶן בֵּין חַיִּין בֵּין מְבוּשָּׁלִין. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״קֻוֽנָּם גְּרִיס אוֹ חִטָּה שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — מוּתָּר לָכוֹס חַיִּים.
human_translation: Ḥitta , ḥittim , that I taste prohibited from whether flour or bread. Pounded bean pounded beans that I taste prohibited from them, whether raw or cooked. Rabbi Yehuda says Pounded bean or ḥitta is konam that I taste permitted to chew raw,
llm_translation: "Wheat, wheat kernels that I taste" - it is forbidden to eat them whether in the form of flour or bread. "Barley, barley kernels that I taste" - it is forbidden to eat them whether raw or cooked. Rabbi Yehuda says: "If one grinds barley or wheat that I taste" - it is permitted to use them for the cup of blessing."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: ״חִטָּה שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר לֶאֱפוֹת וּמוּתָּר לָכוֹס. ״חִטִּים שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר לָכוֹס וּמוּתָּר לֶאֱפוֹת. ״חִטָּה חִטִּין שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בֵּין לָכוֹס בֵּין לֶאֱפוֹת.
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says Ḥitta that I taste prohibited from baked but permitted to chew Ḥittim that I taste prohibited from chewing but permitted to bake Ḥitta ḥittin that I taste prohibited both from chewing from baking
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Rabbi Shimon ben Gamliel says: 'Wheat that I taste' — forbidden to bake and permitted to soak. 'Grains that I taste' — forbidden to soak and permitted to bake. 'Wheat and grains that I taste' — forbidden both to soak and to bake."

hebrew_text: ״גְּרִיס שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר לְבַשֵּׁל וּמוּתָּר לָכוֹס. ״גְּרִיסִין שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר לָכוֹס וּמוּתָּר לְבַשֵּׁל. ״גְּרִיס גְּרִיסִין שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — אָסוּר בֵּין לְבַשֵּׁל בֵּין לָכוֹס.
human_translation: Pounded bean that I taste prohibited from cooking but permitted to chew Pounded beans that I taste prohibited from chewing but permitted to cook Pounded bean pounded beans that I taste prohibited from both cooking and chewing
llm_translation: "Griss she'ani to'em" — forbidden to cook and permitted to soak. "Grissin she'ani to'em" — forbidden to soak and permitted to cook. "Griss grissin she'ani to'em" — forbidden both to cook and to soak.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַמְבוּשָּׁל
llm_translation: We will return to you, the one who abstains from the cooked dish.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיָּרָק — מוּתָּר בַּדִּלּוּעִין, וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹסֵר. אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: וַהֲלֹא אוֹמֵר אָדָם לִשְׁלוּחוֹ ״קַח לִי יָרָק״, וְהוּא אוֹמֵר: ״לֹא מָצָאתִי אֶלָּא דִּלּוּעִין״.
human_translation: one who vows vegetables to is permitted to gourds, and Rabbi Akiva prohibits said to Rabbi Akiva: But doesn’t a person say to his agent: Purchase vegetables for me, and says: I found only gourds?
llm_translation: The one who vows from vegetables - permitted in dilu'in, and Rabbi Akiva prohibits. They said to Rabbi Akiva: But doesn't a person say to his messenger, "Take for me vegetables," and he says, "I only found dilu'in."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: כֵּן הַדָּבָר, אוֹ שֶׁמָּא אוֹמֵר הוּא ״לֹא מָצָאתִי אֶלָּא קִיטְנִית״? אֶלָּא, שֶׁהַדִּלּוּעִין בִּכְלַל יָרָק, וְקִיטְנִית אֵינוֹ בִּכְלַל יָרָק. וְאָסוּר בְּפוֹל הַמִּצְרִי לַח, וּמוּתָּר בַּיָּבֵשׁ.
human_translation: said to them: The matter is so, or perhaps, say: I found only legumes? Rather, that gourds are included in vegetables, And legumes are not included in vegetables, And is prohibited to the fresh cowpea and is permitted to dry
llm_translation: He said to them: Is this the matter, or perhaps he says, "I found only a gourd"? Rather, the leaves are included in the category of vegetables, and a gourd is not included in the category of vegetables. And it is prohibited to soak in Egyptian beer, but it is permitted in dry beer.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיָּרָק כּוּ׳. וְהָא מִן יָרָק נְדַר! אָמַר עוּלָּא: בְּאוֹמֵר ״יַרְקֵי קְדֵרָה עָלַי״, וְדִילְמָא יָרָק הַנֶּאֱכָל בִּקְדֵרָה קָאָמַר? בְּאוֹמֵר ״יָרָק הַמִּתְבַּשֵּׁל בִּקְדֵרָה עָלַי״.
human_translation: one who vows vegetables to But didn’t he vow from vegetables? Ulla said: to one who said: Vegetables in a pot to me. And perhaps he is saying: A vegetable that is eaten in a pot, to one who said: A vegetable that is cooked in a pot to me,
llm_translation: Gemara: One who vows from the vegetables - thus. But isn't it from vegetables that he vowed! Ulla said: When he says, "Cabbage is upon me," perhaps he means cabbage that is eaten in a pot? Rather, when he says, "Vegetables that are cooked in a pot are upon me."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: כֹּל מִילְּתָא דִּצְרִיךְ שְׁלִיחָא לְאִמְּלוֹכֵי עֲלַהּ — לָאו מִינֵיהּ הוּא. וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: כֹּל מִילְּתָא דְּמִימְּלִיךְ שְׁלִיחָא עֲלַהּ — מִינֵיהּ הוּא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא לְעִנְיַן מַלְקוֹת, שֶׁאֵינוֹ לוֹקֶה.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? the Rabbis maintain: Any item with regard to which an agent must consult is not type. And Rabbi Akiva maintains: Any item with regard to which an agent consult is type. Abaye said: Rabbi Akiva concedes with regard to lashes that is not flogged
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what do they argue? The Rabbis hold: any matter that requires a messenger to perform it on his behalf - it is not considered as his own act. And Rabbi Akiva holds: any matter that when a messenger performs it on his behalf - it is considered as his own act. Abaye said: Rabbi Akiva concedes in the case of lashes, as he is not flogged. English translation:

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַשָּׁלִיחַ שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ — בַּעַל הַבַּיִת מָעַל. לֹא עָשָׂה שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ — שָׁלִיחַ מָעַל.
human_translation: We learned there an agent who performed his mission the employer, misused did not perform his mission agent misused
llm_translation: We learned there: The agent who fulfilled his agency - the homeowner is liable. If he did not fulfill his agency - the agent is liable.

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דִּתְנַן: כֵּיצַד? אָמַר לוֹ: ״תֵּן בָּשָׂר לָאוֹרְחִים״ וְנָתַן לָהֶם כָּבֵד, ״תֵּן כָּבֵד״ וְנָתַן לָהֶם בָּשָׂר — הַשָּׁלִיחַ מָעַל. וְאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָא אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: כֹּל מִילְּתָא דְּמִימְּלִיךְ עֲלַהּ שָׁלִיחַ — מִינֵיהּ הוּא, לִמְעוֹל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת וְלָא לִמְעוֹל שָׁלִיחַ!
human_translation: Who is tanna taught Rav Ḥisda said: The mishna not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva as we learned How so? said to Give meat to the guests, and he gave them liver; Give liver, and he gave them meat, the agent has misused And if Rabbi Akiva, didn’t Rabbi Akiva say: Any matter with regard to which an agent must consult is type? let the employer for misuse and let the agent not for misuse
llm_translation: Who taught it? Rav Ḥisdah said: The Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Akiva, for we learned: How so? He said to him: "Give meat to the guests," and he gave them liver. "Give liver," and he gave them meat - the agent has acted treacherously. And if it were Rabbi Akiva, did not Rabbi Akiva say: Any matter that a messenger takes upon himself - it is his responsibility, to act treacherously towards the homeowner and not towards the messenger!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא,
human_translation: Abaye said: Even you say Rabbi Akiva,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Even if you say Rabbi Akiva,

hebrew_text: מִי לָא מוֹדֶה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דִּצְרִיךְ אִימְּלוֹכֵי? אִיתְּמַר שְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר לְהוֹן: שַׁפִּיר אָמַר נַחְמָנִי.
human_translation: doesn’t Rabbi Akiva concede that must consult was stated before Rava. He said to Naḥmani, spoke well.
llm_translation: Who does Rabbi Akiva agree with that he needs to say "Immelokhei"? It was stated a teaching before Rava. He said to them: "Nahmani said well."

hebrew_text: מַאן תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא — רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַבָּשָׂר — אָסוּר בְּכׇל מִינֵי בָשָׂר, וְאָסוּר בָּרֹאשׁ וּבָרַגְלַיִם וּבַקָּנֶה וּבַכָּבֵד וּבַלֵּב, וּבְעוֹפוֹת, וּמוּתָּר בִּבְשַׂר דָּגִים וַחֲגָבִים.
human_translation: Who is the tanna who disagrees with of Rabbi Akiva It is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, as it is taught one who vows meat to is prohibited all types of meat, and is prohibited of the head, and of the feet, and of the windpipe, and of the liver, and of the heart, And of birds, However, is permitted of the meat of fish and grasshoppers,
llm_translation: The one who taught the dispute regarding Rabbi Akiva - it is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel. As it was taught: One who vows from meat - it is prohibited in all types of meat, and prohibited in the head, legs, intestines, liver, and heart, and in birds, and permitted in fish meat and locusts.

hebrew_text: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַבָּשָׂר — אָסוּר בְּכׇל מִינֵי בָשָׂר, וּמוּתָּר בָּרֹאשׁ וּבָרַגְלַיִם וּבַקָּנֶה וּבַכָּבֵד וּבַלֵּב וּבְעוֹפוֹת, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר בְּשַׂר דָּגִים וַחֲגָבִים. וְכֵן הָיָה רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: קְרָבַיִים לָאו בָּשָׂר, וְאוֹכְלֵיהֶן לָאו בַּר אִינָשׁ. אוֹכְלֵיהֶן כְּבָשָׂר, לְעִנְיַן זְבִינֵי — לָאו בַּר אִינָשׁ.
human_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One who vows meat to is forbidden in all types of meat, and is permitted of the head, and of the feet, and of the windpipe, and of the liver, and of the heart and of birds, and needless to say fish and grasshoppers. And Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel would likewise say: Innards are not meat, and one who eats them is not a person, one who eats them, as meat. with regard to purchase, is not a person.
llm_translation: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: One who vows from meat - forbidden in all types of meat, and permitted in the head, legs, intestines, liver, and heart, and in birds, and needless to say in fish and locusts. And so Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Entrails are not meat, and those who eat them are not considered people. If one eats them like meat, for the purpose of sacrifices - they are not considered people.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא בְּשַׂר עוֹף לְתַנָּא קַמָּא דַּאֲסִיר — דַּעֲבִיד שְׁלִיחָא דְּמִימְּלִיךְ עֲלֵיהּ. בְּשַׂר דָּגִים נָמֵי עָבֵיד שְׁלִיחָא, דְּאִי לָא מַשְׁכַּח בִּישְׂרָא, מִימְּלִיךְ עֲלֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: אִי לָא מַשְׁכַּחְנָא בִּישְׂרָא אַיְיתֵי דָּגִים, וְלִיתַּסְרוּ!
human_translation: What is different the meat of a bird according to the first tanna , that he prohibits it that the agent he tends to consult about it? meat of fish too. If the agent does not find meat, he tends to consult about it, as he says: If I do not find meat, should I bring fish? And let be forbidden
llm_translation: What is the difference with regard to the prohibition of bird meat according to the first Tanna? Because he appoints a messenger to bring it to him. Fish meat also, he appoints a messenger, for if he does not find in Israel, he appoints a messenger, as it says: "If we do not find in Israel, we will bring fish, and we will not be deprived!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהִקִּיז דָּם, דְּלָא אָכֵיל דָּגִים. אִי הָכִי, אֲפִילּוּ עוֹפוֹת נָמֵי לָא אָכֵיל. דְּאָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: דִּמְסוֹכַר וְאָכֵיל בִּישְׂרָא דְצִפְּרָא — פָּרַח לִבֵּיהּ כְּצִפְּרָא! וְתַנְיָא: אֵין מַקִּיזִין לֹא עַל דָּגִים, וְלֹא עַל עוֹפוֹת, וְלֹא עַל בָּשָׂר מָלִיחַ. וְתַנְיָא: הִקִּיז דָּם — לֹא יֹאכַל לֹא חָלָב, וְלֹא גְּבִינָה, וְלֹא בֵּיצִים, וְלֹא שַׁחֲלַיִים, וְלֹא עוֹפוֹת, וְלֹא בָּשָׂר מָלִיחַ! שָׁאנֵי עוֹפוֹת, דְּאֶפְשָׁר עַל יְדֵי שְׁלִיקָה.
human_translation: Abaye said: where he let blood as does not eat fish. If so, he not eat birds either, as Shmuel said: who lets blood and eats the meat of a bird, his heart flies like a bird. And it is taught One neither lets blood before fish, nor before birds, nor before salted meat. And it is taught let blood, he may eat neither milk, nor cheese, nor eggs, nor cress, nor birds, nor salted meat. birds is different, as is possible by means of boiling
llm_translation: Abaye said: For example, one who has a nosebleed, should not eat fish. If so, even birds should also not be eaten. For Shmuel said: One who is congested and eats the meat of a bird, his heart will be as light as a feather! And it was taught: One should not have a nosebleed neither on fish, nor on birds, nor on salty meat. And it was taught: If one has a nosebleed, he should not eat neither milk, nor cheese, nor eggs, nor garlic, nor birds, nor salty meat! Birds are different, as it is possible through roasting.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: כְּגוֹן דְּכָיְיבִין לֵיהּ עֵינֵיהּ, דְּדָגִים קָשִׁין לָעֵינַיִם. אִי הָכִי אָכֵיל דָּגִים, דְּהָא אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: נוּן סָמֶךְ עַיִן — נוּנָא סַמָּא לְעֵינַיִם! הָהוּא סוֹף אוּכְלָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: where his eyes hurt him, as fish are harmful for eyes. If so, eat fish, as Shmuel said Nun , samekh , ayin , Nuna samma la’einayim , That latter of the infection.
llm_translation: Abaye said: For example, when her eyes are hurting her, fish are harmful to the eyes. If so, let her eat fish, for Samuel said: Nun supports the eye - nun and samach are similar in appearance! That is the end of the matter.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַדָּגָן — אָסוּר בְּפוֹל הַמִּצְרִי יָבֵשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא בַּחֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַתְּבוּאָה — אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא מֵחֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין. אֲבָל הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַדָּגָן — אָסוּר בַּכֹּל, וּמוּתָּר בְּפֵירוֹת הָאִילָן וּבַיָּרָק.
human_translation: one who vows grain [ dagan ] to is prohibited to the dry cowpea, the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: is prohibited of only the five species Rabbi Meir says: one who vows from grain [ tevua ], is prohibited from the five species However, one who vows from grain [ dagan ], is prohibited to all and is permitted to fruits of the tree and vegetables.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from grain - it is forbidden to eat dry Egyptian flax, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. But the Sages say: It is only forbidden with the five species. Rabbi Meir says: One who vows to abstain from produce - it is only forbidden from the five species. However, one who vows to abstain from grain - it is forbidden in everything, but permitted in tree fruits and vegetables.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמֵימְרָא דְּ״דָגָן״ — כֹּל דְּמִידְּגַן מַשְׁמַע. מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: ״וְכִפְרֹץ הַדָּבָר הִרְבּוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל [רֵאשִׁית] דָּגָן תִּירוֹשׁ וְיִצְהָר וְכֹל תְּבוּאַת שָׂדֶה לָרֹב וְגוֹ׳״, וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ דָּגָן — כֹּל דְּמִידְּגַן מַשְׁמַע, מַאי ״כִּפְרֹץ הַדָּבָר הִרְבּוּ״? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְאֵתוֹיֵי פֵּירוֹת הָאִילָן וְיָרָק.
human_translation: Is this to say that dagan means any that is placed in a pile [ midgan ]? Rav Yosef raised an objection: “And as soon as the matter was publicized, the children of Israel gave in abundance the first fruits of dagan , wine, and oil, and of all the tevua of the field; in abundance” And if you say dagan means any that is placed in a pile, what is “As soon as the matter was publicized, gave in abundance Abaye said: to include fruits of the tree and vegetables,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara to the statement of "dagan" - anyone who benefits from grain implies. Rav Yosef raises an objection: "And as the word of the matter spread, the children of Israel increased abundantly the first of grain, wine, and oil, and all the produce of the field in abundance, etc." If you say "grain" - anyone who benefits from grain implies, what is the meaning of "and as the word of the matter spread, they increased"? Abaye said: To include the fruits of the tree and vegetables.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַתְּבוּאָה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים בְּנוֹדֵר מִן הַתְּבוּאָה שֶׁאֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מֵחֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: שָׁוִין בַּנּוֹדֵר מִן הַתְּבוּאָה שֶׁאֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מֵחֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״תְּבוּאָה״ — כׇּל מִלֵּי מַשְׁמַע, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא מַשְׁמַע כׇּל מִלִּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: one who vows grain tevua ] to Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Everyone concedes with regard to one who vows tevua to that is prohibited from only the five species That is also taught And they agree with regard to one who vows tevua to that is prohibited from only the five species Isn’t obvious, lest you say tevua means all items teaches us that does not mean all items
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: One who vows from produce, etc. Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone agrees regarding one who vows from produce that it is only prohibited from the five species. It was also taught similarly: They are equal regarding one who vows from produce that it is only prohibited from the five species. It is obvious! Lest you say: "Produce" - all words imply, it comes to teach us that not all words imply.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב יוֹסֵף: ״וְכִפְרֹץ הַדָּבָר הִרְבּוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל כּוּ׳״, אָמַר רָבָא: ״תְּבוּאָה״ לְחוּד, ״תְּבוּאַת שָׂדֶה״ לְחוּד.
human_translation: Rav Yosef raised an objection: “And as soon as the matter was publicized, the children of Israel in abundance… Rava said: Tevua is discrete and tevua of the field is discrete
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And as for Perez, the matter was multiplied by the children of Israel" (Numbers 26:22). Rava said: "Produce" is separate, "produce of the field" is separate.

hebrew_text: בַּר מָר שְׁמוּאֵל פַּקֵּיד דְּלִיתְּנוּן תְּלֵיסַר אַלְפֵי זוּזִי לְרָבָא מִן עֲלַלְתָּא דִּנְהַר פַּנְיָא. שַׁלְחַהּ רָבָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף: ״עֲלַלְתָּא״ הֵיכִי מִיקַּרְיָא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, מַתְנִיתִין הִיא: וְשָׁוִין בַּנּוֹדֵר מִן הַתְּבוּאָה שֶׁאֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא מֵחֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: מִי דָּמֵי? ״תְּבוּאָה״ — לָא מַשְׁמַע אֶלָּא מֵחֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין, ״עֲלַלְתָּא״ — כׇּל מִילֵּי מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: The son of Master Shmuel commanded that they give thirteen thousand dinars to Rava from the crop [ alalta ] of the Panya River. Rava sent before Rav Yosef: What is called alalta ; Rav Yosef said: It is baraita And they agree with regard to one who vows tevua to that is prohibited from only the five species Abaye said to Are comparable? tevua means only the five species, alalta means all items
llm_translation: Son of Mar is his name, Samuel the steward, who would collect thirteen thousand dinars for Rava from the produce of the riverbank. Rava sent him before Rav Yosef. "How is it called 'produce'?" asked Rav Yosef. Rav Yosef said, it is a Mishnah: "And they are equal in the case of produce, which is prohibited only from the five species." Abaye said to him: Who is similar? 'Produce'—it only implies from the five species, 'riverbank'—it implies all matters.

hebrew_text: אַהְדְּרוּהוּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. אֲמַר: הָא לָא קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לִי דַּ״עֲלַלְתָּא״ כׇּל מִילֵּי מַשְׁמַע. הָדָא הוּא דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לִי: שְׂכַר בָּתִּים וּשְׂכַר סְפִינוֹת מַאי? מִי אָמְרִינַן: כֵּיוָן דְּפָחֲתָן, לָאו עֲלַלְתָּא הִיא. אוֹ דִילְמָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלָא יְדִיעַ פְּחָתַיְיהוּ — עֲלַלְתָּא הִיא. אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, אָמַר: וְכִי מֵאַחַר דְּלָא צְרִיךְ לַן, אַמַּאי שְׁלַח לַן? אִיקְּפַד רַב יוֹסֵף.
human_translation: returned before Rava. He said: That was not a dilemma for me, that alalta means all items This is that is a dilemma for me: What is rent of houses and the rent of boats? Do we say: Since they depreciate, not that a crop? Or perhaps, since their depreciation is not conspicuous, is a crop. The Rabbis stated before Rav Yosef. said: And since he does not need us, why did he send us Rav Yosef became angry
llm_translation: Return him before Rava. He said: This is not what I asked for, "What is the reward for building houses and the reward for ships?" Do we say: Since they diminish, it is not considered "building"? Or perhaps: Since their owners are not aware, it is considered "building"? The Rabbis said before Rav Yosef: And since we do not need it, why did he send it to us? Rav Yosef became upset.

hebrew_text: שְׁמַע רָבָא, וַאֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ בְּמַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִפּוּרֵי. אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ דַּהֲוָה קָא מָזֵיג קַמֵּיהּ כָּסָא דְחַמְרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַב לִי דְּאֶמְזִיג לֵיהּ אֲנָא. יְהַב לֵיהּ, וְקָא מָזֵיג אִיהוּ כָּסָא דְחַמְרָא. כִּי קָא שָׁתֵי אֲמַר: הָדֵין מִיזְגָּא דָּמֵי לְמִיזְגָּא דְּרָבָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָמָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הוּא נִיהוּ.
human_translation: Rava heard and came before him on Yom Kippur eve He found the attendant of Rav Yosef, who was diluting a cup of wine before him. said to Give me that I will dilute for him. gave to him and diluted the cup of wine. While was drinking he said: This dilution is similar to the dilution of Rava, son of Rav Yosef bar Ḥama, said to him: it is he.
llm_translation: Listen, Rava, and he came before him on the eve of Yom Kippur. He found him pouring a cup of wine before him like the cup of wine. He said to him: "Give me that I may pour it for you." He gave it to him, and he poured for him the cup of wine. When he drank, he said: "This cup of wine is like the cup of wine of Rava, son of Rav Yosef Bar Chama." He said to him: "It is indeed he."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא תִּיתֵּיב אַכַּרְעָךְ עַד דְּאָמְרַתְּ לִי פֵּירוּשָׁא דְּהָדֵין מִילְּתָא: מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמִמִּדְבָּר מַתָּנָה וּמִמַּתָּנָה נַחֲלִיאֵל וּמִנַּחֲלִיאֵל בָּמוֹת״?
human_translation: said to Do not sit on your feet until you tell me the explanation of this matter: What is which is written: “And from the wilderness Mattana and from Mattana Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel Bamot”
llm_translation: He said to him: Do not sit down until you explain to me the matter. What is written: "And from the wilderness a gift, and from the gift Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel the heights"?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה אָדָם אֶת עַצְמוֹ כַּמִּדְבָּר, שֶׁהוּא מוּפְקָר לַכֹּל — תּוֹרָה נִיתְּנָה לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִמִּדְבָּר מַתָּנָה״. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנִּיתְּנָה לוֹ בְּמַתָּנָה — נְחָלוֹ אֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִמַּתָּנָה נַחֲלִיאֵל״. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנְּחָלוֹ אֵל — עוֹלֶה לִגְדוּלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִנַּחֲלִיאֵל בָּמוֹת״. וְאִם הִגְבִּיהַּ עַצְמוֹ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַשְׁפִּילוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּמִבָּמוֹת הַגַּיְא״, וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁשּׁוֹקְעִין אוֹתוֹ בַּקַּרְקַע, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִשְׁקָפָה עַל פְּנֵי הַיְשִׁימוֹן״. וְאִם חוֹזֵר בּוֹ — הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַגְבִּיהוֹ
human_translation: said to him Once a person renders himself like a wilderness, deserted before all, the Torah is given to him as a gift [ mattana ], as it is stated: “And from the wilderness Mattana.” And once it is given to him as a gift, God bequeaths [ naḥalo ] him, as it is stated: “And from Mattana Nahaliel.” And once God bequeaths him, he rises to greatness, as it is stated: And from Nahaliel, Bamot, And if he elevates himself the Holy One, Blessed be He, degrades him, as it is stated: “And from Bamot the valley” And not only but one lowers him into the ground, as it is stated: “And looking over [ nishkafa ] the face of the wasteland” And if he reverses his the Holy One, Blessed be He, elevates him,
llm_translation: He said to him: Once a person makes himself like a desert, open to all - the Torah is given to him as a gift, as it is said: "And from the desert a gift." And once it is given to him as a gift - he becomes an inheritance to God, as it is said: "And from the gift, an inheritance to God." And once he becomes an inheritance to God - he rises to greatness, as it is said: "And from the inheritance to God, heights." But if he exalts himself - the Holy One, blessed be He, lowers him, as it is said: "And from the heights of the valley." And not only that, but they sink him into the ground, as it is said: "And it shall be looked upon over the face of the abyss." And if he repents - the Holy One, blessed be He, raises him up.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל גֶּיא יִנָּשֵׂא״.
human_translation: as it is stated: “Every valley shall be lifted”
llm_translation: It is stated: "Every valley shall be lifted up."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַדָּגָן — אָסוּר אַף בְּפוֹל הַמִּצְרִי יָבֵשׁ, וּמוּתָּר בַּלַּח. וּמוּתָּר בְּאוֹרֶז, בְּחִילְקָא, בְּטַרְגִּיס וּבְטִיסְנֵי. הַנּוֹדֵר מִן פֵּירוֹת הַשָּׁנָה — אָסוּר בְּכׇל פֵּירוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, וּמוּתָּר בִּגְדָיִים וּבִטְלָאִים וּבְחָלָב וּבְבֵיצִים וּבְגוֹזָלוֹת. וְאִם אָמַר ״גִּידּוּלֵי שָׁנָה עָלַי״ — אָסוּר בְּכוּלָּן.
human_translation: It is taught one who vows grain [ dagan ] to is prohibited to of the dry cowpea, and is permitted of fresh And is permitted of rice, of wheat kernels split into two parts [ ḥilka ], of wheat kernels crushed into three parts [ targeis ], and wheat kernels crushed into four parts [ tisnei ]. one who vows produce of the year to is prohibited to of all produce of the year and is permitted of goats, and of lambs, and of milk, and of eggs, and of chicks And if he said: Growths of the year are to me, is prohibited for him all of them.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who vows from grain — it is forbidden even in Egyptian dry beans, and permitted in moist ones. And it is permitted in cedar, in cypress, in terebinth, and in oak. One who vows from the produce of the year — it is forbidden in all the produce of the year, and permitted in garments, in sheets, in milk, in eggs, and in young birds. And if one says, "The growths of the year are upon me" — it is forbidden in all of them.

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן פֵּירוֹת הָאָרֶץ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל פֵּירוֹת הָאָרֶץ, וּמוּתָּר בִּכְמֵהִין וּפִטְרִיּוֹת. וְאִם אָמַר ״גִּידּוּלֵי קַרְקַע עָלַי״ — אָסוּר בְּכוּלָּן.
human_translation: one who vows produce of the land to is prohibited to of all produce the land, and is permitted of truffles and mushrooms But if he said: The growths of the ground are forbidden to me, is prohibited for him all of them.
llm_translation: One who vows from fruits of the land — forbidden in all fruits of the land, and permitted in some and pomegranates. And if he said, "the produce of the ground upon me" — forbidden in all of them.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: עַל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין גִּידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ — אוֹמֵר ״שֶׁהַכֹּל נִהְיֶה בִּדְבָרוֹ״, וְתַנְיָא: עַל הַמֶּלַח וְעַל הַזָּמִית וְעַל כְּמֵהִין וּפִטְרִיּוֹת — אוֹמֵר ״שֶׁהַכֹּל נִהְיֶה בִּדְבָרוֹ״. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִירְבָּא רָבוּ מֵאַרְעָא, מֵינָק מֵאַוֵּירָא יָנְקִי וְלָא מֵאַרְעָא. וְהָא קָתָנֵי ״עַל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין גִּידּוּלוֹ מִן הָאָרֶץ״! תְּנִי: עַל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין יוֹנֵק מִן הָאָרֶץ.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction over item whose growth is not from the ground, one recites: By Whose word all things came to be. And it is taught Over salt and over brine zamit and over truffles and mushrooms, one recites: By Whose word all things came to be. Abaye said: They grow from the earth, to sustenance, they draw sustenance from the air and not from the earth. Isn’t it taught: Over item whose growth is not from the ground Emend Over item that does not draw sustenance from the ground,
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: regarding something whose growth is not from the earth — one says, "that everything is dependent on His word." And it was taught: regarding salt, and pitch, and alum, and potsherds — one says, "that everything is dependent on His word." Abaye said: from the great river one's master, from the small river one nurses, and not from the earth. But it was taught, "regarding something whose growth is not from the earth"! It should be taught: regarding something that does not suckle from the earth.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַכְּסוּת מוּתָּר בְּשַׂק, וּבִירִיעָה, וּבַחֲמִילָה. אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם צֶמֶר עוֹלֶה עָלַי״ — מוּתָּר לְהִתְכַּסּוֹת בְּגִיזֵּי צֶמֶר. ״הַפִּשְׁתָּן עוֹלֶה עָלַי״ — מוּתָּר לְהִתְכַּסּוֹת בַּאֲנִיצֵי פִּשְׁתָּן.
human_translation: one who vows garment to is permitted to sackcloth, and to a sheet, and to a coarse curtain [ ḥamila ], said: Wool is konam place it upon myself, is permitted to cover himself with wool fleece, Flax is konam place it upon myself, is permitted to cover himself with flax in bundles,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from wearing a cloak is permitted to cover himself with a sack, and with a curtain, and with a blanket. It was stated: "Their wool ascends upon me" - he is permitted to cover himself with woolen threads. "Their linen ascends upon me" - he is permitted to cover himself with linen garments.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר, הַכֹּל לְפִי הַנּוֹדֵר: טָעַן וְהִזִּיעַ וְהָיָה רֵיחוֹ קָשֶׁה, אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם צֶמֶר וּפִשְׁתִּים עוֹלֶה עָלַי״ — מוּתָּר לְהִתְכַּסּוֹת, וְאָסוּר לְהַפְשִׁיל לַאֲחוֹרָיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Everything is according to the one who vows. one was bearing and was sweating, and its smell was unpleasant he said: Wool and linen are konam place them upon myself, is permitted to cover himself but is prohibited to sling behind him
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says, everything according to the vow: if one loaded and sweated and his odor became foul, he said: "Their wool and linen are upon me" — it is permitted to cover oneself, and forbidden to expose oneself behind.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַכְּסוּת — מוּתָּר בְּשַׂק וּבִירִיעָה וּבַחֲמִילָה, וְאָסוּר בְּפוּנְדָּא וּבִפְסִקְיָא וּבִסְקוּרְטְיָא וּבְקָטָבֻלְיָא וְאַנְפִּלְיָא וּפְלִינְיָא וּמִכְנָסַיִם וְכוֹבַע. מַאי ״אִיסְקוּרְטֵי״? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר חָנָה: כִּיתּוּנָא דְצַלָּא.
human_translation: It is taught one who vows garment to is permitted to sackcloth, and to a sheet and to a coarse curtain, and is prohibited to a money belt [ punda ], or to a sash [ pesakiyya ], or to a sekurtiyya , or to a leather spread [ katavliyya ], or to a leather sock [ anpilya ] or to a leather apron [ pelinya ], and trousers, and a hat. What is iskurtei , Rabba bar Ḥana said: a tanner’s apron.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: Tanya: HaNoder min haKesut - Mutar beSak uviRi'ah uvaChamila, ve'Asur beFundah uviPsikya uviSku'rteya uveKatbul'ya vanpilya uPilin'ya umiknasayim vekov'a. Mai 'Iskurtei'? Amar Rabba bar Hana: Kituna deTzala." English translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: One who vows from wearing a garment - it is permitted with a sack, and with a curtain, and with a cloak, and it is forbidden with a Fundah, and with a Psikya, and with a Skurteya, and with a Katbul'ya, and with anpilya, and with Pilin'ya, and with pants and a hat. What is 'Iskurtei'? Rabba bar Hana said: A tunic of shade.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: יוֹצְאִין בְּשַׂק עָבֶה וּבְסָגוֹס עָבֶה וּבִירִיעָה וּבַחֲמִילָה מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים, אֲבָל לֹא בְּתֵיבָה וְלֹא בְּקוּפָּה וְלֹא בְּמַחְצֶלֶת מִפְּנֵי הַגְּשָׁמִים. הָרוֹעִים יוֹצְאִין בְּשַׂקִּים. וְלֹא רוֹעִים בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא כׇּל אָדָם, אֶלָּא שֶׁדִּבְּרוּ חֲכָמִים בַּהוֹוֶה.
human_translation: It is taught One may go out in thick sackcloth or in a coarse blanket [ sagos ], or in a sheet or in a coarse curtain from the rain. However, neither in a box, nor in a basket, nor in a mat from the rain, Shepherds may go out in sackcloth, And did not say only shepherds; rather, all people however, the Sages spoke in the present,
llm_translation: It was taught: One may go out with a thick sack, and with a thick saggos, and with a curtain, and with a cloak because of the rain, but not with a chest, nor with a basket, nor with a hat because of the rain. Shepherds may go out with sacks. And they did not say only shepherds, but every person, except that the sages spoke specifically about shepherds.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר הַכֹּל לְפִי הַנּוֹדֵר כּוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: כֵּיצַד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הַכֹּל לְפִי הַנּוֹדֵר? הָיָה לָבוּשׁ צֶמֶר וְהֵצַר, וְאָמַר ״קֻוֽנָּם צֶמֶר עוֹלֶה עָלַי״ — אָסוּר לִלְבּוֹשׁ וּמוּתָּר לִטְעוֹן. הָיָה טָעוּן פִּשְׁתָּן וְהִזִּיעַ, וְאָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם פִּשְׁתָּן עוֹלֶה עָלַי״ — מוּתָּר לִלְבּוֹשׁ וְאָסוּר לִטְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Everything is according to the one who vows. It is taught How, Rabbi Yehuda say: Everything is according to the one who vows? one was wearing woolen and it caused him discomfort, and he said: Wool is konam place it upon myself, is prohibited to wear but is permitted to place one was burdened with flax and was sweating, and said: Flax is konam place it upon myself, is permitted to wear and is prohibited to place
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Everything follows the vow. It was taught: How did Rabbi Yehuda say, "Everything follows the vow"? If one was wearing wool and linen, and he said, "Wool is forbidden to me," he is prohibited to wear it but permitted to benefit from it. If one was wearing linen and sweated, and he said, "Linen is forbidden to me," he is permitted to wear it but prohibited to benefit from it.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַבַּיִת — מוּתָּר בַּעֲלִיָּיה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עֲלִיָּיה בִּכְלַל הַבַּיִת. הַנּוֹדֵר מִן עֲלִיָּיה — מוּתָּר בְּבַיִת.
human_translation: one who vows a house to is permitted in the upper story the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: An upper story is included the house, one who vows an upper story to is permitted in the house,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from entering the house - the husband is permitted to enter, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: Entering the house is included in the vow. One who vows to abstain from entering the house - is permitted to enter the courtyard.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תְּנָא ״בְּבֵית״ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַיָּצִיעַ, ״בְּבֵית״ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָעֲלִיָּיה? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא, דְּאִי רַבָּנַן, הָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן: עֲלִיָּיה בִּכְלַל הַבַּיִת, לְמָה לִי קְרָא ״בְּבֵית״ לְרִיבּוּיָא?
human_translation: Who taught “in the house” to include the gallery, “in the house” to include the upper story? Rav Ḥisda said: Rabbi Meir, as, if the Rabbis, didn’t the Rabbis say a second story is included in the house? Why do I verse “in the house” to include
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is the Tanna that includes "in the house" to include the ramp, "in the house" to include the ascent? Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Meir, for if it were the Rabbis, did the Rabbis say: The ascent is included in the house, why do I need the verse "in the house" for an inclusive interpretation?

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, בָּעֲיָא קְרָא. דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא ״בְּבֵית אֶרֶץ אֲחֻזַּתְכֶם״ כְּתִיב. דִּמְחַבַּר בְּאַרְעָא — שְׁמֵיהּ בַּיִת, עֲלִיָּיה — הָא לָא מְחַבַּר בְּאַרְעָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: Even if you would say the Rabbis, require a verse as it might enter your mind to say it is written: “In a house of the land of your possession” which is attached to the ground status of a house a second story, that is not attached to the ground.
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say it is the opinion of the Rabbis, a verse is needed. For with the departure of your thought, I would say, "In the land of your possession" is written. For when it is connected to the land, its name is "house," but when it is not connected to the land, it is not called "house."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר חִיָּיא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּעוּלָּא: ״בַּיִת בְּבֵיתִי אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ״ — מַרְאֵהוּ עֲלִיָּיה. טַעְמָא דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ ״בַּיִת שֶׁבְּבֵיתִי אֲנִי מוֹכֵר לָךְ״, אֲבָל ״בַּיִת״ סְתָם — אֵינוֹ מַרְאֵהוּ עֲלִיָּיה. לֵימָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר הִיא? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, מַאי ״עֲלִיָּיה״ — מְעוּלָּה שֶׁבַּבָּתִּים.
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya said in the name of Ulla? A house in my house I am selling to you, he may show second story [ aliyya ]. The reason is that said to him: A house in my house I am selling to you. However, if a house, unspecified, he may not show him a second story. Let us say this Rabbi Meir, Even if you would say the Rabbis, what is aliyya the most outstanding of the houses.
llm_translation: As to whom does this statement go according to? This is what Rav Huna son of Chiya said in the name of Ulla: "A house in my house I am selling to you" — show it to him upstairs. The reason he said to him "a house in my house I am selling to you," but if it is just "a house" — do not show it to him upstairs. Let us say, is it according to Rabbi Meir? Even if you say it is according to the Rabbis, what is "upstairs" — the upper story of the houses.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַמִּטָּה — מוּתָּר בַּדַּרְגֵּשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: דַּרְגֵּשׁ בִּכְלַל מִטָּה. הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַדַּרְגֵּשׁ — מוּתָּר בַּמִּטָּה.
human_translation: one who vows a bed to is permitted in a dargash , the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: A dargash is included a bed. one who vows a dargash to is permitted in a bed.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from the bed - is permitted to use a stool, according to the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: A stool is included in the category of a bed. One who vows to abstain from the stool - is permitted to use a bed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי דַּרְגֵּשׁ? אָמַר עוּלָּא: עַרְסָא דְגַדָּא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַבָּנַן לְעוּלָּא, הָא דִּתְנַן: כְּשֶׁהֵן מַבְרִין אוֹתוֹ, כׇּל הָעָם מְסוּבִּין עַל הָאָרֶץ וְהוּא מֵיסֵב עַל הַדַּרְגֵּשׁ. כּוּלָּהּ שַׁתָּא לָא יָתֵיב עֲלֵהּ, הָהוּא יוֹמָא יָתֵיב עֲלֵהּ? מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַבָּשָׂר וְיַיִן, דְּכוּלַּהּ שַׁתָּא אִי בָּעֵי — אָכֵיל, וְאִי בָּעֵי — לָא אָכֵיל, הָהוּא יוֹמָא אֲנַן יָהֲבִינַן לֵיהּ!
human_translation: What is a dargash ? Ulla said: a bed of fortune, The Rabbis said to Ulla: That which we learned When serve meal of comfort all the people recline on the ground and reclines on a dargash the entire year he does not sit on that day he sits on it? Ravina objects to just as it is to meat and wine, as the entire year if he wishes he eats and if he wishes he does not eat that day we give him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of "dargesh"? Ulla said: The step of a fish. The Rabbis said to Ulla: But didn't we learn: When they are examining it, all the people are standing on the ground while he is sitting on the dargesh. Wasn't he sitting on it the whole time? Ravina objected to him: Since he had meat and wine, if he wants to eat, he eats, and if he doesn't want to eat, he doesn't eat. On that day, we will give it to him!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא קַשְׁיָא, דְּתַנְיָא: דַּרְגֵּשׁ לֹא הָיָה כּוֹפֵהוּ, אֶלָּא זוֹקְפוֹ. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ עַרְסָא דְגַדָּא הוּא, וְהָתַנְיָא: הַכּוֹפֶה אֶת מִטָּתוֹ — לֹא מִטָּתוֹ בִּלְבַד הוּא כּוֹפֶה, אֶלָּא כׇּל מִטּוֹת שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת הוּא כּוֹפֶה! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא,
human_translation: Rather, this is difficult, as it is taught a dargash would not overturn it, but stands it And if you say is a bed of fortune, isn’t it taught who overturn his bed overturn not only his own bed, but overturn all of the beds that he has inside his house, This not difficult;
llm_translation: The difficulty is rather this, as it was taught: One who smooths a bed does not press it down, but lifts it up. And if you say it is a large bed, and it was taught: One who presses down his bed – he does not press down only his bed, but he presses down all the beds that are in the house! This is not difficult.

hebrew_text: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמִּטָּה הַמְיוּחֶדֶת לְכֵלִים, דְּתַנְיָא: אִם הָיְתָה מִטָּה הַמְיוּחֶדֶת לְכֵלִים — אֵין צָרִיךְ לִכְפּוֹתָהּ.
human_translation: just as it is to of a bed designated for vessels, as it is taught If was a bed designated for vessels one need not overturn it.
llm_translation: From the time that it was designated for vessels, as it was taught: If it was a designated bed for vessels - there is no need to overturn it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי קַשְׁיָא — הָא קַשְׁיָא, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: דַּרְגֵּשׁ — מַתִּיר קַרְבִּיטָיו וְהוּא נוֹפֵל מֵאֵלָיו. וְאִי דַּרְגֵּשׁ עַרְסָא דְגַדָּא הוּא, קַרְבִּיטִין מִי אִית לֵיהּ? כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר: שְׁאֵילְתֵּיהּ לְהָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן וְרַב תַּחְלִיפָא בַּר מַעְרְבָא שְׁמֵיהּ, דַּהֲוָה שְׁכִיחַ בְּשׁוּקָא דְצַלָּעֵי, וְאָמַר לִי: מַאי דַּרְגֵּשׁ — עַרְסָא דְצַלָּא.
human_translation: Rather, if is difficult, this is difficult, as it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: a dargash ; loosens loops and it collapses on its own. And if a dargash is a bed of fortune, does it have loops [ karvitin ]? When Ravin came he said: I asked one of the Sages and Rav Taḥalifa, from the West, was his name, who frequented the tanners’ market. And he said to me: What is a dargash ? a leather bed.
llm_translation: Rather, it is difficult — this is the difficulty, as it was taught, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If one sharpens a knife — he may release his blade and it falls from him. And if he sharpens a fish knife, does he have blades? When Ravin came, he said: I asked that certain Sage, and Rav Tachlifa bar Ma'arava is his name, who was often in the market of Tzalaei, and he said to me: What is "dar'gesh"? — a fish knife of Tzala.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, אֵיזֶהוּ מִטָּה וְאֵיזֶהוּ דַּרְגֵּשׁ? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: מִטָּה — מְסָרְגִין אוֹתָהּ עַל גַּבָּהּ, דַּרְגֵּשׁ — מְסָרְגִין אוֹתוֹ מִגּוּפוֹ. מֵיתִיבִי: כְּלֵי עֵץ מֵאֵימָתַי מְקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה? הַמִּטָּה וְהָעֲרִיסָה — מִשֶּׁיְּשׁוּפֵם בְּעוֹר הַדָּג. וְאִי מִטָּה מִסְתָּרֶגֶת עַל גַּבָּהּ, לְמָה לִי שִׁיפַת עוֹר הַדָּג?
human_translation: It was stated: Which is a bed and which is a dargash ? Rabbi Yirmeya said: a bed, one fastens straps over a dargash , one fastens the straps through itself. raises an objection wooden vessels, from when susceptible to ritual impurity? A bed and a crib from when he smooths them with the skin of a fish. And If a bed the straps are fastened over why do I smoothing with the skin of a fish?
llm_translation: It was stated: What is a mat and what is a rug? Rabbi Yirmiyah said: A mat - they weave it on top of it, a rug - they weave it from its own body. It was asked: From when do wooden vessels accept impurity? A mat and a rug - from when they are rubbed with the skin of a fish. And if a mat is woven on top of it, why do I need the rubbing of the fish skin?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא וְהָא מִגּוּפָן. מִטָּה — אַעוֹלֵי וְאַפּוֹקֵי בְּבִזְיָנֵי, דַּרְגֵּשׁ — אַעוֹלֵי וְאַפּוֹקֵי בַּאֲבַקְתָּא.
human_translation: Rather, this, and that, through themselves, a bed, are inserted and extracted through holes a dargash , are inserted and extracted through loops
llm_translation: Rather, this and that are from the body. From below - they ascend and depart in disgrace, from the roof - they ascend and depart in dust.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אַחָא אָמַר רַבִּי: מִטָּה שֶׁנַּקְלִיטֶיהָ יוֹצְאִין, זוֹקְפָהּ וְדַיּוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov bar Aḥa said Rabbi said: a bed whose two posts [ nakliteha ] protrude, he stands it and is sufficient for him. Rabbi Ya’akov bar Idi said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel
llm_translation: Rabbi Yaakov bar Acha said in the name of Rabbi: From a bed that its legs have been removed, one may remove it, by lifting it and moving it. Rabbi Yaakov bar Idi said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: The halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הָעִיר — מוּתָּר לִיכָּנֵס לִתְחוּמָהּ שֶׁל עִיר, וְאָסוּר לִיכָּנֵס לְעִיבּוּרָהּ. אֲבָל הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַבַּיִת — אָסוּר מִן הָאֲגַף וְלִפְנִים.
human_translation: one who vows the city to is permitted to enter boundary of city, and is prohibited to enter its outskirts, However, one who vows a house to is prohibited from the doorstop and inward.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One who vows to abstain from entering the city - is permitted to enter its techum, but is forbidden to enter its ibburah. However, one who vows to abstain from entering the house - is forbidden from the courtyard and inward.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מְנָלַן דְּעִיבּוּרָא דְמָתָא כְּמָתָא דָּמֵי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיְהִי בִּהְיוֹת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּירִיחוֹ וְגוֹ׳״, מַאי בִּירִיחוֹ? אִילֵּימָא בִּירִיחוֹ מַמָּשׁ, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וִירִיחוֹ סֹגֶרֶת וּמְסֻגֶּרֶת״! אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בְּעִיבּוּרָהּ.
human_translation: From where do we that the the outskirts of a city are like that of the city Rabbi Yoḥanan said as the verse states: “And it came to pass when Joshua was in Jericho, What “in Jericho”? If we say in Jericho proper, isn’t it written: “And Jericho was completely shut” Rather, learn from here in the outskirts
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive that the speech of a town is like the town itself? Rabbi Yochanan said, as the verse states: "And it came to pass, when Joshua was in Jericho..." What is meant by "in Jericho"? If you say in the actual Jericho, but it is written: "And Jericho was shut up and closed in"! Rather, learn from it regarding its speech.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא אֲפִילּוּ בִּתְחוּמָהּ! הָא כְּתִיב בִּתְחוּמָהּ ״וּמַדֹּתֶם מִחוּץ לָעִיר״.
human_translation: Say even in boundary Isn’t it written with regard to the boundary “And you shall measure outside the city…
llm_translation: אֵימָא אֲפִילּוּ בִּתְחוּמָהּ! הָא כְּתִיב בִּתְחוּמָהּ ״וּמַדֹּתֶם מִחוּץ לָעִיר״. Say, even within its boundary! For it is written within its boundary, "And you shall measure outside the city."

hebrew_text: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַבַּיִת — אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא מִן הָאֲגַף וְלִפְנִים. אֲבָל מִן הָאֲגַף וְלַחוּץ — לֹא. מֵתִיב רַב מָרִי: ״וְיָצָא הַכֹּהֵן מִן הַבַּיִת״, יָכוֹל יֵלֵךְ לְבֵיתוֹ וְיַסְגִּיר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶל פֶּתַח הַבָּיִת״. אִי אֶל פֶּתַח הַבָּיִת, יָכוֹל יַעֲמוֹד תַּחַת הַמַּשְׁקוֹף וְיַסְגִּיר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִן הַבַּיִת״, עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִן הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: one who vows a house to is prohibited only from the doorstop and inward. However, from the doorstop outward, no, Rav Mari raised an objection “And the priest shall go out from the house might may go to his house and quarantine the verse states: “To the entrance of the house” If to the entrance of the house, might he may stand beneath the lintel and quarantine the verse states: from the house,” until he goes out from the entire house.
llm_translation: The one who vows from the house - he is forbidden only from the chamber and inside. But from the chamber and outside - no. Rav Mari raises an objection: "And the priest shall go out from the house," one might think he may go to his house and lock it - the Talmud teaches: "to the entrance of the house." If not to the entrance of the house, one might think he may stand under the lintel and lock it - the Talmud teaches: "from the house," until he completely exits from the house.

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? עוֹמֵד בְּצַד הַמַּשְׁקוֹף וְיַסְגִּיר. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם הָלַךְ לְבֵיתוֹ וְהִסְגִּיר, אוֹ שֶׁעָמַד תַּחַת הַשָּׁקוֹף וְהִסְגִּיר, שֶׁהֶסְגֵּירוֹ מוּסְגָּר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהִסְגִּיר אֶת הַבַּיִת״, מִכׇּל מָקוֹם. שָׁאנֵי גַּבֵּי בַּיִת, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִן הַבַּיִת״, עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא מִן הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: How so? stands alongside the door jamb, and quarantines And from where that if he went to his house and quarantined or stood beneath the lintel and quarantined that his quarantine is quarantine The verse states: “And he shall quarantine the house” in any case. is different with regard to house, as it is written: from the house,” until he goes out from the entire house.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How so? One stands at the side of the skylight and closes it. And from where do we know that if he went into his house and closed it, or if he stood beneath the skylight and closed it, that his closing is considered closed? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall close the house," from any place. It is different regarding a house, as it is written: "From the house," until he entirely exits from the house.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״קֻוֽנָּם פֵּירוֹת הָאֵלּוּ עָלַי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן עַל פִּי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן לְפִי״ — אָסוּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן. ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹכֵל״, וְ״שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם — מוּתָּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן, בְּדָבָר שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ כָּלֶה. אֲבָל בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ כָּלֶה — אֲפִילּוּ גִּידּוּלֵי גִידּוּלִין אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: This produce is konam upon me, it is konam upon my mouth, it is konam to my mouth, is prohibited its replacements, or grows from it. that I eat or that I taste is permitted its replacements or grows from it. with regard to an item whose seeds cease However, with regard to an item whose seeds do not cease is prohibited growths of growths,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "If these fruits are 'kuvnam' upon me," "they are 'kuvnam' according to my mouth," "they are 'kuvnam' according to my taste" — it is prohibited to exchange them and to graft them. "When I eat," and "when I taste — it is permitted to exchange them and to graft them, in a matter where its seed is complete. But in a matter where its seed is not complete — even the grafting of graftings is prohibited."

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ ״קֻוֽנָּם מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ עָלַי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן עַל פִּי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן לְפִי״ — אָסוּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן. ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹכֵל״, ״שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — מוּתָּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן, בְּדָבָר שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ כָּלֶה. אֲבָל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ כָּלֶה — אֲפִילּוּ גִּידּוּלֵי גִידּוּלִין אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: one who says to his wife: Your handicraft is konam upon me, it is konam upon my mouth, it is konam to my mouth, is prohibited their replacements and grows from them. that I eat or that I taste is permitted their replacements and grows from them. with regard to an item whose seeds cease However, with regard to an item whose seeds do not cease is prohibited growths of growths.
llm_translation: One who says to his wife, "Your handiwork is upon me," "Your handiwork is according to me," "Your handiwork is for me" — he is forbidden in their manipulation and in their growth. "That I eat," "That I taste" — he is permitted in their manipulation and in their growth, in a matter that its seed is complete. But in a matter that its seed is not complete — even the growths of growths are forbidden.

hebrew_text: ״שֶׁאַתְּ עוֹשָׂה אֵינִי אוֹכֵל עַד הַפֶּסַח״, ״שֶׁאַתְּ עוֹשָׂה אֵינִי מִתְכַּסֶּה עַד הַפֶּסַח״, עָשְׂתָה לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח — מוּתָּר לֶאֱכוֹל וּלְהִתְכַּסּוֹת אַחַר הַפֶּסַח. ״שֶׁאַתְּ עוֹשָׂה עַד הַפֶּסַח אֵינִי אוֹכֵל״, וְ״שֶׁאַתְּ עוֹשָׂה עַד הַפֶּסַח אֵינִי מִתְכַּסֶּה״, עָשְׂתָה לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח — אָסוּר לֶאֱכוֹל וּלְהִתְכַּסּוֹת אַחַר הַפֶּסַח. ״שֶׁאַתְּ נֶהֱנֵית לִי עַד הַפֶּסַח אִם הוֹלֶכֶת אַתְּ לְבֵית אָבִיךְ עַד הֶחָג״, הָלְכָה לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח — אֲסוּרָה בַּהֲנָאָתוֹ עַד הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: which you prepare, I will not eat until Passover, which you prepare, I will not cover myself until Passover, prepared before Passover, is permitted to eat or to cover himself after Passover. which you prepare until Passover, I will not eat, or which you prepare until Passover, I will not cover myself, prepared before Passover, is prohibited to eat or cover himself after Passover. Benefit from me until Passover if you go to your father’s house until the festival she went before Passover, is prohibited benefit him until Passover.
llm_translation: "‘That which you are doing, I do not eat until Pesach,’ ‘That which you are doing, I do not cover myself until Pesach,’ if she performed the act before Pesach — it is permitted to eat and cover oneself after Pesach. ‘That which you are doing until Pesach, I do not eat,’ and ‘That which you are doing until Pesach, I do not cover myself,’ if she performed the act before Pesach — it is forbidden to eat and cover oneself after Pesach. ‘That which you benefit me until Pesach if you go to your father’s house until the holiday,’ if she went before Pesach — she is forbidden in his benefit until Pesach."

hebrew_text: לְאַחַר הַפֶּסַח — בְּ״בַל יַחֵל״. ״שֶׁאַתְּ נֶהֱנֵית לִי עַד הֶחָג אִם הוֹלֶכֶת אַתְּ לְבֵית אָבִיךָ עַד הַפֶּסַח״, הָלְכָה לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח — אֲסוּרָה בַּהֲנָאָתוֹ עַד הֶחָג, וּמוּתֶּרֶת לֵילֵךְ אַחַר הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: after Passover, for He shall not profane Benefit from me for you until the Festival if you go to your father’s house until Passover, she went before Passover, is prohibited derive benefit him until the Festival, and is permitted to go after Passover,
llm_translation: After Passover - in Babylon it is permissible. "Since you benefit me until the holiday if you go to your father's house until Passover," the law before Passover - it is forbidden to benefit from it until the holiday, and it is permissible to go after Passover.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ הָאוֹמֵר לְאִשְׁתּוֹ ״קֻוֽנָּם מַעֲשֵׂה יָדַיִךְ עָלַי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן עַל פִּי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן לְפִי וְכוּ׳״, יִשְׁמָעֵאל אִישׁ כְּפַר יַמָּא, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אִישׁ כְּפַר דְּיַמָּא, הֶעֱלָה בְּיָדוֹ בָּצָל שֶׁעֲקָרוֹ בַּשְּׁבִיעִית, וּנְטָעוֹ בַּשְּׁמִינִית, וְרַבּוּ גִּידּוּלָיו עַל עִיקָּרוֹ. וְהָכִי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: גִּידּוּלָיו הֶיתֵּר וְעִיקָּרוֹ אָסוּר, כֵּיוָן דְּרָבוּ גִּידּוּלָיו מֵעִיקָּרוֹ — אוֹתָן גִּידּוּלֵי הֶיתֵּר מַעֲלִין אֶת הָאִיסּוּר, אוֹ לָא? אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי לָא הֲוָה בִּידֵיהּ.
human_translation: one who says to his wife: Your handicraft is konam upon me, it is konam upon my mouth, it is konam to my mouth, Yishmael, a man of Kefar Yamma, and some say, a man of Kefar Dima, raised an onion that one uprooted during Sabbatical Year, and planted it during the eighth and its growths exceeded its principal And this is the dilemma that he raised: Its growth is permitted, and its principal prohibited. Since its growth exceeded its principal, those permitted growths neutralize the prohibition or not? came before Rabbi Ami, and he did not have available.
llm_translation: The one who says to his wife, "Your handiwork is upon me," "Your handiwork is according to," "Your handiwork is in accordance with and so forth," Yishmael the man of Kfar Yama, and some say, the man of Kfar Deyama, brought in his hand a shoot that he uprooted in the seventh year, and planted it in the eighth year, and its growth exceeded its root. And thus he asked him: If its growth is excess and its root is deficient, since its growth exceeds its root, do those excess growths elevate the prohibition or not? He came before Rabbi Ammi, but it was not in her hands.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא, פְּשַׁט לֵיהּ מִן הָדָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא תְּרִיתָאָה אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בָּצָל שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנְּטָעוֹ, וְרַבּוּ גִּידּוּלָיו עַל עִיקָּרוֹ — מוּתָּר. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי זְרִיקָא: שָׁבֵיק מָר תְּרֵין וְעָבֵיד כְּחַד?!
human_translation: came before Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, resolved for him from which Rabbi Ḥanina Terita’a said Rabbi Yannai said: an onion of teruma that one planted, its growths exceeded its principal, is permitted. Rabbi Yirmeya said, and some say Rabbi Zerika Did the Master abandon two and conduct in accordance with one
llm_translation: He came before Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha, he explained to him from this that Rabbi Chanina said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: "Regarding a shadow of terumah that one planted, and its growth increased upon its root - it is permitted." Rabbi Yirmeya said to him, and some say it was Rabbi Zerika: "The Master left two and did as one?!"

hebrew_text: מַאן נִינְהוּ תְּרֵין? דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: יַלְדָּה שֶׁסִּיבְּכָהּ בִּזְקֵינָהּ, וּבָהּ פֵּירוֹת, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהוֹסִיפָה מָאתַיִם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: Who are they, two as Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a young that one grafted onto an old, and there were fruits on even though added two hundred forbidden.
llm_translation: Who are these two? For Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A girl who was married off while still a minor, and in her possession are fruits, even though she added two hundred - it is prohibited.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַבִּי נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: בָּצָל שֶׁנְּטָעוֹ בַּכֶּרֶם, וְנֶעֱקַר הַכֶּרֶם — אָסוּר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Rabbi Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: an onion that one planted in a vineyard, and the vineyard was uprooted, forbidden.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel son of Rabbi Nachmani said, Rabbi Yonatan said: In the onion that one planted in the vineyard, and the vineyard was uprooted - it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הֲדַר אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי וּפְשַׁיט לֵיהּ מִן הָדָא דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לִיטְרָא בְּצָלִים שֶׁתִּיקְּנָה וּזְרָעָהּ, מִתְעַשֶּׂרֶת לְפִי כוּלָּהּ. אַלְמָא אוֹתָן גִידּוּלִין מְבַטְּלִין עִיקָּר.
human_translation: then came before Rabbi Ami, who resolved for him from which Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a litra of onions that one tithed, and sowed it is tithed according to the entire Apparently, those growths neutralize the primary,
llm_translation: He returned before Rabbi Ammi and he removed it from this that Rabbi Yitzchak said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If a radish grows in the shade, its seed, it tithes in its entirety. This implies that those that grow are nullifying the essence.

hebrew_text: דִּלְמָא לְחוּמְרָא שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: perhaps is different is a stringency.
llm_translation: Perhaps for a stringency it is different.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִן הָדָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: Rather, this as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says:
llm_translation: Rather, from that which was taught, Rabbi Shimon says:

hebrew_text: כׇּל דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין, כְּגוֹן טֶבֶל וּמַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי וְהֶקְדֵּשׁ וְחָדָשׁ — לֹא נָתְנוּ בָּהֶן חֲכָמִים שִׁיעוּר. וְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ מַתִּירִין, כְּגוֹן תְּרוּמָה וּתְרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר וְחַלָּה וְעׇרְלָה וְכִלְאֵי הַכֶּרֶם — נָתְנוּ בָּהֶם חֲכָמִים שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: any item that can become permitted, for example, untithed produce and second tithe and consecrated items and new the Sages did not determine a measure for their And any item that cannot become permitted, for example, teruma , and teruma of the tithe, and ḥalla fruit of a tree during the first three years after its planting [ orla ]; and forbidden food crops in a vineyard the Sages determined a measure for their
llm_translation: Every matter that has leniencies, such as tevel, second tithe, consecrated items, and new produce - the Sages did not establish a measure for them. And every matter that does not have leniencies, such as terumah, tithe of the tithe, challah, uncircumcised produce, and mixtures of the vineyard - the Sages did establish a measure for them.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: וַהֲלֹא שְׁבִיעִית אֵין לָהּ מַתִּירִין, וְלֹא נָתְנוּ בָּהּ חֲכָמִים שִׁיעוּר. דִּתְנַן: הַשְּׁבִיעִית אוֹסֶרֶת כׇּל שֶׁהוּא בְּמִינָהּ! אָמַר לָהֶן: אַף אֲנִי לֹא אָמַרְתִּי אֶלָּא לְבִיעוּר.
human_translation: said to But isn’t Sabbatical-Year an item that cannot become permitted, and the Sages did not determine a measure for its as we learned The Sabbatical-Year prohibits of its species in any amount. said to them: I too said only to removal
llm_translation: They said to him: But isn't the seventh year not permitted to have any leftovers, and the Sages did not establish a specific measure for it? As we learned: The seventh year prohibits anything that is of its kind! He said to them: I also only said it for clarification.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לַאֲכִילָה בְּנוֹתֵן טַעַם. וְדִלְמָא הָא נָמֵי לְחוּמְרָא שָׁאנֵי!
human_translation: However, to eating to impart flavor And perhaps here too, is different is a stringency.
llm_translation: However, for eating, one must give a reason. But perhaps this is only for stringency, and it is different!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִן הָדָא פַּשְׁטַהּ, דִּתְנַן: בְּצָלִים שֶׁיָּרְדוּ עֲלֵיהֶם גְּשָׁמִים וְצָמְחוּ, אִם הָיוּ עָלִין שֶׁלָּהֶן שְׁחוֹרִין — אֲסוּרִין. הוֹרִיקוּ — מוּתָּרִין.
human_translation: Rather, resolved from this as we learned onions upon which rain fell and they sprouted, if their leaves were black [ sheḥorin ], forbidden turned green [ horiku ], permitted,
llm_translation: Rather, from this source it is derived, as we learned in a Mishnah: "Regarding onions upon which rain fell and they sprouted, if their leaves were black - they are forbidden. If they were white - they are permitted."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן אַנְטִיגְנוֹס אוֹמֵר: אִם יְכוֹלִין לִיתָּלֵשׁ בֶּעָלִין שֶׁלָּהֶן — אֲסוּרִין. וּכְנֶגְדָּן, לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית — מוּתָּרִין. לְמֵימְרָא דְּגִידּוּלֵי הֶיתֵּר מַעֲלִין אֶת הָאִיסּוּר. וְדִלְמָא בִּמְדוּכָּנִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Antigonus says: if can be uprooted by their leaves, forbidden. And parallel at the conclusion of the Sabbatical Year, permitted. Is this to say that permitted growth neutralizes the prohibition And perhaps with regard to crushed [ medukhanin ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Chananya ben Antigonus says: If they are able to separate from their owners - forbidden. And corresponding to them, regarding the produce of the seventh year - permitted. To say that the expansions of the permit elevate the prohibition. And perhaps in the case of mixed species.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מִן הָדָא, דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: Rather, from this as it is taught
llm_translation: Rather, from this, as it was taught:

hebrew_text: הַמְנַכֵּשׁ עִם הַכּוּתִי בַּחֲסִיּוֹת — אוֹכֵל מֵהֶן אֲכִילַת עֲרַאי, וּמְעַשְּׂרָן וַדַּאי.
human_translation: One who weeds ḥasayot with a Samaritan may eat a casual meal from them And he tithes them definitely
llm_translation: One who traps with a Kutite in a trap - may eat from them a temporary meal, and tithes them for sure.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִם יִשְׂרָאֵל חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית, לְמוֹצָאֵי שְׁבִיעִית — מוּתָּר. לְמֵימְרָא דְּגִידּוּלֵי הֶיתֵּר מַעֲלִין אֶת הָאִיסּוּר, וְדִלְמָא בְּדָבָר שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ כָּלֶה? הָא תַּנְיָא: אֵלּוּ הֵן חֲסִיּוֹת — כְּגוֹן הַלּוּף הַשּׁוּם וְהַבְּצָלִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If a Jew suspect the Sabbatical Year, at the conclusion of the Sabbatical Year is permitted Is this to say the permitted growths neutralize the prohibition, And perhaps with regard to an item whose seeds cease Isn’t it taught These are ḥasayot , for example, arum, garlic, and onions,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: If Israel is suspected regarding the seventh year produce, concerning the leftovers of the seventh year produce — it is permitted. To say that the growths of the permitted produce elevate the prohibition, perhaps because it is something whose seed is consumed entirely? But it was taught: These are the types of vegetables — such as garlic, onions, and shallots.

hebrew_text: וְדִלְמָא בִּמְדוּכָּנִין? ״חָשׁוּד עַל הַשְּׁבִיעִית״ קָתָנֵי. וְדִלְמָא בְּתַעֲרוֹבֶת? הַמְנַכֵּשׁ קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: And perhaps with regard to crushed suspect about the Sabbatical Year, is taught And perhaps with regard to a mixture One who weeds, is taught
llm_translation: Perhaps with mixed species? "It is prohibited on the seventh" it teaches. Perhaps with a mixture? It teaches about one who traps.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא תֶּיהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וּדְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן! אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שַׁנְיָא שְׁבִיעִית, הוֹאִיל וְאִיסּוּרָהּ עַל יְדֵי קַרְקַע — בְּטִילָתָהּ נָמֵי עַל יְדֵי קַרְקַע.
human_translation: Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yonatan, Rabbi Yitzḥak said: Sabbatical-Year is different. Since its prohibition by means of the ground, its nullification is by means of the ground as well.
llm_translation: Let it be the preference of Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yonatan! Rabbi Yitzchak said: The seventh year is different, since its prohibition is dependent on the ground — its nullification is also dependent on the ground.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי מַעֲשֵׂר, דְּאִיסּוּרוֹ עַל יְדֵי קַרְקַע, וְאֵין בְּטִילָתוֹ עַל יְדֵי קַרְקַע. דְּתַנְיָא: לִיטְרָא מַעֲשֵׂר טֶבֶל שֶׁזְּרָעָהּ בַּקַּרְקַע וְהִשְׁבִּיחָה, וַהֲרֵי הִיא כְּעֶשֶׂר לִיטְרִין — חַיֶּיבֶת בְּמַעֲשֵׂר וּבִשְׁבִיעִית. וְאוֹתָהּ לִיטְרָא, מְעַשֵּׂר עָלֶיהָ מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר לְפִי חֶשְׁבּוֹן!
human_translation: tithe, whose prohibition is by means of the ground, but its nullification is not by means of the ground? As it is taught a litra of untithed tithe which one sowed in the ground, and it grew and it is approximately ten litra , is obligated tithe and of Sabbatical-Year And that litra tithes for it from a different place, based on a calculation
llm_translation: Behold, tithe, whose prohibition is by way of the ground, and its annulment is not by way of the ground. As it was taught: A basket of tithe produce that was sown in the ground and sprouted, and behold, it is like ten baskets - it is obligated in tithe and in the seventh year. And that basket, one should tithe upon it from another place according to calculation!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: מַעֲשֵׂר, דִּיגּוּן הוּא דְּקָא גָרֵים לֵיהּ.
human_translation: say: tithe, placement in a pile engenders
llm_translation: They said: "Ma'aser is a form of refinement that one is bestowing upon it."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: ״קֻוֽנָּם פֵּירוֹת הָאֵלּוּ עָלַי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן עַל פִּי״, ״קֻוֽנָּם הֵן לְפִי״ — אָסוּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן. ״שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹכֵל״, וְ״שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם״ — מוּתָּר בְּחִילּוּפֵיהֶן וּבְגִידּוּלֵיהֶן בְּדָבָר שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ כָּלֶה, אֲבָל בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ כָּלֶה — אֲפִילּוּ גִּידּוּלֵי גִידּוּלִין אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised an objection This produce is konam upon me, it is konam upon my mouth, it is konam to my mouth, is prohibited of its replacements, or grows from it. that I eat or that I taste is permitted of its replacements or grows from it. with regard to an item whose seeds cease However, with regard to an item whose seeds do not cease is prohibited growths of growths.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "These fruits are prepared on me," "they are prepared according to," "they are prepared for" — it is prohibited due to their peeling and growth. "When I eat," and "when I taste" — it is permitted due to their peeling and growth in a matter that its seed is consumed, but in a matter that its seed is not consumed — even the growths of growths are prohibited.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: שָׁאנֵי קוֹנָמוֹת, הוֹאִיל וְאִי בָּעֵי מִתְּשִׁיל עֲלַיְיהוּ — הָווּ לְהוּ כְּדָבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין, וְאֵין בָּטֵיל בָּרוֹב.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Konamot are different; since if he wishes request their is like an item that can become permitted, and is not nullified by a majority
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: Regarding cornerstones, since if one wants to lean on them — they should be like something that has those who permit it, and is not nullified by the majority.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי תְּרוּמָה, דְּאִי בָּעֵי מִיתְּשִׁיל עֲלַהּ, וּבָטְלִי בְּרוֹב. דִּתְנַן: סְאָה תְּרוּמָה טְמֵאָה שֶׁנָּפְלָה לְפָחוֹת מִמֵּאָה חוּלִּין — תֵּרָקֵב. הָא לְמֵאָה — תַּעֲלֶה! אָמְרִי: בִּתְרוּמָה בְּיַד כֹּהֵן עָסְקִינַן, דְּלָא מָצֵי מִיתְּשִׁיל עֲלַהּ.
human_translation: And teruma , which if wishes request and nullified by a majority As we learned A se’a of ritually impure teruma that fell into less than one hundred non-sacred produce to decay. into one hundred is neutralized. say We are dealing with teruma in the possession of a priest, which can no request
llm_translation: Behold, regarding Terumah, for if one wants to place a leaf on it, it is nullified by the majority.
