For it was taught: If a se'ah of impure Terumah falls into less than a hundred se'ah of common produce - it is mixed in. But if it falls into a hundred se'ah - it is elevated! They said: We are dealing with Terumah in the possession of a Kohen, for one cannot place a leaf on it.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: אִם הָיְתָה טְהוֹרָה תִּמָּכֵר לְכֹהֵן! אֶלָּא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁנָּפְלוּ לוֹ מִבֵּית אֲבִי אִמּוֹ כֹּהֵן עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause If was ritually pure, be sold to a priest, Rather, we are dealing with an Israelite who inherited from the house of his mother’s father, a priest.
llm_translation: If so, why not say the conclusion: If she was pure, she should be sold to a Kohen! Rather, we are dealing with a case in Israel where they fell to him from the house of his father's mother, we are dealing with a Kohen.

hebrew_text: [וְהָא] קָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: תִּימָּכֵר לְכֹהֵן חוּץ מִדְּמֵי אוֹתָהּ סְאָה?
human_translation: But isn’t it taught in latter clause be sold to a priest; except for the value of that se’a
llm_translation: And the Mishnah teaches in the latter part: Should it be sold to a priest except for the value of that se'ah?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אֵימָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא קוּנָּמוֹת — מִצְוָה לְאִיתְּשׁוֹלֵי עֲלֵיהֶן, מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי נָתָן. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן: כׇּל הַנּוֹדֵר — כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה בָּמָה, וְהַמְקַיְּימוֹ — כְּאִילּוּ מַקְטִיר עָלֶיהָ. תְּרוּמָה מַאי מִצְוָה לְאִיתְּשׁוֹלֵי עֲלַהּ?
human_translation: Rather, say Granted, konamot , a mitzva to request them, due to of Rabbi Natan, as Rabbi Natan said: Anyone who vows, it is as if he built altar and one who fulfills as though he burns upon it. teruma , what mitzva to request its
llm_translation: Rather, say: Regarding the "kunamot" - it is a mitzvah to uproot them, because of Rabbi Natan. For Rabbi Natan said: Anyone who vows is as if he built an altar, and one who fulfills it is as if he offered incense upon it. What is the mitzvah to uproot it for the sake of terumah?

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לִיטְרָא בְּצָלִים שֶׁתִּיקְּנָהּ וּזְרָעָהּ — מִתְעַשֶּׂרֶת לְפִי כוּלָּהּ. יָתֵיב רַבָּה וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: מַאן צָאֵית לָךְ וּלְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רַבָּךְ! הֶיתֵּר שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלַךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי לָא תְּנַן דִּכְווֹתַהּ: בְּצָלִים שֶׁיָּרְדוּ עֲלֵיהֶם גְּשָׁמִים וְצִימְּחוּ,
human_translation: the itself, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a litra of onions that one tithed, and sowed, it is tithed according to the entire Rabba sat and stated this halakha . Rav Ḥisda said to him: Who listens to you and Rabbi Yoḥanan, your teacher? The permitted part of to where did it go? said to Didn’t we learn a corresponding onions upon which rain fell and they sprouted,
llm_translation: The body, said Rabbi Yochanan: If a radish is planted and its seed grows - it becomes tithed in its entirety. Rabbah was sitting and saying this teaching. Rav Chisda said to him: Who revealed this to you and to your teacher Rabbi Yochanan your master! Where did the extra part of them go? He said to him: Did we not learn that when rain falls on radishes, they grow.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיוּ עָלִין שֶׁלָּהֶן שְׁחוֹרִין — אֲסוּרִין, הוֹרִיקוּ — מוּתָּרִין. וְכִי שְׁחוֹרִין אַמַּאי אֲסוּרִין? לֵימָא: הֶיתֵּר שֶׁבָּהֶן לְהֵיכָן הָלַךְ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ עַל עִיקָּר קָתָנֵי? אַתּוֹסֶפֶת קָתָנֵי אֲסוּרִין. אִי הָכִי, מַאי אֲתָא רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל לְמֵימַר? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: הַגָּדֵל בְּחִיּוּב — חַיָּיב, הַגָּדֵל בִּפְטוּר — פָּטוּר. תַּנָּא קַמָּא נָמֵי הָכִי אָמַר!
human_translation: if their leaves were black, forbidden. turned green, permitted. And if are black, why forbidden? Let us say The permitted part, to where did it go? said to Do you maintain is taught about the primary, is taught with regard to the additional are forbidden. If so, what is Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, coming to say? As it is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: That which grew during liability is liable which grew during exemption is exempt. the first tanna , also said that.
llm_translation: If their feathers were black - forbidden, if they molted - permitted. And why are black feathers forbidden? Say: Where did the permission in them go? He said to him: Do you think the essence of the Mishnah is on this? You are adding to the Mishnah that they are forbidden. If so, why did Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel come to say? As it was taught, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: If it grew by obligation - liable, if it grew by exemption - exempt. The first Tanna said the same thing!

hebrew_text: כּוּלָּהּ מַתְנִיתִין רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל קָתָנֵי לַהּ. וְעַד כָּאן לָא שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל דְּלָא קָא טָרַח, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּקָא טָרַח — בָּטֵיל בְּרוּבָּא.
human_translation: entire mishna, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught it. And you heard that Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel only he did not exert However, where he exerted neutralized by the majority.
llm_translation: The entire Mishnah, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel taught it. And until here you did not hear it from Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel because he did not exert himself, but where he exerts himself - it is nullified by the majority.

hebrew_text: וְכֹל הֵיכָא דְּקָא טָרַח בָּטֵיל בְּרוּבָּא? וַהֲרֵי לִיטְרָא מַעֲשֵׂר טֶבֶל, דְּקָטָרַח, וְקָתָנֵי: וְאוֹתָהּ לִיטְרָא מְעַשֵּׂר עָלָיו מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר לְפִי חֶשְׁבּוֹן! שָׁאנֵי גַּבֵּי מַעֲשֵׂר, דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״עַשֵּׂר תְּעַשֵּׂר וְגוֹ׳״, וְהֶיתֵּירָא — זָרְעִי אִינָשֵׁי, אִיסּוּרָא — לָא זָרְעִי אִינָשֵׁי.
human_translation: And anywhere that one exerts is nullified by the majority? And a litra of untithed tithe, he exerts and it is taught: And that litra proportionally tithes for it from a different place, is different with regard to tithe, as the verse states: “You shall tithe permitted people sow. Forbidden people do not sow,
llm_translation: And all where that exerted effort, null in majority? And behold, litra tithe, that exerted, and it teaches: And that litra tithe upon him from another place according to calculation! Different regarding tithe, as scripture says "Tithe you shall tithe, etc.", and the permission — human seed, prohibition — not human seed.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא, אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא תִּירְתָּאָה אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בָּצָל שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה שֶׁנְּטָעוֹ, וְרַבּוּ גִּידּוּלָיו עַל עִיקָּרוֹ — מוּתָּר. לְמֵימְרָא דְּגִידּוּלֵי
human_translation: the itself, Rabbi Ḥanina Tirta’a said Rabbi Yannai said: an onion of teruma that one planted, its growths exceeded its principal, is permitted. Is this to say that growths
llm_translation: The body, said Rabbi Chanina Tirta'ah said Rabbi Yannai: In the shade of the tithe that he planted, and its growth increased on its root - it is permitted. To say that the growth

hebrew_text: הֶיתֵּר מַעֲלִין אֶת הָאִיסּוּר? וְהָתְנַן: גִּידּוּלֵי תְרוּמָה תְּרוּמָה! בְּגִידּוּלֵי גִידּוּלִין קָאָמְרִינַן. הָא נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: גִּידּוּלֵי גִידּוּלִין חוּלִּין! הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: אֲפִילּוּ בְּדָבָר שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ כָּלֶה.
human_translation: permitted neutralize the prohibition? But didn’t we learn The growths of teruma are teruma , We are speaking of the growths of growths. We learned that too: The growths of growths non-sacred This teaches us even in items whose seeds do not cease,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Is the prohibition lifted? But we learned in a Mishnah: 'The tithes of the tithe are tithed!' It is referring to the tithes of the tithes. But didn't we learn: 'The tithes of the tithes are treated as common produce!' This teaches us that even in a matter whose seed is not consumed."

hebrew_text: וְהָתְנַן: הַטֶּבֶל — גִּידּוּלָיו מוּתָּרִין בְּדָבָר שֶׁזַּרְעוֹ כָּלֶה. אֲבָל דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין זַרְעוֹ כָּלֶה — גִּידּוּלֵי גִידּוּלִין אֲסוּרִין! רִבּוּיָא דְּרַבּוּ גִידּוּלִין עַל עִיקָּרוֹ מוּתָּר קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: But didn’t we learn untithed produce, its growths are permitted in items whose seeds cease; however, items whose seeds do not cease, the growths of growths are forbidden. It teaches us that the increase of the growths exceeded its primary, permitted.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: "Its tevel - its growths are permitted in a matter where its seed is finished. But in a matter where its seed is not finished - its growths of growths are forbidden!" The multiplication of growths on its essence is what is permitted, we understand.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַיָּרָק
llm_translation: We will return to you, O one who vows from the vegetable.

hebrew_text: ״ קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם הַיּוֹם״ — אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ. ״שַׁבָּת זוֹ״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַשַּׁבָּת, וְשַׁבָּת שֶׁעָבְרָה. ״חֹדֶשׁ זֶה״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַחֹדֶשׁ, וְרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ לְהַבָּא.
human_translation: Wine is as if an offering [ konam ], that I taste today, prohibited only until nightfall, this week, prohibited for the entire week. And Shabbat that passed, this month, forbidden for the entire month; and the New Moon of the next
llm_translation: "Established is wine, that I taste today" - It is not prohibited except until it gets dark. "This Sabbath" - Prohibited on every Sabbath, and the previous Sabbath. "This month" - Prohibited throughout the month, and the upcoming new moon.

hebrew_text: ״שָׁנָה זוֹ״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַשָּׁנָה, וְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא. ״שָׁבוּעַ זֶה״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַשָּׁבוּעַ, וּשְׁבִיעִית שֶׁעָבְרָה.
human_translation: this year, prohibited for the entire year; and Rosh HaShana of the upcoming this seven-year forbidden for the entire seven-year and the Sabbatical that passed,
llm_translation: "This year" — prohibited throughout the entire year, and Rosh Hashanah of the future. "This week" — prohibited throughout the entire week, and the past seventh year.

hebrew_text: וְאִם אָמַר ״יוֹם אֶחָד״, ״שַׁבָּת אַחַת״, ״חֹדֶשׁ אֶחָד״, ״שָׁנָה אַחַת״, ״שָׁבוּעַ אֶחָד״ — אָסוּר מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם.
human_translation: but if he said one day, one week, one month, one year, one seven-year prohibited from day to day,
llm_translation: And if he said "one day," "one Sabbath," "one month," "one year," "one week" - it is prohibited from day to day.

hebrew_text: ״עַד הַפֶּסַח״ — אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ, ״עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא״ — אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא. ״עַד לִפְנֵי הַפֶּסַח״, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא.
human_translation: until Passover, it is forbidden until arrives. Until it will be it is forbidden until ends, Until before Passover, Rabbi Meir says: forbidden until arrives. Rabbi Yosei says: It is forbidden until it ends.
llm_translation: "Until the Pesach" - forbidden until it arrives, "Until it is" - forbidden until it goes out. "Until before the Pesach," Rabbi Meir says: forbidden until it arrives, Rabbi Yosei says: forbidden until it goes out.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לִכְשֶׁתֶּחֱשַׁךְ צָרִיךְ שְׁאֵלָה לְחָכָם.
human_translation: Wine is as if an offering [ konam ], that I taste Rabbi Yirmeya said: when darkness falls he is required request a halakhic authority
llm_translation: Gemara: Their wine is like poison. Rabbi Yirmiyah said: When it gets dark, one must ask a sage.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: גְּזֵירָה ״הַיּוֹם״ מִשּׁוּם ״יוֹם אֶחָד״.
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Yosef said: decree today, due to one day,
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Yosef said: A decree "today" because of "one day."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִי הָכִי, לִיגְזוֹר בְּ״יוֹם אֶחָד״ מִשּׁוּם ״הַיּוֹם״!
human_translation: said to him: If so, should decree in the case of one day due to today.
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, to decree on "one day" because of "the day"!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״הַיּוֹם״ בְּ״יוֹם אֶחָד״ מִיחַלַּף, ״יוֹם אֶחָד״ בְּ״הַיּוֹם״ לָא מִיחַלַּף.
human_translation: said to him: this day interchanged with one day, one day not interchanged today,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Today" in "one day" changes, "one day" in "today" does not change.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: אֲמַר לִי מָרִימָר, הָכִי אֲמַר אֲבוּךְ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב [יוֹסֵף]: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא שְׁמַעְתֵּיהּ דְּרַב יִרְמְיָה בַּר אַבָּא — כְּרַבִּי נָתָן. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: כֹּל הַנּוֹדֵר — כְּאִילּוּ בָּנָה בָּמָה, וְהַמְקַיְּימוֹ — כְּאִילּוּ מַקְטִיר עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Ravina said: Mareimar said to me: Your father said as follows, in the name of Rav Yosef: In accordance with whose halakha by Rav Yirmeya bar Abba? in accordance with Rabbi Natan, as it is taught Rabbi Natan says: Anyone who vows, as if he built altar, And one who fulfills is as though he burns upon it,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Marimar told me, thus said your father in the name of Rav Yosef: To whom should one listen, the teaching of Rav Yirmeya bar Abba or that of Rabbi Natan? As it was taught: Rabbi Natan says, "Anyone who makes a vow is as if he built an altar, and one who fulfills it is as if he offered incense upon it."

hebrew_text: ״שַׁבָּת זוֹ״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַשַּׁבָּת כּוּלָּהּ. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: יוֹמֵי דְשַׁבְּתָא קָאָמַר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: this week, prohibited for the entire week, Isn’t obvious lest you say he said the days of the week, teaches us
llm_translation: "Shabbat Zo" — prohibited on all of Shabbat entirely. Obviously! What might you say: the days of Shabbat he is speaking of, he informs us.

hebrew_text: ״חֹדֶשׁ זֶה״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַחֹדֶשׁ, וְרֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ לְהַבָּא. פְּשִׁיטָא! כִּי אִיצְטְרִיכָא לְחֹדֶשׁ חָסֵר,
human_translation: This month, forbidden for the entire month, and New Moon of the next Isn’t obvious? When it was necessary for a deficient, month.
llm_translation: "this month" — prohibited in the entire month, and the beginning of the month to come. It is obvious! Because it is necessary for a lacking month.

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ לְשֶׁעָבַר הָוֵי, וְלָא לִיתְּסַר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן קָרוּ אִינָשֵׁי רֵישׁ יַרְחָא.
human_translation: lest you say the New Moon is of the previous and and should not be forbidden teaches us people call it the New Moon
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? Rosh Chodesh for the past is, and not for the future, it is heard for us that people call it the beginning of the month.

hebrew_text: ״שָׁנָה זוֹ״ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ.
human_translation: This year, forbidden for the entire year,
llm_translation: "This year" — forbidden in the entire year.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ, אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם יוֹם״ — מַאי דִּינֵיהּ? כְּ״הַיּוֹם״, אוֹ כְּ״יוֹם אֶחָד״?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before said: Wine is konam that I taste a day, what is the halakha his as today, or as one day,
llm_translation: He asked them: "The wine that I taste today, what is its law? Is it like 'today' or like 'one day'?"

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע מִמַּתְנִיתִין: ״קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם הַיּוֹם״ — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ. הָא ״יוֹם״ כְּ״יוֹם אֶחָד״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Come hear from the mishna: Wine is konam , that I taste today, prohibited only until nightfall. therefore, a day, comparable one day,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema mi'matnitin: 'kunnam yayin she'ani to'em hayom' — ein asur ela ad shetechshach. Ha 'yom' ke'yom echad' damei." English translation: "Come and hear from the Mishnah: 'Their wine is like the taste of the day' — it is not prohibited except until it gets dark. This 'day' is like 'one day' in its status."

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא, אָמַר: ״יוֹם אֶחָד״ — אָסוּר מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם. הָא ״יוֹם״ כְּ״הַיּוֹם״ דָּמֵי. אֶלָּא מֵהָא לֵיכָּא לְמִשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: say the latter clause he said one day, prohibited from day to day. but a day, comparable today, Rather, no to be learned from this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa, amar: 'yom echad' — asur miyom leyom. Ha 'yom' ke'hayom damei. Ela meha leika le'mishma minah." English translation: "The Gemara asks: 'What about the latter clause, which states: "one day" — is it prohibited from day to day? The word 'day' is like 'today,' making it equivalent to a specific day. Rather, from here it is not inferred.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם הַשָּׁנָה״, נִתְעַבְּרָה הַשָּׁנָה — אָסוּר בָּהּ וּבְעִיבּוּרָהּ. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי?
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Come hear Wine is konam I taste this year, then the year was extended, prohibited in it and its intercalated What are the circumstances?
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said, come and hear: "Their wine is the venom of serpents" (Deuteronomy 32:33). If the year has passed - it is prohibited in it and in its fermentation. How so?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא כִּדְקָתָנֵי — לְמָה לִי לְמֵימְרָא? אֶלָּא לָאו, דַּאֲמַר ״שָׁנָה״. אַלְמָא ״שָׁנָה״ כְּ״הַשָּׁנָה״ דָּמֵי, וְ״יוֹם״ נָמֵי כְּ״הַיּוֹם״ דִּינֵיהּ.
human_translation: If we say as it teaches, why do I to state Rather, is it not where he said a year, Apparently, a year comparable to this year; and the halakha a day also be like today.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Firstly, as it was taught — why do I need to say? Rather, it is not as one would say 'year.' This implies that 'year' is similar to 'this year,' and 'day' is also similar to 'today' in its judgment."

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם דְּאָמַר ״הַשָּׁנָה״, וּמַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: הַלֵּךְ אַחַר רוֹב הַשָּׁנִים, וְלָא אִית בְּהוּ עִיבּוּר, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: No, actually, that he said this year, and lest you say: Follow the majority of years, which do not have an intercalated teaches us
llm_translation: Not, forever, said "the year," and what you might say: Go after the majority of years, and there is no clarity in them, it is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אָמַר ״יַיִן שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם יוֹבֵל״ מַאי? שְׁנַת חֲמִשִּׁים כְּלִפְנֵי חֲמִשִּׁים, אוֹ כִּלְאַחַר חֲמִשִּׁים?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before said: wine that I taste a Jubilee what the fiftieth year as before fifty, or as after fifty,
llm_translation: He asked them: He said, "Wine that I taste Jubilee," what? Year fifty like before fifty, or after fifty?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתַנְיָא פְּלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּם אֵת שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים שָׁנָה״. שְׁנַת הַחֲמִשִּׁים אַתָּה מוֹנֶה, וְאִי אַתָּה מוֹנֶה שְׁנַת חֲמִשִּׁים וְאַחַת. מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: יוֹבֵל אֵינוֹ עוֹלֶה לְמִנְיַן שָׁבוּעַ. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: יוֹבֵל עוֹלֶה לְמִנְיַן שָׁבוּעַ.
human_translation: Come hear, as it is taught a dispute between Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis: “And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year” You count the fiftieth year, but you do not count fiftieth year and first From here they stated: Jubilee Year is not included in the counting of the seven-year Rabbi Yehuda says: The Jubilee Year is included in the counting of the seven-year
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught in the dispute of Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis: "And you shall sanctify the fiftieth year." The fiftieth year you count, and if you do not count the year fifty and one. From here they said: the Jubilee does not enter into the count of weeks. Rabbi Yehuda says: the Jubilee does enter into the count of weeks.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״שֵׁשׁ שָׁנִים תִּזְרַע שָׂדֶךָ״, וְאֵין כָּאן אֶלָּא חָמֵשׁ!
human_translation: said to Rabbi Yehuda: Doesn’t state: “Six years you shall sow your field” But there are only five here,
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Yehuda: "Behold, it says 'You shall sow your field for six years,' but here there are only five!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: לְדִבְרֵיכֶם, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְעָשָׂת אֶת הַתְּבוּאָה לִשְׁלֹשׁ הַשָּׁנִים״. הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבַּע!
human_translation: said to them: according to your statement Doesn’t state: “And it shall bring forth produce for the three years” there are four
llm_translation: He said to them: According to your words, behold it says "and you shall make the produce for three years." Here there are four!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא — אִיכָּא לְאוֹקֹמַהּ בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ, דִילִי נָמֵי אִיכָּא לְאוֹקֹמַהּ בִּשְׁאָר שְׁנֵי שָׁבוּעַ.
human_translation: Rather, it is possible to establish to the other years of seven-year my also, it is possible to establish to the other years of seven-year
llm_translation: Rather — there is a possibility to establish it in the remaining two weeks, for it is possible to establish it in the remaining two weeks.

hebrew_text: ״עַד הַפֶּסַח״ — אָסוּר כּוּ׳. לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: לָא מְעַיֵּיל אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ
human_translation: until Passover, prohibited Is this to say that Rabbi Meir, maintains a person does not place himself
llm_translation: "Until Pesach" — forbidden as well. According to the opinion of Rabbi Meir, one should not endanger oneself.

hebrew_text: לִסְפֵיקָא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: מְעַיֵּיל אִינִישׁ נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִסְפֵיקָא.
human_translation: in uncertainty, and Rabbi Yosei holds a person does place himself in uncertainty?
llm_translation: Regarding a doubtful case, and Rabbi Yosei holds: a person should endanger himself for a doubtful case.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהִי: מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ שְׁתֵּי כִּיתֵּי בָנוֹת מִשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים, וְאָמַר: קִדַּשְׁתִּי אֶת בִּתִּי הַגְּדוֹלָה, וְאֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת, אִם גְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת, וְאִם קְטַנָּה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת שֶׁהִיא גְּדוֹלָה מִן הַגְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת — כּוּלָּן אֲסוּרוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. חוּץ מִן הַקְּטַנָּה שֶׁבַּקְּטַנּוֹת.
human_translation: raises a contradiction one who has two groups daughters from two women, and he said: I betrothed my older daughter but I do not know if older of the older if the older of the younger or if younger of the older who is older than the older of the younger all are prohibited apart from the younger of the younger the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And they raised a dilemma: One who has two daughters from two wives, and he said: I have consecrated my elder daughter, and I do not know if she is the elder among the elders, or the elder among the younger, and if she is younger among the elders, she is elder than the elder among the younger - all of them are forbidden, the words of Rabbi Meir. Except for the younger among the younger.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כּוּלָּן מוּתָּרוֹת, חוּץ מִן הַגְּדוֹלָה שֶׁבַּגְּדוֹלוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: They are all permitted apart from the older of the older
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: All of them are permitted, except for the large one among the large ones.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בַּר אַבְדִּימִי אָמַר רַב: מוּחְלֶפֶת הַשִּׁיטָה. וְהָתַנְיָא, זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁזְּמַנּוֹ קָבוּעַ וְאָמַר ״עַד לִפְנֵי״ — רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Avdimi said Rav said: The opinions is reversed, And it is taught this is the principle: any a fixed time, said until before Rabbi Meir says until ends, and Rabbi Yosei says until arrives.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina bar Avdimi said in the name of Rav: Muḥlephet HaShitah. And it was taught: This is the principle: Anything whose time is fixed and it says "until" - Rabbi Meir says: until it goes out, and Rabbi Yosei says: until it arrives.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״עַד הַקָּצִיר״, ״עַד הַבָּצִיר״, ״עַד הַמָּסִיק״ — אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ. זֶה הַכְּלָל: כֹּל שֶׁזְּמַנּוֹ קָבוּעַ, וְאָמַר: ״עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ״ — אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ. אָמַר: ״עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא״ — אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא. וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין זְמַנּוֹ קָבוּעַ, בֵּין אָמַר ״עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא״, בֵּין אָמַר ״עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ״ — אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ.
human_translation: until the grain harvest, until the grape harvest, until the olive harvest, it is forbidden only until the arrival This is the principle: any whose time is fixed, and one said: Until it arrives, forbidden until arrives. said: Until it will be, forbidden until ends. And any whose time is not fixed, whether he said: Until it will be, Until it arrives, forbidden only until arrives.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Until the harvest," "until the vintage," "until the gathering" — it is not prohibited except until it arrives. This is the principle: anything whose time is fixed, and one says, "until it arrives" — it is prohibited until it arrives. If one says, "until it will be" — it is prohibited until it departs. And anything whose time is not fixed, whether one says "until it will be," or whether one says "until it arrives" — it is not prohibited except until it arrives.

hebrew_text: ״עַד הַקַּיִץ״, ״עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הַקַּיִץ״ — עַד שֶׁיַּתְחִילוּ הָעָם לְהַכְנִיס בְּכַלְכַּלּוֹת. ״עֵד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר הַקַּיִץ״ — עַד שֶׁיַּקְפִּילוּ הַמִּקְצוֹעוֹת.
human_translation: Until the summer [ kayitz ], Until it will be summer, until the people begin to bring into in baskets. Until the summer has passed, until set aside [ yakpilu ] the knives hamaktzuot
llm_translation: "Until the summer," "until it is summer" - until the people begin to bring in their vessels. "Until the summer passes" - until the nuts fall.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: ״כַּלְכַּלָּה״ שֶׁאָמְרוּ — כַּלְכַּלָּה שֶׁל תְּאֵנִים, וְלֹא כַּלְכַּלָּה שֶׁל עֲנָבִים. תַּנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִפֵּירוֹת הַקַּיִץ — אֵין אָסוּר אֶלָּא בִּתְאֵנִים. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: עֲנָבִים בִּכְלַל תְּאֵנִים.
human_translation: taught: basket they spoke a basket of figs, and not a basket of grapes, is taught One who vows summer [ kayitz ] produce to is prohibited only figs, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Grapes are included with figs.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: 'Kalcala' that they said - Kalcala of figs, and not kalcala of grapes. Tanya: One who vows from summer fruits - it is prohibited only with figs. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Grapes are included in figs."

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא? קָסָבַר: תְּאֵנִים מִיקַּצְצָן בִּידָא, עֲנָבִים לָא מִיקַּצְצָן בִּידָא. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל סָבַר: עֲנָבִים נָמֵי, כִּי מִירַדְּדָן — מִיקַּצְצָן בִּידָא.
human_translation: What is the reason of the first tanna ? holds figs are plucked [ mikkatzetzan ] by hand, grapes are plucked not by hand Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds grapes, too, when they are ripe, are plucked by hand.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the first Tanna taught? He holds: figs, one may cut with the hand, but grapes, one may not cut with the hand. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel holds: even grapes, when they are scattered — one may cut them with the hand.

hebrew_text: ״עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר הַקַּיִץ״, עַד שֶׁיִּכָּפְלוּ הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת. תָּנָא: עַד שֶׁיַּכְפִּילוּ רוֹב הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת.
human_translation: Until the summer has passed, until set aside the knives taught: until most set aside knives,
llm_translation: "Until the summer passes," until the essential matters are doubled. It was taught: until the majority of the essential matters are doubled.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: הוּקְפְּלוּ רוֹב הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת — מוּתָּרוֹת מִשּׁוּם גֵּזֶל, וּפְטוּרוֹת מִן הַמַּעַשְׂרוֹת.
human_translation: taught: most of the knives have been set aside, are permitted with regard to stealing and are exempt from tithes,
llm_translation: Mishna: If most of the compartments were sealed - they are permitted due to theft, and exempt from tithes.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אִיקְּלַעוּ לְהָהוּא אַתְרָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּקְפְּלוּ רוֹב הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת, רַבִּי הֲוָה קָא אָכֵיל, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא אָכֵיל. אֲתָא מָרְהוֹן, אֲמַר לְהוּ: אַמַּאי לָא אָכְלִי רַבָּנַן? הוּקְפְּלוּ רוֹב הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת הוּא! וְאַף עַל פִּי כֵן לָא אָכֵיל רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, קָסָבַר: מִשּׁוּם סַנְיוּת מִילְּתָא הוּא דְּקָאָמַר הָדֵין גַּבְרָא.
human_translation: Rabbi and Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda arrived at a certain place at a time when most of the knives had been set aside. Rabbi ate Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda did not eat. The owner came said to them: Why are the Sages not eating? It is most of the knives have been set aside. But nevertheless, Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda did not eat, he thought due to embarrassment over the matter that man said
llm_translation: Rabbi and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, came to that place at a time when most of the dishes had been overturned. Rabbi was eating, but Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, was not eating. Marhon came and said to them: Why did you not eat, Rabbis? Most of the dishes had been overturned! Nevertheless, Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, did not eat, for he held: It is a matter of modesty that the man is saying so.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אִיקְּלַע לְהָהוּא אַתְרָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּקְפְּלוּ רוֹב הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת, הֲוָה קָאָכֵיל, יָהֵיב לְשַׁמָּעֵיהּ לָא אָכֵיל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֱכוֹל, כָּךְ אָמַר לִי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בַּר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי מִשּׁוּם אָבִיו: הוּקְפְּלוּ רוֹב הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת — מוּתָּרוֹת מִשּׁוּם גֵּזֶל וּפְטוּרוֹת מִן הַמַּעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Rabbi Ḥanina arrived at a certain place at a time when most of the knives had been set aside. He ate he gave to his attendant did not eat. said to him: Eat, Rabbi Yishmael bar Rabbi Yosei said to me the following in the name of his father: most of the knives have been set aside, are permitted with regard to stealing and are exempt from the tithe.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina happened upon a certain place where most of the produce had been tithed. He ate, and then gave to his attendant to eat, but the attendant did not eat. He said to him: Eat, for so Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yosei told me in the name of his father: If most of the produce has been tithed, it is permitted due to theft and exempt from tithing.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ הָהוּא גַּבְרָא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּקְפְּלוּ הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת דְּקָאָכֵיל. אַחֲתֵיהּ בְּשַׂקָּא וְשַׁקְלֵיהּ וְאַמְטְיֵיהּ לְמִשְׁדֵּיהּ בְּנַהֲרָא. אָמַר לוֹ: אוֹי לוֹ לְטַרְפוֹן שֶׁזֶּה הוֹרְגוֹ! שְׁמַע הָהוּא גַּבְרָא שַׁבְקֵיהּ וַעֲרַק. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל: כׇּל יָמָיו שֶׁל אוֹתוֹ צַדִּיק הָיָה מִצְטַעֵר עַל דָּבָר זֶה, אָמַר: אוֹי לִי שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמַּשְׁתִּי בְּכִתְרָהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: A certain man found Rabbi Tarfon eating at the time when most of the knives had been set aside. He placed in a sack, lifted him up, and carried him to throw him into the river. said to him: Woe to Tarfon, for this is killing him. that man heard he left him and fled. Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Ḥananya ben Gamliel: All the days of that righteous man, he was distressed over this matter, saying: Woe is me, for I made use of the crown of Torah,
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon found a certain man who was eating at a time when the joints of the sacrifices had been burnt. He took him, wrapped him in a sack, and threw him into the river. The man said to him: "Woe to Tarfon, for he is killing me!" That man heard, released him, and let him go. Rabbi Abahu said in the name of Rabbi Hananiah ben Gamliel: All the days of that righteous man's life, he was distressed about this matter, saying: "Woe to me that I have used the crown of the Torah for this."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַמִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּכִתְרָהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה נֶעְקָר מִן הָעוֹלָם. קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה בֵּלְשַׁצַּר שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בִּכְלֵי קוֹדֶשׁ שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ כְּלֵי חוֹל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבָאוּ בָהּ פָּרִיצִים וְחִילְּלוּהָ״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁפְּרָצוּם נַעֲשׂוּ חוֹל — נֶעְקַר מִן הָעוֹלָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״בֵּהּ בְּלֵילְיָא קְטִיל בֵּלְשַׁצַּר״, הַמִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּכִתְרָהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה, שֶׁהוּא חַי וְקַיָּים לְעוֹלָם — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Whoever makes use of the crown of Torah is uprooted from the world. an a fortiori If Belshazzar, who made use of the sacred vessels, which had become non-sacred vessels as it is stated “And robbers shall enter into it, and profane it” once have been robbed they become non-sacred, was uprooted from the world as it is written: “On that night Belshazzar was killed” one who makes use of the crown of Torah, which lives and endures forever all the more so
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Anyone who makes personal use of the crown of Torah is uprooted from the world. A fortiori: And what about the desecration of the Temple vessels that were made into mundane vessels, as it is stated: "And the boasters will come and profane it" (Daniel 11:31). Once they were profaned and turned into mundane vessels, they are uprooted from the world, as it is written: "In it, the killer of the night will come" (Hosea 7:1). But one who makes personal use of the crown of Torah, which is alive and enduring forever — how much more so.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן, כֵּיוָן דְּכִי אָכֵיל דְּהוּקְפְּלוּ רוֹב הַמַּקְצוּעוֹת הֲוָה, אַמַּאי צַעֲרֵיהּ הָהוּא גַּבְרָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּהָהוּא הֲווֹ גָּנְבִי לֵיהּ עִנְבֵי כּוּלַּהּ שַׁתָּא, וְכֵיוָן דְּאַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן סָבַר: הַיְינוּ דְּגַנְבַן. אִי הָכִי אַמַּאי צַיעַר נַפְשֵׁיהּ? מִשּׁוּם דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן עָשִׁיר גָּדוֹל הֲוָה, וַהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְפַיְּיסוֹ בְּדָמִים.
human_translation: And Rabbi Tarfon, since he was eating when most of the knives had been set aside, why did that man trouble him? because had been stealing grapes from that all year, and when he found Rabbi Tarfon he thought: This is who stole from me If so, why did Rabbi Tarfon berate himself? Since Rabbi Tarfon was very wealthy, he should have to appease him with money
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon, since when he would eat, the majority of the delicacies were his, why did that man suffer? Because those thieves stole all his grapes, and when Rabbi Tarfon discovered it, he thought: they are the thieves. If so, why did he cause himself distress? Because Rabbi Tarfon was a great wealthy man, and he could have settled with them for money.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: ״לְאַהֲבָה אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ לִשְׁמוֹעַ בְּקֹלוֹ וּלְדׇבְקָה בוֹ״, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר אָדָם: אֶקְרָא שֶׁיִּקְרָאוּנִי ״חָכָם״, אֶשְׁנֶה שֶׁיִּקְרָאוּנִי ״רַבִּי״, אֲשַׁנֵּן שֶׁאֶהְיֶה זָקֵן וְאֵשֵׁב בִּישִׁיבָה.
human_translation: is taught “To love the Lord your God, to listen to His voice, and to cleave to Him” that a person should not say: I will read so that they will call me a Sage; I will study so that they will call me Rabbi; I will review so that I will be an Elder and will sit in the academy.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "To love the Lord your God, to listen to His voice, and to cling to Him," so that a person should not say: I will study in order to be called 'wise,' I will change so that they will call me 'Rabbi,' I will further change so that I will become old and sit in the Yeshiva.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַד מֵאַהֲבָה, וְסוֹף הַכָּבוֹד לָבֹא. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קׇשְׁרֵם עַל אֶצְבְּעֹתֶיךָ כׇּתְבֵם עַל לוּחַ לִבֶּךָ״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״דְּרָכֶיהָ דַרְכֵי נוֹעַם״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״עֵץ חַיִּים הִיא לַמַּחֲזִיקִים בָּהּ וְתֹמְכֶיהָ מְאֻשָּׁר״.
human_translation: Rather, learn out of love, And the honor will eventually come as it is stated: “Bind them upon your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart” and it states: “Its ways are ways of pleasantness, and it states: “It is a tree of life to those who grasp it; happy is everyone who holds it fast”
llm_translation: Rather, learn from love, and the end of honor to come. As it is said: "Bind them upon your fingers, write them upon the tablet of your heart." And it says: "Her ways are ways of pleasantness," and it says: "It is a tree of life to those who grasp it, and those who support it are fortunate."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בַּר רַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹמֵר: עֲשֵׂה דְּבָרִים לְשֵׁם פׇּעֳלָם, וְדַבֵּר בָּהֶם לִשְׁמָם. אַל תַּעֲשֵׂם עֲטָרָה לְהִתְגַּדֵּל בָּהֶם, וְאַל תַּעֲשֵׂם קוּרְדּוֹם לִהְיוֹת עוֹדֵר בּוֹ. וְקַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה בֵּלְשַׁצַּר שֶׁלֹּא נִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ אֶלָּא בִּכְלֵי קֹדֶשׁ שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ כְּלֵי חוֹל — נֶעְקַר מִן הָעוֹלָם, הַמִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בְּכִתְרָהּ שֶׁל תּוֹרָה — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer bar Rabbi Tzadok says: Do things for the sake of their performance, and speak of for their own sake. Do not make them a crown with which to become glorified, nor make them a dolabra [ kordom ] with which to hoe, And an a fortiori If Belshazzar, who made use only of sacred vessels that had become non-sacred vessels, was uprooted from the world, one who makes use of the crown of Torah, all the more so
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: Do things for the sake of their Maker, and speak of them for their own sake. Do not make them a crown to magnify yourself with them, and do not make them a spade to dig with. And a fortiori: Just as with the treasury officer who only used vessels of the sanctuary that were made for secular purposes — he is removed from the world, one who uses the crown of Torah — all the more so.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְאִינִישׁ לְאוֹדוֹעֵי נַפְשֵׁיהּ בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא יָדְעִי לֵיהּ — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעַבְדְּךָ יָרֵא אֶת ה׳ מִנְּעוּרָיו״, אֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא דְּרַבִּי טַרְפוֹן! עָשִׁיר גָּדוֹל הָיָה, וַהֲוָה לֵיהּ לְפַיֹּיסֵיהּ בְּדָמִים.
human_translation: Rava said: it is permitted for a person to make himself known in a place where do not know him. as it is written: “But I, your servant, have feared the Lord from my youth” But difficult Rabbi Tarfon, as he was very wealthy, and he should have to appease him with money.
llm_translation: Rava said: It is permitted for a person to harm themselves in a place where they are not known - as it is written: "And your servant feared the Lord from his youth." Rather, the difficulty is with the statement of Rabbi Tarfon! He was a great wealthy man, and he would appease him with blood.

hebrew_text: רָבָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וְעַבְדְּךָ יָרֵא אֶת ה׳ מִנְּעוּרָיו״, וּכְתִיב: ״יְהַלֶּלְךָ זָר וְלֹא פִיךָ״! הָא — בְּאַתְרָא דְּיָדְעִי לֵיהּ, הָא — בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא יָדְעִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written “But I, your servant, have feared the Lord from my youth.” And it is written: “Let another praise you, and not your own mouth” This to a place where know him, that to a place where do not know him.
llm_translation: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written, "And your servant fears the Lord from his youth," and it is written, "Let a stranger praise you, and not your own mouth!" This one - in a situation where one knows him, and this one - in a situation where one does not know him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְצוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְמֵימַר ״צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן אֲנָא, שְׁרוֹ לִי תִּיגְרַאי בְּרֵישָׁא״, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְנֵי דָוִד כֹּהֲנִים הָיוּ״ — מָה כֹּהֵן נוֹטֵל בָּרֹאשׁ, אַף תַּלְמִיד חָכָם נוֹטֵל בָּרֹאשׁ. וְכֹהֵן מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתּוֹ כִּי אֶת לֶחֶם (ה׳) אֱלֹהֶיךָ הוּא מַקְרִיב״, וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְקִדַּשְׁתּוֹ״ — לְכׇל דָּבָר שֶׁבִּקְדוּשָּׁה,
human_translation: Rava said It is permitted for a Torah scholar to say: I am a Torah scholar, resolve my case first, as it is written: “And the sons of David were priests” just as a priest takes first, so too, a Torah scholar takes first. And a priest, from where do we As it is written: “And you shall sanctify him, for he offers the bread of your God” And the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “and you shall sanctify him” to every matter of sanctity:
llm_translation: Rava said: It is permitted for a student to address his teacher by saying, "My teacher, allow me to argue at the beginning," as it is written: "And the sons of David were priests" — just as a priest takes precedence, so too a Torah scholar takes precedence. And how do we know that a priest takes precedence? As it is written: "And you shall sanctify him, for he offers the bread of your God," and it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And you shall sanctify him" — for anything related to sanctity.

hebrew_text: לִפְתּוֹחַ רִאשׁוֹן, וּלְבָרֵךְ רִאשׁוֹן, וְלִיטּוֹל מָנָה יָפָה רִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: To open first, to recite a blessing first, and to take a fine portion first.
llm_translation: To open first, and to bless first, and to take a beautiful portion first.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְצוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְמֵימַר: לָא יָהֵיבְנָא אַכְּרָגָא, דִּכְתִיב ״מִנְדָּה בְלוֹ וַהֲלָךְ לָא שַׁלִּיט לְמִירְמֵא עֲלֵיהוֹן״. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: ״מִנְדָּה״ — זוֹ מְנָת הַמֶּלֶךְ, ״בְּלוֹ״ — זוֹ כֶּסֶף גֻּולְגָּלְתָּא, ״וַהֲלָךְ״ — זוֹ אַרְנוֹנָא.
human_translation: Rava said: It is permitted for a Torah scholar to say: I will not pay the head tax [ karga ], as it is written “It shall not be lawful to impose minda , belo , and halakh upon them” And Rabbi Yehuda said: Minda ; this is the king’s portion. Belo ; this is the money head And halakh ; this is arnona ,
llm_translation: Rava said: It is permitted for a student to argue with his teacher to say: "I did not give you a reward," as it is written, "A bribe in secret he will take, to pervert the ways of justice" (Proverbs 17:23). And Rabbi Yehuda said: "Bribe" - this is the portion of the king, "in secret" - this is silver coins, "he will take" - this is a pledge.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רָבָא: שְׁרֵי לֵיהּ לְצוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן לְמֵימַר: ״עַבְדָּא דְנוּרָא אֲנָא לָא יָהֵיבְנָא אַכְּרָגָא״. מַאי טַעְמָא — לְאַבְרוֹחֵי אַרְיָא מִינֵּיהּ קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And Rava said It is permitted for a Torah scholar to say: I am a servant of fire I will not pay the head tax. What is the reason is saying to chase a lion from him,
llm_translation: And Rava said: It is permitted for a student to argue with his teacher by saying, "I have not received a measure of light." What is the reason? - To sharpen the lion's claws.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי הֲוָה לֵיהּ הָהוּא אִבָּא, זַבְּנֵיהּ לְבֵי נוּרָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הָאִיכָּא ״לִפְנֵי עִוֵּר לֹא תִתֵּן מִכְשׁוֹל״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: רוֹב עֵצִים לְהַסָּקָה נִיתְּנוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi had a particular forest, he sold it to the temple of fire Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Isn’t there “You shall not put a stumbling block before the blind” He said to him: Most wood is for kindling,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi had a certain father-in-law, his name was Beinura. Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Is there not "Do not put a stumbling block before the blind"? He said to him: Most of the wood was given for burning.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״עַד הַקָּצִיר״ — עַד שֶׁיַּתְחִיל הֶעָם לִקְצוֹר קְצִיר חִטִּין, אֲבָל לֹא קְצִיר שְׂעוֹרִין, הַכֹּל לְפִי מְקוֹם נִדְרוֹ. אִם הָיָה בָּהָר — בָּהָר, וְאִם הָיָה בַּבִּקְעָה — בַּבִּקְעָה.
human_translation: until the harvest, until people begin to harvest. the wheat harvest but not the barley harvest. all according to the place his vow. If he was on a mountain, the mountain, and if he was in a valley, in the valley.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Until the harvest" - until the people begin to harvest the wheat crop, but not the barley crop. Everything depends on the location of his vow. If he was on a mountain - on the mountain, and if he was in a valley - in the valley.

hebrew_text: ״עַד הַגְּשָׁמִים״, ״עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ הַגְּשָׁמִים״ — עַד שֶׁתֵּרֵד רְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה. רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ זְמַנָּהּ שֶׁל רְבִיעָה. ״עַד שֶׁיִּפְסְקוּ גְּשָׁמִים״ — עַד שֶׁיֵּצֵא נִיסָן כּוּלּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד שֶׁיַּעֲבוֹר הַפֶּסַח.
human_translation: until the rains, until there are rains, until the second rain falls. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Until the time of the rainfall arrives, until rains end, until the entire Nisan has ended; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until Passover has passed.
llm_translation: "Until the rains," "until there are rains" - until the second quarter descends. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: until its designated time of the second quarter arrives. "Until the rains cease" - until the entire month of Nisan has passed, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: until the Passover has passed.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר ״עַד הַקַּיִץ״ בַּגָּלִיל, וְיָרַד לָעֲמָקִים, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִגִּיעַ הַקַּיִץ בָּעֲמָקִים — אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ הַקַּיִץ בַּגָּלִיל.
human_translation: It is taught one who vows until the summer in the Galilee and descends to the valleys, even if the summer has arrived in the valleys, forbidden until summer arrives in the Galilee,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: It was taught: One who vows 'until the summer' in the Galilee, and descends to the valleys, even though the summer has arrived in the valleys, it is forbidden until the summer arrives in the Galilee."

hebrew_text: ״עַד הַגְּשָׁמִים״, ״עַד שֶׁיְּהוּ גְּשָׁמִים״ — עַד שֶׁתֵּרֵד רְבִיעָה שְׁנִיָּה, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַחֲלוֹקֶת דְּאָמַר ״עַד הַגְּשָׁמִים״, אֲבָל אָמַר ״עַד הַגֶּשֶׁם״ — עַד זְמַן גְּשָׁמִים קָאָמַר.
human_translation: until the rains, until there are rains, until the second rain Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Rabbi Zeira said: dispute where said: Until the rains. However, he says: Until the rain, he is saying until the time of the rains,
llm_translation: "Until the rains," "until there are rains" - until the second quarter descends, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says, etc. Rabbi Zeira said: The dispute is regarding one who says "until the rains," but one who says "until the rain" - he is referring to the time of rains.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אֵיזוֹהִי זְמַנָּהּ שֶׁל רְבִיעָה? הַבְּכִירָה — בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה, בֵּינוֹנִית — בְּשִׁבְעָה, אֲפִילָה — בְּעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה, וּבְשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר, וּבְעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: raises an objection When is the time of the rainfall? The early on the third intermediate on the seventh late on the twenty-third the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: on the seventh, on the seventeenth, and on the twenty-third
llm_translation: The Tanna raises an objection: What is the time of the fourth period? The eldest sheep - at three years, the middle one - at seven years, and even the youngest - at twenty-three years, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: at seven years, and at seventeen years, and at twenty-three years.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר, וּבְעֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁלֹשָׁה, וּבְחוֹדֶשׁ כִּסְלֵיו. וְכֵן הָיָה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין הַיְּחִידִים מִתְעַנִּין עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ כִּסְלֵיו.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: on the seventeenth and on the twenty-third and at month of Kislev. And so too, Rabbi Yosei would say: individuals, do not fast until the New Moon of Kislev arrives
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: On the seventeenth, and on the twenty-third, and on the month of Kislev. And so Rabbi Yosei used to say: Individuals do not fast until the beginning of the month of Kislev.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן עֲלַהּ: בִּשְׁלָמָא רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — לִישָּׁאֵל. שְׁלִישִׁית — לְהִתְעַנּוֹת. אֶלָּא שְׁנִיָּה לְמַאי? וְאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לְנוֹדֵר.
human_translation: And we say about this: Granted, first rainfall, to asking third to fasting But second for what And Rabbi Zeira said: for one who vows
llm_translation: We say regarding it: The first quarter - for Yisrael. The third - for fasting. But the second, for what? And Rabbi Zeira said: For vows.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן עֲלַהּ: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: גְּשָׁמִים שֶׁיָּרְדוּ שִׁבְעָה יָמִים זֶה אַחַר זֶה — אַתָּה מוֹנֶה בָּהֶן רְבִיעָה רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה. כְּמַאן? כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: And we say about this: In accordance with whose opinion is that which is taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: rains that fell seven days, one after another, you count them the first rainfall and second. In accordance with whose In accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: We say about it: To whom does this that was taught go according to? Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Rain that fell for seven days consecutively - you count the fourth and the second. According to whom? According to Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דְּאָמַר ״עַד הַגְּשָׁמִים״.
human_translation: That who said: Until the rains,
llm_translation: That one who said, "Until the rains."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם לְשָׁנָה״, נִתְעַבְּרָה הַשָּׁנָה — אָסוּר בָּהּ וּבְעִיבּוּרָהּ. ״עַד רֹאשׁ אֲדָר״ — עַד רֹאשׁ אֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן. ״עַד סוֹף אֲדָר״ — עַד סוֹף אֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Wine is konam that I will not taste for the year, the year was extended, prohibited during and its intercalated until the beginning of Adar, until the beginning the first Adar. until the end of Adar, until the end of the first Adar.
llm_translation: Mishnah: "If their wine does not taste like wine," if the year has passed - it is forbidden in it and in its fermentation. "Until the beginning of Adar" - until the beginning of the first Adar. "Until the end of Adar" - until the end of the first Adar.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אַלְמָא סְתָמָא דַּ״אֲדָר״ דְּקָאָמַר — רִאשׁוֹן הוּא.
human_translation: Apparently, says Adar without specification, is the first
llm_translation: Gemara: "G'ma al'ma setama da'Adar deka'amar - rishon hu."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: אֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן — כּוֹתֵב ״אֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן״, אֲדָר שֵׁנִי — כּוֹתֵב ״אֲדָר״ סְתָם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן — כּוֹתֵב סְתָם, אֲדָר שֵׁנִי — כּוֹתֵב ״תִּינְיָין״.
human_translation: Shall we say the mishna is Rabbi Yehuda? As it is taught the first Adar, writes the first Adar. second Adar, writes Adar without specification; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says the first Adar writes without specification, second Adar writes second
llm_translation: Let us say the Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda, it is, as it was taught: The first Adar - one writes "Adar the first," the second Adar - one writes "Adar" simply, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: The first Adar - one writes simply, the second Adar - one writes "Tinyyan."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא דְּיָדַע דִּמְעַבְּרָא שַׁתָּא, הָא דְּלָא יָדַע.
human_translation: Abaye said: You even say Rabbi Meir, this where knew that the year was extended, that where he did not know
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Meir, this one who knows that he passed a cup, this one who does not know.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: ״עַד רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר״ — עַד רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר הָרִאשׁוֹן, אִם הָיְתָה שָׁנָה מְעוּבֶּרֶת — עַד רֹאשׁ חֹדֶשׁ אֲדָר הַשֵּׁנִי.
human_translation: And, it is taught until the New Moon of Adar, until the New Moon of the first Adar, if it was a leap year, until the New Moon of the second Adar.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: "Until the beginning of the month of Adar" - until the beginning of the first month of Adar, if the year was a leap year - until the beginning of the second month of Adar.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא לָאו בִּמְעוּבֶּרֶת עָסְקִינַן?! שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הָא דִּפְשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דִּמְעַבְּרָא שַׁתָּא, הָא דְּלָא יָדַע.
human_translation: by inference that the first clause, we are not dealing with a leap learn from it this where is obvious to him that the year was extended, that where did not know
llm_translation: From the premise of the first part, are we not dealing with a case of "me'uberet"?! Understand from it: that which is clear to him that it is a case of "me'ubera shata," that which he does not know.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הַפֶּסַח״ — לֹא נִתְכַּוֵּון זֶה אֶלָּא עַד לֵיל הַפֶּסַח, עַד שָׁעָה שֶׁדֶּרֶךְ בְּנֵי אָדָם לִשְׁתּוֹת יַיִן.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Wine is konam that I will not taste until it will be Passover, this intended only until the night of Passover, until the time when it is customary for people to drink wine
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Yehuda says: "Their wine, which I do not taste until the Passover" - this one does not intend except until the night of the Passover, until the time when people are accustomed to drink wine.

hebrew_text: אָמַר ״קֻוֽנָּם בָּשָׂר שֶׁאֵינִי טוֹעֵם עַד שֶׁיְּהֵא הַצּוֹם״ — אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא עַד לֵילֵי צוֹם, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְכַּוֵּון זֶה אֶלָּא עַד שָׁעָה שֶׁדֶּרֶךְ בְּנֵי אָדָם לֶאֱכוֹל בָּשָׂר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּנוֹ אוֹמֵר: ״קֻוֽנָּם שׁוּם שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם עַד שֶׁתְּהֵא שַׁבָּת״, אֵינוֹ אָסוּר אֶלָּא עַד לֵילֵי שַׁבָּת, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְכַּוֵּון זֶה אֶלָּא עַד שָׁעָה שֶׁדֶּרֶךְ בְּנֵי אָדָם לֶאֱכוֹל בְּשׁוּם.
human_translation: Meat is konam that I will not taste until it will be the fast he is prohibited only until the eve of [ leilei ] the fast. because this intended only until the time when it is customary for people to eat meat Rabbi Yosei, his son, says: Garlic is konam that I taste until it will be Shabbat, it is prohibited only until the eve of Shabbat, as this intended only until the time when it is customary for people to eat garlic.
llm_translation: He said, "Their meat that I do not taste until the fast" - it is not forbidden except until the eve of the fast, for this intention is not until the hour that it is the way of people to eat meat. Rabbi Yosei his son says: "Their garlic that I taste until it is Shabbat" - it is not forbidden except until the eve of Shabbat, for this intention is not until the hour that it is the way of people to eat garlic.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי נֶהֱנֶה לְךָ אִם אֵין אַתְּ בָּא וְנוֹטֵל לְבָנֶיךָ כּוֹר אֶחָד שֶׁל חִטִּין וּשְׁתֵּי חָבִיּוֹת שֶׁל יַיִן״ — הֲרֵי זֶה יָכוֹל לְהָפֵר אֶת נִדְרוֹ שֶׁלֹּא עַל פִּי חָכָם. וְיֹאמַר לוֹ: כְּלוּם אָמַרְתָּ אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי כְבוֹדִי — זֶהוּ כְּבוֹדִי.
human_translation: one who says to another: Benefiting from you is konam for me, if you do not come and take for your son one kor of wheat and two barrels of wine this can dissolve his vow without consent a halakhic authority. he say to him: you say any other than due to my honor, This is my honor,
llm_translation: The one who says to his fellow, "I am benefiting you with a kor of wheat and two barrels of wine if you do not come and take your bricks" — he is able to annul his vow not in accordance with the ruling of a sage. And he may say to him: "You did not say anything except for my honor — this is my honor."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן הָאוֹמֵר לַחֲבֵירוֹ ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאַתְּ נֶהֱנֵית לִי אִם אֵין אַתְּ בָּא וְנוֹתֵן לִבְנִי כּוֹר שֶׁל חִטִּין וּשְׁתֵּי חָבִיּוֹת שֶׁל יַיִן״, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: אָסוּר עַד שֶׁיִּתֵּן, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אַף זֶה יָכוֹל לְהָפֵר אֶת נִדְרוֹ שֶׁלֹּא עַל פִּי חָכָם, וְיֹאמַר לוֹ: הֲרֵי אֲנִי כְּאִילּוּ נִתְקַבַּלְתִּי.
human_translation: And, so too, one who says to another: Benefiting from me is konam for you, if you do not come and give my son one kor of wheat and two barrels of wine, Rabbi Meir says: prohibited until he gives the Rabbis say: Even this can dissolve his vow without consent of a halakhic authority. he say to him: I hereby as though I have received
llm_translation: The one who says to his fellow, "Designate for me that which you benefit from me, if you do not come and give my son a kor of wheat and two barrels of wine," Rabbi Meir says: It is forbidden until he gives. And the Sages say: Even this can annul his vow without consulting a sage, and he should say to him: "Behold, it is as if I have been accepted."

hebrew_text: הָיָה מְסָרֵב בּוֹ לָשֵׂאת בַּת אֲחוֹתוֹ, וְאָמַר ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁהִיא נֶהֱנֵית לִי לְעוֹלָם״, וְכֵן הַמְגָרֵשׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ, אוֹמֵר ״קֻוֽנָּם אִשְׁתִּי נֶהֱנֵית לִי לְעוֹלָם״ — הֲרֵי אֵלּוּ מוּתָּרוֹת לֵהָנוֹת לוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְכַּוֵּון זֶה אֶלָּא לְשׁוּם אִישׁוּת.
human_translation: was urging to marry the daughter of his sister, and said: Benefiting from me is konam for her forever, and, so too, one who divorces his wife says: Benefiting from me is konam my wife forever, these are permitted to benefit from him, as this intended only for the purpose marriage
llm_translation: He was reluctant to marry his sister, and he said, "Their knot is that she is enjoyable to me forever," and so too one who divorces his wife, says, "Their knot is that my wife is enjoyable to me forever" - these are permitted to benefit him, as he did not intend this except for the sake of marriage.

hebrew_text: הָיָה מְסָרֵב בַּחֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁיֹּאכַל אֶצְלוֹ, אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם לְבֵיתְךָ שֶׁאֲנִי נִכְנָס, טִיפַּת צוֹנֵן שֶׁאֲנִי טוֹעֵם לָךְ״ — מוּתָּר לִיכָּנֵס לְבֵיתוֹ וְלִשְׁתּוֹת מִמֶּנּוּ צוֹנֵן, שֶׁלֹּא נִתְכַּוֵּון זֶה אֶלָּא לְשׁוּם אֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה.
human_translation: was urging another eat with him, said: Entering your house konam me, tasting a drop of cold liquid of yours, permitted to enter his house and to drink a cold of his. because this intended only for the purpose of eating and drinking
llm_translation: He was refusing with his friend that he should eat by him, he said: "Prepare for your house that I am entering, a drop of cold water that I am tasting for you" — he is permitted to enter his house and drink cold water from it, since his intention was only for the sake of eating and drinking.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ קֻוֽנָּם יַיִן
llm_translation: We will return to you, our cup, wine.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר : פּוֹתְחִין לְאָדָם בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: may broach with a person by the honor of his father and mother, But the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: One opens with honor for his father and mother, and the sages prohibit.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי צָדוֹק: עַד שֶׁפּוֹתְחִין לוֹ בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, יִפְתְּחוּ לוֹ בִּכְבוֹד הַמָּקוֹם, אִם כֵּן — אֵין נְדָרִים! מוֹדִים חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּדָבָר שֶׁבֵּינוֹ לְבֵין אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, שֶׁפּוֹתְחִין לוֹ בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Tzadok said: Instead of broaching with him by the honor of his father and mother, let them broach with him by the honor of the Omnipresent. if so, there are no vows. the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer with regard to a matter that is between him and his father and mother, that may broach with him by the honor of his father and mother,
llm_translation: Rabbi Tzadok said: Until they open to him with the honor of his father and mother, they should open to him with the honor of the Omnipresent. If so - there are no vows! The Sages concede to Rabbi Eliezer regarding a matter between him and his father and mother, that they should open to him with the honor of his father and mother.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: פּוֹתְחִין בַּנּוֹלָד, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי נֶהֱנֶה לְאִישׁ פְּלוֹנִי״ וְנַעֲשָׂה סוֹפֵר, אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה מַשִּׂיא אֶת בְּנוֹ, וְאָמַר: ״אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא נַעֲשֶׂה סוֹפֵר אוֹ שֶׁהָיָה מַשִּׂיא אֶת בְּנוֹ בְּקָרוֹב — לֹא הָיִיתִי נוֹדֵר״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer further said: may broach by a new situation, but the Rabbis prohibit How said: It is like an offering [ konam ] that I will derive benefit from so-and-so, and became a scribe [ sofer ], or if was marrying off his son and said: Had I known that he would become a scribe, or that he would be marrying off his son in the near I would not have vowed.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Eliezer said: We may open with the newborn, but the sages prohibit. How so? He said: "Their intention is that I should benefit a certain person," and he became a scribe, or he was appointing his son, and he said: "If only I had known that he would become a scribe or that he would appoint his son soon - I would not have made a vow."

hebrew_text: ״קֻוֽנָּם לְבַיִת זֶה שֶׁאֲנִי נִכְנָס״ וְנַעֲשָׂה בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת, אָמַר: ״אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא נַעֲשָׂה בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת — לֹא הָיִיתִי נוֹדֵר״. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מַתִּיר, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Entering this house is konam and became a synagogue, he said: Had I known that it would become a synagogue, I would not have vowed, Rabbi Eliezer permits and the Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: "Their intent was for this house that I am entering," and it became a synagogue, he said: "If I had known that it would become a synagogue, I would not have made a vow." Rabbi Eliezer permits, but the sages prohibit.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״אֵין נְדָרִים״? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: אִם כֵּן, אֵין נְדָרִים נִיתָּרִין יָפֶה.
human_translation: What there are no vows, Abaye said: If so, vows are not dissolved properly.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "ein nedarim"? Abaye said: If so, nedarim are not annulled properly.

hebrew_text: וְרָבָא אָמַר: אִם כֵּן אֵין נְדָרִים נִשְׁאָלִין לְחָכָם.
human_translation: And Rava said: If so, there are no requests of vows to a halakhic authority.
llm_translation: Rava said: If so, vows are not asked of a sage.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: וּמוֹדִין חֲכָמִים לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּדָבָר שֶׁבֵּינוֹ לְבֵין אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ, שֶׁפּוֹתְחִים לוֹ בִּכְבוֹד אָבִיו וְאִמּוֹ. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְאַבָּיֵי דְּאָמַר: אִם כֵּן אֵין נְדָרִים נִיתָּרִין, הָכָא כֵּיוָן דְּאִיחֲצַף לֵיהּ — הָא אִיחֲצַף לֵיהּ.
human_translation: We learned And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Eliezer with regard to a matter that is between him and his father and mother, that may broach with him by the honor of his father and mother. Granted, according to Abaye, who said: If so, vows are not dissolved here, since he was impudent toward him he was impudent toward him
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: And the Sages concede to Rabbi Eliezer in a matter between him and his father and mother, that they should honor him with the honor due to his father and mother. Granted according to Abbaye who said: If so, vows are not annulled, here, since he became angry with him - he became angry with him.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר: אִם כֵּן אֵין נְדָרִים נִשְׁאָלִין לְחָכָם, הָכָא אַמַּאי פּוֹתְחִין? אָמְרִי: כֵּיוָן דְּכֹל נִדְרֵי לָא סַגִּיא לְהוֹן דְּלָאו חָכָם — הָכָא נָמֵי פּוֹתְחִין.
human_translation: But according to Rava, who said: If so, there are no requests to a halakhic authority, here, why broach say Since it is not sufficient for all vows not a halakhic authority, here too, may broach
llm_translation: To Rava, for he said: If so, vows are not asked of a sage, here why do we open? They said: Since all vows are not significant to those who are not wise - here we also open.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר פּוֹתְחִין בַּנּוֹלָד כּוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״כִּי מֵתוּ כׇּל הָאֲנָשִׁים״ — וְהָא מִיתָה דְּנוֹלָד הוּא, מִכָּאן שֶׁפּוֹתְחִין בַּנּוֹלָד.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer further said: may broach by a new situation, What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? Rav Ḥisda said: For the verse states “For all the men are dead But death is a new circumstance, from here that may broach by a new situation.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Eliezer said: We may open with the case of a stillborn at nine months. What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer's statement? Rav Hisda said: As the verse states, "For all the men have died" - and the death of a stillborn is considered a death; hence we may open with the case of a stillborn.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ? קָסָבְרִי: הָנְהוּ מִי מָיְיתִי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״נִצִּים״ וְ״נִצָּבִים״, אֵינָן אֶלָּא דָּתָן וַאֲבִירָם. אֶלָּא אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: שֶׁיָּרְדוּ מִנִּכְסֵיהֶן.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what is their reason They hold: These had they died? But Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Wherever it is stated striving or standing they are none other than Dathan and Abiram. Rather, Reish Lakish said: that they lost their property
llm_translation: The Sages, what are their reasons? They hold: Did they actually come? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Any place where it says "Nitzim" and "Nitzavim," it is none other than Dathan and Abiram. Rather, Reish Lakish said: that they descended from their wealth.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל אָדָם שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּנִים — חָשׁוּב כְּמֵת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הָבָה לִּי בָנִים וְאִם אַיִן מֵתָה אָנֹכִי״. וְתַנְיָא, אַרְבָּעָה חֲשׁוּבִין מֵת: עָנִי, וּמְצוֹרָע, וְסוֹמֵא, וּמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּנִים. עָנִי — דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מֵתוּ כׇּל הָאֲנָשִׁים״. מְצוֹרָע — דִּכְתִיב: ״אַל נָא תְהִי כַּמֵּת״. וְסוֹמֵא — דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּמַחֲשַׁכִּים הוֹשִׁיבַנִי כְּמֵתֵי עוֹלָם״. וּמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ בָּנִים — דִּכְתִיב: ״הָבָה לִּי בָנִים וְאִם אַיִן מֵתָה אָנֹכִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Any person who does not have children is considered like a dead as is stated “Give me children, or else I am dead” And it was taught Four are considered as dead: A pauper, and a leper, and a blind and one who has no children. A pauper, as it is written: “For all the men are dead” A leper, as it is written “Let her not, I pray, be as one dead” And a blind as it is written: “He has made me to dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead” And one who has no children, as it is written: “Give me children, or else I am dead”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Every man who does not have children - considered as dead, as it is stated: "Give me children, or else I die." And it was taught: Four are considered as dead: the poor, the leper, the blind, and one who does not have children. The poor - as it is written: "For all men are dead." The leper - as it is written: "Let me not be as one dead." The blind - as it is written: "He has made me dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead." And one who does not have children - as it is written: "Give me children, or else I die."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא: הַמּוּדָּר הֲנָאָה מֵחֲבֵירוֹ אֵין מַתִּירִין לוֹ אֶלָּא בְּפָנָיו. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ אֶל מֹשֶׁה בְּמִדְיָן לֵךְ שֻׁב מִצְרָיִם כִּי מֵתוּ כׇּל הָאֲנָשִׁים״. אָמַר לוֹ: בְּמִדְיָן נָדַרְתָּ — לֵךְ וְהַתֵּר נִדְרְךָ בְּמִדְיָן. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיּוֹאֶל מֹשֶׁה״ — אֵין אָלָה אֶלָּא שְׁבוּעָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֵא אֹתוֹ בְּאָלָה״.
human_translation: It is taught one prohibited by a vow from deriving benefit from another, they dissolve for him only in the presence From where are these matters Rav Naḥman said: As it is written: “And the Lord said to Moses in Midian: Go, return to Egypt; for all the men are dead” said to him: In Midian you vowed go and dissolve your vow in Midian. For it is written: “And Moses was content [ vayo’el ] ala means nothing other than an oath, as it is written: “And he…brought him under an oath [ ala ]”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: One who vows to abstain from deriving benefit from his fellow, we only permit him to do so in his presence. From where do we derive these matters? Rav Nachman said: As it is written: "And Hashem said to Moshe in Midian, 'Go, return to Egypt, for all the men who sought your life are dead.'" He said to him: You made a vow in Midian - go and annul your vow in Midian. As it is written: "And Moshe swore" - an oath is nothing but a vow, as it is written: "And he brought him into an oath."

hebrew_text: ״וְגַם בַּמֶּלֶךְ נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר מָרָד אֲשֶׁר הִשְׁבִּיעוֹ בֵּאלֹהִים (חַיִּים)״. מַאי מַרְדּוּתֵיהּ? אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ צִדְקִיָּה לִנְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר דַּהֲוָה קָאָכֵיל אַרְנְבָא חַיָּה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִישְׁתְּבַע לִי דְּלָא מְגַלֵּית עִילָּוַי וְלָא תִּיפּוֹק מִילְּתָא. אִישְׁתְּבַע.
human_translation: “And he also rebelled against King Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God” What his rebellion? Zedekiah found Nebuchadnezzar eating a live rabbit, He said to him: Take an oath to me that you will not reveal my and this matter will not emerge took an oath
llm_translation: "And also in the reign of King Nebuchadnezzar, Mordecai, whom he swore by the living God." What is the meaning of his rebellion? Zedekiah found for Nebuchadnezzar that he was eating a live rabbit. He said to him: 'Reveal to me the reason for your actions, and do not hide the matter.' He revealed it."

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף הֲוָה קָא מִצְטַעַר צִדְקִיָּהוּ בְּגוּפֵיהּ. אִיתְּשִׁיל אַשְּׁבוּעֲתֵיהּ, וַאֲמַר. שְׁמַע נְבוּכַדְנֶצַּר דְּקָא מְבַזִּין לֵיהּ, שְׁלַח וְאַיְיתִי סַנְהֶדְרִין וְצִדְקִיָּהוּ. אֲמַר לְהוֹן: חֲזֵיתוּן מַאי קָא עָבֵיד צִדְקִיָּהוּ? לָאו הָכִי אִישְׁתְּבַע בִּשְׁמָא דִשְׁמַיָּא דְּ״לָא מְגַלֵּינָא״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִיתְּשַׁלִי אַשְּׁבוּעֲתָא.
human_translation: Later, Zedekiah was physically suffering, He requested of his oath and he said Nebuchadnezzar heard that he was being ridiculed He sent and brought the Sanhedrin and Zedekiah He said to them: Did you see what Zedekiah has done? Did he not take an oath in the name of Heaven: That I will not reveal? They said to him: He requested of the oath.
llm_translation: At the end, Tzidkiyahu was in pain in his body. He sent for his oath and said, "Listen, Nebuchadnezzar is humiliating him, send and bring Sanhedrin and Tzidkiyahu." He said to them, "Have you seen what Tzidkiyahu is doing? Is he not invoking the Name of Heaven, 'I will not reveal'?" He said to him, "My oath has been fulfilled."

hebrew_text: [אֲמַר לְהוּ: מִתַּשְׁלִין אַשְּׁבוּעֲתָא?] אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אִין. אֲמַר לְהוּ: בְּפָנָיו, אוֹ אֲפִילּוּ שֶׁלֹּא בְּפָנָיו? אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: בְּפָנָיו. אֲמַר לְהוֹן: וְאַתּוּן מַאי עָבְדִיתוּן, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמְרִיתוּן לְצִדְקִיָּהוּ? מִיָּד ״יֵשְׁבוּ לָאָרֶץ יִדְּמוּ זִקְנֵי בַת צִיּוֹן״. אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שֶׁשָּׁמְטוּ כָּרִים מִתַּחְתֵּיהֶם.
human_translation: He said to them: Can one request of an oath? They said to him: Yes. He said to them: in the presence or even not in his presence? They said to him: in his presence. He said to them: And you, what did you do? What is the reason you did not say to Zedekiah Immediately, “They sit upon the ground, and keep silence, the elders of the daughter of Zion” Rabbi Yitzḥak said: that they removed cushions from underneath them,
llm_translation: He said to them: Do you take an oath? They said to him: No. He said to them: In his presence, or even not in his presence? They said to him: In his presence. He said to them: And what have you done, why did you not say in defense of Zedekiah? Immediately, "Let the elders of the daughter of Zion sit silently on the ground." Rabbi Yitzchak said: They released the beams from underneath them.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: יֵשׁ דְּבָרִים שֶׁהֵן כַּנּוֹלָד וְאֵינָן כַּנּוֹלָד, וְאֵין חֲכָמִים מוֹדִים לוֹ. כֵּיצַד? אָמַר ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי נוֹשֵׂא אֶת פְּלוֹנִית, שֶׁאָבִיהָ רַע״, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מֵת, אוֹ שֶׁעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה. ״קֻוֽנָּם לְבַיִת זֶה שֶׁאֲנִי נִכְנָס, שֶׁהַכֶּלֶב רַע בְּתוֹכוֹ״, אוֹ ״שֶׁהַנָּחָשׁ בְּתוֹכוֹ״, אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מֵת הַכֶּלֶב, אוֹ שֶׁנֶּהֱרַג הַנָּחָשׁ — הֲרֵי הֵן כַּנּוֹלָד, וְאֵינוֹ כַּנּוֹלָד. וְאֵין חֲכָמִים מוֹדִים לוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: There are matters that are, like a new situation but are not like a new situation, and the Rabbis do not concede to him. How so? one said: Marrying so-and-so is konam as her father is evil, they told him died, or that repented. Entering this house is konam as there is a bad dog inside it, or a snake inside it, they told him the dog died, or that the snake was killed. This is like a new situation, and it is not like a new situation, But the Rabbis do not concede to him.
llm_translation: The Mishnah: Rabbi Meir says: There are things that are like a newborn and not like a newborn, and the sages do not agree with him. How so? He said, "Their nest that I marry Plonit, whose father is evil." They said to him: He dies, or he repents. "Their nest to this house that I enter, where the dog is evil inside it," or "where the snake is inside it," they said to him: The dog dies, or the snake is killed - they are like a newborn, and not like a newborn. And the sages do not agree with him.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֲנִי נִכְנָס לְבַיִת זֶה שֶׁהַכֶּלֶב וְכוּ׳״ — מֵת נוֹלָד הוּא! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: נַעֲשָׂה כְּתוֹלֶה נִדְרוֹ בְּדָבָר. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּבָר מֵת וּכְבָר עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה, קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Entering this house is konam as there is a dog death is a new situation. Rav Huna said: He is considered like one who makes his vow dependent on a matter. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said they say to him: already died, or: already repented,
llm_translation: Gemara: "Kunam that I enter this house where the dog, etc." — He is a stillborn! Rav Huna said: He made his vow conditional on something. And Rabbi Yochanan said: He is already dead and has already repented, they say to him.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי אַבָּא: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֵינִי נוֹשֵׂא לִפְלוֹנִית כְּעוּרָה״, וַהֲרֵי הִיא נָאָה. ״שְׁחוֹרָה״, וַהֲרֵי הִיא לְבָנָה. ״קְצָרָה״, וַהֲרֵי הִיא אֲרוּכָּה — מוּתָּר בָּהּ. לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁכְּעוּרָה וְנַעֲשֵׂת נָאֶה, שְׁחוֹרָה וְנַעֲשֵׂת לְבָנָה, קְצָרָה וְנַעֲשֵׂת אֲרוּכָּה — אֶלָּא שֶׁהַנֶּדֶר טָעוּת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב הוּנָא דְּאָמַר נַעֲשָׂה כְּתוֹלֶה נִדְרוֹ בְּדָבָר: תְּנָא תּוֹלֶה נִדְרוֹ בְּדָבָר, וּתְנָא נֶדֶר טָעוּת. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר כְּבָר מֵת וּכְבָר עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה, לְמָה לִי לְמִתְנֵי תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי נֶדֶר טָעוּת? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba raised an objection I will not marry ugly so-and-so that is konam and she is beautiful, black, and she is white, short, and she is tall, he is permitted to her. Not because she ugly and became beautiful, black and became white, short and became tall, rather, the vow was mistaken Granted, according to Rav Huna, who said that he is considered like one who makes his vow dependent on a matter, taught makes his vow dependent on a matter, and it taught a mistaken vow. But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said already died, or already repented, why do I to teach a mistaken vow twice? difficult.
llm_translation: The Rabbi Abba raises an objection: "A vow that I will not marry Plonit because she is ugly," yet she is beautiful. "A vow that she is black," yet she is fair. "A vow that she is short," yet she is tall - the vow is permitted. Not because she is tall and becomes beautiful, black and becomes fair, short and becomes tall - but because the vow is mistaken. According to Rav Huna who said, "A vow is like a dangling thing," it is understandable. The Tanna teaches: "A dangling thing is his vow," and "a mistaken vow." But according to Rabbi Yochanan who said, "He has already died and repented, why should I bring up two mistaken vows?" This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי מֵאִיר: פּוֹתְחִין לוֹ מִן הַכָּתוּב שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, וְאוֹמְרִין לוֹ: אִילּוּ הָיִיתָ יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאַתָּה עוֹבֵר עַל ״לֹא תִקֹּם״, וְעַל ״לֹא תִטֹּר״, וְעַל ״לֹא תִשְׂנָא אֶת אָחִיךָ בִּלְבָבֶךָ״, ״וְאָהַבְתָּ לְרֵעֲךָ כָּמוֹךָ״, ״וְחֵי אָחִיךָ עִמָּךְ״, שֶׁהוּא עָנִי וְאֵין אַתָּה יָכוֹל לְפַרְנָסוֹ. אָמַר: אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא כֵּן, לֹא הָיִיתִי נוֹדֵר — הֲרֵי זֶה מוּתָּר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir further said: may broach with him from that which is written in the Torah, and may say to him: Had you known that you are transgressing “you shall not take vengeance” and “nor bear any grudge” and “you shall not hate your brother in your heart” “you shall love your neighbor as yourself” “and your brother live with you” as he, is poor and you are not able to provide him he said Had I known that it is so, I would not have vowed; it is dissolved.
llm_translation: Mishnah: And furthermore, Rabbi Meir said: One opens for him from the verse in the Torah, and says to him: If you had known that you transgress "Do not take revenge," and "Do not bear a grudge," and "Do not hate your brother in your heart," "Love your neighbor as yourself," "You shall surely rebuke your fellow," for he is poor and you cannot support him. He said: If I had known this, I would not have taken a vow — this is permitted.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר לְהוּ רַב הוּנָא בַּר רַב קַטִּינָא לְרַבָּנַן: נֵימָא, כֹּל דְּמִעֲנֵי לָאו עֲלַי נָפֵיל. מַאי דְּמָטֵי לִי לְפַרְנְסוֹ — בַּהֲדֵי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מְפַרְנַסְנָא לֵיהּ. אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אֲנִי אוֹמֵר כׇּל הַנּוֹפֵל, אֵינוֹ נוֹפֵל לִידֵי גַבַּאי תְּחִלָּה.
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Rav Ketina said to the Sages: let say All who become poor do not fall upon me; What is placed upon me to provide for him together with everyone else, I will provide him They said to him: I say anyone who falls does not fall into the hands of the collector first.
llm_translation: Gemara said to them Rav Huna son of Rav Katina to the Rabbis: Say, anyone who is dependent is not dependent on me. What falls to me to provide for him - in the presence of everyone in the world we provide for him. They said to him: I say, anyone who falls, does not fall into the hands of the collection plate at first.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ פּוֹתְחִין לָאָדָם בִּכְתוּבַּת אִשְׁתּוֹ.
human_translation: may broach with a man by his wife’s marriage contract.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: One may open with his wife in writing.

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁנָּדַר מֵאִשְׁתּוֹ הֲנָאָה, וְהָיְתָה כְּתוּבָּתָהּ אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת דִּינָרִים. וּבָא לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, וְחִיְּיבוֹ לִיתֵּן לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, שְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת דִּינָרִין הִנִּיחַ אַבָּא. נָטַל אָחִי אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת, וַאֲנִי אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת. לֹא דַּיָּה שֶׁתִּטּוֹל הִיא מָאתַיִם וַאֲנִי מָאתַיִם? אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אֲפִילּוּ אַתָּה מוֹכֵר שְׂעַר רֹאשְׁךָ — אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לָהּ כְּתוּבָּתָהּ. אָמַר לוֹ: אִילּוּ הָיִיתִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁהוּא כֵּן — לֹא הָיִיתִי נוֹדֵר. וְהִתִּירָהּ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא.
human_translation: And an incident with regard to one who vowed his wife benefit from and her marriage contract was four hundred dinars. And he came before Rabbi Akiva, and he obligated him to give her her marriage contract. He said to My teacher, father left eight hundred dinars my brother took four hundred and I four hundred. Isn’t it enough for to take two hundred and I two hundred? Rabbi Akiva said to him: even if you sell the hair on your head, you must give her her marriage contract. He said to him: Had I known that it was so, I would not have vowed. And Rabbi Akiva permitted her
llm_translation: And it happened with one who vowed from his wife pleasure, and its writing was four hundred dinars. And he came before Rabbi Akiva, and he obligated him to give her her writing. He said to him: Rabbi, my grandfather left eight hundred dinars. My brother took four hundred, and I took four hundred. Is it not enough that she takes two hundred and I take two hundred? Rabbi Akiva said to him: Even if you sell the hair of your head — you must give her her writing. He said to him: If I had known this, I would not have vowed. And Rabbi Akiva permitted her.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִטַּלְטְלֵי מִי מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִי לִכְתוּבָה? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: קַרְקַע שָׁוָה שְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת דִּינָר. וְהָקָתָנֵי: ״שְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ״, וּשְׂעַר רֹאשׁוֹ מִטַּלְטְלֵי הוּא! הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אַתָּה מוֹכֵר שְׂעַר רֹאשְׁךָ וְאוֹכֵל.
human_translation: Is movable property mortgaged for a marriage contract? Abaye said: land worth eight hundred dinars, But teaches The hair on his head, and the hair on his head is movable property. This is what he said: even you sell hair on your head and eat,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara: From what source do we learn that one is liable to pay for writing on someone else's property? Abaye said: The ground is worth eight hundred dinars. And it was taught in a Baraita: "The hair of his head," and his hair is movable! This is what the Baraita is saying: Even if you sell the hair of your head, you may eat the proceeds.

hebrew_text: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ אֵין מְסַדְּרִין לְבַעַל חוֹב? אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בְּרַבִּי יִצְחָק:
