hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תַּנְיָא: ״שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֵית לְאַבָּא וּלְאָבִיךְ אִם אֲנִי עוֹשָׂה לְפִיךָ״, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: לֹא יָפֵר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יָפֵר.
human_translation: It is taught Deriving benefit from father or from your father for me if I prepare for you, Rabbi Natan says cannot nullify And the Rabbis say he can nullify
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: 'That I am not benefiting your father and your mother if I do according to your words,' Rabbi Natan says: He should not annul. And the Sages say: He should annul."

hebrew_text: ״נְטוּלָה אֲנִי מִן הַיְּהוּדִים אִם מְשַׁמַּשְׁתֶּךָ״, רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: לֹא יָפֵר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: יָפֵר.
human_translation: I am removed from the Jews, if I engage in sexual intercourse with you, Rabbi Natan says he cannot nullify And the Rabbis say he can nullify
llm_translation: "Detached I am from the Jews if I serve you," Rabbi Nathan says: "It shall not annul." And the sages say: "It shall annul."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דְּאִיתְּסַר הֲנָיָיתָא דְּעָלְמָא עֲלֵיהּ אִי נָסֵיב אִיתְּתָא כִּי לָא תָּנֵינָא הִילְכְתָא. רָהֵיט בְּגַפָּא וְתוּבַלְיָא וְלָא אִמְּצִי לְמִיתְנֵא. אֲתָא רַב אַחָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא וְשַׁבְּשֵׁיהּ וְאִינְּסִיב אִיתְּתָא,
human_translation: a certain man who benefit from the world should be forbidden to him if marries a woman when he has not learned halakha . He would run up a ladder and rope but was not able to learn Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna came and misled him, and he married a woman.
llm_translation: That man who was once engaged to the daughter of the world, if he marries another woman, for we did not learn the rule, he is exempt. He was riding on a horse and a camel, and he did not find a place to dismount. Rav Acha bar Rav Huna came, pushed him, and he dismounted.

hebrew_text: וְשַׁרְקֵיהּ טִינָא, וְאַתְיֵיהּ לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא. אָמַר רָבָא: מַאן חַכִּים לְמִיעְבַּד כִּי הָא מִילְּתָא אִי לָאו דְּרַב אַחָא בַּר רַב הוּנָא, דְּגַבְרָא רַבָּה הוּא. דְּקָסָבַר דְּכִי הֵיכִי דִּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן וְרַבִּי נָתָן בַּהֲפָרָה — הָכִי נָמֵי פְּלִיגִי בִּשְׁאֵלָה.
human_translation: And smeared him with clay And brought him before Rav Ḥisda, Rava said: Who is wise to act in this manner, if not Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna, who is a great man? As he holds that just as the Rabbis and Rabbi Natan disagree with regard to nullification, so too, they disagree with regard to a request
llm_translation: His servant, Tena, came before Rav Ḥisda. Rava said: Who is wise to resolve this matter if not Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna, a great man? For he holds that when the Rabbis and Rabbi Natan disagree in the case of a heifer, they are actually disagreeing in the question.

hebrew_text: וְרַב פַּפִּי אָמַר: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בַּהֲפָרָה, דְּרַבִּי נָתָן סָבַר: אֵין הַבַּעַל מֵיפֵר אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן חָל נֶדֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְחָפְרָה הַלְּבָנָה״. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: בַּעַל מֵיפֵר אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא חָל נֶדֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״מֵפֵר מַחְשְׁבוֹת עֲרוּמִים״.
human_translation: And Rav Pappi said dispute with regard to nullification as Rabbi Natan holds a husband can nullify only once the vow has taken effect, as it is written: “And the moon shall be confounded [ ḥafera ]” And the Rabbis hold a husband can nullify even though the vow has not taken effect, as it is written: “He nullifies the thoughts of the crafty”
llm_translation: Rav Pappi said: A dispute regarding annulment of vows, for Rabbi Natan holds: The husband may annul vows only if a vow was violated, as it is written: "And the moon shall be voided." And the Rabbis hold: The husband may annul vows even if a vow was not violated, as it is written: "He annuls the schemes of the crafty."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל בִּשְׁאֵלָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל אֵין חָכָם מַתִּיר כְּלוּם אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן חָל נֶדֶר, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֹא יַחֵל דְּבָרוֹ״.
human_translation: But with regard to a request everyone, agrees that a halakhic authority cannot dissolve anything unless the vow has taken effect, as it is written: “He shall not profane his word”
llm_translation: But in a case of inquiry - the words of everyone, no wise person permits anything unless a vow has been violated, as it is written: "He shall not profane his word."

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי, וּלְמִי שֶׁאֶשָּׁאֵל עָלָיו״ — נִשְׁאָל עַל הָרִאשׁוֹן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִשְׁאָל עַל הַשֵּׁנִי. וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ נִשְׁאָל אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא חָל נֶדֶר, אִי בָּעֵי — עַל הַאי נִיתְּשִׁיל בְּרֵישָׁא, אִי בָּעֵי — עַל הַאי נִיתְּשִׁיל בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Let us say supports of so-and-so is konam that I will not benefit and he who I will request for he request with regard to the first and afterward he request with regard to the second. And if you say one can request even though the vow has not taken effect, If he wishes, he first request with regard to this if he wishes, he first request with regard to that
llm_translation: Let us say it assists him: "Their vow that I do not benefit from so-and-so, and for whom I am asked about" — He was asked about the first one, and afterwards he was asked about the second one. And if you say he was asked even though the vow was not annulled, if he wants — he can annul it at the outset, if he wants — he can annul it at the outset.

hebrew_text: וּמִי יָדַע אִי הַאי קַמָּא אִי הַאי בָּתְרָא?
human_translation: And does he know if this is first if that is last?
llm_translation: And who knows whether this one is the first or that one is the last?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי, הֲרֵינִי נָזִיר לִכְשֶׁאֶשָּׁאֵל עָלָיו״ — נִשְׁאָל עַל נִדְרוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִשְׁאָל עַל נִזְרוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, let us say supports of so-and-so is konam that I will not benefit I am hereby a nazirite for when I will request of he request with regard to his vow and afterward he request with regard to his naziriteship
llm_translation: Rather, let us say that he assists him: "Their vow that I do not benefit from so-and-so, behold I am a Nazirite when asked about it" - he was asked about his vow, and afterwards he was asked about his Naziriteship.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ נִשְׁאָל אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא חָל נֶדֶר, אִי בָּעֵי — עַל נִדְרוֹ אִיתְּשִׁיל בְּרֵישָׁא, אִי בָּעֵי — עַל נִזְרוֹ אִיתְּשִׁיל בְּרֵישָׁא! רַבִּי נָתָן הִיא.
human_translation: And if you say one request even though the vow has not taken effect, If he wishes, he first request with regard to his vow if he wishes, he first request with regard to his naziriteship. is Rabbi Natan,
llm_translation: And if you say, "She was asked even though the vow did not take effect," if he wants - he can annul his vow at the outset, if he wants - he can annul his Nazirite vow at the outset! This is the opinion of Rabbi Natan.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: אָמַר לִי מָרִימָר, הָכִי אֲמַר אֲבוּךְ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב פַּפִּי: מַחֲלוֹקֶת בַּהֲפָרָה, אֲבָל בִּשְׁאֵלָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מֵפֵר וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁלֹּא חָל נֶדֶר, דִּכְתִיב ״לֹא יַחֵל דְּבָרוֹ״.
human_translation: Ravina said: Mareimar said to me: This is your father said in the name of Rav Pappi: dispute with regard to nullification But with regard to a request everyone, agrees, he can dissolve even though the vow has not taken effect. As it is written: “He shall not profane his word”
llm_translation: Ravina said: Marimar told me, thus said your father in the name of Rav Pappi: Dispute regarding a heifer, but regarding a question — the words of everyone nullify, even though the vow was not violated, as it is written, "He shall not break his word."

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּלָא הֲוָה בֵּיהּ מַעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: That is to say that there was not action
llm_translation: In the matter that there was not in it an action.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה לִפְלוֹנִי וּלְמִי שֶׁנִּשְׁאָל עָלָיו״ — נִשְׁאָל עַל הָרִאשׁוֹן, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִשְׁאָל עַל הַשֵּׁנִי. אַמַּאי? אִי בָּעֵי — עַל הַאי נִיתְּשִׁיל בְּרֵישָׁא, וְאִי בָּעֵי — עַל הַאי נִיתְּשִׁיל בְּרֵישָׁא!
human_translation: raises an objection of so-and-so is konam that I will not benefit and he who I will request for he request with regard to the first and afterward he request with regard to the second. why If he wishes, he first request with regard to this if he wishes, he first request with regard to that
llm_translation: Challenger: "Their claim that I do not benefit from so-and-so and from the one who was asked about." — He was asked about the first one, and afterwards he was asked about the second one. Why? If he wants — he should have been asked about the first one initially, and if he wants — he should have been asked about the second one initially!

hebrew_text: מִי יוֹדֵעַ הֵי רִאשׁוֹן וְהֵי שֵׁנִי?
human_translation: Does he know which is first and which is second?
llm_translation: Who knows, "He is the first and he is the second"?

hebrew_text: מֵתִיבִי: ״קֻוֽנָּם שֶׁאֵינִי נֶהֱנֶה וַהֲרֵינִי נָזִיר לִכְשֶׁאֶשָּׁאֵל עָלָיו״ — נִשְׁאָל עַל נִדְרוֹ, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִשְׁאָל עַל נִזְרוֹ. וְאַמַּאי? אִי בָּעֵי — עַל נִדְרוֹ נִיתְּשִׁיל בְּרֵישָׁא, וְאִי בָּעֵי — עַל נִזְרוֹ נִיתְּשִׁיל בְּרֵישָׁא! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises objection of so-and-so is konam that I will not benefit I am hereby a nazirite for when I will request of he request with regard to his vow and afterward he request with regard to his naziriteship But why If he wishes he first request with regard to his vow and if he wishes he first request with regard to his naziriteship. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "It was asked: 'Their vow from which I do not benefit, and behold I become a Nazir when asked about it' — he was asked about his vow, and afterwards he was asked about his Nazirite vow. And why? If he wants — he can annul his vow at the outset, and if he wants — he can annul his Nazirite vow at the outset! A refutation."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: שָׁלֹשׁ נָשִׁים יוֹצְאוֹת וְנוֹטְלוֹת כְּתוּבָה: הָאוֹמֶרֶת ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי לָךְ״, ״שָׁמַיִם בֵּינִי לְבֵינָךְ״, וּ״נְטוּלָה אֲנִי מִן הַיְּהוּדִים״.
human_translation: Initially would say three women are divorced and they receive marriage contract. who says I am defiled to you, Heaven is between me and you, And I am removed from the Jews,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Initially, they used to say: Three women go out and receive a bill of divorce: One who says, "I am impure to you," "Heaven is between me and you," and "I am removed from the Jews."

hebrew_text: חָזְרוּ לוֹמַר, שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אִשָּׁה נוֹתֶנֶת עֵינֶיהָ בְּאַחֵר וּמְקַלְקֶלֶת עַל בַּעְלָהּ: הָאוֹמֶרֶת ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי לָךְ״ — תָּבִיא רְאָיָה לִדְבָרֶיהָ. ״הַשָּׁמַיִם בֵּינִי לְבֵינָךְ״ — יַעֲשׂוּ דֶּרֶךְ בַּקָּשָׁה. וּ״נְטוּלָה אֲנִי מִן הַיְּהוּדִים״ — יָפֵר לְחֶלְקוֹ, וּתְהֵא מְשַׁמַּשְׁתּוֹ, וּתְהֵא נְטוּלָה מִן הַיְּהוּדִים.
human_translation: They retracted and said that woman should not cast her eyes on another and ruin with her husband who says I am defiled to you, must bring proof for her words Heaven is between me and you, must act by way of a request, And I am removed from the Jews, must nullify his part, and she may engage in sexual intercourse with him, but she is removed from Jews,
llm_translation: They returned to say, that a woman should not gaze at another man and thereby disrespect her husband. If she says, "I am impure for you," she should bring proof for her words. "May the heavens judge between me and you" - let them take a difficult path. And "I am separated from the Jews" - let him annul his portion, and she should serve him, and she should be separated from the Jews.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אָמְרָה לְבַעְלָהּ ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי״, מַהוּ שֶׁתֹּאכַל בִּתְרוּמָה? רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אוֹכֶלֶת, שֶׁלֹּא תּוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל בָּנֶיהָ. רָבָא אָמַר: אֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת, אֶפְשָׁר דְּאָכְלָה חוּלִּין.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before said to her husband: I am defiled what is with regard to she may partake of teruma ? Rav Sheshet said: may partake so that she not cast aspersions on her children. Rava said: She may not partake she can partake of non-sacred
llm_translation: Gemara: She sought to ask them: If she said to her husband, "I am impure," what may she eat of the terumah? Rav Sheshet said: She may eat, so that she does not provoke her children. Rava said: She may not eat, perhaps she ate unconsecrated food.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: וּמוֹדֶה רַב שֵׁשֶׁת שֶׁאִם נִתְאַרְמְלָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ אוֹכֶלֶת. מִידֵּי הוּא טַעְמָא אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם תּוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל בָּנֶיהָ. נִתְאַרְמְלָה וְנִתְגָּרְשָׁה, אָמְרִי: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאִיתְּנִיסָא.
human_translation: Rava said: And Rav Sheshet concedes that if was widowed she may not partake Isn’t the reason only that she cast aspersions on her children? was widowed or divorced, will say now that she was raped,
llm_translation: Rava said: And Rav Sheshet concedes that if it became leavened, it does not eat. Immediately he gives a reason, but rather because of "you shall bring out the stubborn and rebellious son." If it became leavened and was divorced, they say: "This is what was tested now."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, בָּדֵיק לַן רָבָא: אֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן שֶׁנֶּאֶנְסָה, יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה אוֹ אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה? כֵּיוָן דְּאוֹנֶס לְגַבֵּי כֹּהֵן כְּרָצוֹן לְגַבֵּי יִשְׂרָאֵל דָּמֵי, אֵין לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה. אוֹ דִילְמָא מָצֵי אָמְרָה לֵיהּ: אֲנָא הָא חֲזֵינָא,
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Rava tested us wife of a priest who was raped she receive marriage contract or she not receive marriage contract? since rape with regard to a priest is like willing with regard to a an Israelite, she not receive marriage contract? Or perhaps she can say to him: I am fit
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, we checked with Rava: Does the wife of a Kohen who was forced have a document or not? Since when she is forced against the will of the Kohen, it is considered as if she consents to an Israelite, she does not have a document. Or perhaps she could say to him: I saw this.

hebrew_text: וְגַבְרָא הוּא דְּנִסְתַּחֲפָה שָׂדֵהוּ. וְאָמְרִינַן לֵיהּ, מַתְנִיתִין הִיא: הָאוֹמֶרֶת ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי לָךְ״ — יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: And it is the man, whose field was flooded. And we said to is the mishna, who says I am defiled to you, receive marriage contract.
llm_translation: And a man who concealed his field. And we say to him, it is a Mishnah: One who says, "I am impure to you" - she has a document.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּאֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל, אִי בְּרָצוֹן — כְּלוּם יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה? וְאִי בְּאוֹנֶס — מִי קָא מִיתַּסְרָא עַל גַּבְרָא? וְאֶלָּא בְּאֵשֶׁת כֹּהֵן. אִי בְּרָצוֹן — כְּלוּם יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה? מִי גָּרְעָה מֵאֵשֶׁת יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּרָצוֹן? אֶלָּא לָאו: בְּאוֹנֶס, וְקָתָנֵי: יֵשׁ לָהּ כְּתוּבָּה.
human_translation: With what are we dealing? If we say of the wife of an Israelite, If willingly, does she have any marriage contract? And if by force, is she forbidden to the man, But rather, the wife of a priest. If willingly, does she have any marriage contract? Is her any less than the wife of an Israelite willingly Rather, is it not by force? And teaches she has marriage contract.
llm_translation: In what are we dealing? If you say with a Jewish woman, if willingly — does she not have a document of marriage? And if by force — who can be angry with her? Rather, we are dealing with the wife of a Kohen. If willingly — does she not have a document of marriage? Who would remove a Jewish woman willingly? Rather, we are dealing not by force, and it teaches: she has a document of marriage.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אָמְרָה לְבַעְלָהּ ״גֵּרַשְׁתַּנִי״, מַהוּ? אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָאוֹמֶרֶת ״טְמֵאָה אֲנִי לָךְ״, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְמִשְׁנָה אַחֲרוֹנָה דְּקָתָנֵי לָא מְהֵימְנָא — הָתָם הוּא דִּמְשַׁקְּרָה, דְּיָדְעָה דְּבַעְלַהּ לָא יָדַע בָּהּ. אֲבָל גַּבֵּי ״גֵּרַשְׁתַּנִי״ דְּיָדַע בָּהּ — מְהֵימְנָא, דַּחֲזָקָה אֵין אִשָּׁה מְעִיזָּה פָּנֶיהָ בִּפְנֵי בַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before said to her husband: You divorced me, what is Rav Hamnuna said: Come hear who says: I am defiled to you, that even according to the ultimate mishna that teaches she is not believed it is there that she is lying as she knows that her husband does not know about her. But concerning You divorced me, with regard to which he knows about her, is believed. Because presumption that a woman is not brazen in the presence of her husband
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a dilemma: If a woman says to her husband, "You have divorced me," what is the ruling? Rav Hamnuna said: Come and hear: One who says, "I am impure to you," even if she contradicts herself in a later Mishnah, we do not believe her - there, she is lying, as she knows that her husband is unaware of it. But regarding "You have divorced me," where she knows that he is aware of it - we believe her, as it is assumed that a woman does not have the audacity to confront her husband.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: אַדְרַבָּא, אֲפִילּוּ לְמִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה דְּקָתָנֵי מְהֵימְנָא — הָתָם מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא עֲבִידָא לְבַזּוֹיֵי נַפְשַׁהּ, אֲבָל הָכָא דְּזִמְנִין דִּתְקִיף לַהּ מִן גַּבְרָא — מְעִיזָּה וּמְעִיזָּה.
human_translation: Rava said to him: On the contrary, even according to the initial mishna that teaches is believed there because would not demean herself But here, where it is sometimes hard for her under the man, she would be brazen
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: On the contrary, even according to the first Mishnah that we trust — there, because she did not cause disgrace to herself, but here, in times when she is strong against him — she is bold and bold.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: ״הַשָּׁמַיִם בֵּינִי לְבֵינָךְ״ דְּמִשְׁנָה רִאשׁוֹנָה — תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרָבָא, הָכָא דְּלֵית לַהּ כִּיסּוּפָא, וְקָתָנֵי דִּמְהֵימְנָא! קָסָבַר רָבָא: הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא סַגִּי לַהּ דְּלָא אָמְרָה ״אֵין יוֹרֶה כְּחֵץ״, אִי לָא אִיתָא כִּדְקָאָמְרָה — לָא אָמְרָה לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya raised an objection: of initial mishna, Heaven is between me and you, conclusive refutation of Rava, here she no embarrassment and teaches that is believed. Rava maintains there, since it is not sufficient for her not state he does not shoot like an arrow, were it not as she said, she would not say it.
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "The heavens are between me and you," as in the first Mishnah - it is the response of Rava, here where there is no suspicion, and it teaches that I trust! Rava holds: There, since she did not reach the point of saying, "It does not shoot like an arrow," if it does not come as she said - she did not say it to him.

hebrew_text: ״הַשָּׁמַיִם בֵּינִי לְבֵינָךְ״ דְּמִשְׁנָה אַחֲרוֹנָה, תִּהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הַמְנוּנָא: וְהָא הָכָא דְּיָדְעָה הִיא, וּבַעְלַהּ יָדַע בַּהּ, וְקָתָנֵי דְּלָא מְהֵימְנָא!
human_translation: of ultimate mishna, Heaven is between me and you, be conclusive refutation of Rav Hamnuna, But here, she knows and her husband knows with regard to her and teaches that she is not believed.
llm_translation: "The heavens between me and you" as it is taught in the latter Mishnah, it will be a refutation of Rav Hamnuna: But here, she knew, and her husband knew about it, and the small ones do not believe!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא: הָכָא נָמֵי הִיא גּוּפָא אָמְרָה: נְהִי דִּבְבִיאָה יָדַע, בְּיוֹרֶה כְּחֵץ מִי יָדַע? וּמִשּׁוּם הָכִי מְשַׁקְּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna maintains here too, herself says Though he may know in sexual intercourse, does he know he shoots like an arrow? And due to that she lies.
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna thought: Here it is clear, the body itself said: "A weasel knows the time of its coming, but who knows the power of a falcon?" And because of this, the verse deceives.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּכׇל יוֹמָא דְּתַשְׁמִישׁ מִיקַדְּמָה מָשְׁיָא יְדֵיהּ לְגַבְרָא. יוֹמָא חַד אַתְיָא לֵיהּ מַיָּא לְמִמְשֵׁא. אֲמַר לַהּ: הָדָא מִילְּתָא לָא הֲוָת הָאִידָּנָא! אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן, חַד מִן נׇכְרִים
human_translation: a certain woman, who every day of sexual intercourse would rise early and wash husband’s hands. One day she brought him water to wash he said to her: This matter, did not occur now. She said to him: If so, one of gentile
llm_translation: That woman, every day of marital relations, she would place her hand before the man. One day, water came to her from the top. He said to her: "This matter was not like this until now!" She said to him: "If so, one of the foreigners."

hebrew_text: אַהֲלוֹיֵי דַּהֲווֹ הָכָא הָאִידָּנָא, אִי אַנְתְּ לָא — דִּלְמָא מִנְּהוֹן. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: עֵינֶיהָ נָתְנָה בְּאַחֵר, וְלֵית בַּהּ מְשָׁשָׁא בְּמִלַּהּ.
human_translation: aloe merchants [ ahaloyei ] who were here now if not you, perhaps of them. Rav Naḥman, said: she might have cast her eyes upon another and there is no substance to her words.
llm_translation: The text reads: "Ahaloyei d'havo hacha haidana, i ant l'a - dilmah minhon. Amar Rav Nachman: Eineha natna b'acher, v'leit bah meshasha b'milta." Translation: "The tent pegs that were here are now there, if not - perhaps from them. Rav Nachman said: She gave her eyes to another, and there is no suspicion in her words."

hebrew_text: הָהִיא אִיתְּתָא דְּלָא הֲוָה בְּדִיחָא דַּעְתַּהּ בַּהֲדֵי גַּבְרָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: הָאִידָּנָא מַאי שְׁנָא? אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: מֵעוֹלָם לָא צַעַרְתַּן בְּדֶרֶךְ אֶרֶץ כִּי הָאִידָּנָא. אֲמַר לַהּ: לָא הֲוָה הָדָא מִילְּתָא הָאִידָּנָא. אֲמַרָה לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן הָלֵין נׇכְרִים נַפְטוֹיֵי דַּהֲווֹ הָכָא הָאִידָּנָא, אִי אַנְתְּ לָא — דִּלְמָא חַד מִנְּהוֹן. אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב נַחְמָן: לָא תַּשְׁגִּיחוּן בַּהּ, נוֹתֶנֶת עֵינֶיהָ בְּאַחֵר הֲוַאי.
human_translation: a certain woman who was displeased with man. He said to her: What is different now? She said to him: you never hurt me in proper relations as now. He said to her: This matter did not occur now. She said to him: If so, one of gentile oil merchants [ naftoyei ] who were here now if not you, perhaps of them. Rav Naḥman said to them: Take no notice of her; she has cast her eyes upon another
llm_translation: That woman who was not careful with her modesty in the presence of a man. He said to her: "What is different now?" She said to him: "I have never troubled you on the way of the world, for it is different now." He said to her: "This matter was not so until now." She said to him: "If so, the foreign men who were here before were perhaps one of them." Rav Nachman said to them: "Do not look at her, she is putting her eyes on another man."

hebrew_text: הָהוּא גַּבְרָא דַּהֲוָה מִהַרְזִיק בְּבֵיתָא הוּא וְאִינְתְּתָא. עָל אֲתָא מָרֵיהּ דְּבֵיתָא, פַּרְטֵיהּ נוֹאֵף לְהוּצָא וַעֲרַק. אָמַר רָבָא: אִיתְּתָא שַׁרְיָא. אִם אִיתָא דַּעֲבַד אִיסּוּרָא — אִרְכוֹסֵי הֲוָה מִירְכַס.
human_translation: a certain man who was secluding [ meharzeik ] in a house, he and a woman. the owner of the house entered, the adulterer burst through the wall of palm branches and fled. Rava said: The woman is permitted if it is so that had committed a transgression, he would have hidden
llm_translation: That man who was frequenting in the house, he and his wife. The master of the house came, his wife he found in an act of adultery to take out and burn. Rava said: The wife is permitted. If there is one who performs a prohibition - the husband was negligent.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא נוֹאֵף דְּעָל לְגַבֵּי דְּהָהִיא אִנְתְּתָא, אֲתָא גַּבְרָא, סְלֵיק נוֹאֵף אִיתִּיב [בִּכְלָאֵי] בָּבָא. הֲוָה מַחֲתָן תַּחְלֵי תַּמָּן וְטַעְמִינּוּן חִוְיָא. בְּעָא מָרֵי דְבֵיתָא לְמֵיכַל מִן הָנְהוּ תַּחְלֵי בְּלָא דַּעְתָּא דְּאִינְתְּתָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא נוֹאֵף: לָא תֵּיכוּל מִנְּהוֹן דְּטַעְמִינּוּן חִוְיָא.
human_translation: a certain adulterer who entered of a certain woman. the man, came adulterer went and sat himself behind the door, There was cress [ taḥlei ] lying there and a snake tasted of it, The master of the house wanted to eat from that cress, without the woman’s knowledge. The adulterer said to him: Do not eat from as a snake has tasted of it.
llm_translation: That adulterer who was with that woman, a man came, the adulterer went out with him in the midst of the night. He was the groom before them, and their taste was wine. The master of the house wanted to feed from those foods before the woman's knowledge, that adulterer said to him: You cannot eat from those whose taste is wine.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: אִינְתְּתֵיהּ שַׁרְיָא, אִם אִיתֵיהּ דַּעֲבַד אִיסּוּרָא, נִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלֵיכוֹל וְלֵימוּת, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי נִאֵפוּ וְדָם בִּידֵיהֶן״.
human_translation: Rava, said: His wife is permitted were it so that had committed a transgression, it would have been preferable for him that eat and die. as it is written: “For they have committed adultery and blood is on their hands”
llm_translation: Rava said: His wife is permitted, if there is one who performs the prohibition, it is preferable for him to be able to die, as it is written: "For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands."

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: אִיסּוּרָא עֲבַד, וְהַאי דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ דְּנִיחָא לֵיהּ דְּלָא לֵימוּת בַּעַל, דְּתֶהְוֵי אִינְתְּתֵיהּ עִלָּוֵיהּ ״מַיִם גְּנוּבִים יִמְתָּקוּ וְלֶחֶם סְתָרִים יִנְעָם״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: is obvious lest you say commit a transgression and that he said to because it is preferable for him that the husband should not die. that his wife should be to him “Stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant” teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious! What might you say: the prohibition he did, and this that he said to him that he should leave it so that her husband will not die, for his wife will be upon him "stolen waters are sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant," we hear.

hebrew_text: הַדְרָן עֲלָךְ וְאֵלּוּ נְדָרִים וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת נְדָרִים
llm_translation: We will return to you, and these are the vows, and the conclusion is the Tractate Nedarim.
